Translate | verse by verse

ReferenceText
Job 1:1There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job. That man was blameless and upright, and one who feared God, and turned away from evil.
Job 1:1   אִ֛ישׁ הָיָ֥ה בְאֶֽרֶץ־ע֖וּץ אִיּ֣וֹב שְׁמ֑וֹ וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֗וּא תָּ֧ם וְיָשָׁ֛ר וִירֵ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְסָ֥ר מֵרָֽע׃ ‬
Job 1:1
Job 1:2There were born to him seven sons and three daughters.
Job 1:2   וַיִּוָּ֥לְדוּ ל֛וֹ שִׁבְעָ֥ה בָנִ֖ים וְשָׁל֥וֹשׁ בָּנֽוֹת׃ ‬
Job 1:2
Job 1:3His possessions also were seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred yoke of oxen, five hundred female donkeys, and a very great household; so that this man was the greatest of all the children of the east.
Job 1:3   וַיְהִ֣י מִ֠קְנֵהוּ שִֽׁבְעַ֨ת אַלְפֵי־צֹ֜אן וּשְׁלֹ֧שֶׁת אַלְפֵ֣י גְמַלִּ֗ים וַחֲמֵ֨שׁ מֵא֤וֹת צֶֽמֶד־בָּקָר֙ וַחֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֣וֹת אֲתוֹנ֔וֹת וַעֲבֻדָּ֖ה רַבָּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד וַיְהִי֙ הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא גָּד֖וֹל מִכָּל־בְּנֵי־קֶֽדֶם׃ ‬
Job 1:3
Job 1:4His sons went and held a feast in the house of each one on his birthday; and they sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.
Job 1:4   וְהָלְכ֤וּ בָנָיו֙ וְעָשׂ֣וּ מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה בֵּ֖ית אִ֣ישׁ יוֹמ֑וֹ וְשָׁלְח֗וּ וְקָרְאוּ֙ לִשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת *אחיתיהם **אַחְיֽוֹתֵיהֶ֔ם לֶאֱכֹ֥ל וְלִשְׁתּ֖וֹת עִמָּהֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 1:4
Job 1:5It was so, when the days of their feasting had run their course, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt offerings according to the number of them all. For Job said, |It may be that my sons have sinned, and renounced God in their hearts.| Job did so continually.
Job 1:5   וַיְהִ֡י כִּ֣י הִקִּיפֽוּ֩ יְמֵ֨י הַמִּשְׁתֶּ֜ה וַיִּשְׁלַ֧ח אִיּ֣וֹב וַֽיְקַדְּשֵׁ֗ם וְהִשְׁכִּ֣ים בַּבֹּקֶר֮ וְהֶעֱלָ֣ה עֹלוֹת֮ מִסְפַּ֣ר כֻּלָּם֒ כִּ֚י אָמַ֣ר אִיּ֔וֹב אוּלַי֙ חָטְא֣וּ בָנַ֔י וּבֵרֲכ֥וּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים בִּלְבָבָ֑ם כָּ֛כָה יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אִיּ֖וֹב כָּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ פ ‬
Job 1:5
Job 1:6Now it happened on the day when God's sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, that Satan also came among them.
Job 1:6   וַיְהִ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לְהִתְיַצֵּ֖ב עַל־יְהוָ֑ה וַיָּב֥וֹא גַֽם־הַשָּׂטָ֖ן בְּתוֹכָֽם׃ ‬
Job 1:6
Job 1:7Yahweh said to Satan, |Where have you come from?| Then Satan answered Yahweh, and said, |From going back and forth in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.|
Job 1:7   וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהוָ֛ה אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֖ן מֵאַ֣יִן תָּבֹ֑א וַיַּ֨עַן הַשָּׂטָ֤ן אֶת־יְהוָה֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר מִשּׁ֣וּט בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּמֵֽהִתְהַלֵּ֖ךְ בָּֽהּ׃ ‬
Job 1:7
Job 1:8Yahweh said to Satan, |Have you considered my servant, Job? For there is none like him in the earth, a blameless and an upright man, one who fears God, and turns away from evil.|
Job 1:8   וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֔ן הֲשַׂ֥מְתָּ לִבְּךָ֖ עַל־עַבְדִּ֣י אִיּ֑וֹב כִּ֣י אֵ֤ין כָּמֹ֙הוּ֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ אִ֣ישׁ תָּ֧ם וְיָשָׁ֛ר יְרֵ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְסָ֥ר מֵרָֽע׃ ‬
Job 1:8
Job 1:9Then Satan answered Yahweh, and said, |Does Job fear God for nothing?
Job 1:9   וַיַּ֧עַן הַשָּׂטָ֛ן אֶת־יְהוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַֽחִנָּ֔ם יָרֵ֥א אִיּ֖וֹב אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Job 1:9
Job 1:10Haven't you made a hedge around him, and around his house, and around all that he has, on every side? You have blessed the work of his hands, and his substance is increased in the land.
Job 1:10   הֲלֹֽא־*את **אַ֠תָּה שַׂ֣כְתָּ בַעֲד֧וֹ וּבְעַד־בֵּית֛וֹ וּבְעַ֥ד כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ מִסָּבִ֑יב מַעֲשֵׂ֤ה יָדָיו֙ בֵּרַ֔כְתָּ וּמִקְנֵ֖הוּ פָּרַ֥ץ בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Job 1:10
Job 1:11But put forth your hand now, and touch all that he has, and he will renounce you to your face.|
Job 1:11   וְאוּלָם֙ שְֽׁלַֽח־נָ֣א יָֽדְךָ֔ וְגַ֖ע בְּכָל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ אִם־לֹ֥א עַל־פָּנֶ֖יךָ יְבָרֲכֶֽךָּ׃ ‬
Job 1:11
Job 1:12Yahweh said to Satan, |Behold, all that he has is in your power. Only on himself don't put forth your hand.| So Satan went forth from the presence of Yahweh.
Job 1:12   וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֗ן הִנֵּ֤ה כָל־אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֙ בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ רַ֣ק אֵלָ֔יו אַל־תִּשְׁלַ֖ח יָדֶ֑ךָ וַיֵּצֵא֙ הַשָּׂטָ֔ן מֵעִ֖ם פְּנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Job 1:12
Job 1:13It fell on a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother's house,
Job 1:13   וַיְהִ֖י הַיּ֑וֹם וּבָנָ֨יו וּבְנֹתָ֤יו אֹֽכְלִים֙ וְשֹׁתִ֣ים יַ֔יִן בְּבֵ֖ית אֲחִיהֶ֥ם הַבְּכֽוֹר׃ ‬
Job 1:13
Job 1:14that there came a messenger to Job, and said, |The oxen were plowing, and the donkeys feeding beside them,
Job 1:14   וּמַלְאָ֛ךְ בָּ֥א אֶל־אִיּ֖וֹב וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַבָּקָר֙ הָי֣וּ חֹֽרְשׁ֔וֹת וְהָאֲתֹנ֖וֹת רֹע֥וֹת עַל־יְדֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 1:14
Job 1:15and the Sabeans attacked, and took them away. Yes, they have killed the servants with the edge of the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell you.|
Job 1:15   וַתִּפֹּ֤ל שְׁבָא֙ וַתִּקָּחֵ֔ם וְאֶת־הַנְּעָרִ֖ים הִכּ֣וּ לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וָֽאִמָּ֨לְטָ֧ה רַק־אֲנִ֛י לְבַדִּ֖י לְהַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 1:15
Job 1:16While he was still speaking, there also came another, and said, |The fire of God has fallen from the sky, and has burned up the sheep and the servants, and consumed them, and I alone have escaped to tell you.|
Job 1:16   ע֣וֹד ׀ זֶ֣ה מְדַבֵּ֗ר וְזֶה֮ בָּ֣א וַיֹּאמַר֒ אֵ֣שׁ אֱלֹהִ֗ים נָֽפְלָה֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וַתִּבְעַ֥ר בַּצֹּ֛אן וּבַנְּעָרִ֖ים וַתֹּאכְלֵ֑ם וָאִמָּ֨לְטָ֧ה רַק־אֲנִ֛י לְבַדִּ֖י לְהַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 1:16
Job 1:17While he was still speaking, there came also another, and said, |The Chaldeans made three bands, and swept down on the camels, and have taken them away, yes, and killed the servants with the edge of the sword; and I alone have escaped to tell you.|
Job 1:17   ע֣וֹד ׀ זֶ֣ה מְדַבֵּ֗ר וְזֶה֮ בָּ֣א וַיֹּאמַר֒ כַּשְׂדִּ֞ים שָׂ֣מוּ ׀ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה רָאשִׁ֗ים וַֽיִּפְשְׁט֤וּ עַל־הַגְּמַלִּים֙ וַיִּקָּח֔וּם וְאֶת־הַנְּעָרִ֖ים הִכּ֣וּ לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וָאִמָּ֨לְטָ֧ה רַק־אֲנִ֛י לְבַדִּ֖י לְהַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 1:17
Job 1:18While he was still speaking, there came also another, and said, |Your sons and your daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother's house,
Job 1:18   עַ֚ד זֶ֣ה מְדַבֵּ֔ר וְזֶ֖ה בָּ֣א וַיֹּאמַ֑ר בָּנֶ֨יךָ וּבְנוֹתֶ֤יךָ אֹֽכְלִים֙ וְשֹׁתִ֣ים יַ֔יִן בְּבֵ֖ית אֲחִיהֶ֥ם הַבְּכֽוֹר׃ ‬
Job 1:18
Job 1:19and behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness, and struck the four corners of the house, and it fell on the young men, and they are dead. I alone have escaped to tell you.|
Job 1:19   וְהִנֵּה֩ ר֨וּחַ גְּדוֹלָ֜ה בָּ֣אָה ׀ מֵעֵ֣בֶר הַמִּדְבָּ֗ר וַיִּגַּע֙ בְּאַרְבַּע֙ פִּנּ֣וֹת הַבַּ֔יִת וַיִּפֹּ֥ל עַל־הַנְּעָרִ֖ים וַיָּמ֑וּתוּ וָאִמָּ֨לְטָ֧ה רַק־אֲנִ֛י לְבַדִּ֖י לְהַגִּ֥יד לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 1:19
Job 1:20Then Job arose, and tore his robe, and shaved his head, and fell down on the ground, and worshiped.
Job 1:20   וַיָּ֤קָם אִיּוֹב֙ וַיִּקְרַ֣ע אֶת־מְעִל֔וֹ וַיָּ֖גָז אֶת־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיִּפֹּ֥ל אַ֖רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּֽחוּ׃ ‬
Job 1:20
Job 1:21He said, |Naked I came out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return there. Yahweh gave, and Yahweh has taken away. Blessed be the name of Yahweh.|
Job 1:21   וַיֹּאמֶר֩ עָרֹ֨ם *יצתי **יָצָ֜אתִי מִבֶּ֣טֶן אִמִּ֗י וְעָרֹם֙ אָשׁ֣וּב שָׁ֔מָה יְהוָ֣ה נָתַ֔ן וַיהוָ֖ה לָקָ֑ח יְהִ֛י שֵׁ֥ם יְהוָ֖ה מְבֹרָֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 1:21
Job 1:22In all this, Job did not sin, nor charge God with wrongdoing.
Job 1:22   בְּכָל־זֹ֖את לֹא־חָטָ֣א אִיּ֑וֹב וְלֹא־נָתַ֥ן תִּפְלָ֖ה לֵאלֹהִֽים׃ פ ‬
Job 1:22
Job 2:1Again it happened on the day when the God's sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, that Satan came also among them to present himself before Yahweh.
Job 2:1   וַיְהִ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים לְהִתְיַצֵּ֖ב עַל־יְהוָ֑ה וַיָּב֤וֹא גַֽם־הַשָּׂטָן֙ בְּתֹכָ֔ם לְהִתְיַצֵּ֖ב עַל־יְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Job 2:1
Job 2:2Yahweh said to Satan, |Where have you come from?| Satan answered Yahweh, and said, |From going back and forth in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.|
Job 2:2   וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֔ן אֵ֥י מִזֶּ֖ה תָּבֹ֑א וַיַּ֨עַן הַשָּׂטָ֤ן אֶת־יְהוָה֙ וַיֹּאמַ֔ר מִשֻּׁ֣ט בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּמֵהִתְהַלֵּ֖ךְ בָּֽהּ׃ ‬
Job 2:2
Job 2:3Yahweh said to Satan, |Have you considered my servant Job? For there is none like him in the earth, a blameless and an upright man, one who fears God, and turns away from evil. He still maintains his integrity, although you incited me against him, to ruin him without cause.|
Job 2:3   וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֗ן הֲשַׂ֣מְתָּ לִבְּךָ֮ אֶל־עַבְדִּ֣י אִיּוֹב֒ כִּי֩ אֵ֨ין כָּמֹ֜הוּ בָּאָ֗רֶץ אִ֣ישׁ תָּ֧ם וְיָשָׁ֛ר יְרֵ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים וְסָ֣ר מֵרָ֑ע וְעֹדֶ֙נּוּ֙ מַחֲזִ֣יק בְּתֻמָּת֔וֹ וַתְּסִיתֵ֥נִי ב֖וֹ לְבַלְּע֥וֹ חִנָּֽם׃ ‬
Job 2:3
Job 2:4Satan answered Yahweh, and said, |Skin for skin. Yes, all that a man has he will give for his life.
Job 2:4   וַיַּ֧עַן הַשָּׂטָ֛ן אֶת־יְהוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר ע֣וֹר בְּעַד־ע֗וֹר וְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָאִ֔ישׁ יִתֵּ֖ן בְּעַ֥ד נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃ ‬
Job 2:4
Job 2:5But put forth your hand now, and touch his bone and his flesh, and he will renounce you to your face.|
Job 2:5   אוּלָם֙ שְֽׁלַֽח־נָ֣א יָֽדְךָ֔ וְגַ֥ע אֶל־עַצְמ֖וֹ וְאֶל־בְּשָׂר֑וֹ אִם־לֹ֥א אֶל־פָּנֶ֖יךָ יְבָרֲכֶֽךָּ׃ ‬
Job 2:5
Job 2:6Yahweh said to Satan, |Behold, he is in your hand. Only spare his life.|
Job 2:6   וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהוָ֛ה אֶל־הַשָּׂטָ֖ן הִנּ֣וֹ בְיָדֶ֑ךָ אַ֖ךְ אֶת־נַפְשׁ֥וֹ שְׁמֹֽר׃ ‬
Job 2:6
Job 2:7So Satan went forth from the presence of Yahweh, and struck Job with painful sores from the sole of his foot to his head.
Job 2:7   וַיֵּצֵא֙ הַשָּׂטָ֔ן מֵאֵ֖ת פְּנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַיַּ֤ךְ אֶת־אִיּוֹב֙ בִּשְׁחִ֣ין רָ֔ע מִכַּ֥ף רַגְל֖וֹ *עד **וְעַ֥ד קָדְקֳדֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 2:7
Job 2:8He took for himself a potsherd to scrape himself with, and he sat among the ashes.
Job 2:8   וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֣וֹ חֶ֔רֶשׂ לְהִתְגָּרֵ֖ד בּ֑וֹ וְה֖וּא יֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּתוֹךְ־הָאֵֽפֶר׃ ‬
Job 2:8
Job 2:9Then his wife said to him, |Do you still maintain your integrity? Renounce God, and die.|
Job 2:9   וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ עֹדְךָ֖ מַחֲזִ֣יק בְּתֻמָּתֶ֑ךָ בָּרֵ֥ךְ אֱלֹהִ֖ים וָמֻֽת׃ ‬
Job 2:9
Job 2:10But he said to her, |You speak as one of the foolish women would speak. What? Shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil?| In all this Job didn't sin with his lips.
Job 2:10   וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלֶ֗יהָ כְּדַבֵּ֞ר אַחַ֤ת הַנְּבָלוֹת֙ תְּדַבֵּ֔רִי גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַטּ֗וֹב נְקַבֵּל֙ מֵאֵ֣ת הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְאֶת־הָרָ֖ע לֹ֣א נְקַבֵּ֑ל בְּכָל־זֹ֛את לֹא־חָטָ֥א אִיּ֖וֹב בִּשְׂפָתָֽיו׃ פ ‬
Job 2:10
Job 2:11Now when Job's three friends heard of all this evil that had come on him, they each came from his own place: Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite, and they made an appointment together to come to sympathize with him and to comfort him.
Job 2:11   וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֞וּ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת ׀ רֵעֵ֣י אִיּ֗וֹב אֵ֣ת כָּל־הָרָעָ֣ה הַזֹּאת֮ הַבָּ֣אָה עָלָיו֒ וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִמְּקֹמ֔וֹ אֱלִיפַ֤ז הַתֵּימָנִי֙ וּבִלְדַּ֣ד הַשּׁוּחִ֔י וְצוֹפַ֖ר הַנַּֽעֲמָתִ֑י וַיִּוָּעֲד֣וּ יַחְדָּ֔ו לָב֥וֹא לָנֽוּד־ל֖וֹ וּֽלְנַחֲמֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 2:11
Job 2:12When they lifted up their eyes from a distance, and didn't recognize him, they raised their voices, and wept; and they each tore his robe, and sprinkled dust on their heads toward the sky.
Job 2:12   וַיִּשְׂא֨וּ אֶת־עֵינֵיהֶ֤ם מֵרָחוֹק֙ וְלֹ֣א הִכִּירֻ֔הוּ וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ קוֹלָ֖ם וַיִּבְכּ֑וּ וַֽיִּקְרְעוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ מְעִל֔וֹ וַיִּזְרְק֥וּ עָפָ֛ר עַל־רָאשֵׁיהֶ֖ם הַשָּׁמָֽיְמָה׃ ‬
Job 2:12
Job 2:13So they sat down with him on the ground seven days and seven nights, and none spoke a word to him, for they saw that his grief was very great.
Job 2:13   וַיֵּשְׁב֤וּ אִתּוֹ֙ לָאָ֔רֶץ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים וְשִׁבְעַ֣ת לֵיל֑וֹת וְאֵין־דֹּבֵ֤ר אֵלָיו֙ דָּבָ֔ר כִּ֣י רָא֔וּ כִּֽי־גָדַ֥ל הַכְּאֵ֖ב מְאֹֽד׃ ‬
Job 2:13
Job 3:1After this Job opened his mouth, and cursed the day of his birth.
Job 3:1   אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן פָּתַ֤ח אִיּוֹב֙ אֶת־פִּ֔יהוּ וַיְקַלֵּ֖ל אֶת־יוֹמֽוֹ׃ פ ‬
Job 3:1
Job 3:2Job answered:
Job 3:2   וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 3:2
Job 3:3|Let the day perish in which I was born, the night which said, 'There is a boy conceived.'
Job 3:3   יֹ֣אבַד י֭וֹם אִוָּ֣לֶד בּ֑וֹ וְהַלַּ֥יְלָה אָ֝מַ֗ר הֹ֣רָה גָֽבֶר׃ ‬
Job 3:3
Job 3:4Let that day be darkness. Don't let God from above seek for it, neither let the light shine on it.
Job 3:4   הַיּ֥וֹם הַה֗וּא יְֽהִ֫י חֹ֥שֶׁךְ אַֽל־יִדְרְשֵׁ֣הוּ אֱל֣וֹהַּ מִמָּ֑עַל וְאַל־תּוֹפַ֖ע עָלָ֣יו נְהָרָֽה׃ ‬
Job 3:4
Job 3:5Let darkness and the shadow of death claim it for their own. Let a cloud dwell on it. Let all that makes black the day terrify it.
Job 3:5   יִגְאָלֻ֡הוּ חֹ֣שֶׁךְ וְ֭צַלְמָוֶת תִּשְׁכָּן־עָלָ֣יו עֲנָנָ֑ה יְ֝בַעֲתֻ֗הוּ כִּֽמְרִ֥ירֵי יֽוֹם׃ ‬
Job 3:5
Job 3:6As for that night, let thick darkness seize on it. Let it not rejoice among the days of the year. Let it not come into the number of the months.
Job 3:6   הַלַּ֥יְלָה הַהוּא֮ יִקָּחֵ֢ה֫וּ אֹ֥פֶל אַל־יִ֭חַדְּ בִּימֵ֣י שָׁנָ֑ה בְּמִסְפַּ֥ר יְ֝רָחִ֗ים אַל־יָבֹֽא׃ ‬
Job 3:6
Job 3:7Behold, let that night be barren. Let no joyful voice come therein.
Job 3:7   הִנֵּ֤ה הַלַּ֣יְלָה הַ֭הוּא יְהִ֣י גַלְמ֑וּד אַל־תָּבֹ֖א רְנָנָ֣ה בֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 3:7
Job 3:8Let them curse it who curse the day, who are ready to rouse up leviathan.
Job 3:8   יִקְּבֻ֥הוּ אֹרְרֵי־י֑וֹם הָ֝עֲתִידִ֗ים עֹרֵ֥ר לִוְיָתָֽן׃ ‬
Job 3:8
Job 3:9Let the stars of its twilight be dark. Let it look for light, but have none, neither let it see the eyelids of the morning,
Job 3:9   יֶחְשְׁכוּ֮ כּוֹכְבֵ֢י נִ֫שְׁפּ֥וֹ יְקַו־לְא֥וֹר וָאַ֑יִן וְאַל־יִ֝רְאֶ֗ה בְּעַפְעַפֵּי־שָֽׁחַר׃ ‬
Job 3:9
Job 3:10because it didn't shut up the doors of my mother's womb, nor did it hide trouble from my eyes.
Job 3:10   כִּ֤י לֹ֣א סָ֭גַר דַּלְתֵ֣י בִטְנִ֑י וַיַּסְתֵּ֥ר עָ֝מָ֗ל מֵעֵינָֽי׃ ‬
Job 3:10
Job 3:11|Why didn't I die from the womb? Why didn't I give up the spirit when my mother bore me?
Job 3:11   לָ֤מָּה לֹּ֣א מֵרֶ֣חֶם אָמ֑וּת מִבֶּ֖טֶן יָצָ֣אתִי וְאֶגְוָֽע׃ ‬
Job 3:11
Job 3:12Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breast, that I should nurse?
Job 3:12   מַ֭דּוּעַ קִדְּמ֣וּנִי בִרְכָּ֑יִם וּמַה־שָּׁ֝דַ֗יִם כִּ֣י אִינָֽק׃ ‬
Job 3:12
Job 3:13For now should I have lain down and been quiet. I should have slept, then I would have been at rest,
Job 3:13   כִּֽי־עַ֭תָּה שָׁכַ֣בְתִּי וְאֶשְׁק֑וֹט יָ֝שַׁ֗נְתִּי אָ֤ז ׀ יָנ֬וּחַֽ לִֽי׃ ‬
Job 3:13
Job 3:14with kings and counselors of the earth, who built up waste places for themselves;
Job 3:14   עִם־מְ֭לָכִים וְיֹ֣עֲצֵי אָ֑רֶץ הַבֹּנִ֖ים חֳרָב֣וֹת לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Job 3:14
Job 3:15or with princes who had gold, who filled their houses with silver:
Job 3:15   א֣וֹ עִם־שָׂ֭רִים זָהָ֣ב לָהֶ֑ם הַֽמְמַלְאִ֖ים בָּתֵּיהֶ֣ם כָּֽסֶף׃ ‬
Job 3:15
Job 3:16or as a hidden untimely birth I had not been, as infants who never saw light.
Job 3:16   א֤וֹ כְנֵ֣פֶל טָ֭מוּן לֹ֣א אֶהְיֶ֑ה כְּ֝עֹלְלִ֗ים לֹא־רָ֥אוּ אֽוֹר׃ ‬
Job 3:16
Job 3:17There the wicked cease from troubling. There the weary are at rest.
Job 3:17   שָׁ֣ם רְ֭שָׁעִים חָ֣דְלוּ רֹ֑גֶז וְשָׁ֥ם יָ֝נ֗וּחוּ יְגִ֣יעֵי כֹֽחַ׃ ‬
Job 3:17
Job 3:18There the prisoners are at ease together. They don't hear the voice of the taskmaster.
Job 3:18   יַ֭חַד אֲסִירִ֣ים שַׁאֲנָ֑נוּ לֹ֥א שָׁ֝מְע֗וּ ק֣וֹל נֹגֵֽשׂ׃ ‬
Job 3:18
Job 3:19The small and the great are there. The servant is free from his master.
Job 3:19   קָטֹ֣ן וְ֭גָדוֹל שָׁ֣ם ה֑וּא וְ֝עֶ֗בֶד חָפְשִׁ֥י מֵאֲדֹנָֽיו׃ ‬
Job 3:19
Job 3:20|Why is light given to him who is in misery, life to the bitter in soul,
Job 3:20   לָ֤מָּה יִתֵּ֣ן לְעָמֵ֣ל א֑וֹר וְ֝חַיִּ֗ים לְמָ֣רֵי נָֽפֶשׁ׃ ‬
Job 3:20
Job 3:21Who long for death, but it doesn't come; and dig for it more than for hidden treasures,
Job 3:21   הַֽמְחַכִּ֣ים לַמָּ֣וֶת וְאֵינֶ֑נּוּ וַֽ֝יַּחְפְּרֻ֗הוּ מִמַּטְמוֹנִֽים׃ ‬
Job 3:21
Job 3:22who rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?
Job 3:22   הַשְּׂמֵחִ֥ים אֱלֵי־גִ֑יל יָ֝שִׂ֗ישׂוּ כִּ֣י יִמְצְאוּ־קָֽבֶר׃ ‬
Job 3:22
Job 3:23Why is light given to a man whose way is hidden, whom God has hedged in?
Job 3:23   לְ֭גֶבֶר אֲשֶׁר־דַּרְכּ֣וֹ נִסְתָּ֑רָה וַיָּ֖סֶךְ אֱל֣וֹהַּ בַּעֲדֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 3:23
Job 3:24For my sighing comes before I eat. My groanings are poured out like water.
Job 3:24   כִּֽי־לִפְנֵ֣י לַ֭חְמִי אַנְחָתִ֣י תָבֹ֑א וַֽיִּתְּכ֥וּ כַ֝מַּ֗יִם שַׁאֲגֹתָֽי׃ ‬
Job 3:24
Job 3:25For the thing which I fear comes on me, That which I am afraid of comes to me.
Job 3:25   כִּ֤י פַ֣חַד פָּ֭חַדְתִּי וַיֶּאֱתָיֵ֑נִי וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָ֝גֹ֗רְתִּי יָ֣בֹא לִֽי׃ ‬
Job 3:25
Job 3:26I am not at ease, neither am I quiet, neither have I rest; but trouble comes.|
Job 3:26   לֹ֤א שָׁלַ֨וְתִּי ׀ וְלֹ֖א שָׁקַ֥טְתִּי וְֽלֹא־נָ֗חְתִּי וַיָּ֥בֹא רֹֽגֶז׃ פ ‬
Job 3:26
Job 4:1Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered,
Job 4:1   וַ֭יַּעַן אֱלִיפַ֥ז הַֽתֵּימָנִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 4:1
Job 4:2|If someone ventures to talk with you, will you be grieved? But who can withhold himself from speaking?
Job 4:2   הֲנִסָּ֬ה דָבָ֣ר אֵלֶ֣יךָ תִּלְאֶ֑ה וַעְצֹ֥ר בְּ֝מִלִּ֗ין מִ֣י יוּכָֽל׃ ‬
Job 4:2
Job 4:3Behold, you have instructed many, you have strengthened the weak hands.
Job 4:3   הִ֭נֵּה יִסַּ֣רְתָּ רַבִּ֑ים וְיָדַ֖יִם רָפ֣וֹת תְּחַזֵּֽק׃ ‬
Job 4:3
Job 4:4Your words have supported him who was falling, You have made firm the feeble knees.
Job 4:4   כּ֭וֹשֵׁל יְקִימ֣וּן מִלֶּ֑יךָ וּבִרְכַּ֖יִם כֹּרְע֣וֹת תְּאַמֵּֽץ׃ ‬
Job 4:4
Job 4:5But now it is come to you, and you faint. It touches you, and you are troubled.
Job 4:5   כִּ֤י עַתָּ֨ה ׀ תָּב֣וֹא אֵלֶ֣יךָ וַתֵּ֑לֶא תִּגַּ֥ע עָ֝דֶ֗יךָ וַתִּבָּהֵֽל׃ ‬
Job 4:5
Job 4:6Isn't your piety your confidence? Isn't the integrity of your ways your hope?
Job 4:6   הֲלֹ֣א יִ֭רְאָתְךָ כִּסְלָתֶ֑ךָ תִּ֝קְוָתְךָ֗ וְתֹ֣ם דְּרָכֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Job 4:6
Job 4:7|Remember, now, whoever perished, being innocent? Or where were the upright cut off?
Job 4:7   זְכָר־נָ֗א מִ֤י ה֣וּא נָקִ֣י אָבָ֑ד וְ֝אֵיפֹ֗ה יְשָׁרִ֥ים נִכְחָֽדוּ׃ ‬
Job 4:7
Job 4:8According to what I have seen, those who plow iniquity, and sow trouble, reap the same.
Job 4:8   כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר רָ֭אִיתִי חֹ֣רְשֵׁי אָ֑וֶן וְזֹרְעֵ֖י עָמָ֣ל יִקְצְרֻֽהוּ׃ ‬
Job 4:8
Job 4:9By the breath of God they perish. By the blast of his anger are they consumed.
Job 4:9   מִנִּשְׁמַ֣ת אֱל֣וֹהַ יֹאבֵ֑דוּ וּמֵר֖וּחַ אַפּ֣וֹ יִכְלֽוּ׃ ‬
Job 4:9
Job 4:10The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, the teeth of the young lions, are broken.
Job 4:10   שַׁאֲגַ֣ת אַ֭רְיֵה וְק֣וֹל שָׁ֑חַל וְשִׁנֵּ֖י כְפִירִ֣ים נִתָּֽעוּ׃ ‬
Job 4:10
Job 4:11The old lion perishes for lack of prey. The cubs of the lioness are scattered abroad.
Job 4:11   לַ֭יִשׁ אֹבֵ֣ד מִבְּלִי־טָ֑רֶף וּבְנֵ֥י לָ֝בִ֗יא יִתְפָּרָֽדוּ׃ ‬
Job 4:11
Job 4:12|Now a thing was secretly brought to me. My ear received a whisper of it.
Job 4:12   וְ֭אֵלַי דָּבָ֣ר יְגֻנָּ֑ב וַתִּקַּ֥ח אָ֝זְנִ֗י שֵׁ֣מֶץ מֽ͏ֶנְהֽוּ׃ ‬
Job 4:12
Job 4:13In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falls on men,
Job 4:13   בִּ֭שְׂעִפִּים מֵחֶזְיֹנ֣וֹת לָ֑יְלָה בִּנְפֹ֥ל תַּ֝רְדֵּמָ֗ה עַל־אֲנָשִֽׁים׃ ‬
Job 4:13
Job 4:14fear came on me, and trembling, which made all my bones shake.
Job 4:14   פַּ֣חַד קְ֭רָאַנִי וּרְעָדָ֑ה וְרֹ֖ב עַצְמוֹתַ֣י הִפְחִֽיד׃ ‬
Job 4:14
Job 4:15Then a spirit passed before my face. The hair of my flesh stood up.
Job 4:15   וְ֭רוּחַ עַל־פָּנַ֣י יַחֲלֹ֑ף תְּ֝סַמֵּ֗ר שַֽׂעֲרַ֥ת בְּשָׂרִֽי׃ ‬
Job 4:15
Job 4:16It stood still, but I couldn't discern its appearance. A form was before my eyes. Silence, then I heard a voice, saying,
Job 4:16   יַעֲמֹ֤ד ׀ וְֽלֹא־אַכִּ֬יר מַרְאֵ֗הוּ תְּ֭מוּנָה לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָ֑י דְּמָמָ֖ה וָק֣וֹל אֶשְׁמָֽע׃ ‬
Job 4:16
Job 4:17'Shall mortal man be more just than God? Shall a man be more pure than his Maker?
Job 4:17   הַֽ֭אֱנוֹשׁ מֵאֱל֣וֹהַ יִצְדָּ֑ק אִ֥ם מֵ֝עֹשֵׂ֗הוּ יִטְהַר־גָּֽבֶר׃ ‬
Job 4:17
Job 4:18Behold, he puts no trust in his servants. He charges his angels with error.
Job 4:18   הֵ֣ן בַּ֭עֲבָדָיו לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֑ין וּ֝בְמַלְאָכָ֗יו יָשִׂ֥ים תָּהֳלָֽה׃ ‬
Job 4:18
Job 4:19How much more, those who dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, who are crushed before the moth!
Job 4:19   אַ֤ף ׀ שֹׁכְנֵ֬י בָֽתֵּי־חֹ֗מֶר אֲשֶׁר־בֶּעָפָ֥ר יְסוֹדָ֑ם יְ֝דַכְּא֗וּם לִפְנֵי־עָֽשׁ׃ ‬
Job 4:19
Job 4:20Between morning and evening they are destroyed. They perish forever without any regarding it.
Job 4:20   מִבֹּ֣קֶר לָעֶ֣רֶב יֻכַּ֑תּוּ מִבְּלִ֥י מֵ֝שִׂ֗ים לָנֶ֥צַח יֹאבֵֽדוּ׃ ‬
Job 4:20
Job 4:21Isn't their tent cord plucked up within them? They die, and that without wisdom.'
Job 4:21   הֲלֹא־נִסַּ֣ע יִתְרָ֣ם בָּ֑ם יָ֝מ֗וּתוּ וְלֹ֣א בְחָכְמָֽה׃ ‬
Job 4:21
Job 5:1|Call now; is there any who will answer you? To which of the holy ones will you turn?
Job 5:1   קְֽרָא־נָ֭א הֲיֵ֣שׁ עוֹנֶ֑ךָּ וְאֶל־מִ֖י מִקְּדֹשִׁ֣ים תִּפְנֶֽה׃ ‬
Job 5:1
Job 5:2For resentment kills the foolish man, and jealousy kills the simple.
Job 5:2   כִּֽי־לֶֽ֭אֱוִיל יַהֲרָג־כָּ֑עַשׂ וּ֝פֹתֶ֗ה תָּמִ֥ית קִנְאָֽה׃ ‬
Job 5:2
Job 5:3I have seen the foolish taking root, but suddenly I cursed his habitation.
Job 5:3   אֲ‍ֽנִי־רָ֭אִיתִי אֱוִ֣יל מַשְׁרִ֑ישׁ וָאֶקּ֖וֹב נָוֵ֣הוּ פִתְאֹֽם׃ ‬
Job 5:3
Job 5:4His children are far from safety. They are crushed in the gate. Neither is there any to deliver them,
Job 5:4   יִרְחֲק֣וּ בָנָ֣יו מִיֶּ֑שַׁע וְיִֽדַּכְּא֥וּ בַ֝שַּׁ֗עַר וְאֵ֣ין מַצִּֽיל׃ ‬
Job 5:4
Job 5:5whose harvest the hungry eats up, and take it even out of the thorns. The snare gapes for their substance.
Job 5:5   אֲשֶׁ֤ר קְצִיר֨וֹ ׀ רָ֘עֵ֤ב יֹאכֵ֗ל וְאֶֽל־מִצִּנִּ֥ים יִקָּחֵ֑הוּ וְשָׁאַ֖ף צַמִּ֣ים חֵילָֽם׃ ‬
Job 5:5
Job 5:6For affliction doesn't come forth from the dust, neither does trouble spring out of the ground;
Job 5:6   כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־יֵצֵ֣א מֵעָפָ֣ר אָ֑וֶן וּ֝מֵאֲדָמָ֗ה לֹא־יִצְמַ֥ח עָמָֽל׃ ‬
Job 5:6
Job 5:7but man is born to trouble, as the sparks fly upward.
Job 5:7   כִּֽי־אָ֭דָם לְעָמָ֣ל יוּלָּ֑ד וּבְנֵי־רֶ֝֗שֶׁף יַגְבִּ֥יהוּ עֽוּף׃ ‬
Job 5:7
Job 5:8|But as for me, I would seek God. I would commit my cause to God,
Job 5:8   אוּלָ֗ם אֲ֭נִי אֶדְרֹ֣שׁ אֶל־אֵ֑ל וְאֶל־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים אָשִׂ֥ים דִּבְרָתִֽי׃ ‬
Job 5:8
Job 5:9who does great things that can't be fathomed, marvelous things without number;
Job 5:9   עֹשֶׂ֣ה גְ֭דֹלוֹת וְאֵ֣ין חֵ֑קֶר נִ֝פְלָא֗וֹת עַד־אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃ ‬
Job 5:9
Job 5:10who gives rain on the earth, and sends waters on the fields;
Job 5:10   הַנֹּתֵ֣ן מָ֭טָר עַל־פְּנֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְשֹׁ֥לֵֽחַ מַ֝יִם עַל־פְּנֵ֥י חוּצֽוֹת׃ ‬
Job 5:10
Job 5:11so that he sets up on high those who are low, those who mourn are exalted to safety.
Job 5:11   לָשׂ֣וּם שְׁפָלִ֣ים לְמָר֑וֹם וְ֝קֹדְרִ֗ים שָׂ֣גְבוּ יֶֽשַׁע׃ ‬
Job 5:11
Job 5:12He frustrates the devices of the crafty, So that their hands can't perform their enterprise.
Job 5:12   מֵ֭פֵר מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת עֲרוּמִ֑ים וְֽלֹא־תַעֲשֶׂ֥ינָה יְ֝דֵיהֶ֗ם תּוּשִׁיָּֽה׃ ‬
Job 5:12
Job 5:13He takes the wise in their own craftiness; the counsel of the cunning is carried headlong.
Job 5:13   לֹכֵ֣ד חֲכָמִ֣ים בְּעָרְמָ֑ם וַעֲצַ֖ת נִפְתָּלִ֣ים נִמְהָֽרָה׃ ‬
Job 5:13
Job 5:14They meet with darkness in the day time, and grope at noonday as in the night.
Job 5:14   יוֹמָ֥ם יְפַגְּשׁוּ־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וְ֝כַלַּ֗יְלָה יְֽמַשְׁשׁ֥וּ בַֽצָּהֳרָֽיִם׃ ‬
Job 5:14
Job 5:15But he saves from the sword of their mouth, even the needy from the hand of the mighty.
Job 5:15   וַיֹּ֣שַׁע מֵ֭חֶרֶב מִפִּיהֶ֑ם וּמִיַּ֖ד חָזָ֣ק אֶבְיֽוֹן׃ ‬
Job 5:15
Job 5:16So the poor has hope, and injustice shuts her mouth.
Job 5:16   וַתְּהִ֣י לַדַּ֣ל תִּקְוָ֑ה וְ֝עֹלָ֗תָה קָ֣פְצָה פִּֽיהָ׃ ‬
Job 5:16
Job 5:17|Behold, happy is the man whom God corrects. Therefore do not despise the chastening of the Almighty.
Job 5:17   הִנֵּ֤ה אַשְׁרֵ֣י אֱ֭נוֹשׁ יוֹכִחֶ֣נּֽוּ אֱל֑וֹהַּ וּמוּסַ֥ר שַׁ֝דַּ֗י אַל־תִּמְאָֽס׃ ‬
Job 5:17
Job 5:18For he wounds, and binds up. He injures, and his hands make whole.
Job 5:18   כִּ֤י ה֣וּא יַכְאִ֣יב וְיֶחְבָּ֑שׁ יִ֝מְחַ֗ץ *וידו **וְיָדָ֥יו תִּרְפֶּֽינָה׃ ‬
Job 5:18
Job 5:19He will deliver you in six troubles; yes, in seven no evil shall touch you.
Job 5:19   בְּשֵׁ֣שׁ צָ֭רוֹת יַצִּילֶ֑ךָּ וּבְשֶׁ֓בַע ׀ לֹא־יִגַּ֖ע בְּךָ֣ רָֽע׃ ‬
Job 5:19
Job 5:20In famine he will redeem you from death; in war, from the power of the sword.
Job 5:20   בְּ֭רָעָב פָּֽדְךָ֣ מִמָּ֑וֶת וּ֝בְמִלְחָמָ֗ה מִ֣ידֵי חָֽרֶב׃ ‬
Job 5:20
Job 5:21You shall be hidden from the scourge of the tongue, neither shall you be afraid of destruction when it comes.
Job 5:21   בְּשׁ֣וֹט לָ֭שׁוֹן תֵּחָבֵ֑א וְֽלֹא־תִירָ֥א מִ֝שֹּׁ֗ד כִּ֣י יָבֽוֹא׃ ‬
Job 5:21
Job 5:22At destruction and famine you shall laugh, neither shall you be afraid of the animals of the earth.
Job 5:22   לְשֹׁ֣ד וּלְכָפָ֣ן תִּשְׂחָ֑ק וּֽמֵחַיַּ֥ת הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ אַל־תִּירָֽא׃ ‬
Job 5:22
Job 5:23For you shall be allied with the stones of the field. The animals of the field shall be at peace with you.
Job 5:23   כִּ֤י עִם־אַבְנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֣ה בְרִיתֶ֑ךָ וְחַיַּ֥ת הַ֝שָּׂדֶ֗ה הָשְׁלְמָה־לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 5:23
Job 5:24You shall know that your tent is in peace. You shall visit your fold, and shall miss nothing.
Job 5:24   וְֽ֭יָדַעְתָּ כִּי־שָׁל֣וֹם אָהֳלֶ֑ךָ וּֽפָקַדְתָּ֥ נָ֝וְךָ וְלֹ֣א תֶחֱטָֽא׃ ‬
Job 5:24
Job 5:25You shall know also that your seed shall be great, Your offspring as the grass of the earth.
Job 5:25   וְֽ֭יָדַעְתָּ כִּי־רַ֣ב זַרְעֶ֑ךָ וְ֝צֶאֱצָאֶ֗יךָ כְּעֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Job 5:25
Job 5:26You shall come to your grave in a full age, like a shock of grain comes in its season.
Job 5:26   תָּב֣וֹא בְכֶ֣לַח אֱלֵי־קָ֑בֶר כַּעֲל֖וֹת גָּדִ֣ישׁ בְּעִתּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 5:26
Job 5:27Look this, we have searched it, so it is. Hear it, and know it for your good.|
Job 5:27   הִנֵּה־זֹ֭את חֲקַרְנ֥וּהָ כֶּֽן־הִ֑יא שְׁ֝מָעֶ֗נָּה וְאַתָּ֥ה דַֽע־לָֽךְ׃ פ ‬
Job 5:27
Job 6:1Then Job answered,
Job 6:1   וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 6:1
Job 6:2|Oh that my anguish were weighed, and all my calamity laid in the balances!
Job 6:2   ל֗וּ שָׁק֣וֹל יִשָּׁקֵ֣ל כַּעְשִׂ֑י *והיתי **וְ֝הַוָּתִ֗י בְּֽמֹאזְנַ֥יִם יִשְׂאוּ־יָֽחַד׃ ‬
Job 6:2
Job 6:3For now it would be heavier than the sand of the seas, therefore have my words been rash.
Job 6:3   כִּֽי־עַתָּ֗ה מֵח֣וֹל יַמִּ֣ים יִכְבָּ֑ד עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן דְּבָרַ֥י לָֽעוּ׃ ‬
Job 6:3
Job 6:4For the arrows of the Almighty are within me. My spirit drinks up their poison. The terrors of God set themselves in array against me.
Job 6:4   כִּ֤י חִצֵּ֪י שַׁדַּ֡י עִמָּדִ֗י אֲשֶׁ֣ר חֲ֭מָתָם שֹׁתָ֣ה רוּחִ֑י בִּעוּתֵ֖י אֱל֣וֹהַּ יַֽעַרְכֽוּנִי׃ ‬
Job 6:4
Job 6:5Does the wild donkey bray when he has grass? Or does the ox low over his fodder?
Job 6:5   הֲיִֽנְהַק־פֶּ֥רֶא עֲלֵי־דֶ֑שֶׁא אִ֥ם יִגְעֶה־שּׁ֝֗וֹר עַל־בְּלִילֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 6:5
Job 6:6Can that which has no flavor be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
Job 6:6   הֲיֵאָכֵ֣ל תָּ֭פֵל מִבְּלִי־מֶ֑לַח אִם־יֶשׁ־טַ֝֗עַם בְּרִ֣יר חַלָּמֽוּת׃ ‬
Job 6:6
Job 6:7My soul refuses to touch them. They are as loathsome food to me.
Job 6:7   מֵאֲנָ֣ה לִנְגּ֣וֹעַ נַפְשִׁ֑י הֵ֝֗מָּה כִּדְוֵ֥י לַחְמִֽי׃ ‬
Job 6:7
Job 6:8|Oh that I might have my request, that God would grant the thing that I long for,
Job 6:8   מִֽי־יִ֭תֵּן תָּב֣וֹא שֶֽׁאֱלָתִ֑י וְ֝תִקְוָתִ֗י יִתֵּ֥ן אֱלֽוֹהַּ׃ ‬
Job 6:8
Job 6:9even that it would please God to crush me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!
Job 6:9   וְיֹאֵ֣ל אֱ֭לוֹהַּ וִֽידַכְּאֵ֑נִי יַתֵּ֥ר יָ֝ד֗וֹ וִֽיבַצְּעֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 6:9
Job 6:10Be it still my consolation, yes, let me exult in pain that doesn't spare, that I have not denied the words of the Holy One.
Job 6:10   וּ֥תְהִי ע֨וֹד ׀ נֶ֘חָ֤מָתִ֗י וַאֲסַלְּדָ֣ה בְ֭חִילָה לֹ֣א יַחְמ֑וֹל כִּי־לֹ֥א כִ֝חַ֗דְתִּי אִמְרֵ֥י קָדֽוֹשׁ׃ ‬
Job 6:10
Job 6:11What is my strength, that I should wait? What is my end, that I should be patient?
Job 6:11   מַה־כֹּחִ֥י כִֽי־אֲיַחֵ֑ל וּמַה־קִּ֝צִּ֗י כִּֽי־אַאֲרִ֥יךְ נַפְשִֽׁי׃ ‬
Job 6:11
Job 6:12Is my strength the strength of stones? Or is my flesh of brass?
Job 6:12   אִם־כֹּ֣חַ אֲבָנִ֣ים כֹּחִ֑י אִֽם־בְּשָׂרִ֥י נָחֽוּשׁ׃ ‬
Job 6:12
Job 6:13Isn't it that I have no help in me, That wisdom is driven quite from me?
Job 6:13   הַאִ֬ם אֵ֣ין עֶזְרָתִ֣י בִ֑י וְ֝תֻשִׁיָּ֗ה נִדְּחָ֥ה מִמֶּֽנִּי׃ ‬
Job 6:13
Job 6:14|To him who is ready to faint, kindness should be shown from his friend; even to him who forsakes the fear of the Almighty.
Job 6:14   לַמָּ֣ס מֵרֵעֵ֣הוּ חָ֑סֶד וְיִרְאַ֖ת שַׁדַּ֣י יַעֲזֽוֹב׃ ‬
Job 6:14
Job 6:15My brothers have dealt deceitfully as a brook, as the channel of brooks that pass away;
Job 6:15   אַ֭חַי בָּגְד֣וּ כְמוֹ־נָ֑חַל כַּאֲפִ֖יק נְחָלִ֣ים יַעֲבֹֽרוּ׃ ‬
Job 6:15
Job 6:16Which are black by reason of the ice, in which the snow hides itself.
Job 6:16   הַקֹּדְרִ֥ים מִנִּי־קָ֑רַח עָ֝לֵ֗ימוֹ יִתְעַלֶּם־שָֽׁלֶג׃ ‬
Job 6:16
Job 6:17In the dry season, they vanish. When it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.
Job 6:17   בְּ֭עֵת יְזֹרְב֣וּ נִצְמָ֑תוּ בְּ֝חֻמּ֗וֹ נִדְעֲכ֥וּ מִמְּקוֹמָֽם׃ ‬
Job 6:17
Job 6:18The caravans that travel beside them turn aside. They go up into the waste, and perish.
Job 6:18   יִ֭לָּ֣פְתוּ אָרְח֣וֹת דַּרְכָּ֑ם יַעֲל֖וּ בַתֹּ֣הוּ וְיֹאבֵֽדוּ׃ ‬
Job 6:18
Job 6:19The caravans of Tema looked. The companies of Sheba waited for them.
Job 6:19   הִ֭בִּיטוּ אָרְח֣וֹת תֵּמָ֑א הֲלִיכֹ֥ת שְׁ֝בָ֗א קִוּוּ־לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Job 6:19
Job 6:20They were distressed because they were confident. They came there, and were confounded.
Job 6:20   בֹּ֥שׁוּ כִּֽי־בָטָ֑ח בָּ֥אוּ עָ֝דֶ֗יהָ וַיֶּחְפָּֽרוּ׃ ‬
Job 6:20
Job 6:21For now you are nothing. You see a terror, and are afraid.
Job 6:21   כִּֽי־עַ֭תָּה הֱיִ֣יתֶם *לא **ל֑וֹ תִּֽרְא֥וּ חֲ֝תַ֗ת וַתִּירָֽאוּ׃ ‬
Job 6:21
Job 6:22Did I say, 'Give to me?' or, 'Offer a present for me from your substance?'
Job 6:22   הֲ‍ֽכִי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי הָ֣בוּ לִ֑י וּ֝מִכֹּחֲכֶ֗ם שִׁחֲד֥וּ בַעֲדִֽי׃ ‬
Job 6:22
Job 6:23or, 'Deliver me from the adversary's hand?' or, 'Redeem me from the hand of the oppressors?'
Job 6:23   וּמַלְּט֥וּנִי מִיַּד־צָ֑ר וּמִיַּ֖ד עָרִיצִ֣ים תִּפְדּֽוּנִי׃ ‬
Job 6:23
Job 6:24|Teach me, and I will hold my peace. Cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
Job 6:24   ה֭וֹרוּנִי וַאֲנִ֣י אַחֲרִ֑ישׁ וּמַה־שָּׁ֝גִ֗יתִי הָבִ֥ינוּ לִֽי׃ ‬
Job 6:24
Job 6:25How forcible are words of uprightness! But your reproof, what does it reprove?
Job 6:25   מַה־נִּמְרְצ֥וּ אִמְרֵי־יֹ֑שֶׁר וּמַה־יּוֹכִ֖יחַ הוֹכֵ֣חַ מִכֶּֽם׃ ‬
Job 6:25
Job 6:26Do you intend to reprove words, since the speeches of one who is desperate are as wind?
Job 6:26   הַלְהוֹכַ֣ח מִלִּ֣ים תַּחְשֹׁ֑בוּ וּ֝לְר֗וּחַ אִמְרֵ֥י נֹאָֽשׁ׃ ‬
Job 6:26
Job 6:27Yes, you would even cast lots for the fatherless, and make merchandise of your friend.
Job 6:27   אַף־עַל־יָת֥וֹם תַּפִּ֑ילוּ וְ֝תִכְר֗וּ עַל־רֵֽיעֲכֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 6:27
Job 6:28Now therefore be pleased to look at me, for surely I shall not lie to your face.
Job 6:28   וְ֭עַתָּה הוֹאִ֣ילוּ פְנוּ־בִ֑י וְעַל־פְּ֝נֵיכֶ֗ם אִם־אֲכַזֵּֽב׃ ‬
Job 6:28
Job 6:29Please return. Let there be no injustice. Yes, return again. My cause is righteous.
Job 6:29   שֻֽׁבוּ־נָ֭א אַל־תְּהִ֣י עַוְלָ֑ה *ושבי **וְשׁ֥וּבוּ ע֝וֹד צִדְקִי־בָֽהּ׃ ‬
Job 6:29
Job 6:30Is there injustice on my tongue? Can't my taste discern mischievous things?
Job 6:30   הֲיֵשׁ־בִּלְשׁוֹנִ֥י עַוְלָ֑ה אִם־חִ֝כִּ֗י לֹא־יָבִ֥ין הַוּֽוֹת׃ ‬
Job 6:30
Job 7:1|Isn't a man forced to labor on earth? Aren't his days like the days of a hired hand?
Job 7:1   הֲלֹא־צָבָ֣א לֶאֱנ֣וֹשׁ *על־**עֲלֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְכִימֵ֖י שָׂכִ֣יר יָמָֽיו׃ ‬
Job 7:1
Job 7:2As a servant who earnestly desires the shadow, as a hireling who looks for his wages,
Job 7:2   כְּעֶ֥בֶד יִשְׁאַף־צֵ֑ל וּ֝כְשָׂכִ֗יר יְקַוֶּ֥ה פָעֳלֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 7:2
Job 7:3so am I made to possess months of misery, wearisome nights are appointed to me.
Job 7:3   כֵּ֤ן הָנְחַ֣לְתִּי לִ֭י יַרְחֵי־שָׁ֑וְא וְלֵיל֥וֹת עָ֝מָ֗ל מִנּוּ־לִֽי׃ ‬
Job 7:3
Job 7:4When I lie down, I say, 'When shall I arise, and the night be gone?' I toss and turn until the dawning of the day.
Job 7:4   אִם־שָׁכַ֗בְתִּי וְאָמַ֗רְתִּי מָתַ֣י אָ֭קוּם וּמִדַּד־עָ֑רֶב וְשָׂבַ֖עְתִּי נְדֻדִ֣ים עֲדֵי־נָֽשֶׁף׃ ‬
Job 7:4
Job 7:5My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust. My skin closes up, and breaks out afresh.
Job 7:5   לָ֘בַ֤שׁ בְּשָׂרִ֣י רִ֭מָּה *וגיש **וְג֣וּשׁ עָפָ֑ר עוֹרִ֥י רָ֝גַ֗ע וַיִּמָּאֵֽס׃ ‬
Job 7:5
Job 7:6My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle, and are spent without hope.
Job 7:6   יָמַ֣י קַ֭לּוּ מִנִּי־אָ֑רֶג וַ֝יִּכְל֗וּ בְּאֶ֣פֶס תִּקְוָֽה׃ ‬
Job 7:6
Job 7:7Oh remember that my life is a breath. My eye shall no more see good.
Job 7:7   זְ֭כֹר כִּי־ר֣וּחַ חַיָּ֑י לֹא־תָשׁ֥וּב עֵ֝ינִ֗י לִרְא֥וֹת טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Job 7:7
Job 7:8The eye of him who sees me shall see me no more. Your eyes shall be on me, but I shall not be.
Job 7:8   לֹֽא־תְ֭שׁוּרֵנִי עֵ֣ין רֹ֑אִי עֵינֶ֖יךָ בִּ֣י וְאֵינֶֽנִּי׃ ‬
Job 7:8
Job 7:9As the cloud is consumed and vanishes away, so he who goes down to Sheol shall come up no more.
Job 7:9   כָּלָ֣ה עָ֭נָן וַיֵּלַ֑ךְ כֵּ֥ן יוֹרֵ֥ד שְׁ֝א֗וֹל לֹ֣א יַעֲלֽ͏ֶה׃ ‬
Job 7:9
Job 7:10He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.
Job 7:10   לֹא־יָשׁ֣וּב ע֣וֹד לְבֵית֑וֹ וְלֹא־יַכִּירֶ֖נּוּ ע֣וֹד מְקֹמֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 7:10
Job 7:11|Therefore I will not keep silent. I will speak in the anguish of my spirit. I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
Job 7:11   גַּם־אֲנִי֮ לֹ֤א אֶחֱשָׂ֫ךְ פִּ֥י אֲ‍ֽ֭דַבְּרָה בְּצַ֣ר רוּחִ֑י אָ֝שִׂ֗יחָה בְּמַ֣ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃ ‬
Job 7:11
Job 7:12Am I a sea, or a sea monster, that you put a guard over me?
Job 7:12   הֲ‍ֽיָם־אָ֭נִי אִם־תַּנִּ֑ין כִּֽי־תָשִׂ֖ים עָלַ֣י מִשְׁמָֽר׃ ‬
Job 7:12
Job 7:13When I say, 'My bed shall comfort me. My couch shall ease my complaint;'
Job 7:13   כִּֽי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי תְּנַחֲמֵ֣נִי עַרְשִׂ֑י יִשָּׂ֥א בְ֝שִׂיחִ֗י מִשְׁכָּבִֽי׃ ‬
Job 7:13
Job 7:14then you scare me with dreams, and terrify me through visions:
Job 7:14   וְחִתַּתַּ֥נִי בַחֲלֹמ֑וֹת וּֽמֵחֶזְיֹנ֥וֹת תְּבַעֲתַֽנִּי׃ ‬
Job 7:14
Job 7:15so that my soul chooses strangling, death rather than my bones.
Job 7:15   וַתִּבְחַ֣ר מַחֲנָ֣ק נַפְשִׁ֑י מָ֝֗וֶת מֵֽעַצְמוֹתָֽי׃ ‬
Job 7:15
Job 7:16I loathe my life. I don't want to live forever. Leave me alone, for my days are but a breath.
Job 7:16   מָ֭אַסְתִּי לֹא־לְעֹלָ֣ם אֶֽחְיֶ֑ה חֲדַ֥ל מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי כִּי־הֶ֥בֶל יָמָֽי׃ ‬
Job 7:16
Job 7:17What is man, that you should magnify him, that you should set your mind on him,
Job 7:17   מָֽה־אֱ֭נוֹשׁ כִּ֣י תְגַדְּלֶ֑נּוּ וְכִי־תָשִׁ֖ית אֵלָ֣יו לִבֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Job 7:17
Job 7:18that you should visit him every morning, and test him every moment?
Job 7:18   וַתִּפְקְדֶ֥נּוּ לִבְקָרִ֑ים לִ֝רְגָעִ֗ים תִּבְחָנֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Job 7:18
Job 7:19How long will you not look away from me, nor leave me alone until I swallow down my spittle?
Job 7:19   כַּ֭מָּה לֹא־תִשְׁעֶ֣ה מִמֶּ֑נִּי לֹֽא־תַ֝רְפֵּ֗נִי עַד־בִּלְעִ֥י רֻקִּֽי׃ ‬
Job 7:19
Job 7:20If I have sinned, what do I do to you, you watcher of men? Why have you set me as a mark for you, so that I am a burden to myself?
Job 7:20   חָטָ֡אתִי מָ֤ה אֶפְעַ֨ל ׀ לָךְ֮ נֹצֵ֢ר הָאָ֫דָ֥ם לָ֤מָה שַׂמְתַּ֣נִי לְמִפְגָּ֣ע לָ֑ךְ וָאֶהְיֶ֖ה עָלַ֣י לְמַשָּֽׂא׃ ‬
Job 7:20
Job 7:21Why do you not pardon my disobedience, and take away my iniquity? For now shall I lie down in the dust. You will seek me diligently, but I shall not be.|
Job 7:21   וּמֶ֤ה ׀ לֹא־תִשָּׂ֣א פִשְׁעִי֮ וְתַעֲבִ֢יר אֶת־עֲוֺ֫נִ֥י כִּֽי־עַ֭תָּה לֶעָפָ֣ר אֶשְׁכָּ֑ב וְשִׁ֖חֲרְתַּ֣נִי וְאֵינֶֽנִּי׃ פ ‬
Job 7:21
Job 8:1Then Bildad the Shuhite answered,
Job 8:1   וַ֭יַּעַן בִּלְדַּ֥ד הַשּׁוּחִ֗י וַיֹאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 8:1
Job 8:2|How long will you speak these things? Shall the words of your mouth be a mighty wind?
Job 8:2   עַד־אָ֥ן תְּמַלֶּל־אֵ֑לֶּה וְר֥וּחַ כַּ֝בִּיר אִמְרֵי־פִֽיךָ׃ ‬
Job 8:2
Job 8:3Does God pervert justice? Or does the Almighty pervert righteousness?
Job 8:3   הַ֭אֵל יְעַוֵּ֣ת מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וְאִם־שַׁ֝דַּ֗י יְעַוֵּֽת־צֶֽדֶק׃ ‬
Job 8:3
Job 8:4If your children have sinned against him, He has delivered them into the hand of their disobedience.
Job 8:4   אִם־בָּנֶ֥יךָ חָֽטְאוּ־ל֑וֹ וַֽ֝יְשַׁלְּחֵ֗ם בְּיַד־פִּשְׁעָֽם׃ ‬
Job 8:4
Job 8:5If you want to seek God diligently, make your supplication to the Almighty.
Job 8:5   אִם־אַ֭תָּה תְּשַׁחֵ֣ר אֶל־אֵ֑ל וְאֶל־שַׁ֝דַּ֗י תִּתְחַנָּֽן׃ ‬
Job 8:5
Job 8:6If you were pure and upright, surely now he would awaken for you, and make the habitation of your righteousness prosperous.
Job 8:6   אִם־זַ֥ךְ וְיָשָׁ֗ר אָ֥תָּה כִּי־עַ֭תָּה יָעִ֣יר עָלֶ֑יךָ וְ֝שִׁלַּ֗ם נְוַ֣ת צִדְקֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Job 8:6
Job 8:7Though your beginning was small, yet your latter end would greatly increase.
Job 8:7   וְהָיָ֣ה רֵאשִׁיתְךָ֣ מִצְעָ֑ר וְ֝אַחֲרִיתְךָ֗ יִשְׂגֶּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃ ‬
Job 8:7
Job 8:8|Please inquire of past generations. Find out about the learning of their fathers.
Job 8:8   כִּֽי־שְׁאַל־נָ֭א לְדֹ֣ר רִישׁ֑וֹן וְ֝כוֹנֵ֗ן לְחֵ֣קֶר אֲבוֹתָֽם׃ ‬
Job 8:8
Job 8:9(For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days on earth are a shadow.)
Job 8:9   כִּֽי־תְמ֣וֹל אֲ֭נַחְנוּ וְלֹ֣א נֵדָ֑ע כִּ֤י צֵ֖ל יָמֵ֣ינוּ עֲלֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Job 8:9
Job 8:10Shall they not teach you, tell you, and utter words out of their heart?
Job 8:10   הֲלֹא־הֵ֣ם י֭וֹרוּךָ יֹ֣אמְרוּ לָ֑ךְ וּ֝מִלִּבָּ֗ם יוֹצִ֥אוּ מִלִּֽים׃ ‬
Job 8:10
Job 8:11|Can the papyrus grow up without mire? Can the rushes grow without water?
Job 8:11   הֲיִֽגְאֶה־גֹּ֭מֶא בְּלֹ֣א בִצָּ֑ה יִשְׂגֶּה־אָ֥חוּ בְלִי־מָֽיִם׃ ‬
Job 8:11
Job 8:12While it is yet in its greenness, not cut down, it withers before any other reed.
Job 8:12   עֹדֶ֣נּוּ בְ֭אִבּוֹ לֹ֣א יִקָּטֵ֑ף וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָל־חָצִ֣יר יִיבָֽשׁ׃ ‬
Job 8:12
Job 8:13So are the paths of all who forget God. The hope of the godless man shall perish,
Job 8:13   כֵּ֗ן אָ֭רְחוֹת כָּל־שֹׁ֣כְחֵי אֵ֑ל וְתִקְוַ֖ת חָנֵ֣ף תֹּאבֵֽד׃ ‬
Job 8:13
Job 8:14Whose confidence shall break apart, Whose trust is a spider's web.
Job 8:14   אֲשֶׁר־יָק֥וֹט כִּסְל֑וֹ וּבֵ֥ית עַ֝כָּבִ֗ישׁ מִבְטַחֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 8:14
Job 8:15He shall lean on his house, but it shall not stand. He shall cling to it, but it shall not endure.
Job 8:15   יִשָּׁעֵ֣ן עַל־בֵּ֭יתוֹ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲמֹ֑ד יַחֲזִ֥יק בּ֝֗וֹ וְלֹ֣א יָקֽוּם׃ ‬
Job 8:15
Job 8:16He is green before the sun. His shoots go forth over his garden.
Job 8:16   רָטֹ֣ב ה֭וּא לִפְנֵי־שָׁ֑מֶשׁ וְעַ֥ל גַּ֝נָּת֗וֹ יֹֽנַקְתּ֥וֹ תֵצֵֽא׃ ‬
Job 8:16
Job 8:17His roots are wrapped around the rock pile. He sees the place of stones.
Job 8:17   עַל־גַּ֭ל שָֽׁרָשָׁ֣יו יְסֻבָּ֑כוּ בֵּ֖ית אֲבָנִ֣ים יֶחֱזֶֽה׃ ‬
Job 8:17
Job 8:18If he is destroyed from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, 'I have not seen you.'
Job 8:18   אִם־יְבַלְּעֶ֥נּוּ מִמְּקוֹמ֑וֹ וְכִ֥חֶשׁ בּ֝֗וֹ לֹ֣א רְאִיתִֽיךָ׃ ‬
Job 8:18
Job 8:19Behold, this is the joy of his way: out of the earth, others shall spring.
Job 8:19   הֶן־ה֭וּא מְשׂ֣וֹשׂ דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּ֝מֵעָפָ֗ר אַחֵ֥ר יִצְמָֽחוּ׃ ‬
Job 8:19
Job 8:20|Behold, God will not cast away a blameless man, neither will he uphold the evildoers.
Job 8:20   הֶן־אֵ֭ל לֹ֣א יִמְאַס־תָּ֑ם וְלֹֽא־יַ֝חֲזִ֗יק בְּיַד־מְרֵעִֽים׃ ‬
Job 8:20
Job 8:21He will still fill your mouth with laughter, your lips with shouting.
Job 8:21   עַד־יְמַלֵּ֣ה שְׂח֣וֹק פִּ֑יךָ וּשְׂפָתֶ֥יךָ תְרוּעָֽה׃ ‬
Job 8:21
Job 8:22Those who hate you shall be clothed with shame. The tent of the wicked shall be no more.|
Job 8:22   שֹׂנְאֶ֥יךָ יִלְבְּשׁוּ־בֹ֑שֶׁת וְאֹ֖הֶל רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֵינֶֽנּוּ׃ פ ‬
Job 8:22
Job 9:1Then Job answered,
Job 9:1   וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 9:1
Job 9:2|Truly I know that it is so, but how can man be just with God?
Job 9:2   אָ֭מְנָם יָדַ֣עְתִּי כִי־כֵ֑ן וּמַה־יִּצְדַּ֖ק אֱנ֣וֹשׁ עִם־אֵֽל׃ ‬
Job 9:2
Job 9:3If he is pleased to contend with him, he can't answer him one time in a thousand.
Job 9:3   אִם־יַ֭חְפֹּץ לָרִ֣יב עִמּ֑וֹ לֹֽא־יַ֝עֲנֶ֗נּוּ אַחַ֥ת מִנִּי־אָֽלֶף׃ ‬
Job 9:3
Job 9:4God who is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who has hardened himself against him, and prospered?
Job 9:4   חֲכַ֣ם לֵ֭בָב וְאַמִּ֣יץ כֹּ֑חַ מִֽי־הִקְשָׁ֥ה אֵ֝לָ֗יו וַיִּשְׁלָֽם׃ ‬
Job 9:4
Job 9:5He removes the mountains, and they don't know it, when he overturns them in his anger.
Job 9:5   הַמַּעְתִּ֣יק הָ֭רִים וְלֹ֣א יָדָ֑עוּ אֲשֶׁ֖ר הֲפָכָ֣ם בְּאַפּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 9:5
Job 9:6He shakes the earth out of its place. Its pillars tremble.
Job 9:6   הַמַּרְגִּ֣יז אֶ֭רֶץ מִמְּקוֹמָ֑הּ וְ֝עַמּוּדֶ֗יהָ יִתְפַלָּצֽוּן׃ ‬
Job 9:6
Job 9:7He commands the sun, and it doesn't rise, and seals up the stars.
Job 9:7   הָאֹמֵ֣ר לַ֭חֶרֶס וְלֹ֣א יִזְרָ֑ח וּבְעַ֖ד כּוֹכָבִ֣ים יַחְתֹּֽם׃ ‬
Job 9:7
Job 9:8He alone stretches out the heavens, and treads on the waves of the sea.
Job 9:8   נֹטֶ֣ה שָׁמַ֣יִם לְבַדּ֑וֹ וְ֝דוֹרֵ֗ךְ עַל־בָּ֥מֳתֵי יָֽם׃ ‬
Job 9:8
Job 9:9He makes the Bear, Orion, and the Pleiades, and the rooms of the south.
Job 9:9   עֹֽשֶׂה־עָ֭שׁ כְּסִ֥יל וְכִימָ֗ה וְחַדְרֵ֥י תֵמָֽן׃ ‬
Job 9:9
Job 9:10He does great things past finding out; yes, marvelous things without number.
Job 9:10   עֹשֶׂ֣ה גְ֭דֹלוֹת עַד־אֵ֣ין חֵ֑קֶר וְנִפְלָא֗וֹת עַד־אֵ֥ין מִסְפָּֽר׃ ‬
Job 9:10
Job 9:11Behold, he goes by me, and I don't see him. He passes on also, but I don't perceive him.
Job 9:11   הֵ֤ן יַעֲבֹ֣ר עָ֭לַי וְלֹ֣א אֶרְאֶ֑ה וְ֝יַחֲלֹ֗ף וְֽלֹא־אָבִ֥ין לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 9:11
Job 9:12Behold, he snatches away. Who can hinder him? Who will ask him, 'What are you doing?'
Job 9:12   הֵ֣ן יַ֭חְתֹּף מִ֣י יְשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ מִֽי־יֹאמַ֥ר אֵ֝לָ֗יו מַֽה־תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃ ‬
Job 9:12
Job 9:13|God will not withdraw his anger. The helpers of Rahab stoop under him.
Job 9:13   אֱ֭לוֹהַּ לֹא־יָשִׁ֣יב אַפּ֑וֹ *תחתו **תַּחְתָּ֥יו שָׁ֝חֲח֗וּ עֹ֣זְרֵי רָֽהַב׃ ‬
Job 9:13
Job 9:14How much less shall I answer him, And choose my words to argue with him?
Job 9:14   אַ֭ף כִּֽי־אָנֹכִ֣י אֶֽעֱנֶ֑נּוּ אֶבְחֲרָ֖ה דְבָרַ֣י עִמּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 9:14
Job 9:15Though I were righteous, yet I wouldn't answer him. I would make supplication to my judge.
Job 9:15   אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִם־צָ֭דַקְתִּי לֹ֣א אֶעֱנֶ֑ה לִ֝מְשֹׁפְטִ֗י אֶתְחַנָּֽן׃ ‬
Job 9:15
Job 9:16If I had called, and he had answered me, yet I wouldn't believe that he listened to my voice.
Job 9:16   אִם־קָרָ֥אתִי וַֽיַּעֲנֵ֑נִי לֹֽא־אַ֝אֲמִ֗ין כִּֽי־יַאֲזִ֥ין קוֹלִֽי׃ ‬
Job 9:16
Job 9:17For he breaks me with a storm, and multiplies my wounds without cause.
Job 9:17   אֲשֶׁר־בִּשְׂעָרָ֥ה יְשׁוּפֵ֑נִי וְהִרְבָּ֖ה פְצָעַ֣י חִנָּֽם׃ ‬
Job 9:17
Job 9:18He will not allow me to catch my breath, but fills me with bitterness.
Job 9:18   לֹֽא־יִ֭תְּנֵנִי הָשֵׁ֣ב רוּחִ֑י כִּ֥י יַ֝שְׂבִּעַ֗נִי מַמְּרֹרִֽים׃ ‬
Job 9:18
Job 9:19If it is a matter of strength, behold, he is mighty! If of justice, 'Who,' says he, 'will summon me?'
Job 9:19   אִם־לְכֹ֣חַ אַמִּ֣יץ הִנֵּ֑ה וְאִם־לְ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט מִ֣י יוֹעִידֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 9:19
Job 9:20Though I am righteous, my own mouth shall condemn me. Though I am blameless, it shall prove me perverse.
Job 9:20   אִם־אֶ֭צְדָּק פִּ֣י יַרְשִׁיעֵ֑נִי תָּֽם־אָ֝֗נִי וַֽיַּעְקְשֵֽׁנִי׃ ‬
Job 9:20
Job 9:21I am blameless. I don't respect myself. I despise my life.
Job 9:21   תָּֽם־אָ֭נִי לֹֽא־אֵדַ֥ע נַפְשִׁ֗י אֶמְאַ֥ס חַיָּֽי׃ ‬
Job 9:21
Job 9:22|It is all the same. Therefore I say he destroys the blameless and the wicked.
Job 9:22   אַחַ֗ת הִ֥יא עַל־כֵּ֥ן אָמַ֑רְתִּי תָּ֥ם וְ֝רָשָׁ֗ע ה֣וּא מְכַלֶּֽה׃ ‬
Job 9:22
Job 9:23If the scourge kills suddenly, he will mock at the trial of the innocent.
Job 9:23   אִם־שׁ֭וֹט יָמִ֣ית פִּתְאֹ֑ם לְמַסַּ֖ת נְקִיִּ֣ם יִלְעָֽג׃ ‬
Job 9:23
Job 9:24The earth is given into the hand of the wicked. He covers the faces of its judges. If not he, then who is it?
Job 9:24   אֶ֤רֶץ ׀ נִתְּנָ֬ה בְֽיַד־רָשָׁ֗ע פְּנֵֽי־שֹׁפְטֶ֥יהָ יְכַסֶּ֑ה אִם־לֹ֖א אֵפ֣וֹא מִי־הֽוּא׃ ‬
Job 9:24
Job 9:25|Now my days are swifter than a runner. They flee away, they see no good,
Job 9:25   וְיָמַ֣י קַ֭לּוּ מִנִּי־רָ֑ץ בָּֽ֝רְח֗וּ לֹא־רָא֥וּ טוֹבָֽה׃ ‬
Job 9:25
Job 9:26They have passed away as the swift ships, as the eagle that swoops on the prey.
Job 9:26   חָ֭לְפוּ עִם־אֳנִיּ֣וֹת אֵבֶ֑ה כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר יָט֥וּשׂ עֲלֵי־אֹֽכֶל׃ ‬
Job 9:26
Job 9:27If I say, 'I will forget my complaint, I will put off my sad face, and cheer up;'
Job 9:27   אִם־אָ֭מְרִי אֶשְׁכְּחָ֣ה שִׂיחִ֑י אֶעֶזְבָ֖ה פָנַ֣י וְאַבְלִֽיגָה׃ ‬
Job 9:27
Job 9:28I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that you will not hold me innocent.
Job 9:28   יָגֹ֥רְתִּי כָל־עַצְּבֹתָ֑י יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי כִּי־לֹ֥א תְנַקֵּֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 9:28
Job 9:29I shall be condemned. Why then do I labor in vain?
Job 9:29   אָנֹכִ֥י אֶרְשָׁ֑ע לָמָּה־זֶּ֝֗ה הֶ֣בֶל אִיגָֽע׃ ‬
Job 9:29
Job 9:30If I wash myself with snow, and cleanse my hands with lye,
Job 9:30   אִם־הִתְרָחַ֥צְתִּי *במו־**בְמֵי־שָׁ֑לֶג וַ֝הֲזִכּ֗וֹתִי בְּבֹ֣ר כַּפָּֽי׃ ‬
Job 9:30
Job 9:31yet you will plunge me in the ditch. My own clothes shall abhor me.
Job 9:31   אָ֭ז בַּשַּׁ֣חַת תִּטְבְּלֵ֑נִי וְ֝תִֽעֲב֗וּנִי שַׂלְמוֹתָֽי׃ ‬
Job 9:31
Job 9:32For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, that we should come together in judgment.
Job 9:32   כִּי־לֹא־אִ֣ישׁ כָּמֹ֣נִי אֶֽעֱנֶ֑נּוּ נָב֥וֹא יַ֝חְדָּ֗ו בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃ ‬
Job 9:32
Job 9:33There is no umpire between us, that might lay his hand on us both.
Job 9:33   לֹ֣א יֵשׁ־בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ מוֹכִ֑יחַ יָשֵׁ֖ת יָד֣וֹ עַל־שְׁנֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Job 9:33
Job 9:34Let him take his rod away from me. Let his terror not make me afraid;
Job 9:34   יָסֵ֣ר מֵעָלַ֣י שִׁבְט֑וֹ וְ֝אֵמָת֗וֹ אַֽל־תְּבַעֲתַֽנִּי׃ ‬
Job 9:34
Job 9:35then I would speak, and not fear him, for I am not so in myself.
Job 9:35   אַֽ֭דַבְּרָה וְלֹ֣א אִירָאֶ֑נּוּ כִּ֥י לֹא־כֵ֥ן אָ֝נֹכִ֗י עִמָּדִֽי׃ ‬
Job 9:35
Job 10:1|My soul is weary of my life. I will give free course to my complaint. I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
Job 10:10  נָֽקְטָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֗י בְּחַ֫יָּ֥י אֶֽעֶזְבָ֣ה עָלַ֣י שִׂיחִ֑י אֲ֝דַבְּרָה֗ בְּמַ֣ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃ ‬
Job 10:1
Job 10:2I will tell God, 'Do not condemn me. Show me why you contend with me.
Job 10:20  אֹמַ֣ר אֶל־אֱ֭לוֹהַּ אַל־תַּרְשִׁיעֵ֑נִי הֽ֝וֹדִיעֵ֗נִי עַ֣ל מַה־תְּרִיבֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 10:2
Job 10:3Is it good to you that you should oppress, that you should despise the work of your hands, and smile on the counsel of the wicked?
Job 10:30  הֲט֤וֹב לְךָ֨ ׀ כִּֽי־תַעֲשֹׁ֗ק כִּֽי־תִ֭מְאַס יְגִ֣יעַ כַּפֶּ֑יךָ וְעַל־עֲצַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים הוֹפָֽעְתָּ׃ ‬
Job 10:3
Job 10:4Do you have eyes of flesh? Or do you see as man sees?
Job 10:40  הַעֵינֵ֣י בָשָׂ֣ר לָ֑ךְ אִם־כִּרְא֖וֹת אֱנ֣וֹשׁ תִּרְאֶֽה׃ ‬
Job 10:4
Job 10:5Are your days as the days of mortals, or your years as man's years,
Job 10:50  הֲכִימֵ֣י אֱנ֣וֹשׁ יָמֶ֑יךָ אִם־שְׁ֝נוֹתֶ֗יךָ כִּ֣ימֵי גָֽבֶר׃ ‬
Job 10:5
Job 10:6that you inquire after my iniquity, and search after my sin?
Job 10:60  כִּֽי־תְבַקֵּ֥שׁ לַעֲוֺנִ֑י וּ֭לְחַטָּאתִ֥י תִדְרֽוֹשׁ׃ ‬
Job 10:6
Job 10:7Although you know that I am not wicked, there is no one who can deliver out of your hand.
Job 10:70  עַֽל־דַּ֭עְתְּךָ כִּי־לֹ֣א אֶרְשָׁ֑ע וְאֵ֖ין מִיָּדְךָ֣ מַצִּֽיל׃ ‬
Job 10:7
Job 10:8|'Your hands have framed me and fashioned me altogether, yet you destroy me.
Job 10:80  יָדֶ֣יךָ עִ֭צְּבוּנִי וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֑וּנִי יַ֥חַד סָ֝בִ֗יב וַֽתְּבַלְּעֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 10:8
Job 10:9Remember, I beg you, that you have fashioned me as clay. Will you bring me into dust again?
Job 10:90  זְכָר־נָ֭א כִּי־כַחֹ֣מֶר עֲשִׂיתָ֑נִי וְֽאֶל־עָפָ֥ר תְּשִׁיבֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 10:9
Job 10:10Haven't you poured me out like milk, and curdled me like cheese?
Job 10:100  הֲלֹ֣א כֶ֭חָלָב תַּתִּיכֵ֑נִי וְ֝כַגְּבִנָּ֗ה תַּקְפִּיאֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 10:10
Job 10:11You have clothed me with skin and flesh, and knit me together with bones and sinews.
Job 10:110  ע֣וֹר וּ֭בָשָׂר תַּלְבִּישֵׁ֑נִי וּֽבַעֲצָמ֥וֹת וְ֝גִידִ֗ים תְּסֹכְכֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 10:11
Job 10:12You have granted me life and loving kindness. Your visitation has preserved my spirit.
Job 10:120  חַיִּ֣ים וָ֭חֶסֶד עָשִׂ֣יתָ עִמָּדִ֑י וּ֝פְקֻדָּתְךָ֗ שָֽׁמְרָ֥ה רוּחִֽי׃ ‬
Job 10:12
Job 10:13Yet you hid these things in your heart. I know that this is with you:
Job 10:130  וְ֭אֵלֶּה צָפַ֣נְתָּ בִלְבָבֶ֑ךָ יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי כִּי־זֹ֥את עִמָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 10:13
Job 10:14if I sin, then you mark me. You will not acquit me from my iniquity.
Job 10:140  אִם־חָטָ֥אתִי וּשְׁמַרְתָּ֑נִי וּ֝מֵעֲוֺנִ֗י לֹ֣א תְנַקֵּֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 10:14
Job 10:15If I am wicked, woe to me. If I am righteous, I still shall not lift up my head, being filled with disgrace, and conscious of my affliction.
Job 10:150  אִם־רָשַׁ֡עְתִּי אַלְלַ֬י לִ֗י וְ֭צָדַקְתִּי לֹא־אֶשָּׂ֣א רֹאשִׁ֑י שְׂבַ֥ע קָ֝ל֗וֹן וּרְאֵ֥ה עָנְיֽ͏ִי׃ ‬
Job 10:15
Job 10:16If my head is held high, you hunt me like a lion. Again you show yourself powerful to me.
Job 10:160  וְ֭יִגְאֶה כַּשַּׁ֣חַל תְּצוּדֵ֑נִי וְ֝תָשֹׁ֗ב תִּתְפַּלָּא־בִֽי׃ ‬
Job 10:16
Job 10:17You renew your witnesses against me, and increase your indignation on me. Changes and warfare are with me.
Job 10:170  תְּחַדֵּ֬שׁ עֵדֶ֨יךָ ׀ נֶגְדִּ֗י וְתֶ֣רֶב כַּֽ֭עַשְׂךָ עִמָּדִ֑י חֲלִיפ֖וֹת וְצָבָ֣א עִמִּֽי׃ ‬
Job 10:17
Job 10:18|'Why, then, have you brought me forth out of the womb? I wish I had given up the spirit, and no eye had seen me.
Job 10:180  וְלָ֣מָּה מֵ֭רֶחֶם הֹצֵאתָ֑נִי אֶ֝גְוַ֗ע וְעַ֣יִן לֹא־תִרְאֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 10:18
Job 10:19I should have been as though I had not been. I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
Job 10:190  כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־הָיִ֣יתִי אֶהְיֶ֑ה מִ֝בֶּ֗טֶן לַקֶּ֥בֶר אוּבָֽל׃ ‬
Job 10:19
Job 10:20Aren't my days few? Cease then. Leave me alone, that I may find a little comfort,
Job 10:200  הֲלֹא־מְעַ֣ט יָמַ֣י *יחדל **וַחֲדָ֑ל *ישית **וְשִׁ֥ית מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי וְאַבְלִ֥יגָה מְּעָֽט׃ ‬
Job 10:20
Job 10:21before I go where I shall not return from, to the land of darkness and of the shadow of death;
Job 10:210  בְּטֶ֣רֶם אֵ֭לֵךְ וְלֹ֣א אָשׁ֑וּב אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ חֹ֣שֶׁךְ וְצַלְמָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Job 10:21
Job 10:22the land dark as midnight, of the shadow of death, without any order, where the light is as midnight.'|
Job 10:220  אֶ֤רֶץ עֵיפָ֨תָה ׀ כְּמ֥וֹ אֹ֗פֶל צַ֭לְמָוֶת וְלֹ֥א סְדָרִ֗ים וַתֹּ֥פַע כְּמוֹ־אֹֽפֶל׃ פ ‬
Job 10:22
Job 11:1Then Zophar, the Naamathite, answered,
Job 11:11  וַ֭יַּעַן צֹפַ֥ר הַֽנַּעֲמָתִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 11:1
Job 11:2|Shouldn't the multitude of words be answered? Should a man full of talk be justified?
Job 11:21  הֲרֹ֣ב דְּ֭בָרִים לֹ֣א יֵעָנֶ֑ה וְאִם־אִ֖ישׁ שְׂפָתַ֣יִם יִצְדָּֽק׃ ‬
Job 11:2
Job 11:3Should your boastings make men hold their peace? When you mock, shall no man make you ashamed?
Job 11:31  בַּ֭דֶּיךָ מְתִ֣ים יַחֲרִ֑ישׁו וַ֝תִּלְעַ֗ג וְאֵ֣ין מַכְלִֽם׃ ‬
Job 11:3
Job 11:4For you say, 'My doctrine is pure. I am clean in your eyes.'
Job 11:41  וַ֭תֹּאמֶר זַ֣ךְ לִקְחִ֑י וּ֝בַ֗ר הָיִ֥יתִי בְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Job 11:4
Job 11:5But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against you,
Job 11:51  וְֽאוּלָ֗ם מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן אֱל֣וֹהַּ דַּבֵּ֑ר וְיִפְתַּ֖ח שְׂפָתָ֣יו עִמָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 11:5
Job 11:6that he would show you the secrets of wisdom! For true wisdom has two sides. Know therefore that God exacts of you less than your iniquity deserves.
Job 11:61  וְיַגֶּד־לְךָ֨ ׀ תַּֽעֲלֻמ֣וֹת חָכְמָה֮ כִּֽי־כִפְלַ֢יִם לְֽת֫וּשִׁיָּ֥ה וְדַ֡ע כִּֽי־יַשֶּׁ֥ה לְךָ֥ אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַ מֵעֲוֺנֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Job 11:6
Job 11:7|Can you fathom the mystery of God? Or can you probe the limits of the Almighty?
Job 11:71  הַחֵ֣קֶר אֱל֣וֹהַ תִּמְצָ֑א אִ֤ם עַד־תַּכְלִ֖ית שַׁדַּ֣י תִּמְצָֽא׃ ‬
Job 11:7
Job 11:8They are high as heaven. What can you do? They are deeper than Sheol. What can you know?
Job 11:81  גָּבְהֵ֣י שָׁ֭מַיִם מַה־תִּפְעָ֑ל עֲמֻקָּ֥ה מִ֝שְּׁא֗וֹל מַה־תֵּדָֽע׃ ‬
Job 11:8
Job 11:9Its measure is longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.
Job 11:91  אֲרֻכָּ֣ה מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִדָּ֑הּ וּ֝רְחָבָ֗ה מִנִּי־יָֽם׃ ‬
Job 11:9
Job 11:10If he passes by, or confines, or convenes a court, then who can oppose him?
Job 11:101  אִם־יַחֲלֹ֥ף וְיַסְגִּ֑יר וְ֝יַקְהִ֗יל וּמִ֣י יְשִׁיבֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Job 11:10
Job 11:11For he knows false men. He sees iniquity also, even though he doesn't consider it.
Job 11:111  כִּי־ה֭וּא יָדַ֣ע מְתֵי־שָׁ֑וְא וַיַּרְא־אָ֝֗וֶן וְלֹ֣א יִתְבּוֹנָֽן׃ ‬
Job 11:11
Job 11:12An empty-headed man becomes wise when a man is born as a wild donkey's colt.
Job 11:121  וְאִ֣ישׁ נָ֭בוּב יִלָּבֵ֑ב וְעַ֥יִר פֶּ֝֗רֶא אָדָ֥ם יִוָּלֵֽד׃ ‬
Job 11:12
Job 11:13|If you set your heart aright, stretch out your hands toward him.
Job 11:131  אִם־אַ֭תָּ֗ה הֲכִינ֣וֹתָ לִבֶּ֑ךָ וּפָרַשְׂתָּ֖ אֵלָ֣יו כַּפֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Job 11:13
Job 11:14If iniquity is in your hand, put it far away. Don't let unrighteousness dwell in your tents.
Job 11:141  אִם־אָ֣וֶן בְּ֭יָדְךָ הַרְחִיקֵ֑הוּ וְאַל־תַּשְׁכֵּ֖ן בְּאֹהָלֶ֣יךָ עַוְלָֽה׃ ‬
Job 11:14
Job 11:15Surely then you shall lift up your face without spot; Yes, you shall be steadfast, and shall not fear:
Job 11:151  כִּי־אָ֤ז ׀ תִּשָּׂ֣א פָנֶ֣יךָ מִמּ֑וּם וְהָיִ֥יתָ מֻ֝צָ֗ק וְלֹ֣א תִירָֽא׃ ‬
Job 11:15
Job 11:16for you shall forget your misery. You shall remember it as waters that are passed away.
Job 11:161  כִּי־אַ֭תָּה עָמָ֣ל תִּשְׁכָּ֑ח כְּמַ֖יִם עָבְר֣וּ תִזְכֹּֽר׃ ‬
Job 11:16
Job 11:17Life shall be clearer than the noonday. Though there is darkness, it shall be as the morning.
Job 11:171  וּֽ֭מִצָּהֳרַיִם יָק֣וּם חָ֑לֶד תָּ֝עֻ֗פָה כַּבֹּ֥קֶר תִּהְיֶֽה׃ ‬
Job 11:17
Job 11:18You shall be secure, because there is hope. Yes, you shall search, and shall take your rest in safety.
Job 11:181  וּֽ֭בָטַחְתָּ כִּי־יֵ֣שׁ תִּקְוָ֑ה וְ֝חָפַרְתָּ֗ לָבֶ֥טַח תִּשְׁכָּֽב׃ ‬
Job 11:18
Job 11:19Also you shall lie down, and none shall make you afraid. Yes, many shall court your favor.
Job 11:191  וְֽ֭רָבַצְתָּ וְאֵ֣ין מַחֲרִ֑יד וְחִלּ֖וּ פָנֶ֣יךָ רַבִּֽים׃ ‬
Job 11:19
Job 11:20But the eyes of the wicked shall fail. They shall have no way to flee. Their hope shall be the giving up of the spirit.|
Job 11:201  וְעֵינֵ֥י רְשָׁעִ֗ים תִּ֫כְלֶ֥ינָה וּ֭מָנוֹס אָבַ֣ד מִנְהֶ֑ם וְ֝תִקְוָתָ֗ם מַֽפַּח־נָֽפֶשׁ׃ פ ‬
Job 11:20
Job 12:1Then Job answered,
Job 12:12  וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 12:1
Job 12:2|No doubt, but you are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.
Job 12:22  אָ֭מְנָם כִּ֣י אַתֶּם־עָ֑ם וְ֝עִמָּכֶ֗ם תָּמ֥וּת חָכְמָֽה׃ ‬
Job 12:2
Job 12:3But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you. Yes, who doesn't know such things as these?
Job 12:32  גַּם־לִ֤י לֵבָ֨ב ׀ כְּֽמוֹכֶ֗ם לֹא־נֹפֵ֣ל אָנֹכִ֣י מִכֶּ֑ם וְאֶת־מִי־אֵ֥ין כְּמוֹ־אֵֽלֶּה׃ ‬
Job 12:3
Job 12:4I am like one who is a joke to his neighbor, I, who called on God, and he answered. The just, the blameless man is a joke.
Job 12:42  שְׂחֹ֤ק לְרֵעֵ֨הוּ ׀ אֶֽהְיֶ֗ה קֹרֵ֣א לֶ֭אֱלוֹהַּ וַֽיַּעֲנֵ֑הוּ שְׂ֝ח֗וֹק צַדִּ֥יק תָּמִֽים׃ ‬
Job 12:4
Job 12:5In the thought of him who is at ease there is contempt for misfortune. It is ready for them whose foot slips.
Job 12:52  לַפִּ֣יד בּ֭וּז לְעַשְׁתּ֣וּת שַׁאֲנָ֑ן נָ֝כ֗וֹן לְמ֣וֹעֲדֵי רָֽגֶל׃ ‬
Job 12:5
Job 12:6The tents of robbers prosper. Those who provoke God are secure, who carry their God in their hands.
Job 12:62  יִשְׁלָ֤יוּ אֹֽהָלִ֨ים ׀ לְשֹׁ֥דְדִ֗ים וּֽ֭בַטֻּחוֹת לְמַרְגִּ֣יזֵי אֵ֑ל לַאֲשֶׁ֤ר הֵבִ֖יא אֱל֣וֹהַּ בְּיָדֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 12:6
Job 12:7|But ask the animals, now, and they shall teach you; the birds of the sky, and they shall tell you.
Job 12:72  וְֽאוּלָ֗ם שְׁאַל־נָ֣א בְהֵמ֣וֹת וְתֹרֶ֑ךָּ וְע֥וֹף הַ֝שָּׁמַ֗יִם וְיַגֶּד־לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 12:7
Job 12:8Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach you. The fish of the sea shall declare to you.
Job 12:82  א֤וֹ שִׂ֣יחַ לָאָ֣רֶץ וְתֹרֶ֑ךָּ וִֽיסַפְּר֥וּ לְ֝ךָ֗ דְּגֵ֣י הַיָּֽם׃ ‬
Job 12:8
Job 12:9Who doesn't know that in all these, the hand of Yahweh has done this,
Job 12:92  מִ֭י לֹא־יָדַ֣ע בְּכָל־אֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֥י יַד־יְ֝הוָה עָ֣שְׂתָה זֹּֽאת׃ ‬
Job 12:9
Job 12:10in whose hand is the life of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind?
Job 12:102  אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּ֭יָדוֹ נֶ֣פֶשׁ כָּל־חָ֑י וְ֝ר֗וּחַ כָּל־בְּשַׂר־אִֽישׁ׃ ‬
Job 12:10
Job 12:11Doesn't the ear try words, even as the palate tastes its food?
Job 12:112  הֲלֹא־אֹ֭זֶן מִלִּ֣ין תִּבְחָ֑ן וְ֝חֵ֗ךְ אֹ֣כֶל יִטְעַם־לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 12:11
Job 12:12With aged men is wisdom, in length of days understanding.
Job 12:122  בִּֽישִׁישִׁ֥ים חָכְמָ֑ה וְאֹ֖רֶךְ יָמִ֣ים תְּבוּנָֽה׃ ‬
Job 12:12
Job 12:13|With God is wisdom and might. He has counsel and understanding.
Job 12:132  עִ֭מּוֹ חָכְמָ֣ה וּגְבוּרָ֑ה ל֝֗וֹ עֵצָ֥ה וּתְבוּנָֽה׃ ‬
Job 12:13
Job 12:14Behold, he breaks down, and it can't be built again. He imprisons a man, and there can be no release.
Job 12:142  הֵ֣ן יַ֭הֲרוֹס וְלֹ֣א יִבָּנֶ֑ה יִסְגֹּ֥ר עַל־אִ֝֗ישׁ וְלֹ֣א יִפָּתֵֽחַ׃ ‬
Job 12:14
Job 12:15Behold, he withholds the waters, and they dry up. Again, he sends them out, and they overturn the earth.
Job 12:152  הֵ֤ן יַעְצֹ֣ר בַּמַּ֣יִם וְיִבָ֑שׁוּ וִֽ֝ישַׁלְּחֵ֗ם וְיַ֖הַפְכוּ אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Job 12:15
Job 12:16With him is strength and wisdom. The deceived and the deceiver are his.
Job 12:162  עִ֭מּוֹ עֹ֣ז וְתֽוּשִׁיָּ֑ה ל֝֗וֹ שֹׁגֵ֥ג וּמַשְׁגֶּֽה׃ ‬
Job 12:16
Job 12:17He leads counselors away stripped. He makes judges fools.
Job 12:172  מוֹלִ֣יךְ יוֹעֲצִ֣ים שׁוֹלָ֑ל וְֽשֹׁפְטִ֥ים יְהוֹלֵֽל׃ ‬
Job 12:17
Job 12:18He loosens the bond of kings. He binds their waist with a belt.
Job 12:182  מוּסַ֣ר מְלָכִ֣ים פִּתֵּ֑חַ וַיֶּאְסֹ֥ר אֵ֝ז֗וֹר בְּמָתְנֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 12:18
Job 12:19He leads priests away stripped, and overthrows the mighty.
Job 12:192  מוֹלִ֣יךְ כֹּהֲנִ֣ים שׁוֹלָ֑ל וְאֵֽתָנִ֣ים יְסַלֵּֽף׃ ‬
Job 12:19
Job 12:20He removes the speech of those who are trusted, and takes away the understanding of the elders.
Job 12:202  מֵסִ֣יר שָׂ֭פָה לְנֶאֱמָנִ֑ים וְטַ֖עַם זְקֵנִ֣ים יִקָּֽח׃ ‬
Job 12:20
Job 12:21He pours contempt on princes, and loosens the belt of the strong.
Job 12:212  שׁוֹפֵ֣ךְ בּ֭וּז עַל־נְדִיבִ֑ים וּמְזִ֖יחַ אֲפִיקִ֣ים רִפָּֽה׃ ‬
Job 12:21
Job 12:22He uncovers deep things out of darkness, and brings out to light the shadow of death.
Job 12:222  מְגַלֶּ֣ה עֲ֭מֻקוֹת מִנִּי־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ וַיֹּצֵ֖א לָא֣וֹר צַלְמָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Job 12:22
Job 12:23He increases the nations, and he destroys them. He enlarges the nations, and he leads them captive.
Job 12:232  מַשְׂגִּ֣יא לַ֭גּוֹיִם וַֽיְאַבְּדֵ֑ם שֹׁטֵ֥חַ לַ֝גּוֹיִ֗ם וַיַּנְחֵֽם׃ ‬
Job 12:23
Job 12:24He takes away understanding from the chiefs of the people of the earth, and causes them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
Job 12:242  מֵסִ֗יר לֵ֭ב רָאשֵׁ֣י עַם־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַ֝יַּתְעֵ֗ם בְּתֹ֣הוּ לֹא־דָֽרֶךְ׃ ‬
Job 12:24
Job 12:25They grope in the dark without light. He makes them stagger like a drunken man.
Job 12:252  יְמַֽשְׁשׁוּ־חֹ֥שֶׁךְ וְלֹא־א֑וֹר וַ֝יַּתְעֵ֗ם כַּשִּׁכּֽוֹר׃ ‬
Job 12:25
Job 13:1|Behold, my eye has seen all this. My ear has heard and understood it.
Job 13:13  הֶן־כֹּ֭ל רָאֲתָ֣ה עֵינִ֑י שָֽׁמְעָ֥ה אָ֝זְנִ֗י וַתָּ֥בֶן לָֽהּ׃ ‬
Job 13:1
Job 13:2What you know, I know also. I am not inferior to you.
Job 13:23  כְּֽ֭דַעְתְּכֶם יָדַ֣עְתִּי גַם־אָ֑נִי לֹא־נֹפֵ֖ל אָנֹכִ֣י מִכֶּֽם׃ ‬
Job 13:2
Job 13:3|Surely I would speak to the Almighty. I desire to reason with God.
Job 13:33  אוּלָ֗ם אֲ֭נִי אֶל־שַׁדַּ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וְהוֹכֵ֖חַ אֶל־אֵ֣ל אֶחְפָּֽץ׃ ‬
Job 13:3
Job 13:4But you are forgers of lies. You are all physicians of no value.
Job 13:43  וְֽאוּלָ֗ם אַתֶּ֥ם טֹֽפְלֵי־שָׁ֑קֶר רֹפְאֵ֖י אֱלִ֣ל כֻּלְּכֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 13:4
Job 13:5Oh that you would be completely silent! Then you would be wise.
Job 13:53  מִֽי־יִ֭תֵּן הַחֲרֵ֣שׁ תַּחֲרִישׁ֑וּן וּתְהִ֖י לָכֶ֣ם לְחָכְמָֽה׃ ‬
Job 13:5
Job 13:6Hear now my reasoning. Listen to the pleadings of my lips.
Job 13:63  שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֥א תוֹכַחְתִּ֑י וְרִב֖וֹת שְׂפָתַ֣י הַקְשִֽׁיבוּ׃ ‬
Job 13:6
Job 13:7Will you speak unrighteously for God, and talk deceitfully for him?
Job 13:73  הַ֭לְאֵל תְּדַבְּר֣וּ עַוְלָ֑ה וְ֝ל֗וֹ תְּֽדַבְּר֥וּ רְמִיָּֽה׃ ‬
Job 13:7
Job 13:8Will you show partiality to him? Will you contend for God?
Job 13:83  הֲפָנָ֥יו תִּשָּׂא֑וּן אִם־לָאֵ֥ל תְּרִיבֽוּן׃ ‬
Job 13:8
Job 13:9Is it good that he should search you out? Or as one deceives a man, will you deceive him?
Job 13:93  הֲ֭טוֹב כִּֽי־יַחְקֹ֣ר אֶתְכֶ֑ם אִם־כְּהָתֵ֥ל בֶּ֝אֱנ֗וֹשׁ תְּהָתֵ֥לּוּ בֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 13:9
Job 13:10He will surely reprove you if you secretly show partiality.
Job 13:103  הוֹכֵ֣חַ יוֹכִ֣יחַ אֶתְכֶ֑ם אִם־בַּ֝סֵּ֗תֶר פָּנִ֥ים תִּשָּׂאֽוּן׃ ‬
Job 13:10
Job 13:11Shall not his majesty make you afraid, And his dread fall on you?
Job 13:113  הֲלֹ֣א שְׂ֭אֵתוֹ תְּבַעֵ֣ת אֶתְכֶ֑ם וּ֝פַחְדּ֗וֹ יִפֹּ֥ל עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 13:11
Job 13:12Your memorable sayings are proverbs of ashes, Your defenses are defenses of clay.
Job 13:123  זִֽ֭כְרֹנֵיכֶם מִשְׁלֵי־אֵ֑פֶר לְגַבֵּי־חֹ֝֗מֶר גַּבֵּיכֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 13:12
Job 13:13|Be silent, leave me alone, that I may speak. Let come on me what will.
Job 13:133  הַחֲרִ֣ישׁוּ מִ֭מֶּנִּי וַאֲדַבְּרָה־אָ֑נִי וְיַעֲבֹ֖ר עָלַ֣י מָֽה׃ ‬
Job 13:13
Job 13:14Why should I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in my hand?
Job 13:143  עַל־מָ֤ה ׀ אֶשָּׂ֣א בְשָׂרִ֣י בְשִׁנָּ֑י וְ֝נַפְשִׁ֗י אָשִׂ֥ים בְּכַפִּֽי׃ ‬
Job 13:14
Job 13:15Behold, he will kill me. I have no hope. Nevertheless, I will maintain my ways before him.
Job 13:153  הֵ֣ן יִ֭קְטְלֵנִי *לא **ל֣וֹ אֲיַחֵ֑ל אַךְ־דְּ֝רָכַ֗י אֶל־פָּנָ֥יו אוֹכִֽיחַ׃ ‬
Job 13:15
Job 13:16This also shall be my salvation, that a godless man shall not come before him.
Job 13:163  גַּם־הוּא־לִ֥י לִֽישׁוּעָ֑ה כִּי־לֹ֥א לְ֝פָנָ֗יו חָנֵ֥ף יָבֽוֹא׃ ‬
Job 13:16
Job 13:17Hear diligently my speech. Let my declaration be in your ears.
Job 13:173  שִׁמְע֣וּ שָׁ֭מוֹעַ מִלָּתִ֑י וְ֝אֽ͏ַחֲוָתִ֗י בְּאָזְנֵיכֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 13:17
Job 13:18See now, I have set my cause in order. I know that I am righteous.
Job 13:183  הִנֵּה־נָ֭א עָרַ֣כְתִּי מִשְׁפָּ֑ט יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי כִּֽי־אֲנִ֥י אֶצְדָּֽק׃ ‬
Job 13:18
Job 13:19Who is he who will contend with me? For then would I hold my peace and give up the spirit.
Job 13:193  מִי־ה֭וּא יָרִ֣יב עִמָּדִ֑י כִּֽי־עַתָּ֖ה אַחֲרִ֣ישׁ וְאֶגְוָֽע׃ ‬
Job 13:19
Job 13:20|Only don't do two things to me; then I will not hide myself from your face:
Job 13:203  אַךְ־שְׁ֭תַּיִם אַל־תַּ֣עַשׂ עִמָּדִ֑י אָ֥ז מִ֝פָּנֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א אֶסָּתֵֽר׃ ‬
Job 13:20
Job 13:21withdraw your hand far from me; and don't let your terror make me afraid.
Job 13:213  כַּ֭פְּךָ מֵעָלַ֣י הַרְחַ֑ק וְ֝אֵ֥מָתְךָ֗ אַֽל־תְּבַעֲתַֽנִּי׃ ‬
Job 13:21
Job 13:22Then call, and I will answer; or let me speak, and you answer me.
Job 13:223  וּ֭קְרָא וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֶֽעֱנֶ֑ה אֽוֹ־אֲ֝דַבֵּ֗ר וַהֲשִׁיבֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 13:22
Job 13:23How many are my iniquities and sins? Make me know my disobedience and my sin.
Job 13:233  כַּמָּ֣ה לִ֭י עֲוֺנ֣וֹת וְחַטָּא֑וֹת פִּֽשְׁעִ֥י וְ֝חַטָּאתִ֗י הֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 13:23
Job 13:24Why hide you your face, and hold me for your enemy?
Job 13:243  לָֽמָּה־פָנֶ֥יךָ תַסְתִּ֑יר וְתַחְשְׁבֵ֖נִי לְאוֹיֵ֣ב לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 13:24
Job 13:25Will you harass a driven leaf? Will you pursue the dry stubble?
Job 13:253  הֶעָלֶ֣ה נִדָּ֣ף תַּעֲר֑וֹץ וְאֶת־קַ֖שׁ יָבֵ֣שׁ תִּרְדֹּֽף׃ ‬
Job 13:25
Job 13:26For you write bitter things against me, and make me inherit the iniquities of my youth:
Job 13:263  כִּֽי־תִכְתֹּ֣ב עָלַ֣י מְרֹר֑וֹת וְ֝תוֹרִישֵׁ֗נִי עֲוֺנ֥וֹת נְעוּרָֽי׃ ‬
Job 13:26
Job 13:27You also put my feet in the stocks, and mark all my paths. You set a bound to the soles of my feet,
Job 13:273  וְתָ֘שֵׂ֤ם בַּסַּ֨ד ׀ רַגְלַ֗י וְתִשְׁמ֥וֹר כָּל־אָרְחוֹתָ֑י עַל־שָׁרְשֵׁ֥י רַ֝גְלַ֗י תִּתְחַקֶּֽה׃ ‬
Job 13:27
Job 13:28though I am decaying like a rotten thing, like a garment that is moth-eaten.
Job 13:283  וְ֭הוּא כְּרָקָ֣ב יִבְלֶ֑ה כְּ֝בֶ֗גֶד אֲכָ֣לוֹ עָֽשׁ׃ ‬
Job 13:28
Job 14:1|Man, who is born of a woman, is of few days, and full of trouble.
Job 14:14  אָ֭דָם יְל֣וּד אִשָּׁ֑ה קְצַ֥ר יָ֝מִ֗ים וּֽשְׂבַֽע־רֹֽגֶז׃ ‬
Job 14:1
Job 14:2He comes forth like a flower, and is cut down. He also flees like a shadow, and doesn't continue.
Job 14:24  כְּצִ֣יץ יָ֭צָא וַיִּמָּ֑ל וַיִּבְרַ֥ח כַּ֝צֵּ֗ל וְלֹ֣א יַעֲמֽוֹד׃ ‬
Job 14:2
Job 14:3Do you open your eyes on such a one, and bring me into judgment with you?
Job 14:34  אַף־עַל־זֶ֭ה פָּקַ֣חְתָּ עֵינֶ֑ךָ וְאֹ֘תִ֤י תָבִ֖יא בְמִשְׁפָּ֣ט עִמָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 14:3
Job 14:4Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? Not one.
Job 14:44  מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן טָ֭הוֹר מִטָּמֵ֗א לֹ֣א אֶחָֽד׃ ‬
Job 14:4
Job 14:5Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months is with you, and you have appointed his bounds that he can't pass;
Job 14:54  אִ֥ם חֲרוּצִ֨ים ׀ יָמָ֗יו מִֽסְפַּר־חֳדָשָׁ֥יו אִתָּ֑ךְ *חקו **חֻקָּ֥יו עָ֝שִׂ֗יתָ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲבֽוֹר׃ ‬
Job 14:5
Job 14:6Look away from him, that he may rest, until he shall accomplish, as a hireling, his day.
Job 14:64  שְׁעֵ֣ה מֵעָלָ֣יו וְיֶחְדָּ֑ל עַד־יִ֝רְצֶ֗ה כְּשָׂכִ֥יר יוֹמֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 14:6
Job 14:7|For there is hope for a tree, If it is cut down, that it will sprout again, that the tender branch of it will not cease.
Job 14:74  כִּ֤י יֵ֥שׁ לָעֵ֗ץ תִּ֫קְוָ֥ה אִֽם־יִ֭כָּרֵת וְע֣וֹד יַחֲלִ֑יף וְ֝יֹֽנַקְתּ֗וֹ לֹ֣א תֶחְדָּֽל׃ ‬
Job 14:7
Job 14:8Though its root grows old in the earth, and its stock dies in the ground,
Job 14:84  אִם־יַזְקִ֣ין בָּאָ֣רֶץ שָׁרְשׁ֑וֹ וּ֝בֶעָפָ֗ר יָמ֥וּת גִּזְעֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 14:8
Job 14:9yet through the scent of water it will bud, and put forth boughs like a plant.
Job 14:94  מֵרֵ֣יחַ מַ֣יִם יַפְרִ֑חַ וְעָשָׂ֖ה קָצִ֣יר כְּמוֹ־נָֽטַע׃ ‬
Job 14:9
Job 14:10But man dies, and is laid low. Yes, man gives up the spirit, and where is he?
Job 14:104  וְגֶ֣בֶר יָ֭מוּת וַֽיֶּחֱלָ֑שׁ וַיִּגְוַ֖ע אָדָ֣ם וְאַיּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 14:10
Job 14:11As the waters fail from the sea, and the river wastes and dries up,
Job 14:114  אָֽזְלוּ־מַ֭יִם מִנִּי־יָ֑ם וְ֝נָהָ֗ר יֶחֱרַ֥ב וְיָבֵֽשׁ׃ ‬
Job 14:11
Job 14:12so man lies down and doesn't rise. Until the heavens are no more, they shall not awake, nor be roused out of their sleep.
Job 14:124  וְאִ֥ישׁ שָׁכַ֗ב וְֽלֹא־יָ֫ק֥וּם עַד־בִּלְתִּ֣י שָׁ֭מַיִם לֹ֣א יָקִ֑יצוּ וְלֹֽא־יֵ֝עֹ֗רוּ מִשְּׁנָתָֽם׃ ‬
Job 14:12
Job 14:13|Oh that you would hide me in Sheol, that you would keep me secret, until your wrath is past, that you would appoint me a set time, and remember me!
Job 14:134  מִ֤י יִתֵּ֨ן ׀ בִּשְׁא֬וֹל תַּצְפִּנֵ֗נִי תַּ֭סְתִּירֵנִי עַד־שׁ֣וּב אַפֶּ֑ךָ תָּ֤שִׁ֥ית לִ֖י חֹ֣ק וְתִזְכְּרֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 14:13
Job 14:14If a man dies, shall he live again? All the days of my warfare would I wait, until my release should come.
Job 14:144  אִם־יָמ֥וּת גֶּ֗בֶר הֲיִ֫חְיֶ֥ה כָּל־יְמֵ֣י צְבָאִ֣י אֲיַחֵ֑ל עַד־בּ֝֗וֹא חֲלִיפָתִֽי׃ ‬
Job 14:14
Job 14:15You would call, and I would answer you. You would have a desire to the work of your hands.
Job 14:154  תִּ֭קְרָא וְאָנֹכִ֣י אֶֽעֱנֶ֑ךָּ לְֽמַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יָדֶ֣יךָ תִכְסֹֽף׃ ‬
Job 14:15
Job 14:16But now you number my steps. Don't you watch over my sin?
Job 14:164  כִּֽי־עַ֭תָּה צְעָדַ֣י תִּסְפּ֑וֹר לֹֽא־תִ֝שְׁמ֗וֹר עַל־חַטָּאתִֽי׃ ‬
Job 14:16
Job 14:17My disobedience is sealed up in a bag. You fasten up my iniquity.
Job 14:174  חָתֻ֣ם בִּצְר֣וֹר פִּשְׁעִ֑י וַ֝תִּטְפֹּ֗ל עַל־עֲוֺנִֽי׃ ‬
Job 14:17
Job 14:18|But the mountain falling comes to nothing. The rock is removed out of its place;
Job 14:184  וְ֭אוּלָם הַר־נוֹפֵ֣ל יִבּ֑וֹל וְ֝צ֗וּר יֶעְתַּ֥ק מִמְּקֹמֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 14:18
Job 14:19The waters wear the stones. The torrents of it wash away the dust of the earth. So you destroy the hope of man.
Job 14:194  אֲבָנִ֤ים ׀ שָׁ֥חֲקוּ מַ֗יִם תִּשְׁטֹֽף־סְפִיחֶ֥יהָ עֲפַר־אָ֑רֶץ וְתִקְוַ֖ת אֱנ֣וֹשׁ הֶאֱבַֽדְתָּ׃ ‬
Job 14:19
Job 14:20You forever prevail against him, and he departs. You change his face, and send him away.
Job 14:204  תִּתְקְפֵ֣הוּ לָ֭נֶצַח וַֽיַּהֲלֹ֑ךְ מְשַׁנֶּ֥ה פָ֝נָ֗יו וַֽתְּשַׁלְּחֵֽהוּ׃ ‬
Job 14:20
Job 14:21His sons come to honor, and he doesn't know it. They are brought low, but he doesn't perceive it of them.
Job 14:214  יִכְבְּד֣וּ בָ֭נָיו וְלֹ֣א יֵדָ֑ע וְ֝יִצְעֲר֗וּ וְֽלֹא־יָבִ֥ין לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Job 14:21
Job 14:22But his flesh on him has pain, and his soul within him mourns.|
Job 14:224  אַךְ־בְּ֭שָׂרוֹ עָלָ֣יו יִכְאָ֑ב וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ עָלָ֥יו תֶּאֱבָֽל׃ פ ‬
Job 14:22
Job 15:1Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered,
Job 15:15  וַ֭יַּעַן אֱלִיפַ֥ז הַֽתֵּימָנִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 15:1
Job 15:2|Should a wise man answer with vain knowledge, and fill himself with the east wind?
Job 15:25  הֶֽחָכָ֗ם יַעֲנֶ֥ה דַֽעַת־ר֑וּחַ וִֽימַלֵּ֖א קָדִ֣ים בִּטְנֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 15:2
Job 15:3Should he reason with unprofitable talk, or with speeches with which he can do no good?
Job 15:35  הוֹכֵ֣חַ בְּ֭דָבָר לֹ֣א יִסְכּ֑וֹן וּ֝מִלִּ֗ים לֹא־יוֹעִ֥יל בָּֽם׃ ‬
Job 15:3
Job 15:4Yes, you do away with fear, and hinder devotion before God.
Job 15:45  אַף־אַ֭תָּה תָּפֵ֣ר יִרְאָ֑ה וְתִגְרַ֥ע שִׂ֝יחָ֗ה לִפְנֵי־אֵֽל׃ ‬
Job 15:4
Job 15:5For your iniquity teaches your mouth, and you choose the language of the crafty.
Job 15:55  כִּ֤י יְאַלֵּ֣ף עֲוֺנְךָ֣ פִ֑יךָ וְ֝תִבְחַ֗ר לְשׁ֣וֹן עֲרוּמִֽים׃ ‬
Job 15:5
Job 15:6Your own mouth condemns you, and not I. Yes, your own lips testify against you.
Job 15:65  יַרְשִֽׁיעֲךָ֣ פִ֣יךָ וְלֹא־אָ֑נִי וּ֝שְׂפָתֶ֗יךָ יַעֲנוּ־בָֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 15:6
Job 15:7|Are you the first man who was born? Or were you brought forth before the hills?
Job 15:75  הֲרִאישׁ֣וֹן אָ֭דָם תִּוָּלֵ֑ד וְלִפְנֵ֖י גְבָע֣וֹת חוֹלָֽלְתָּ׃ ‬
Job 15:7
Job 15:8Have you heard the secret counsel of God? Do you limit wisdom to yourself?
Job 15:85  הַבְס֣וֹד אֱל֣וֹהַ תִּשְׁמָ֑ע וְתִגְרַ֖ע אֵלֶ֣יךָ חָכְמָֽה׃ ‬
Job 15:8
Job 15:9What do you know, that we don't know? What do you understand, which is not in us?
Job 15:95  מַה־יָּ֭דַעְתָּ וְלֹ֣א נֵדָ֑ע תָּ֝בִ֗ין וְֽלֹא־עִמָּ֥נוּ הֽוּא׃ ‬
Job 15:9
Job 15:10With us are both the gray-headed and the very aged men, much elder than your father.
Job 15:105  גַּם־שָׂ֣ב גַּם־יָשִׁ֣ישׁ בָּ֑נוּ כַּבִּ֖יר מֵאָבִ֣יךָ יָמִֽים׃ ‬
Job 15:10
Job 15:11Are the consolations of God too small for you, even the word that is gentle toward you?
Job 15:115  הַמְעַ֣ט מִ֭מְּךָ תַּנְחֻמ֣וֹת אֵ֑ל וְ֝דָבָ֗ר לָאַ֥ט עִמָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 15:11
Job 15:12Why does your heart carry you away? Why do your eyes flash,
Job 15:125  מַה־יִּקָּחֲךָ֥ לִבֶּ֑ךָ וּֽמַה־יִּרְזְמ֥וּן עֵינֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Job 15:12
Job 15:13That you turn your spirit against God, and let such words go out of your mouth?
Job 15:135  כִּֽי־תָשִׁ֣יב אֶל־אֵ֣ל רוּחֶ֑ךָ וְהֹצֵ֖אתָ מִפִּ֣יךָ מִלִּֽין׃ ‬
Job 15:13
Job 15:14What is man, that he should be clean? What is he who is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
Job 15:145  מָֽה־אֱנ֥וֹשׁ כִּֽי־יִזְכֶּ֑ה וְכִֽי־יִ֝צְדַּ֗ק יְל֣וּד אִשָּֽׁה׃ ‬
Job 15:14
Job 15:15Behold, he puts no trust in his holy ones. Yes, the heavens are not clean in his sight;
Job 15:155  הֵ֣ן *בקדשו **בִּ֭קְדֹשָׁיו לֹ֣א יַאֲמִ֑ין וְ֝שָׁמַ֗יִם לֹא־זַכּ֥וּ בְעֵינָֽיו׃ ‬
Job 15:15
Job 15:16how much less one who is abominable and corrupt, a man who drinks iniquity like water!
Job 15:165  אַ֭ף כִּֽי־נִתְעָ֥ב וְֽנֶאֱלָ֑ח אִישׁ־שֹׁתֶ֖ה כַמַּ֣יִם עַוְלָֽה׃ ‬
Job 15:16
Job 15:17|I will show you, listen to me; that which I have seen I will declare:
Job 15:175  אֲחַוְךָ֥ שְֽׁמַֽע־לִ֑י וְזֶֽה־חָ֝זִ֗יתִי וַאֲסַפֵּֽרָה׃ ‬
Job 15:17
Job 15:18(Which wise men have told by their fathers, and have not hidden it;
Job 15:185  אֲשֶׁר־חֲכָמִ֥ים יַגִּ֑ידוּ וְלֹ֥א כִֽ֝חֲד֗וּ מֵאֲבוֹתָֽם׃ ‬
Job 15:18
Job 15:19to whom alone the land was given, and no stranger passed among them):
Job 15:195  לָהֶ֣ם לְ֭בַדָּם נִתְּנָ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ וְלֹא־עָ֖בַר זָ֣ר בְּתוֹכָֽם׃ ‬
Job 15:19
Job 15:20the wicked man writhes in pain all his days, even the number of years that are laid up for the oppressor.
Job 15:205  כָּל־יְמֵ֣י רָ֭שָׁע ה֣וּא מִתְחוֹלֵ֑ל וּמִסְפַּ֥ר שָׁ֝נִ֗ים נִצְפְּנ֥וּ לֶעָרִֽיץ׃ ‬
Job 15:20
Job 15:21A sound of terrors is in his ears. In prosperity the destroyer shall come on him.
Job 15:215  קוֹל־פְּחָדִ֥ים בְּאָזְנָ֑יו בַּ֝שָּׁל֗וֹם שׁוֹדֵ֥ד יְבוֹאֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Job 15:21
Job 15:22He doesn't believe that he shall return out of darkness. He is waited for by the sword.
Job 15:225  לֹא־יַאֲמִ֣ין שׁ֭וּב מִנִּי־חֹ֑שֶׁךְ *וצפו **וְצָפ֖וּי ה֣וּא אֱלֵי־חָֽרֶב׃ ‬
Job 15:22
Job 15:23He wanders abroad for bread, saying, 'Where is it?' He knows that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
Job 15:235  נֹ֘דֵ֤ד ה֣וּא לַלֶּ֣חֶם אַיֵּ֑ה יָדַ֓ע ׀ כִּֽי־נָכ֖וֹן בְּיָד֣וֹ יֽוֹם־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃ ‬
Job 15:23
Job 15:24Distress and anguish make him afraid. They prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
Job 15:245  יְֽ֭בַעֲתֻהוּ צַ֣ר וּמְצוּקָ֑ה תִּ֝תְקְפֵ֗הוּ כְּמֶ֤לֶךְ ׀ עָתִ֬יד לַכִּידֽוֹר׃ ‬
Job 15:24
Job 15:25Because he has stretched out his hand against God, and behaves himself proudly against the Almighty;
Job 15:255  כִּֽי־נָטָ֣ה אֶל־אֵ֣ל יָד֑וֹ וְאֶל־שַׁ֝דַּ֗י יִתְגַּבָּֽר׃ ‬
Job 15:25
Job 15:26he runs at him with a stiff neck, with the thick shields of his bucklers;
Job 15:265  יָר֣וּץ אֵלָ֣יו בְּצַוָּ֑אר בַּ֝עֲבִ֗י גַּבֵּ֥י מָֽגִנָּֽיו׃ ‬
Job 15:26
Job 15:27because he has covered his face with his fatness, and gathered fat on his thighs.
Job 15:275  כִּֽי־כִסָּ֣ה פָנָ֣יו בְּחֶלְבּ֑וֹ וַיַּ֖עַשׂ פִּימָ֣ה עֲלֵי־כָֽסֶל׃ ‬
Job 15:27
Job 15:28He has lived in desolate cities, in houses which no one inhabited, which were ready to become heaps.
Job 15:285  וַיִּשְׁכּ֤וֹן ׀ עָ֘רִ֤ים נִכְחָד֗וֹת בָּ֭תִּים לֹא־יֵ֣שְׁבוּ לָ֑מוֹ אֲשֶׁ֖ר הִתְעַתְּד֣וּ לְגַלִּֽים׃ ‬
Job 15:28
Job 15:29He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall their possessions be extended on the earth.
Job 15:295  לֹֽא־יֶ֭עְשַׁר וְלֹא־יָק֣וּם חֵיל֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־יִטֶּ֖ה לָאָ֣רֶץ מִנְלָֽם׃ ‬
Job 15:29
Job 15:30He shall not depart out of darkness. The flame shall dry up his branches. By the breath of God's mouth shall he go away.
Job 15:305  לֹֽא־יָס֨וּר ׀ מִנִּי־חֹ֗שֶׁךְ יֹֽ֭נַקְתּוֹ תְּיַבֵּ֣שׁ שַׁלְהָ֑בֶת וְ֝יָס֗וּר בְּר֣וּחַ פִּֽיו׃ ‬
Job 15:30
Job 15:31Let him not trust in emptiness, deceiving himself; for emptiness shall be his reward.
Job 15:315  אַל־יַאֲמֵ֣ן *בשו **בַּשָּׁ֣יו נִתְעָ֑ה כִּי־שָׁ֝֗וְא תִּהְיֶ֥ה תְמוּרָתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 15:31
Job 15:32It shall be accomplished before his time. His branch shall not be green.
Job 15:325  בְּֽלֹא־י֭וֹמוֹ תִּמָּלֵ֑א וְ֝כִפָּת֗וֹ לֹ֣א רַעֲנָֽנָה׃ ‬
Job 15:32
Job 15:33He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive tree.
Job 15:335  יַחְמֹ֣ס כַּגֶּ֣פֶן בִּסְר֑וֹ וְיַשְׁלֵ֥ךְ כַּ֝זַּ֗יִת נִצָּתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Job 15:33
Job 15:34For the company of the godless shall be barren, and fire shall consume the tents of bribery.
Job 15:345  כִּֽי־עֲדַ֣ת חָנֵ֣ף גַּלְמ֑וּד וְ֝אֵ֗שׁ אָכְלָ֥ה אָֽהֳלֵי־שֹֽׁחַד׃ ‬
Job 15:34
Job 15:35They conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity. Their heart prepares deceit.|
Job 15:355  הָרֹ֣ה עָ֭מָל וְיָ֣לֹד אָ֑וֶן וּ֝בִטְנָ֗ם תָּכִ֥ין מִרְמָֽה׃ ס ‬
Job 15:35
Job 16:1Then Job answered,
Job 16:16  וַיַּ֥עַן אִיּ֗וֹב וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 16:1
Job 16:2|I have heard many such things. You are all miserable comforters!
Job 16:26  שָׁמַ֣עְתִּי כְאֵ֣לֶּה רַבּ֑וֹת מְנַחֲמֵ֖י עָמָ֣ל כֻּלְּכֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 16:2
Job 16:3Shall vain words have an end? Or what provokes you that you answer?
Job 16:36  הֲקֵ֥ץ לְדִבְרֵי־ר֑וּחַ א֥וֹ מַה־יַּ֝מְרִֽיצְךָ֗ כִּ֣י תַעֲנֶֽה׃ ‬
Job 16:3
Job 16:4I also could speak as you do. If your soul were in my soul's place, I could join words together against you, and shake my head at you,
Job 16:46  גַּ֤ם ׀ אָנֹכִי֮ כָּכֶ֢ם אֲדַ֫בֵּ֥רָה ל֤וּ־יֵ֪שׁ נַפְשְׁכֶ֡ם תַּ֤חַת נַפְשִׁ֗י אַחְבִּ֣ירָה עֲלֵיכֶ֣ם בְּמִלִּ֑ים וְאָנִ֥יעָה עֲ֝לֵיכֶ֗ם בְּמ֣וֹ רֹאשִֽׁי׃ ‬
Job 16:4
Job 16:5but I would strengthen you with my mouth. The solace of my lips would relieve you.
Job 16:56  אֲאַמִּצְכֶ֥ם בְּמוֹ־פִ֑י וְנִ֖יד שְׂפָתַ֣י יַחְשֹֽׂךְ׃ ‬
Job 16:5
Job 16:6|Though I speak, my grief is not subsided. Though I forbear, what am I eased?
Job 16:66  אִֽם־אֲ֭דַבְּרָה לֹא־יֵחָשֵׂ֣ךְ כְּאֵבִ֑י וְ֝אַחְדְּלָ֗ה מַה־מִנִּ֥י יַהֲלֹֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 16:6
Job 16:7But now, God, you have surely worn me out. You have made desolate all my company.
Job 16:76  אַךְ־עַתָּ֥ה הֶלְאָ֑נִי הֲ֝שִׁמּ֗וֹתָ כָּל־עֲדָתִֽי׃ ‬
Job 16:7
Job 16:8You have shriveled me up. This is a witness against me. My leanness rises up against me. It testifies to my face.
Job 16:86  וַֽ֭תִּקְמְטֵנִי לְעֵ֣ד הָיָ֑ה וַיָּ֥קָם בִּ֥י כַ֝חֲשִׁ֗י בְּפָנַ֥י יַעֲנֶֽה׃ ‬
Job 16:8
Job 16:9He has torn me in his wrath, and persecuted me. He has gnashed on me with his teeth. My adversary sharpens his eyes on me.
Job 16:96  אַפּ֤וֹ טָרַ֨ף ׀ וַֽיִּשְׂטְמֵ֗נִי חָרַ֣ק עָלַ֣י בְּשִׁנָּ֑יו צָרִ֓י ׀ יִלְט֖וֹשׁ עֵינָ֣יו לִֽי׃ ‬
Job 16:9
Job 16:10They have gaped on me with their mouth. They have struck me on the cheek reproachfully. They gather themselves together against me.
Job 16:106  פָּעֲר֬וּ עָלַ֨י ׀ בְּפִיהֶ֗ם בְּ֭חֶרְפָּה הִכּ֣וּ לְחָיָ֑י יַ֝֗חַד עָלַ֥י יִתְמַלָּאֽוּן׃ ‬
Job 16:10
Job 16:11God delivers me to the ungodly, and casts me into the hands of the wicked.
Job 16:116  יַסְגִּירֵ֣נִי אֵ֭ל אֶ֣ל עֲוִ֑יל וְעַל־יְדֵ֖י רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִרְטֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Job 16:11
Job 16:12I was at ease, and he broke me apart. Yes, he has taken me by the neck, and dashed me to pieces. He has also set me up for his target.
Job 16:126  שָׁ֘לֵ֤ו הָיִ֨יתִי ׀ וַֽיְפַרְפְּרֵ֗נִי וְאָחַ֣ז בְּ֭עָרְפִּי וַֽיְפַצְפְּצֵ֑נִי וַיְקִימֵ֥נִי ל֝֗וֹ לְמַטָּרָֽה׃ ‬
Job 16:12
Job 16:13His archers surround me. He splits my kidneys apart, and does not spare. He pours out my gall on the ground.
Job 16:136  יָ֘סֹ֤בּוּ עָלַ֨י ׀ רַבָּ֗יו יְפַלַּ֣ח כִּ֭לְיוֹתַי וְלֹ֣א יַחְמ֑וֹל יִשְׁפֹּ֥ךְ לָ֝אָ֗רֶץ מְרֵרָֽתִי׃ ‬
Job 16:13
Job 16:14He breaks me with breach on breach. He runs on me like a giant.
Job 16:146  יִפְרְצֵ֣נִי פֶ֭רֶץ עַל־פְּנֵי־פָ֑רֶץ יָרֻ֖ץ עָלַ֣י כְּגִבּֽוֹר׃ ‬
Job 16:14
Job 16:15I have sewed sackcloth on my skin, and have thrust my horn in the dust.
Job 16:156  שַׂ֣ק תָּ֭פַרְתִּי עֲלֵ֣י גִלְדִּ֑י וְעֹלַ֖לְתִּי בֶעָפָ֣ר קַרְנִֽי׃ ‬
Job 16:15
Job 16:16My face is red with weeping. Deep darkness is on my eyelids.
Job 16:166  פָּנַ֣י *חמרמרה **חֳ֭מַרְמְרוּ מִנִּי־בֶ֑כִי וְעַ֖ל עַפְעַפַּ֣י צַלְמָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Job 16:16
Job 16:17Although there is no violence in my hands, and my prayer is pure.
Job 16:176  עַ֭ל לֹא־חָמָ֣ס בְּכַפָּ֑י וּֽתְפִלָּתִ֥י זַכָּֽה׃ ‬
Job 16:17
Job 16:18|Earth, don't cover my blood. Let my cry have no place to rest.
Job 16:186  אֶ֭רֶץ אַל־תְּכַסִּ֣י דָמִ֑י וְֽאַל־יְהִ֥י מָ֝ק֗וֹם לְזַעֲקָתִֽי׃ ‬
Job 16:18
Job 16:19Even now, behold, my witness is in heaven. He who vouches for me is on high.
Job 16:196  גַּם־עַ֭תָּה הִנֵּה־בַשָּׁמַ֣יִם עֵדִ֑י וְ֝שָׂהֲדִ֗י בַּמְּרוֹמִֽים׃ ‬
Job 16:19
Job 16:20My friends scoff at me. My eyes pour out tears to God,
Job 16:206  מְלִיצַ֥י רֵעָ֑י אֶל־אֱ֝ל֗וֹהַ דָּלְפָ֥ה עֵינִֽי׃ ‬
Job 16:20
Job 16:21that he would maintain the right of a man with God, of a son of man with his neighbor!
Job 16:216  וְיוֹכַ֣ח לְגֶ֣בֶר עִם־אֱל֑וֹהַּ וּֽבֶן־אָדָ֥ם לְרֵעֵֽהוּ׃ ‬
Job 16:21
Job 16:22For when a few years are come, I shall go the way of no return.
Job 16:226  כִּֽי־שְׁנ֣וֹת מִסְפָּ֣ר יֶאֱתָ֑יוּ וְאֹ֖רַח לֹא־אָשׁ֣וּב אֶהֱלֹֽךְ׃ ‬
Job 16:22
Job 17:1|My spirit is consumed. My days are extinct, And the grave is ready for me.
Job 17:17  רוּחִ֣י חֻ֭בָּלָה יָמַ֥י נִזְעָ֗כוּ קְבָרִ֥ים לִֽי׃ ‬
Job 17:1
Job 17:2Surely there are mockers with me. My eye dwells on their provocation.
Job 17:27  אִם־לֹ֣א הֲ֭תֻלִים עִמָּדִ֑י וּ֝בְהַמְּרוֹתָ֗ם תָּלַ֥ן עֵינִֽי׃ ‬
Job 17:2
Job 17:3|Now give a pledge, be collateral for me with yourself. Who is there who will strike hands with me?
Job 17:37  שִֽׂימָה־נָּ֭א עָרְבֵ֣נִי עִמָּ֑ךְ מִֽי ה֝֗וּא לְיָדִ֥י יִתָּקֵֽעַ׃ ‬
Job 17:3
Job 17:4For you have hidden their heart from understanding, Therefore you shall not exalt them.
Job 17:47  כִּֽי־לִ֭בָּם צָפַ֣נְתָּ מִּשָּׂ֑כֶל עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן לֹ֣א תְרֹמֵֽם׃ ‬
Job 17:4
Job 17:5He who denounces his friends for a prey, Even the eyes of his children shall fail.
Job 17:57  לְ֭חֵלֶק יַגִּ֣יד רֵעִ֑ים וְעֵינֵ֖י בָנָ֣יו תִּכְלֶֽנָה׃ ‬
Job 17:5
Job 17:6|But he has made me a byword of the people. They spit in my face.
Job 17:67  וְֽ֭הִצִּגַנִי לִמְשֹׁ֣ל עַמִּ֑ים וְתֹ֖פֶת לְפָנִ֣ים אֶֽהְיֶֽה׃ ‬
Job 17:6
Job 17:7My eye also is dim by reason of sorrow. All my members are as a shadow.
Job 17:77  וַתֵּ֣כַהּ מִכַּ֣עַשׂ עֵינִ֑י וִֽיצֻרַ֖י כַּצֵּ֣ל כֻּלָּֽם׃ ‬
Job 17:7
Job 17:8Upright men shall be astonished at this. The innocent shall stir up himself against the godless.
Job 17:87  יָשֹׁ֣מּוּ יְשָׁרִ֣ים עַל־זֹ֑את וְ֝נָקִ֗י עַל־חָנֵ֥ף יִתְעֹרָֽר׃ ‬
Job 17:8
Job 17:9Yet shall the righteous hold on his way. He who has clean hands shall grow stronger and stronger.
Job 17:97  וְיֹאחֵ֣ז צַדִּ֣יק דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּֽטֳהָר־יָ֝דַ֗יִם יֹסִ֥יף אֹֽמֶץ׃ ‬
Job 17:9
Job 17:10But as for you all, come on now again; I shall not find a wise man among you.
Job 17:107  וְֽאוּלָ֗ם כֻּלָּ֣ם תָּ֭שֻׁבוּ וּבֹ֣אוּ נָ֑א וְלֹֽא־אֶמְצָ֖א בָכֶ֣ם חָכָֽם׃ ‬
Job 17:10
Job 17:11My days are past, my plans are broken off, as are the thoughts of my heart.
Job 17:117  יָמַ֣י עָ֭בְרוּ זִמֹּתַ֣י נִתְּק֑וּ מ֖וֹרָשֵׁ֣י לְבָבִֽי׃ ‬
Job 17:11
Job 17:12They change the night into day, saying 'The light is near' in the presence of darkness.
Job 17:127  לַ֭יְלָה לְי֣וֹם יָשִׂ֑ימוּ א֝֗וֹר קָר֥וֹב מִפְּנֵי־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃ ‬
Job 17:12
Job 17:13If I look for Sheol as my house, if I have spread my couch in the darkness,
Job 17:137  אִם־אֲ֭קַוֶּה שְׁא֣וֹל בֵּיתִ֑י בַּ֝חֹ֗שֶׁךְ רִפַּ֥דְתִּי יְצוּעָֽי׃ ‬
Job 17:13
Job 17:14If I have said to corruption, 'You are my father;' to the worm, 'My mother,' and 'my sister;'
Job 17:147  לַשַּׁ֣חַת קָ֭רָאתִי אָ֣בִי אָ֑תָּה אִמִּ֥י וַ֝אֲחֹתִ֗י לָֽרִמָּֽה׃ ‬
Job 17:14
Job 17:15where then is my hope? as for my hope, who shall see it?
Job 17:157  וְ֭אַיֵּה אֵפ֣וֹ תִקְוָתִ֑י וְ֝תִקְוָתִ֗י מִ֣י יְשׁוּרֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
Job 17:15
Job 17:16Shall it go down with me to the gates of Sheol, or descend together into the dust?|
Job 17:167  בַּדֵּ֣י שְׁאֹ֣ל תֵּרַ֑דְנָה אִם־יַ֖חַד עַל־עָפָ֣ר נָֽחַת׃ ס ‬
Job 17:16
Job 18:1Then Bildad the Shuhite answered,
Job 18:18  וַ֭יַּעַן בִּלְדַּ֥ד הַשֻּׁחִ֗י וַיֹּאמַֽר׃ ‬
Job 18:1
Job 18:2|How long will you hunt for words? Consider, and afterwards we will speak.
Job 18:28  עַד־אָ֤נָה ׀ תְּשִׂימ֣וּן קִנְצֵ֣י לְמִלִּ֑ין תָּ֝בִ֗ינוּ וְאַחַ֥ר נְדַבֵּֽר׃ ‬
Job 18:2
Job 18:3Why are we counted as animals, which have become unclean in your sight?
Job 18:38  מַ֭דּוּעַ נֶחְשַׁ֣בְנוּ כַבְּהֵמָ֑ה נִ֝טְמִ֗ינוּ בְּעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃ ‬
Job 18:3
Job 18:4You who tear yourself in your anger, shall the earth be forsaken for you? Or shall the rock be removed out of its place?
