Psalm 37:327  צוֹפֶ֣ה רָ֭שָׁע לַצַּדִּ֑יק וּ֝מְבַקֵּ֗שׁ לַהֲמִיתוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 37:32
Psalm 37:33Yahweh will not leave him in his hand, nor condemn him when he is judged.
Psalm 37:337  יְ֭הוָה לֹא־יַעַזְבֶ֣נּוּ בְיָד֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א יַ֝רְשִׁיעֶ֗נּוּ בְּהִשָּׁפְטֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 37:33
Psalm 37:34Wait for Yahweh, and keep his way, and he will exalt you to inherit the land. When the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.
Psalm 37:347  קַוֵּ֤ה אֶל־יְהוָ֨ה ׀ וּשְׁמֹ֬ר דַּרְכּ֗וֹ וִֽ֭ירוֹמִמְךָ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אָ֑רֶץ בְּהִכָּרֵ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תִּרְאֶֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 37:34
Psalm 37:35I have seen the wicked in great power, spreading himself like a green tree in its native soil.
Psalm 37:357  רָ֭אִיתִי רָשָׁ֣ע עָרִ֑יץ וּ֝מִתְעָרֶ֗ה כְּאֶזְרָ֥ח רַעֲנָֽן׃ ‬
Psalm 37:35
Psalm 37:36But he passed away, and behold, he was not. Yes, I sought him, but he could not be found.
Psalm 37:367  וַ֭יּֽ͏ַעֲבֹר וְהִנֵּ֣ה אֵינֶ֑נּוּ וָֽ֝אֲבַקְשֵׁ֗הוּ וְלֹ֣א נִמְצָֽא׃ ‬
Psalm 37:36
Psalm 37:37Mark the perfect man, and see the upright, for there is a future for the man of peace.
Psalm 37:377  שְׁמָר־תָּ֭ם וּרְאֵ֣ה יָשָׁ֑ר כִּֽי־אַחֲרִ֖ית לְאִ֣ישׁ שָׁלֽוֹם׃ ‬
Psalm 37:37
Psalm 37:38As for transgressors, they shall be destroyed together. The future of the wicked shall be cut off.
Psalm 37:387  וּֽ֭פֹשְׁעִים נִשְׁמְד֣וּ יַחְדָּ֑ו אַחֲרִ֖ית רְשָׁעִ֣ים נִכְרָֽתָה׃ ‬
Psalm 37:38
Psalm 37:39But the salvation of the righteous is from Yahweh. He is their stronghold in the time of trouble.
Psalm 37:397  וּתְשׁוּעַ֣ת צַ֭דִּיקִים מֵיְהוָ֑ה מָֽ֝עוּזָּ֗ם בְּעֵ֣ת צָרָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 37:39
Psalm 37:40Yahweh helps them, and rescues them. He rescues them from the wicked, and saves them, Because they have taken refuge in him. A Psalm by David, for a memorial.
Psalm 37:407  וַֽיַּעְזְרֵ֥ם יְהוָ֗ה וַֽיְפַ֫לְּטֵ֥ם יְפַלְּטֵ֣ם מֵ֭רְשָׁעִים וְיוֹשִׁיעֵ֑ם כִּי־חָ֥סוּ בֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 37:40
Psalm 38:1Yahweh, don't rebuke me in your wrath, neither chasten me in your hot displeasure.
Psalm 38:18  מִזְמ֖וֹר לְדָוִ֣ד לְהַזְכִּֽיר׃ ‬
Psalm 38:1
Psalm 38:2For your arrows have pierced me, your hand presses hard on me.
Psalm 38:28  יְֽהוָ֗ה אַל־בְּקֶצְפְּךָ֥ תוֹכִיחֵ֑נִי וּֽבַחֲמָתְךָ֥ תְיַסְּרֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:2
Psalm 38:3There is no soundness in my flesh because of your indignation, neither is there any health in my bones because of my sin.
Psalm 38:38  כִּֽי־חִ֭צֶּיךָ נִ֣חֲתוּ בִ֑י וַתִּנְחַ֖ת עָלַ֣י יָדֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 38:3
Psalm 38:4For my iniquities have gone over my head. As a heavy burden, they are too heavy for me.
Psalm 38:48  אֵין־מְתֹ֣ם בִּ֭בְשָׂרִי מִפְּנֵ֣י זַעְמֶ֑ךָ אֵין־שָׁל֥וֹם בַּ֝עֲצָמַ֗י מִפְּנֵ֥י חַטָּאתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:4
Psalm 38:5My wounds are loathsome and corrupt, because of my foolishness.
Psalm 38:58  כִּ֣י עֲ֭וֺנֹתַי עָבְר֣וּ רֹאשִׁ֑י כְּמַשָּׂ֥א כָ֝בֵ֗ד יִכְבְּד֥וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:5
Psalm 38:6I am pained and bowed down greatly. I go mourning all day long.
Psalm 38:68  הִבְאִ֣ישׁוּ נָ֭מַקּוּ חַבּוּרֹתָ֑י מִ֝פְּנֵ֗י אִוַּלְתִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:6
Psalm 38:7For my waist is filled with burning. There is no soundness in my flesh.
Psalm 38:78  נַעֲוֵ֣יתִי שַׁחֹ֣תִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד כָּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם קֹדֵ֥ר הִלָּֽכְתִּי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:7
Psalm 38:8I am faint and severely bruised. I have groaned by reason of the anguish of my heart.
Psalm 38:88  כִּֽי־כְ֭סָלַי מָלְא֣וּ נִקְלֶ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין מְ֝תֹ֗ם בִּבְשָׂרִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:8
Psalm 38:9Lord, all my desire is before you. My groaning is not hidden from you.
Psalm 38:98  נְפוּג֣וֹתִי וְנִדְכֵּ֣יתִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד שָׁ֝אַ֗גְתִּי מִֽנַּהֲמַ֥ת לִבִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:9
Psalm 38:10My heart throbs. My strength fails me. As for the light of my eyes, it has also left me.
Psalm 38:108  אֲ‍ֽדֹנָי נֶגְדְּךָ֥ כָל־תַּאֲוָתִ֑י וְ֝אַנְחָתִ֗י מִמְּךָ֥ לֹא־נִסְתָּֽרָה׃ ‬
Psalm 38:10
Psalm 38:11My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my plague. My kinsmen stand far away.
Psalm 38:118  לִבִּ֣י סְ֭חַרְחַר עֲזָבַ֣נִי כֹחִ֑י וְֽאוֹר־עֵינַ֥י גַּם־הֵ֝֗ם אֵ֣ין אִתִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:11
Psalm 38:12They also who seek after my life lay snares. Those who seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and meditate deceits all day long.
Psalm 38:128  אֹֽהֲבַ֨י ׀ וְרֵעַ֗י מִנֶּ֣גֶד נִגְעִ֣י יַעֲמֹ֑דוּ וּ֝קְרוֹבַ֗י מֵרָחֹ֥ק עָמָֽדוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 38:12
Psalm 38:13But I, as a deaf man, don't hear. I am as a mute man who doesn't open his mouth.
Psalm 38:138  וַיְנַקְשׁ֤וּ ׀ מְבַקְשֵׁ֬י נַפְשִׁ֗י וְדֹרְשֵׁ֣י רָ֭עָתִי דִּבְּר֣וּ הַוּ֑וֹת וּ֝מִרְמ֗וֹת כָּל־הַיּ֥וֹם יֶהְגּֽוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 38:13
Psalm 38:14Yes, I am as a man who doesn't hear, in whose mouth are no reproofs.
Psalm 38:148  וַאֲנִ֣י כְ֭חֵרֵשׁ לֹ֣א אֶשְׁמָ֑ע וּ֝כְאִלֵּ֗ם לֹ֣א יִפְתַּח־פִּֽיו׃ ‬
Psalm 38:14
Psalm 38:15For in you, Yahweh, do I hope. You will answer, Lord my God.
Psalm 38:158  וָאֱהִ֗י כְּ֭אִישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־שֹׁמֵ֑עַ וְאֵ֥ין בְּ֝פִ֗יו תּוֹכָחֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 38:15
Psalm 38:16For I said, |Don't let them gloat over me, or exalt themselves over me when my foot slips.|
Psalm 38:168  כִּֽי־לְךָ֣ יְהוָ֣ה הוֹחָ֑לְתִּי אַתָּ֥ה תַ֝עֲנֶ֗ה אֲדֹנָ֥י אֱלֹהָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:16
Psalm 38:17For I am ready to fall. My pain is continually before me.
Psalm 38:178  כִּֽי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי פֶּן־יִשְׂמְחוּ־לִ֑י בְּמ֥וֹט רַ֝גְלִ֗י עָלַ֥י הִגְדִּֽילוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 38:17
Psalm 38:18For I will declare my iniquity. I will be sorry for my sin.
Psalm 38:188  כִּֽי־אֲ֭נִי לְצֶ֣לַע נָכ֑וֹן וּמַכְאוֹבִ֖י נֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִֽיד׃ ‬
Psalm 38:18
Psalm 38:19But my enemies are vigorous and many. Those who hate me without reason are numerous.
Psalm 38:198  כִּֽי־עֲוֺנִ֥י אַגִּ֑יד אֶ֝דְאַ֗ג מֵֽחַטָּאתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:19
Psalm 38:20They who also render evil for good are adversaries to me, because I follow what is good.
Psalm 38:208  וְֽ֭אֹיְבַי חַיִּ֣ים עָצֵ֑מוּ וְרַבּ֖וּ שֹׂנְאַ֣י שָֽׁקֶר׃ ‬
Psalm 38:20
Psalm 38:21Don't forsake me, Yahweh. My God, don't be far from me.
Psalm 38:218  וּמְשַׁלְּמֵ֣י רָ֭עָה תַּ֣חַת טוֹבָ֑ה יִ֝שְׂטְנ֗וּנִי תַּ֣חַת *רדופי־**רָֽדְפִי־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Psalm 38:21
Psalm 38:22Hurry to help me, Lord, my salvation. For the Chief Musician. For Jeduthun. A Psalm by David.
Psalm 38:228  אַל־תַּֽעַזְבֵ֥נִי יְהוָ֑ה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אַל־תִּרְחַ֥ק מִמֶּֽנִּי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:22
Psalm 38:23(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 38:238  ח֥וּשָׁה לְעֶזְרָתִ֑י אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י תְּשׁוּעָתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 38:23
Psalm 39:1I said, |I will watch my ways, so that I don't sin with my tongue. I will keep my mouth with a bridle while the wicked is before me.|
Psalm 39:19  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ *לידיתון **לִֽידוּת֗וּן מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 39:1
Psalm 39:2I was mute with silence. I held my peace, even from good. My sorrow was stirred.
Psalm 39:29  אָמַ֗רְתִּי אֶֽשְׁמְרָ֣ה דְרָכַי֮ מֵחֲט֢וֹא בִלְשׁ֫וֹנִ֥י אֶשְׁמְרָ֥ה לְפִ֥י מַחְס֑וֹם בְּעֹ֖ד רָשָׁ֣ע לְנֶגְדִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 39:2
Psalm 39:3My heart was hot within me. While I meditated, the fire burned: I spoke with my tongue:
Psalm 39:39  נֶאֱלַ֣מְתִּי ד֭וּמִיָּה הֶחֱשֵׁ֣יתִי מִטּ֑וֹב וּכְאֵבִ֥י נֶעְכָּֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 39:3
Psalm 39:4|Yahweh, show me my end, what is the measure of my days. Let me know how frail I am.
Psalm 39:49  חַם־לִבִּ֨י ׀ בְּקִרְבִּ֗י בַּהֲגִיגִ֥י תִבְעַר־אֵ֑שׁ דִּ֝בַּ֗רְתִּי בִּלְשֽׁוֹנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 39:4
Psalm 39:5Behold, you have made my days handbreadths. My lifetime is as nothing before you. Surely every man stands as a breath.| Selah.
Psalm 39:59  הוֹדִ֘יעֵ֤נִי יְהוָ֨ה ׀ קִצִּ֗י וּמִדַּ֣ת יָמַ֣י מַה־הִ֑יא אֵ֝דְעָ֗ה מֶה־חָדֵ֥ל אָֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 39:5
Psalm 39:6|Surely every man walks like a shadow. Surely they busy themselves in vain. He heaps up, and doesn't know who shall gather.
Psalm 39:69  הִנֵּ֤ה טְפָח֨וֹת ׀ נָ֘תַ֤תָּה יָמַ֗י וְחֶלְדִּ֣י כְאַ֣יִן נֶגְדֶּ֑ךָ אַ֥ךְ כָּֽל־הֶ֥בֶל כָּל־אָ֝דָ֗ם נִצָּ֥ב סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 39:6
Psalm 39:7Now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in you.
Psalm 39:79  אַךְ־בְּצֶ֤לֶם ׀ יִֽתְהַלֶּךְ־אִ֗ישׁ אַךְ־הֶ֥בֶל יֶהֱמָי֑וּן יִ֝צְבֹּ֗ר וְֽלֹא־יֵדַ֥ע מִי־אֹסְפָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 39:7
Psalm 39:8Deliver me from all my transgressions. Don't make me the reproach of the foolish.
Psalm 39:89  וְעַתָּ֣ה מַה־קִּוִּ֣יתִי אֲדֹנָ֑י תּ֝וֹחַלְתִּ֗י לְךָ֣ הִֽיא׃ ‬
Psalm 39:8
Psalm 39:9I was mute. I didn't open my mouth, because you did it.
Psalm 39:99  מִכָּל־פְּשָׁעַ֥י הַצִּילֵ֑נִי חֶרְפַּ֥ת נָ֝בָ֗ל אַל־תְּשִׂימֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 39:9
Psalm 39:10Remove your scourge away from me. I am overcome by the blow of your hand.
Psalm 39:109  נֶ֭אֱלַמְתִּי לֹ֣א אֶפְתַּח־פִּ֑י כִּ֖י אַתָּ֣ה עָשִֽׂיתָ׃ ‬
Psalm 39:10
Psalm 39:11When you rebuke and correct man for iniquity, You consume his wealth like a moth. Surely every man is but a breath.| Selah.
Psalm 39:119  הָסֵ֣ר מֵעָלַ֣י נִגְעֶ֑ךָ מִתִּגְרַ֥ת יָ֝דְךָ֗ אֲנִ֣י כָלִֽיתִי׃ ‬
Psalm 39:11
Psalm 39:12|Hear my prayer, Yahweh, and give ear to my cry. Don't be silent at my tears. For I am a stranger with you, a foreigner, as all my fathers were.
Psalm 39:129  בְּֽתוֹכָ֘ח֤וֹת עַל־עָוֺ֨ן ׀ יִסַּ֬רְתָּ אִ֗ישׁ וַתֶּ֣מֶס כָּעָ֣שׁ חֲמוּד֑וֹ אַ֤ךְ הֶ֖בֶל כָּל־אָדָ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 39:12
Psalm 39:13Oh spare me, that I may recover strength, before I go away, and exist no more.| For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.
Psalm 39:139  שִֽׁמְעָ֥ה־תְפִלָּתִ֨י ׀ יְהוָ֡ה וְשַׁוְעָתִ֨י ׀ הַאֲזִינָה֮ אֶֽל־דִּמְעָתִ֗י אַֽל־תֶּ֫חֱרַ֥שׁ כִּ֤י גֵ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י עִמָּ֑ךְ תּ֝וֹשָׁ֗ב כְּכָל־אֲבוֹתָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 39:13
Psalm 39:14(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 39:149  הָשַׁ֣ע מִמֶּ֣נִּי וְאַבְלִ֑יגָה בְּטֶ֖רֶם אֵלֵ֣ךְ וְאֵינֶֽנִּי׃ ‬
Psalm 39:14
Psalm 40:1I waited patiently for Yahweh. He turned to me, and heard my cry.
Psalm 40:10  לַ֝מְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָוִ֥ד מִזְמֽוֹר׃ ‬
Psalm 40:1
Psalm 40:2He brought me up also out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay. He set my feet on a rock, and gave me a firm place to stand.
Psalm 40:20  קַוֺּ֣ה קִוִּ֣יתִי יְהוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥ט אֵ֝לַ֗י וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע שַׁוְעָתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 40:2
Psalm 40:3He has put a new song in my mouth, even praise to our God. Many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in Yahweh.
Psalm 40:30  וַיַּעֲלֵ֤נִי ׀ מִבּ֥וֹר שָׁאוֹן֮ מִטִּ֢יט הַיָּ֫וֵ֥ן וַיָּ֖קֶם עַל־סֶ֥לַע רַגְלַ֗י כּוֹנֵ֥ן אֲשֻׁרָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 40:3
Psalm 40:4Blessed is the man who makes Yahweh his trust, and doesn't respect the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.
Psalm 40:40  וַיִּתֵּ֬ן בְּפִ֨י ׀ שִׁ֥יר חָדָשׁ֮ תְּהִלָּ֢ה לֵֽאלֹ֫הֵ֥ינוּ יִרְא֣וּ רַבִּ֣ים וְיִירָ֑אוּ וְ֝יִבְטְח֗וּ בַּיהוָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 40:4
Psalm 40:5Many, Yahweh, my God, are the wonderful works which you have done, and your thoughts which are toward us. They can't be declared back to you. If I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered.
Psalm 40:50  אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי הַגֶּ֗בֶר אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם יְ֭הֹוָה מִבְטַח֑וֹ וְֽלֹא־פָנָ֥ה אֶל־רְ֝הָבִ֗ים וְשָׂטֵ֥י כָזָֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 40:5
Psalm 40:6Sacrifice and offering you didn't desire. You have opened my ears. You have not required burnt offering and sin offering.
Psalm 40:60  רַבּ֤וֹת עָשִׂ֨יתָ ׀ אַתָּ֤ה ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהַי֮ נִֽפְלְאֹתֶ֥יךָ וּמַחְשְׁבֹתֶ֗יךָ אֵ֫לֵ֥ינוּ אֵ֤ין ׀ עֲרֹ֬ךְ אֵלֶ֗יךָ אַגִּ֥ידָה וַאֲדַבֵּ֑רָה עָ֝צְמ֗וּ מִסַּפֵּֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 40:6
Psalm 40:7Then I said, |Behold, I have come. It is written about me in the book in the scroll.
Psalm 40:70  זֶ֤בַח וּמִנְחָ֨ה ׀ לֹֽא־חָפַ֗צְתָּ אָ֭זְנַיִם כָּרִ֣יתָ לִּ֑י עוֹלָ֥ה וַ֝חֲטָאָ֗ה לֹ֣א שָׁאָֽלְתָּ׃ ‬
Psalm 40:7
Psalm 40:8I delight to do your will, my God. Yes, your law is within my heart.|
Psalm 40:80  אָ֣ז אָ֭מַרְתִּי הִנֵּה־בָ֑אתִי בִּמְגִלַּת־סֵ֝֗פֶר כָּת֥וּב עָלָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 40:8
Psalm 40:9I have proclaimed glad news of righteousness in the great assembly. Behold, I will not seal my lips, Yahweh, you know.
Psalm 40:90  לַֽעֲשֽׂוֹת־רְצוֹנְךָ֣ אֱלֹהַ֣י חָפָ֑צְתִּי וְ֝ת֥וֹרָתְךָ֗ בְּת֣וֹךְ מֵעָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 40:9
Psalm 40:10I have not hidden your righteousness within my heart. I have declared your faithfulness and your salvation. I have not concealed your loving kindness and your truth from the great assembly.
Psalm 40:100  בִּשַּׂ֤רְתִּי צֶ֨דֶק ׀ בְּקָ֘הָ֤ל רָ֗ב הִנֵּ֣ה שְׂ֭פָתַי לֹ֣א אֶכְלָ֑א יְ֝הוָ֗ה אַתָּ֥ה יָדָֽעְתָּ׃ ‬
Psalm 40:10
Psalm 40:11Don't withhold your tender mercies from me, Yahweh. Let your loving kindness and your truth continually preserve me.
Psalm 40:110  צִדְקָתְךָ֬ לֹא־כִסִּ֨יתִי ׀ בְּת֬וֹךְ לִבִּ֗י אֱמוּנָתְךָ֣ וּתְשׁוּעָתְךָ֣ אָמָ֑רְתִּי לֹא־כִחַ֥דְתִּי חַסְדְּךָ֥ וַ֝אֲמִתְּךָ֗ לְקָהָ֥ל רָֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 40:11
Psalm 40:12For innumerable evils have surrounded me. My iniquities have overtaken me, so that I am not able to look up. They are more than the hairs of my head. My heart has failed me.
Psalm 40:120  אַתָּ֤ה יְהוָ֗ה לֹא־תִכְלָ֣א רַחֲמֶ֣יךָ מִמֶּ֑נִּי חַסְדְּךָ֥ וַ֝אֲמִתְּךָ֗ תָּמִ֥יד יִצְּרֽוּנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 40:12
Psalm 40:13Be pleased, Yahweh, to deliver me. Hurry to help me, Yahweh.
Psalm 40:130  כִּ֤י אָפְפ֥וּ־עָלַ֨י ׀ רָע֡וֹת עַד־אֵ֬ין מִסְפָּ֗ר הִשִּׂיג֣וּנִי עֲ֭וֺנֹתַי וְלֹא־יָכֹ֣לְתִּי לִרְא֑וֹת עָצְמ֥וּ מִשַּֽׂעֲר֥וֹת רֹ֝אשִׁ֗י וְלִבִּ֥י עֲזָבָֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 40:13
Psalm 40:14Let them be disappointed and confounded together who seek after my soul to destroy it. Let them be turned backward and brought to dishonor who delight in my hurt.
Psalm 40:140  רְצֵ֣ה יְ֭הוָה לְהַצִּילֵ֑נִי יְ֝הוָ֗ה לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי חֽוּשָׁה׃ ‬
Psalm 40:14
Psalm 40:15Let them be desolate by reason of their shame that tell me, |Aha! Aha!|
Psalm 40:150  יֵ֘בֹ֤שׁוּ וְיַחְפְּר֨וּ ׀ יַחַד֮ מְבַקְשֵׁ֥י נַפְשִׁ֗י לִסְפּ֫וֹתָ֥הּ יִסֹּ֣גוּ אָ֭חוֹר וְיִכָּלְמ֑וּ חֲ֝פֵצֵ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 40:15
Psalm 40:16Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you. Let such as love your salvation say continually, |Let Yahweh be exalted!|
Psalm 40:160  יָ֭שֹׁמּוּ עַל־עֵ֣קֶב בָּשְׁתָּ֑ם הָאֹמְרִ֥ים לִ֝֗י הֶ֘אָ֥ח ׀ הֶאָֽח׃ ‬
Psalm 40:16
Psalm 40:17But I am poor and needy. May the Lord think about me. You are my help and my deliverer. Don't delay, my God. For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.
Psalm 40:170  יָ֘שִׂ֤ישׂוּ וְיִשְׂמְח֨וּ ׀ בְּךָ֗ כָּֽל־מְבַ֫קְשֶׁ֥יךָ יֹאמְר֣וּ תָ֭מִיד יִגְדַּ֣ל יְהוָ֑ה אֹֽ֝הֲבֵ֗י תְּשׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 40:17
Psalm 40:18(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 40:180  וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְיוֹן֮ אֲדֹנָ֢י יַחֲשָׁ֫ב לִ֥י עֶזְרָתִ֣י וּמְפַלְטִ֣י אַ֑תָּה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אַל־תְּאַחַֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 40:18
Psalm 41:1Blessed is he who considers the poor. Yahweh will deliver him in the day of evil.
Psalm 41:11  לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 41:1
Psalm 41:2Yahweh will preserve him, and keep him alive. He shall be blessed on the earth, and he will not surrender him to the will of his enemies.
Psalm 41:21  אַ֭שְׁרֵי מַשְׂכִּ֣יל אֶל־דָּ֑ל בְּי֥וֹם רָ֝עָ֗ה יְֽמַלְּטֵ֥הוּ יְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 41:2
Psalm 41:3Yahweh will sustain him on his sickbed, and restore him from his bed of illness.
Psalm 41:31  יְהוָ֤ה ׀ יִשְׁמְרֵ֣הוּ וִֽ֭יחַיֵּהוּ *יאשר **וְאֻשַּׁ֣ר בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְאַֽל־תִּ֝תְּנֵ֗הוּ בְּנֶ֣פֶשׁ אֹיְבָֽיו׃ ‬
Psalm 41:3
Psalm 41:4I said, |Yahweh, have mercy on me! Heal me, for I have sinned against you.|
Psalm 41:41  יְֽהוָ֗ה יִ֭סְעָדֶנּוּ עַל־עֶ֣רֶשׂ דְּוָ֑י כָּל־מִ֝שְׁכָּב֗וֹ הָפַ֥כְתָּ בְחָלְיֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 41:4
Psalm 41:5My enemies speak evil against me: |When will he die, and his name perish?|
Psalm 41:51  אֲ‍ֽנִי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי יְהוָ֣ה חָנֵּ֑נִי רְפָאָ֥ה נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י כִּי־חָטָ֥אתִי לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 41:5
Psalm 41:6If he comes to see me, he speaks falsehood. His heart gathers iniquity to itself. When he goes abroad, he tells it.
Psalm 41:61  אוֹיְבַ֗י יֹאמְר֣וּ רַ֣ע לִ֑י מָתַ֥י יָ֝מ֗וּת וְאָבַ֥ד שְׁמֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 41:6
Psalm 41:7All who hate me whisper together against me. They imagine the worst for me.
Psalm 41:71  וְאִם־בָּ֤א לִרְא֨וֹת ׀ שָׁ֤וְא יְדַבֵּ֗ר לִבּ֗וֹ יִקְבָּץ־אָ֥וֶן ל֑וֹ יֵצֵ֖א לַח֣וּץ יְדַבֵּֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 41:7
Psalm 41:8|An evil disease,| they say, |has afflicted him. Now that he lies he shall rise up no more.|
Psalm 41:81  יַ֗חַד עָלַ֣י יִ֭תְלַחֲשׁוּ כָּל־שֹׂנְאָ֑י עָלַ֓י ׀ יַחְשְׁב֖וּ רָעָ֣ה לִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 41:8
Psalm 41:9Yes, my own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, who ate bread with me, has lifted up his heel against me.
Psalm 41:91  דְּֽבַר־בְּ֭לִיַּעַל יָצ֣וּק בּ֑וֹ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁ֝כַ֗ב לֹא־יוֹסִ֥יף לָקֽוּם׃ ‬
Psalm 41:9
Psalm 41:10But you, Yahweh, have mercy on me, and raise me up, that I may repay them.
Psalm 41:101  גַּם־אִ֤ישׁ שְׁלוֹמִ֨י ׀ אֲשֶׁר־בָּטַ֣חְתִּי ב֭וֹ אוֹכֵ֣ל לַחְמִ֑י הִגְדִּ֖יל עָלַ֣י עָקֵֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 41:10
Psalm 41:11By this I know that you delight in me, because my enemy doesn't triumph over me.
Psalm 41:111  וְאַתָּ֤ה יְהוָ֗ה חָנֵּ֥נִי וַהֲקִימֵ֑נִי וַֽאֲשַׁלְּמָ֥ה לָהֶֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 41:11
Psalm 41:12As for me, you uphold me in my integrity, and set me in your presence forever.
Psalm 41:121  בְּזֹ֣את יָ֭דַעְתִּי כִּֽי־חָפַ֣צְתָּ בִּ֑י כִּ֤י לֹֽא־יָרִ֖יעַ אֹיְבִ֣י עָלָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 41:12
Psalm 41:13Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, from everlasting and to everlasting! Amen and amen. BOOK II For the Chief Musician. A contemplation by the sons of Korah.
Psalm 41:131  וַאֲנִ֗י בְּ֭תֻמִּי תָּמַ֣כְתָּ בִּ֑י וַתַּצִּיבֵ֖נִי לְפָנֶ֣יךָ לְעוֹלָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 41:13
Psalm 41:14(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 41:141  בָּ֘ר֤וּךְ יְהוָ֨ה ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מֵֽ֭הָעוֹלָם וְעַ֥ד הָעוֹלָ֗ם אָ֘מֵ֥ן ׀ וְאָמֵֽן׃ ‬
Psalm 41:14
Psalm 42:1As the deer pants for the water brooks, so my soul pants after you, God.
Psalm 42:12  לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לִבְנֵי־קֹֽרַח׃ ‬
Psalm 42:1
Psalm 42:2My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When shall I come and appear before God?
Psalm 42:22  כְּאַיָּ֗ל תַּעֲרֹ֥ג עַל־אֲפִֽיקֵי־מָ֑יִם כֵּ֤ן נַפְשִׁ֨י תַעֲרֹ֖ג אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 42:2
Psalm 42:3My tears have been my food day and night, while they continually ask me, |Where is your God?|
Psalm 42:32  צָמְאָ֬ה נַפְשִׁ֨י ׀ לֵאלֹהִים֮ לְאֵ֢ל חָ֥י מָתַ֥י אָב֑וֹא וְ֝אֵרָאֶ֗ה פְּנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 42:3
Psalm 42:4These things I remember, and pour out my soul within me, how I used to go with the crowd, and led them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, a multitude keeping a holy day.
Psalm 42:42  הָֽיְתָה־לִּ֬י דִמְעָתִ֣י לֶ֭חֶם יוֹמָ֣ם וָלָ֑יְלָה בֶּאֱמֹ֥ר אֵלַ֥י כָּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם אַיֵּ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 42:4
Psalm 42:5Why are you in despair, my soul? Why are you disturbed within me? Hope in God! For I shall still praise him for the saving help of his presence.
Psalm 42:52  אֵ֤לֶּה אֶזְכְּרָ֨ה ׀ וְאֶשְׁפְּכָ֬ה עָלַ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁ֗י כִּ֤י אֶֽעֱבֹ֨ר ׀ בַּסָּךְ֮ אֶדַּדֵּ֗ם עַד־בֵּ֥ית אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים בְּקוֹל־רִנָּ֥ה וְתוֹדָ֗ה הָמ֥וֹן חוֹגֵֽג׃ ‬
Psalm 42:5
Psalm 42:6My God, my soul is in despair within me. Therefore I remember you from the land of the Jordan, the heights of Hermon, from the hill Mizar.
Psalm 42:62  מַה־תִּשְׁתּ֬וֹחֲחִ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ וַתֶּהֱמִ֢י עָ֫לָ֥י הוֹחִ֣ילִי לֵֽ֭אלֹהִים כִּי־ע֥וֹד אוֹדֶ֗נּוּ יְשׁוּע֥וֹת פָּנָֽיו׃ ‬
Psalm 42:6
Psalm 42:7Deep calls to deep at the noise of your waterfalls. All your waves and your billows have swept over me.
Psalm 42:72  אֱ‍ֽלֹהַ֗י עָלַי֮ נַפְשִׁ֢י תִשְׁתּ֫וֹחָ֥ח עַל־כֵּ֗ן אֶ֭זְכָּרְךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ יַרְדֵּ֑ן וְ֝חֶרְמוֹנִ֗ים מֵהַ֥ר מִצְעָֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 42:7
Psalm 42:8Yahweh will command his loving kindness in the daytime. In the night his song shall be with me: a prayer to the God of my life.
Psalm 42:82  תְּהֽוֹם־אֶל־תְּה֣וֹם ק֭וֹרֵא לְק֣וֹל צִנּוֹרֶ֑יךָ כָּֽל־מִשְׁבָּרֶ֥יךָ וְ֝גַלֶּ֗יךָ עָלַ֥י עָבָֽרוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 42:8
Psalm 42:9I will ask God, my rock, |Why have you forgotten me? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?|
Psalm 42:92  יוֹמָ֤ם ׀ יְצַוֶּ֬ה יְהוָ֨ה ׀ חַסְדּ֗וֹ וּ֭בַלַּיְלָה *שירה **שִׁיר֣וֹ עִמִּ֑י תְּ֝פִלָּ֗ה לְאֵ֣ל חַיָּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 42:9
Psalm 42:10As with a sword in my bones, my adversaries reproach me, while they continually ask me, |Where is your God?|
Psalm 42:102  אוֹמְרָ֤ה ׀ לְאֵ֥ל סַלְעִי֮ לָמָ֢ה שְׁכַ֫חְתָּ֥נִי לָֽמָּה־קֹדֵ֥ר אֵלֵ֗ךְ בְּלַ֣חַץ אוֹיֵֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 42:10
Psalm 42:11Why are you in despair, my soul? Why are you disturbed within me? Hope in God! For I shall still praise him, the saving help of my countenance, and my God.
Psalm 42:112  בְּרֶ֤צַח ׀ בְּֽעַצְמוֹתַ֗י חֵרְפ֥וּנִי צוֹרְרָ֑י בְּאָמְרָ֥ם אֵלַ֥י כָּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם אַיֵּ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 42:11
Psalm 42:12(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 42:122  מַה־תִּשְׁתּ֬וֹחֲחִ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ וּֽמַה־תֶּהֱמִ֢י עָ֫לָ֥י הוֹחִ֣ילִי לֽ͏ֵ֭אלֹהִים כִּי־ע֣וֹד אוֹדֶ֑נּוּ יְשׁוּעֹ֥ת פָּ֝נַ֗י וֵֽאלֹהָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 42:12
Psalm 43:1Vindicate me, God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation. Oh, deliver me from deceitful and wicked men.
Psalm 43:13  שָׁפְטֵ֤נִי אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ וְרִ֘יבָ֤ה רִיבִ֗י מִגּ֥וֹי לֹא־חָסִ֑יד מֵ֤אִישׁ־מִרְמָ֖ה וְעַוְלָ֣ה תְפַלְּטֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 43:1
Psalm 43:2For you are the God of my strength. Why have you rejected me? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
Psalm 43:23  כִּֽי־אַתָּ֤ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י מָֽעוּזִּי֮ לָמָ֢ה זְנַ֫חְתָּ֥נִי לָֽמָּה־קֹדֵ֥ר אֶתְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בְּלַ֣חַץ אוֹיֵֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 43:2
Psalm 43:3Oh, send out your light and your truth. Let them lead me. Let them bring me to your holy hill, To your tents.
Psalm 43:33  שְׁלַח־אוֹרְךָ֣ וַ֭אֲמִתְּךָ הֵ֣מָּה יַנְח֑וּנִי יְבִיא֥וּנִי אֶל־הַֽר־קָ֝דְשְׁךָ֗ וְאֶל־מִשְׁכְּנוֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 43:3
Psalm 43:4Then I will go to the altar of God, to God, my exceeding joy. I will praise you on the harp, God, my God.
Psalm 43:43  וְאָב֤וֹאָה ׀ אֶל־מִזְבַּ֬ח אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֶל־אֵל֮ שִׂמְחַ֢ת גִּ֫ילִ֥י וְאוֹדְךָ֥ בְכִנּ֗וֹר אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֱלֹהָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 43:4
Psalm 43:5Why are you in despair, my soul? Why are you disturbed within me? Hope in God! For I shall still praise him: my Savior, my helper, and my God. For the Chief Musician. By the sons of Korah. A contemplative psalm.
Psalm 43:53  מַה־תִּשְׁתּ֬וֹחֲחִ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ וּֽמַה־תֶּהֱמִ֢י עָ֫לָ֥י הוֹחִ֣ילִי לֽ͏ֵ֭אלֹהִים כִּי־ע֣וֹד אוֹדֶ֑נּוּ יְשׁוּעֹ֥ת פָּ֝נַ֗י וֵֽאלֹהָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 43:5
Psalm 44:1We have heard with our ears, God; our fathers have told us, what work you did in their days, in the days of old.
Psalm 44:14  לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃ ‬
Psalm 44:1
Psalm 44:2You drove out the nations with your hand, but you planted them. You afflicted the peoples, but you spread them abroad.
Psalm 44:24  אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ בְּאָזְנֵ֬ינוּ שָׁמַ֗עְנוּ אֲבוֹתֵ֥ינוּ סִפְּרוּ־לָ֑נוּ פֹּ֥עַל פָּעַ֥לְתָּ בִֽ֝ימֵיהֶ֗ם בִּ֣ימֵי קֶֽדֶם׃ ‬
Psalm 44:2
Psalm 44:3For they didn't get the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them; but your right hand, and your arm, and the light of your face, because you were favorable to them.
Psalm 44:34  אַתָּ֤ה ׀ יָדְךָ֡ גּוֹיִ֣ם ה֭וֹרַשְׁתָּ וַתִּטָּעֵ֑ם תָּרַ֥ע לְ֝אֻמִּ֗ים וַֽתְּשַׁלְּחֵֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 44:3
Psalm 44:4You are my King, God. Command victories for Jacob!
Psalm 44:44  כִּ֤י לֹ֪א בְחַרְבָּ֡ם יָ֥רְשׁוּ אָ֗רֶץ וּזְרוֹעָם֮ לֹא־הוֹשִׁ֢יעָ֫ה לָּ֥מוֹ כִּֽי־יְמִֽינְךָ֣ וּ֭זְרוֹעֲךָ וְא֥וֹר פָּנֶ֗יךָ כִּ֣י רְצִיתָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 44:4
Psalm 44:5Through you, will we push down our adversaries. Through your name, will we tread them under who rise up against us.
Psalm 44:54  אַתָּה־ה֣וּא מַלְכִּ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים צַ֝וֵּ֗ה יְשׁוּע֥וֹת יַעֲקֹֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 44:5
Psalm 44:6For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
Psalm 44:64  בְּ֭ךָ צָרֵ֣ינוּ נְנַגֵּ֑חַ בְּ֝שִׁמְךָ֗ נָב֥וּס קָמֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:6
Psalm 44:7But you have saved us from our adversaries, and have shamed those who hate us.
Psalm 44:74  כִּ֤י לֹ֣א בְקַשְׁתִּ֣י אֶבְטָ֑ח וְ֝חַרְבִּ֗י לֹ֣א תוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 44:7
Psalm 44:8In God we have made our boast all day long, we will give thanks to your name forever. Selah.
Psalm 44:84  כִּ֣י ה֭וֹשַׁעְתָּנוּ מִצָּרֵ֑ינוּ וּמְשַׂנְאֵ֥ינוּ הֱבִישֽׁוֹתָ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:8
Psalm 44:9But now you rejected us, and brought us to dishonor, and don't go out with our armies.
Psalm 44:94  בֵּֽ֭אלֹהִים הִלַּלְ֣נוּ כָל־הַיּ֑וֹם וְשִׁמְךָ֓ ׀ לְעוֹלָ֖ם נוֹדֶ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 44:9
Psalm 44:10You make us turn back from the adversary. Those who hate us take spoil for themselves.
Psalm 44:104  אַף־זָ֭נַחְתָּ וַתַּכְלִימֵ֑נוּ וְלֹא־תֵ֝צֵ֗א בְּצִבְאוֹתֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:10
Psalm 44:11You have made us like sheep for food, and have scattered us among the nations.
Psalm 44:114  תְּשִׁיבֵ֣נוּ אָ֭חוֹר מִנִּי־צָ֑ר וּ֝מְשַׂנְאֵ֗ינוּ שָׁ֣סוּ לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:11
Psalm 44:12You sell your people for nothing, and have gained nothing from their sale.
Psalm 44:124  תִּ֭תְּנֵנוּ כְּצֹ֣אן מַאֲכָ֑ל וּ֝בַגּוֹיִ֗ם זֵרִיתָֽנוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:12
Psalm 44:13You make us a reproach to our neighbors, a scoffing and a derision to those who are around us.
Psalm 44:134  תִּמְכֹּֽר־עַמְּךָ֥ בְלֹא־ה֑וֹן וְלֹ֥א־רִ֝בִּ֗יתָ בִּמְחִירֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 44:13
Psalm 44:14You make us a byword among the nations, a shaking of the head among the peoples.
Psalm 44:144  תְּשִׂימֵ֣נוּ חֶ֭רְפָּה לִשְׁכֵנֵ֑ינוּ לַ֥עַג וָ֝קֶ֗לֶס לִסְבִיבוֹתֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:14
Psalm 44:15All day long my dishonor is before me, and shame covers my face,
Psalm 44:154  תְּשִׂימֵ֣נוּ מָ֭שָׁל בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם מְנֽוֹד־רֹ֝֗אשׁ בַּל־אֻמִּֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 44:15
Psalm 44:16At the taunt of one who reproaches and verbally abuses, because of the enemy and the avenger.
Psalm 44:164  כָּל־הַ֭יּוֹם כְּלִמָּתִ֣י נֶגְדִּ֑י וּבֹ֖שֶׁת פָּנַ֣י כִּסָּֽתְנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 44:16
Psalm 44:17All this has come on us, yet have we not forgotten you, Neither have we been false to your covenant.
Psalm 44:174  מִ֭קּוֹל מְחָרֵ֣ף וּמְגַדֵּ֑ף מִפְּנֵ֥י א֝וֹיֵ֗ב וּמִתְנַקֵּֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 44:17
Psalm 44:18Our heart has not turned back, neither have our steps strayed from your path,
Psalm 44:184  כָּל־זֹ֣את בָּ֭אַתְנוּ וְלֹ֣א שְׁכַחֲנ֑וּךָ וְלֹֽא־שִׁ֝קַּ֗רְנוּ בִּבְרִיתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:18
Psalm 44:19Though you have crushed us in the haunt of jackals, and covered us with the shadow of death.
Psalm 44:194  לֹא־נָס֣וֹג אָח֣וֹר לִבֵּ֑נוּ וַתֵּ֥ט אֲשֻׁרֵ֗ינוּ מִנִּ֥י אָרְחֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:19
Psalm 44:20If we have forgotten the name of our God, or spread forth our hands to a strange god;
Psalm 44:204  כִּ֣י דִ֭כִּיתָנוּ בִּמְק֣וֹם תַּנִּ֑ים וַתְּכַ֖ס עָלֵ֣ינוּ בְצַלְמָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Psalm 44:20
Psalm 44:21won't God search this out? For he knows the secrets of the heart.
Psalm 44:214  אִם־שָׁ֭כַחְנוּ שֵׁ֣ם אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַנִּפְרֹ֥שׂ כַּ֝פֵּ֗ינוּ לְאֵ֣ל זָֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 44:21
Psalm 44:22Yes, for your sake we are killed all day long. We are regarded as sheep for the slaughter.
Psalm 44:224  הֲלֹ֣א אֱ֭לֹהִים יַֽחֲקָר־זֹ֑את כִּֽי־ה֥וּא יֹ֝דֵ֗עַ תַּעֲלֻמ֥וֹת לֵֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 44:22
Psalm 44:23Wake up! Why do you sleep, Lord? Arise! Don't reject us forever.
Psalm 44:234  כִּֽי־עָ֭לֶיךָ הֹרַ֣גְנוּ כָל־הַיּ֑וֹם נֶ֝חְשַׁ֗בְנוּ כְּצֹ֣אן טִבְחָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 44:23
Psalm 44:24Why do you hide your face, and forget our affliction and our oppression?
Psalm 44:244  ע֤וּרָה ׀ לָ֖מָּה תִישַׁ֥ן ׀ אֲדֹנָ֑י הָ֝קִ֗יצָה אַל־תִּזְנַ֥ח לָנֶֽצַח׃ ‬
Psalm 44:24
Psalm 44:25For our soul is bowed down to the dust. Our body clings to the earth.
Psalm 44:254  לָֽמָּה־פָנֶ֥יךָ תַסְתִּ֑יר תִּשְׁכַּ֖ח עָנְיֵ֣נוּ וְֽלַחֲצֵֽנוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:25
Psalm 44:26Rise up to help us. Redeem us for your loving kindness' sake. For the Chief Musician. Set to |The Lilies.| A contemplation by the sons of Korah. A wedding song.
Psalm 44:264  כִּ֤י שָׁ֣חָה לֶעָפָ֣ר נַפְשֵׁ֑נוּ דָּבְקָ֖ה לָאָ֣רֶץ בִּטְנֵֽנוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:26
Psalm 44:27(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 44:274  ק֭וּמָֽה עֶזְרָ֣תָה לָּ֑נוּ וּ֝פְדֵ֗נוּ לְמַ֣עַן חַסְדֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 44:27
Psalm 45:1My heart overflows with a noble theme. I recite my verses for the king. My tongue is like the pen of a skillful writer.
Psalm 45:15  לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ עַל־שֹׁ֭שַׁנִּים לִבְנֵי־קֹ֑רַח מַ֝שְׂכִּ֗יל שִׁ֣יר יְדִידֹֽת׃ ‬
Psalm 45:1
Psalm 45:2You are the most excellent of the sons of men. Grace has anointed your lips, therefore God has blessed you forever.
Psalm 45:25  רָ֘חַ֤שׁ לִבִּ֨י ׀ דָּ֘בָ֤ר ט֗וֹב אֹמֵ֣ר אָ֭נִי מַעֲשַׂ֣י לְמֶ֑לֶךְ לְ֝שׁוֹנִ֗י עֵ֤ט ׀ סוֹפֵ֬ר מָהִֽיר׃ ‬
Psalm 45:2
Psalm 45:3Strap your sword on your thigh, mighty one: your splendor and your majesty.
Psalm 45:35  יָפְיָפִ֡יתָ מִבְּנֵ֬י אָדָ֗ם ה֣וּצַק חֵ֭ן בְּשְׂפְתוֹתֶ֑יךָ עַל־כֵּ֤ן בֵּֽרַכְךָ֖ אֱלֹהִ֣ים לְעוֹלָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 45:3
Psalm 45:4In your majesty ride on victoriously on behalf of truth, humility, and righteousness. Let your right hand display awesome deeds.
Psalm 45:45  חֲגֽוֹר־חַרְבְּךָ֣ עַל־יָרֵ֣ךְ גִּבּ֑וֹר ה֝וֹדְךָ֗ וַהֲדָרֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:4
Psalm 45:5Your arrows are sharp. The nations fall under you, with arrows in the heart of the king's enemies.
Psalm 45:55  וַהֲדָ֬רְךָ֨ ׀ צְלַ֬ח רְכַ֗ב עַֽל־דְּבַר־אֱ֭מֶת וְעַנְוָה־צֶ֑דֶק וְתוֹרְךָ֖ נוֹרָא֣וֹת יְמִינֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:5
Psalm 45:6Your throne, God, is forever and ever. A scepter of equity is the scepter of your kingdom.
Psalm 45:65  חִצֶּ֗יךָ שְׁנ֫וּנִ֥ים עַ֭מִּים תַּחְתֶּ֣יךָ יִפְּל֑וּ בְּ֝לֵ֗ב אוֹיְבֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:6
Psalm 45:7You have loved righteousness, and hated wickedness. Therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.
Psalm 45:75  כִּסְאֲךָ֣ אֱ֭לֹהִים עוֹלָ֣ם וָעֶ֑ד שֵׁ֥בֶט מִ֝ישֹׁ֗ר שֵׁ֣בֶט מַלְכוּתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:7
Psalm 45:8All your garments smell like myrrh, aloes, and cassia. Out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made you glad.
Psalm 45:85  אָהַ֣בְתָּ צֶּדֶק֮ וַתִּשְׂנָ֫א רֶ֥שַׁע עַל־כֵּ֤ן ׀ מְשָׁחֲךָ֡ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֱ֭לֹהֶיךָ שֶׁ֥מֶן שָׂשׂ֗וֹן מֵֽחֲבֵרֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:8
Psalm 45:9Kings' daughters are among your honorable women. At your right hand the queen stands in gold of Ophir.
Psalm 45:95  מֹר־וַאֲהָל֣וֹת קְ֭צִיעוֹת כָּל־בִּגְדֹתֶ֑יךָ מִֽן־הֵ֥יכְלֵי שֵׁ֝֗ן מִנִּ֥י שִׂמְּחֽוּךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:9
Psalm 45:10Listen, daughter, consider, and turn your ear. Forget your own people, and also your father's house.
Psalm 45:105  בְּנ֣וֹת מְ֭לָכִים בְּיִקְּרוֹתֶ֑יךָ נִצְּבָ֥ה שֵׁגַ֥ל לִֽ֝ימִינְךָ֗ בְּכֶ֣תֶם אוֹפִֽיר׃ ‬
Psalm 45:10
Psalm 45:11So the king will desire your beauty, honor him, for he is your lord.
Psalm 45:115  שִׁמְעִי־בַ֣ת וּ֭רְאִי וְהַטִּ֣י אָזְנֵ֑ךְ וְשִׁכְחִ֥י עַ֝מֵּ֗ךְ וּבֵ֥ית אָבִֽיךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:11
Psalm 45:12The daughter of Tyre comes with a gift. The rich among the people entreat your favor.
Psalm 45:125  וְיִתְאָ֣ו הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ יָפְיֵ֑ךְ כִּי־ה֥וּא אֲ֝דֹנַ֗יִךְ וְהִשְׁתַּֽחֲוִי־לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:12
Psalm 45:13The princess inside is all glorious. Her clothing is interwoven with gold.
Psalm 45:135  וּבַֽת־צֹ֨ר ׀ בְּ֭מִנְחָה פָּנַ֥יִךְ יְחַלּ֗וּ עֲשִׁ֣ירֵי עָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 45:13
Psalm 45:14She shall be led to the king in embroidered work. The virgins, her companions who follow her, shall be brought to you.
Psalm 45:145  כָּל־כְּבוּדָּ֣ה בַת־מֶ֣לֶךְ פְּנִ֑ימָה מִֽמִּשְׁבְּצ֖וֹת זָהָ֣ב לְבוּשָֽׁהּ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:14
Psalm 45:15With gladness and rejoicing they shall be led. They shall enter into the king's palace.
Psalm 45:155  לִרְקָמוֹת֮ תּוּבַ֢ל לַ֫מֶּ֥לֶךְ בְּתוּל֣וֹת אַ֭חֲרֶיהָ רֵעוֹתֶ֑יהָ מ֖וּבָא֣וֹת לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:15
Psalm 45:16Your sons will take the place of your fathers. You shall make them princes in all the earth.
Psalm 45:165  תּ֭וּבַלְנָה בִּשְׂמָחֹ֣ת וָגִ֑יל תְּ֝בֹאֶ֗ינָה בְּהֵ֣יכַל מֶֽלֶךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:16
Psalm 45:17I will make your name to be remembered in all generations. Therefore the peoples shall give you thanks forever and ever. For the Chief Musician. By the sons of Korah. According to Alamoth.
Psalm 45:175  תַּ֣חַת אֲ֭בֹתֶיךָ יִהְי֣וּ בָנֶ֑יךָ תְּשִׁיתֵ֥מוֹ לְ֝שָׂרִ֗ים בְּכָל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 45:17
Psalm 45:18(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 45:185  אַזְכִּ֣ירָה שִׁ֭מְךָ בְּכָל־דֹּ֣ר וָדֹ֑ר עַל־כֵּ֥ן עַמִּ֥ים יְ֝הוֹדֻ֗ךָ לְעֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 45:18
Psalm 46:1God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
Psalm 46:16  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ לִבְנֵי־קֹ֑רַח עַֽל־עֲלָמ֥וֹת שִֽׁיר׃ ‬
Psalm 46:1
Psalm 46:2Therefore we won't be afraid, though the earth changes, though the mountains are shaken into the heart of the seas;
Psalm 46:26  אֱלֹהִ֣ים לָ֭נוּ מַחֲסֶ֣ה וָעֹ֑ז עֶזְרָ֥ה בְ֝צָר֗וֹת נִמְצָ֥א מְאֹֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 46:2
Psalm 46:3though its waters roar and are troubled, though the mountains tremble with their swelling. Selah.
Psalm 46:36  עַל־כֵּ֣ן לֹא־נִ֭ירָא בְּהָמִ֣יר אָ֑רֶץ וּבְמ֥וֹט הָ֝רִ֗ים בְּלֵ֣ב יַמִּֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 46:3
Psalm 46:4There is a river, the streams of which make the city of God glad, the holy place of the tents of the Most High.
Psalm 46:46  יֶהֱמ֣וּ יֶחְמְר֣וּ מֵימָ֑יו יִֽרְעֲשֽׁוּ־הָרִ֖ים בְּגַאֲוָת֣וֹ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 46:4
Psalm 46:5God is in her midst. She shall not be moved. God will help her at dawn.
Psalm 46:56  נָהָ֗ר פְּלָגָ֗יו יְשַׂמְּח֥וּ עִיר־אֱלֹהִ֑ים קְ֝דֹ֗שׁ מִשְׁכְּנֵ֥י עֶלְיֽוֹן׃ ‬
Psalm 46:5
Psalm 46:6The nations raged. The kingdoms were moved. He lifted his voice, and the earth melted.
Psalm 46:66  אֱלֹהִ֣ים בְּ֭קִרְבָּהּ בַּל־תִּמּ֑וֹט יַעְזְרֶ֥הָ אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לִפְנ֥וֹת בֹּֽקֶר׃ ‬
Psalm 46:6
Psalm 46:7Yahweh of Armies is with us. The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
Psalm 46:76  הָמ֣וּ ג֭וֹיִם מָ֣טוּ מַמְלָכ֑וֹת נָתַ֥ן בְּ֝קוֹל֗וֹ תָּמ֥וּג אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 46:7
Psalm 46:8Come, see Yahweh's works, what desolations he has made in the earth.
Psalm 46:86  יְהוָ֣ה צְבָא֣וֹת עִמָּ֑נוּ מִשְׂגָּֽב־לָ֝נוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 46:8
Psalm 46:9He makes wars cease to the end of the earth. He breaks the bow, and shatters the spear. He burns the chariots in the fire.
Psalm 46:96  לְֽכוּ־חֲ֭זוּ מִפְעֲל֣וֹת יְהוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֖ם שַׁמּ֣וֹת בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 46:9
Psalm 46:10|Be still, and know that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations. I will be exalted in the earth.|
Psalm 46:106  מַשְׁבִּ֥ית מִלְחָמוֹת֮ עַד־קְצֵ֢ה הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ קֶ֣שֶׁת יְ֭שַׁבֵּר וְקִצֵּ֣ץ חֲנִ֑ית עֲ֝גָל֗וֹת יִשְׂרֹ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 46:10
Psalm 46:11Yahweh of Armies is with us. The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah. For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by the sons of Korah.
Psalm 46:116  הַרְפּ֣וּ וּ֭דְעוּ כִּי־אָנֹכִ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים אָר֥וּם בַּ֝גּוֹיִ֗ם אָר֥וּם בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 46:11
Psalm 46:12(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 46:126  יְהוָ֣ה צְבָא֣וֹת עִמָּ֑נוּ מִשְׂגָּֽב־לָ֝נוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 46:12
Psalm 47:1Oh clap your hands, all you nations. Shout to God with the voice of triumph!
Psalm 47:17  לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ ׀ לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃ ‬
Psalm 47:1
Psalm 47:2For Yahweh Most High is awesome. He is a great King over all the earth.
Psalm 47:27  כָּֽל־הָ֭עַמִּים תִּקְעוּ־כָ֑ף הָרִ֥יעוּ לֵ֝אלֹהִ֗ים בְּק֣וֹל רִנָּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 47:2
Psalm 47:3He subdues nations under us, and peoples under our feet.
Psalm 47:37  כִּֽי־יְהוָ֣ה עֶלְי֣וֹן נוֹרָ֑א מֶ֥לֶךְ גָּ֝דוֹל עַל־כָּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 47:3
Psalm 47:4He chooses our inheritance for us, the glory of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
Psalm 47:47  יַדְבֵּ֣ר עַמִּ֣ים תַּחְתֵּ֑ינוּ וּ֝לְאֻמִּ֗ים תַּ֣חַת רַגְלֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 47:4
Psalm 47:5God has gone up with a shout, Yahweh with the sound of a trumpet.
Psalm 47:57  יִבְחַר־לָ֥נוּ אֶת־נַחֲלָתֵ֑נוּ אֶ֥ת גְּא֨וֹן יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֲשֶׁר־אָהֵ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 47:5
Psalm 47:6Sing praise to God, sing praises. Sing praises to our King, sing praises.
Psalm 47:67  עָלָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים בִּתְרוּעָ֑ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בְּק֣וֹל שׁוֹפָֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 47:6
Psalm 47:7For God is the King of all the earth. Sing praises with understanding.
Psalm 47:77  זַמְּר֣וּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים זַמֵּ֑רוּ זַמְּר֖וּ לְמַלְכֵּ֣נוּ זַמֵּֽרוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 47:7
Psalm 47:8God reigns over the nations. God sits on his holy throne.
Psalm 47:87  כִּ֤י מֶ֖לֶךְ כָּל־הָאָ֥רֶץ אֱלֹהִ֗ים זַמְּר֥וּ מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃ ‬
Psalm 47:8
Psalm 47:9The princes of the peoples are gathered together, the people of the God of Abraham. For the shields of the earth belong to God. He is greatly exalted! A Song. A Psalm by the sons of Korah.
Psalm 47:97  מָלַ֣ךְ אֱ֭לֹהִים עַל־גּוֹיִ֑ם אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים יָשַׁ֤ב ׀ עַל־כִּסֵּ֬א קָדְשֽׁוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 47:9
Psalm 47:10(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 47:107  נְדִ֘יבֵ֤י עַמִּ֨ים ׀ נֶאֱסָ֗פוּ עַם֮ אֱלֹהֵ֢י אַבְרָ֫הָ֥ם כִּ֣י לֵֽ֭אלֹהִים מָֽגִנֵּי־אֶ֗רֶץ מְאֹ֣ד נַעֲלָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 47:10
Psalm 48:1Great is Yahweh, and greatly to be praised, in the city of our God, in his holy mountain.
Psalm 48:18  שִׁ֥יר מִ֝זְמוֹר לִבְנֵי־קֹֽרַח׃ ‬
Psalm 48:1
Psalm 48:2Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth, is Mount Zion, on the north sides, the city of the great King.
Psalm 48:28  גָּ֘ד֤וֹל יְהוָ֣ה וּמְהֻלָּ֣ל מְאֹ֑ד בְּעִ֥יר אֱ֝לֹהֵ֗ינוּ הַר־קָדְשֽׁוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 48:2
Psalm 48:3God has shown himself in her citadels as a refuge.
Psalm 48:38  יְפֵ֥ה נוֹף֮ מְשׂ֢וֹשׂ כָּל־הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ הַר־צִ֭יּוֹן יַרְכְּתֵ֣י צָפ֑וֹן קִ֝רְיַ֗ת מֶ֣לֶךְ רָֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 48:3
Psalm 48:4For, behold, the kings assembled themselves, they passed by together.
Psalm 48:48  אֱלֹהִ֥ים בְּאַרְמְנוֹתֶ֗יהָ נוֹדַ֥ע לְמִשְׂגָּֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 48:4
Psalm 48:5They saw it, then they were amazed. They were dismayed. They hurried away.
Psalm 48:58  כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה הַ֭מְּלָכִים נֽוֹעֲד֑וּ עָבְר֥וּ יַחְדָּֽו׃ ‬
Psalm 48:5
Psalm 48:6Trembling took hold of them there, pain, as of a woman in travail.
Psalm 48:68  הֵ֣מָּה רָ֭אוּ כֵּ֣ן תָּמָ֑הוּ נִבְהֲל֥וּ נֶחְפָּֽזוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 48:6
Psalm 48:7With the east wind, you break the ships of Tarshish.
Psalm 48:78  רְ֭עָדָה אֲחָזָ֣תַם שָׁ֑ם חִ֝֗יל כַּיּוֹלֵֽדָה׃ ‬
Psalm 48:7
Psalm 48:8As we have heard, so we have seen, in the city of Yahweh of Armies, in the city of our God. God will establish it forever. Selah.
Psalm 48:88  בְּר֥וּחַ קָדִ֑ים תְּ֝שַׁבֵּ֗ר אֳנִיּ֥וֹת תַּרְשִֽׁישׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 48:8
Psalm 48:9We have thought about your loving kindness, God, in the midst of your temple.
Psalm 48:98  כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר שָׁמַ֨עְנוּ ׀ כֵּ֤ן רָאִ֗ינוּ בְּעִיר־יְהוָ֣ה צְ֭בָאוֹת בְּעִ֣יר אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ אֱלֹ֘הִ֤ים יְכוֹנְנֶ֖הָ עַד־עוֹלָ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 48:9
Psalm 48:10As is your name, God, so is your praise to the ends of the earth. Your right hand is full of righteousness.
Psalm 48:108  דִּמִּ֣ינוּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ בְּ֝קֶ֗רֶב הֵיכָלֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 48:10
Psalm 48:11Let Mount Zion be glad! Let the daughters of Judah rejoice, Because of your judgments.
Psalm 48:118  כְּשִׁמְךָ֤ אֱלֹהִ֗ים כֵּ֣ן תְּ֭הִלָּתְךָ עַל־קַצְוֵי־אֶ֑רֶץ צֶ֝֗דֶק מָלְאָ֥ה יְמִינֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 48:11
Psalm 48:12Walk about Zion, and go around her. Number its towers.
Psalm 48:128  יִשְׂמַ֤ח ׀ הַר־צִיּ֗וֹן תָּ֭גֵלְנָה בְּנ֣וֹת יְהוּדָ֑ה לְ֝מַ֗עַן מִשְׁפָּטֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 48:12
Psalm 48:13Mark well her bulwarks. Consider her palaces, that you may tell it to the next generation.
Psalm 48:138  סֹ֣בּוּ צִ֭יּוֹן וְהַקִּיפ֑וּהָ סִ֝פְר֗וּ מִגְדָּלֶֽיהָ׃ ‬
Psalm 48:13
Psalm 48:14For this God is our God forever and ever. He will be our guide even to death. For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by the sons of Korah.
Psalm 48:148  שִׁ֤יתוּ לִבְּכֶ֨ם ׀ לְֽחֵילָ֗ה פַּסְּג֥וּ אַרְמְנוֹתֶ֑יהָ לְמַ֥עַן תְּ֝סַפְּר֗וּ לְד֣וֹר אַחֲרֽוֹן׃ ‬
Psalm 48:14
Psalm 48:15(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 48:158  כִּ֤י זֶ֨ה ׀ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֱ֭לֹהֵינוּ עוֹלָ֣ם וָעֶ֑ד ה֖וּא יְנַהֲגֵ֣נוּ עַל־מֽוּת׃ ‬
Psalm 48:15
Psalm 49:1Hear this, all you peoples. Listen, all you inhabitants of the world,
Psalm 49:19  לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ ׀ לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃ ‬
Psalm 49:1
Psalm 49:2both low and high, rich and poor together.
Psalm 49:29  שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֭את כָּל־הָֽעַמִּ֑ים הַ֝אֲזִ֗ינוּ כָּל־יֹ֥שְׁבֵי חָֽלֶד׃ ‬
Psalm 49:2
Psalm 49:3My mouth will speak words of wisdom. My heart shall utter understanding.
Psalm 49:39  גַּם־בְּנֵ֣י אָ֭דָם גַּם־בְּנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ יַ֝֗חַד עָשִׁ֥יר וְאֶבְיֽוֹן׃ ‬
Psalm 49:3
Psalm 49:4I will incline my ear to a proverb. I will open my riddle on the harp.
Psalm 49:49  פִּ֭י יְדַבֵּ֣ר חָכְמ֑וֹת וְהָג֖וּת לִבִּ֣י תְבוּנֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 49:4
Psalm 49:5Why should I fear in the days of evil, when iniquity at my heels surrounds me?
Psalm 49:59  אַטֶּ֣ה לְמָשָׁ֣ל אָזְנִ֑י אֶפְתַּ֥ח בְּ֝כִנּ֗וֹר חִידָתֽ͏ִי׃ ‬
Psalm 49:5
Psalm 49:6Those who trust in their wealth, and boast in the multitude of their riches—
Psalm 49:69  לָ֣מָּה אִ֭ירָא בִּ֣ימֵי רָ֑ע עֲוֺ֖ן עֲקֵבַ֣י יְסוּבֵּֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 49:6
Psalm 49:7none of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give God a ransom for him.
Psalm 49:79  הַבֹּטְחִ֥ים עַל־חֵילָ֑ם וּבְרֹ֥ב עָ֝שְׁרָ֗ם יִתְהַלָּֽלוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 49:7
Psalm 49:8For the redemption of their life is costly, no payment is ever enough,
Psalm 49:89  אָ֗ח לֹא־פָדֹ֣ה יִפְדֶּ֣ה אִ֑ישׁ לֹא־יִתֵּ֖ן לֵאלֹהִ֣ים כָּפְרֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 49:8
Psalm 49:9That he should live on forever, that he should not see corruption.
Psalm 49:99  וְ֭יֵקַר פִּדְי֥וֹן נַפְשָׁ֗ם וְחָדַ֥ל לְעוֹלָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 49:9
Psalm 49:10For he sees that wise men die; likewise the fool and the senseless perish, and leave their wealth to others.
Psalm 49:109  וִֽיחִי־ע֥וֹד לָנֶ֑צַח לֹ֖א יִרְאֶ֣ה הַשָּֽׁחַת׃ ‬
Psalm 49:10
Psalm 49:11Their inward thought is that their houses will endure forever, and their dwelling places to all generations. They name their lands after themselves.
Psalm 49:119  כִּ֤י יִרְאֶ֨ה ׀ חֲכָ֘מִ֤ים יָמ֗וּתוּ יַ֤חַד כְּסִ֣יל וָבַ֣עַר יֹאבֵ֑דוּ וְעָזְב֖וּ לַאֲחֵרִ֣ים חֵילָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 49:11
Psalm 49:12But man, despite his riches, doesn't endure. He is like the animals that perish.
Psalm 49:129  קִרְבָּ֤ם בָּתֵּ֨ימוֹ ׀ לְֽעוֹלָ֗ם מִ֭שְׁכְּנֹתָם לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹ֑ר קָֽרְא֥וּ בִ֝שְׁמוֹתָ֗ם עֲלֵ֣י אֲדָמֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 49:12
Psalm 49:13This is the destiny of those who are foolish, and of those who approve their sayings. Selah.
Psalm 49:139  וְאָדָ֣ם בִּ֭יקָר בַּל־יָלִ֑ין נִמְשַׁ֖ל כַּבְּהֵמ֣וֹת נִדְמֽוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 49:13
Psalm 49:14They are appointed as a flock for Sheol. Death shall be their shepherd. The upright shall have dominion over them in the morning. Their beauty shall decay in Sheol, far from their mansion.
Psalm 49:149  זֶ֣ה דַ֭רְכָּם כֵּ֣סֶל לָ֑מוֹ וְאַחֲרֵיהֶ֓ם ׀ בְּפִיהֶ֖ם יִרְצ֣וּ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 49:14
Psalm 49:15But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol, for he will receive me. Selah.
Psalm 49:159  כַּצֹּ֤אן ׀ לִֽשְׁא֣וֹל שַׁתּוּ֮ מָ֤וֶת יִ֫רְעֵ֥ם וַיִּרְדּ֘וּ בָ֤ם יְשָׁרִ֨ים ׀ לַבֹּ֗קֶר *וצירם **וְ֭צוּרָם לְבַלּ֥וֹת שְׁא֗וֹל מִזְּבֻ֥ל לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 49:15
Psalm 49:16Don't be afraid when a man is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased.
Psalm 49:169  אַךְ־אֱלֹהִ֗ים יִפְדֶּ֣ה נַ֭פְשִׁי מִֽיַּד־שְׁא֑וֹל כִּ֖י יִקָּחֵ֣נִי סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 49:16
Psalm 49:17For when he dies he shall carry nothing away. His glory shall not descend after him.
Psalm 49:179  אַל־תִּ֭ירָא כִּֽי־יַעֲשִׁ֣ר אִ֑ישׁ כִּֽי־יִ֝רְבֶּה כְּב֣וֹד בֵּיתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 49:17
Psalm 49:18Though while he lived he blessed his soul— and men praise you when you do well for yourself—
Psalm 49:189  כִּ֤י לֹ֣א בְ֭מוֹתוֹ יִקַּ֣ח הַכֹּ֑ל לֹא־יֵרֵ֖ד אַחֲרָ֣יו כְּבוֹדֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 49:18
Psalm 49:19he shall go to the generation of his fathers. They shall never see the light.
Psalm 49:199  כִּֽי־נַ֭פְשׁוֹ בְּחַיָּ֣יו יְבָרֵ֑ךְ וְ֝יוֹדֻ֗ךָ כִּי־תֵיטִ֥יב לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 49:19
Psalm 49:20A man who has riches without understanding, is like the animals that perish. A Psalm by Asaph.
Psalm 49:209  תָּ֭בוֹא עַד־דּ֣וֹר אֲבוֹתָ֑יו עַד־נֵ֝֗צַח לֹ֣א יִרְאוּ־אֽוֹר׃ ‬
Psalm 49:20
Psalm 49:21(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 49:219  אָדָ֣ם בִּ֭יקָר וְלֹ֣א יָבִ֑ין נִמְשַׁ֖ל כַּבְּהֵמ֣וֹת נִדְמֽוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 49:21
Psalm 50:1The Mighty One, God, Yahweh, speaks, and calls the earth from sunrise to sunset.
Psalm 50:10  מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אֵ֤ל ׀ אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֡ים יְֽהוָ֗ה דִּבֶּ֥ר וַיִּקְרָא־אָ֑רֶץ מִמִּזְרַח־שֶׁ֝֗מֶשׁ עַד־מְבֹאֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 50:1
Psalm 50:2Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shines forth.
Psalm 50:20  מִצִּיּ֥וֹן מִכְלַל־יֹ֗פִי אֱלֹהִ֥ים הוֹפִֽיעַ׃ ‬
Psalm 50:2
Psalm 50:3Our God comes, and does not keep silent. A fire devours before him. It is very stormy around him.
Psalm 50:30  יָ֤בֹ֥א אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וְֽאַל־יֶ֫חֱרַ֥שׁ אֵשׁ־לְפָנָ֥יו תֹּאכֵ֑ל וּ֝סְבִיבָ֗יו נִשְׂעֲרָ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 50:3
Psalm 50:4He calls to the heavens above, to the earth, that he may judge his people:
Psalm 50:40  יִקְרָ֣א אֶל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם מֵעָ֑ל וְאֶל־הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ לָדִ֥ין עַמּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 50:4
Psalm 50:5|Gather my saints together to me, those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.|
Psalm 50:50  אִסְפוּ־לִ֥י חֲסִידָ֑י כֹּרְתֵ֖י בְרִיתִ֣י עֲלֵי־זָֽבַח׃ ‬
Psalm 50:5
Psalm 50:6The heavens shall declare his righteousness, for God himself is judge. Selah.
Psalm 50:60  וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ שָׁמַ֣יִם צִדְק֑וֹ כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֓ים ׀ שֹׁפֵ֖ט ה֣וּא סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 50:6
Psalm 50:7|Hear, my people, and I will speak; Israel, and I will testify against you. I am God, your God.
Psalm 50:70  שִׁמְעָ֤ה עַמִּ֨י ׀ וַאֲדַבֵּ֗רָה יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל וְאָעִ֣ידָה בָּ֑ךְ אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֱלֹהֶ֣יךָ אָנֹֽכִי׃ ‬
Psalm 50:7
Psalm 50:8I don't rebuke you for your sacrifices. Your burnt offerings are continually before me.
Psalm 50:80  לֹ֣א עַל־זְ֭בָחֶיךָ אוֹכִיחֶ֑ךָ וְעוֹלֹתֶ֖יךָ לְנֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִֽיד׃ ‬
Psalm 50:8
Psalm 50:9I have no need for a bull from your stall, nor male goats from your pens.
Psalm 50:90  לֹא־אֶקַּ֣ח מִבֵּיתְךָ֣ פָ֑ר מִ֝מִּכְלְאֹתֶ֗יךָ עַתּוּדִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 50:9
Psalm 50:10For every animal of the forest is mine, and the livestock on a thousand hills.
Psalm 50:100  כִּי־לִ֥י כָל־חַיְתוֹ־יָ֑עַר בְּ֝הֵמ֗וֹת בְּהַרְרֵי־אָֽלֶף׃ ‬
Psalm 50:10
Psalm 50:11I know all the birds of the mountains. The wild animals of the field are mine.
Psalm 50:110  יָ֭דַעְתִּי כָּל־ע֣וֹף הָרִ֑ים וְזִ֥יז שָׂ֝דַ֗י עִמָּדִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 50:11
Psalm 50:12If I were hungry, I would not tell you, for the world is mine, and all that is in it.
Psalm 50:120  אִם־אֶ֭רְעַב לֹא־אֹ֣מַר לָ֑ךְ כִּי־לִ֥י תֵ֝בֵ֗ל וּמְלֹאָֽהּ׃ ‬
Psalm 50:12
Psalm 50:13Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
Psalm 50:130  הַֽ֭אוֹכַל בְּשַׂ֣ר אַבִּירִ֑ים וְדַ֖ם עַתּוּדִ֣ים אֶשְׁתֶּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 50:13
Psalm 50:14Offer to God the sacrifice of thanksgiving. Pay your vows to the Most High.
Psalm 50:140  זְבַ֣ח לֵאלֹהִ֣ים תּוֹדָ֑ה וְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לְעֶלְי֣וֹן נְדָרֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 50:14
Psalm 50:15Call on me in the day of trouble. I will deliver you, and you will honor me.|
Psalm 50:150  וּ֭קְרָאֵנִי בְּי֣וֹם צָרָ֑ה אֲ֝חַלֶּצְךָ֗ וּֽתְכַבְּדֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 50:15
Psalm 50:16But to the wicked God says, |What right do you have to declare my statutes, that you have taken my covenant on your lips,
Psalm 50:160  וְלָ֤רָשָׁ֨ע ׀ אָ֘מַ֤ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים מַה־לְּ֭ךָ לְסַפֵּ֣ר חֻקָּ֑י וַתִּשָּׂ֖א בְרִיתִ֣י עֲלֵי־פִֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 50:16
Psalm 50:17since you hate instruction, and throw my words behind you?
Psalm 50:170  וְ֭אַתָּה שָׂנֵ֣אתָ מוּסָ֑ר וַתַּשְׁלֵ֖ךְ דְּבָרַ֣י אַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 50:17
Psalm 50:18When you saw a thief, you consented with him, and have participated with adulterers.
Psalm 50:180  אִם־רָאִ֣יתָ גַ֭נָּב וַתִּ֣רֶץ עִמּ֑וֹ וְעִ֖ם מְנָאֲפִ֣ים חֶלְקֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 50:18
Psalm 50:19|You give your mouth to evil. Your tongue frames deceit.
Psalm 50:190  פִּ֭יךָ שָׁלַ֣חְתָּ בְרָעָ֑ה וּ֝לְשׁוֹנְךָ֗ תַּצְמִ֥יד מִרְמָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 50:19
Psalm 50:20You sit and speak against your brother. You slander your own mother's son.
Psalm 50:200  תֵּ֭שֵׁב בְּאָחִ֣יךָ תְדַבֵּ֑ר בְּבֶֽן־אִ֝מְּךָ֗ תִּתֶּן־דֹּֽפִי׃ ‬
Psalm 50:20
Psalm 50:21You have done these things, and I kept silent. You thought that I was just like you. I will rebuke you, and accuse you in front of your eyes.
Psalm 50:210  אֵ֤לֶּה עָשִׂ֨יתָ ׀ וְֽהֶחֱרַ֗שְׁתִּי דִּמִּ֗יתָ הֱֽיוֹת־אֶֽהְיֶ֥ה כָמ֑וֹךָ אוֹכִיחֲךָ֖ וְאֶֽעֶרְכָ֣ה לְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 50:21
Psalm 50:22|Now consider this, you who forget God, lest I tear you into pieces, and there be none to deliver.
Psalm 50:220  בִּֽינוּ־נָ֣א זֹ֭את שֹׁכְחֵ֣י אֱל֑וֹהַּ פֶּן־אֶ֝טְרֹ֗ף וְאֵ֣ין מַצִּֽיל׃ ‬
Psalm 50:22
Psalm 50:23Whoever offers the sacrifice of thanksgiving glorifies me, and prepares his way so that I will show God's salvation to him.| For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David, when Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba.
Psalm 50:230  זֹבֵ֥חַ תּוֹדָ֗ה יְֽכַ֫בְּדָ֥נְנִי וְשָׂ֥ם דֶּ֑רֶךְ אַ֝רְאֶ֗נּוּ בְּיֵ֣שַׁע אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 50:23
Psalm 51:1Have mercy on me, God, according to your loving kindness. According to the multitude of your tender mercies, blot out my transgressions.
Psalm 51:11  לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 51:1
Psalm 51:2Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity. Cleanse me from my sin.
Psalm 51:21  בְּֽבוֹא־אֵ֭לָיו נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֑יא כַּֽאֲשֶׁר־בָּ֝֗א אֶל־בַּת־שָֽׁבַע׃ ‬
Psalm 51:2
Psalm 51:3For I know my transgressions. My sin is constantly before me.
Psalm 51:31  חָנֵּ֣נִי אֱלֹהִ֣ים כְּחַסְדֶּ֑ךָ כְּרֹ֥ב רַ֝חֲמֶ֗יךָ מְחֵ֣ה פְשָׁעָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 51:3
Psalm 51:4Against you, and you only, have I sinned, and done that which is evil in your sight; that you may be proved right when you speak, and justified when you judge.
Psalm 51:41  *הרבה **הֶ֭רֶב כַּבְּסֵ֣נִי מֵעֲוֺנִ֑י וּֽמֵחַטָּאתִ֥י טַהֲרֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 51:4
Psalm 51:5Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity. In sin my mother conceived me.
Psalm 51:51  כִּֽי־פְ֭שָׁעַי אֲנִ֣י אֵדָ֑ע וְחַטָּאתִ֖י נֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִֽיד׃ ‬
Psalm 51:5
Psalm 51:6Behold, you desire truth in the inward parts. You teach me wisdom in the inmost place.
Psalm 51:61  לְךָ֤ לְבַדְּךָ֨ ׀ חָטָאתִי֮ וְהָרַ֥ע בְּעֵינֶ֗יךָ עָ֫שִׂ֥יתִי לְ֭מַעַן תִּצְדַּ֥ק בְּדָבְרֶ֗ךָ תִּזְכֶּ֥ה בְשָׁפְטֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 51:6
Psalm 51:7Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
Psalm 51:71  הֵן־בְּעָו֥וֹן חוֹלָ֑לְתִּי וּ֝בְחֵ֗טְא יֶֽחֱמַ֥תְנִי אִמִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 51:7
Psalm 51:8Let me hear joy and gladness, That the bones which you have broken may rejoice.
Psalm 51:81  הֵן־אֱ֭מֶת חָפַ֣צְתָּ בַטֻּח֑וֹת וּ֝בְסָתֻ֗ם חָכְמָ֥ה תוֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 51:8
Psalm 51:9Hide your face from my sins, and blot out all of my iniquities.
Psalm 51:91  תְּחַטְּאֵ֣נִי בְאֵז֣וֹב וְאֶטְהָ֑ר תְּ֝כַבְּסֵ֗נִי וּמִשֶּׁ֥לֶג אַלְבִּֽין׃ ‬
Psalm 51:9
Psalm 51:10Create in me a clean heart, O God. Renew a right spirit within me.
Psalm 51:101  תַּ֭שְׁמִיעֵנִי שָׂשׂ֣וֹן וְשִׂמְחָ֑ה תָּ֝גֵ֗לְנָה עֲצָמ֥וֹת דִּכִּֽיתָ׃ ‬
Psalm 51:10
Psalm 51:11Don't throw me from your presence, and don't take your holy Spirit from me.
Psalm 51:111  הַסְתֵּ֣ר פָּ֭נֶיךָ מֵחֲטָאָ֑י וְֽכָל־עֲוֺ֖נֹתַ֣י מְחֵֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 51:11
Psalm 51:12Restore to me the joy of your salvation. Uphold me with a willing spirit.
Psalm 51:121  לֵ֣ב טָ֭הוֹר בְּרָא־לִ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְר֥וּחַ נָ֝כ֗וֹן חַדֵּ֥שׁ בְּקִרְבִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 51:12
Psalm 51:13Then I will teach transgressors your ways. Sinners shall be converted to you.
Psalm 51:131  אַל־תַּשְׁלִיכֵ֥נִי מִלְּפָנֶ֑יךָ וְר֥וּחַ קָ֝דְשְׁךָ֗ אַל־תִּקַּ֥ח מִמֶּֽנִּי׃ ‬
Psalm 51:13
Psalm 51:14Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation. My tongue shall sing aloud of your righteousness.
Psalm 51:141  הָשִׁ֣יבָה לִּ֭י שְׂשׂ֣וֹן יִשְׁעֶ֑ךָ וְר֖וּחַ נְדִיבָ֣ה תִסְמְכֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 51:14
Psalm 51:15Lord, open my lips. My mouth shall declare your praise.
Psalm 51:151  אֲלַמְּדָ֣ה פֹשְׁעִ֣ים דְּרָכֶ֑יךָ וְ֝חַטָּאִ֗ים אֵלֶ֥יךָ יָשֽׁוּבוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 51:15
Psalm 51:16For you don't delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it. You have no pleasure in burnt offering.
Psalm 51:161  הַצִּ֘ילֵ֤נִי מִדָּמִ֨ים ׀ אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים אֱלֹהֵ֥י תְּשׁוּעָתִ֑י תְּרַנֵּ֥ן לְ֝שׁוֹנִ֗י צִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 51:16
Psalm 51:17The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit. A broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise.
Psalm 51:171  אֲ֭דֹנָי שְׂפָתַ֣י תִּפְתָּ֑ח וּ֝פִ֗י יַגִּ֥יד תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 51:17
Psalm 51:18Do well in your good pleasure to Zion. Build the walls of Jerusalem.
Psalm 51:181  כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־תַחְפֹּ֣ץ זֶ֣בַח וְאֶתֵּ֑נָה ע֝וֹלָ֗ה לֹ֣א תִרְצֶֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 51:18
Psalm 51:19Then you will delight in the sacrifices of righteousness, in burnt offerings and in whole burnt offerings. Then they will offer bulls on your altar. For the Chief Musician. A contemplation by David, when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul, |David has come to Abimelech's house.|
Psalm 51:191  זִֽבְחֵ֣י אֱלֹהִים֮ ר֢וּחַ נִשְׁבָּ֫רָ֥ה לֵב־נִשְׁבָּ֥ר וְנִדְכֶּ֑ה אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לֹ֣א תִבְזֶֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 51:19
Psalm 51:20(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 51:201  הֵיטִ֣יבָה בִ֭רְצוֹנְךָ אֶת־צִיּ֑וֹן תִּ֝בְנֶ֗ה חוֹמ֥וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ ‬
Psalm 51:20
Psalm 51:21(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 51:211  אָ֤ז תַּחְפֹּ֣ץ זִבְחֵי־צֶ֭דֶק עוֹלָ֣ה וְכָלִ֑יל אָ֤ז יַעֲל֖וּ עַל־מִזְבַּחֲךָ֣ פָרִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 51:21
Psalm 52:1Why do you boast of mischief, mighty man? God's loving kindness endures continually.
Psalm 52:12  לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 52:1
Psalm 52:2Your tongue plots destruction, like a sharp razor, working deceitfully.
Psalm 52:22  בְּב֤וֹא ׀ דּוֹאֵ֣ג הָאֲדֹמִי֮ וַיַּגֵּ֢ד לְשָׁ֫א֥וּל וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֑וֹ בָּ֥א דָ֝וִ֗ד אֶל־בֵּ֥ית אֲחִימֶֽלֶךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 52:2
Psalm 52:3You love evil more than good, lying rather than speaking the truth. Selah.
Psalm 52:32  מַה־תִּתְהַלֵּ֣ל בְּ֭רָעָה הַגִּבּ֑וֹר חֶ֥סֶד אֵ֝֗ל כָּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃ ‬
Psalm 52:3
Psalm 52:4You love all devouring words, you deceitful tongue.
Psalm 52:42  הַ֭וּוֹת תַּחְשֹׁ֣ב לְשׁוֹנֶ֑ךָ כְּתַ֥עַר מְ֝לֻטָּ֗שׁ עֹשֵׂ֥ה רְמִיָּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 52:4
Psalm 52:5God will likewise destroy you forever. He will take you up, and pluck you out of your tent, and root you out of the land of the living. Selah.
Psalm 52:52  אָהַ֣בְתָּ רָּ֣ע מִטּ֑וֹב שֶׁ֓קֶר ׀ מִדַּבֵּ֖ר צֶ֣דֶק סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 52:5
Psalm 52:6The righteous also will see it, and fear, and laugh at him, saying,
Psalm 52:62  אָהַ֥בְתָּ כָֽל־דִּבְרֵי־בָ֗לַע לְשׁ֣וֹן מִרְמָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 52:6
Psalm 52:7|Behold, this is the man who didn't make God his strength, but trusted in the abundance of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.|
Psalm 52:72  גַּם־אֵל֮ יִתָּצְךָ֢ לָ֫נֶ֥צַח יַחְתְּךָ֣ וְיִסָּחֲךָ֣ מֵאֹ֑הֶל וְשֵֽׁרֶשְׁךָ֨ מֵאֶ֖רֶץ חַיִּ֣ים סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 52:7
Psalm 52:8But as for me, I am like a green olive tree in God's house. I trust in God's loving kindness forever and ever.
Psalm 52:82  וְיִרְא֖וּ צַדִּיקִ֥ים וְיִירָ֗אוּ וְעָלָ֥יו יִשְׂחָֽקוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 52:8
Psalm 52:9I will give you thanks forever, because you have done it. I will hope in your name, for it is good, in the presence of your saints. For the Chief Musician. To the tune of |Mahalath.| A contemplation by David.
Psalm 52:92  הִנֵּ֤ה הַגֶּ֗בֶר לֹ֤א יָשִׂ֥ים אֱלֹהִ֗ים מָֽע֫וּזּ֥וֹ וַ֭יִּבְטַח בְּרֹ֣ב עָשְׁר֑וֹ יָ֝עֹ֗ז בְּהַוָּתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 52:9
Psalm 52:10(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 52:102  וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ כְּזַ֣יִת רַ֭עֲנָן בְּבֵ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים בָּטַ֥חְתִּי בְחֶֽסֶד־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים עוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 52:10
Psalm 52:11(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 52:112  אוֹדְךָ֣ לְ֭עוֹלָם כִּ֣י עָשִׂ֑יתָ וַאֲקַוֶּ֖ה שִׁמְךָ֥ כִֽי־ט֝֗וֹב נֶ֣גֶד חֲסִידֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 52:11
Psalm 53:1The fool has said in his heart, |There is no God.| They are corrupt, and have done abominable iniquity. There is no one who does good.
Psalm 53:13  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־מָחֲלַ֗ת מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 53:1
Psalm 53:2God looks down from heaven on the children of men, to see if there are any who understood, who seek after God.
Psalm 53:23  אָ֘מַ֤ר נָבָ֣ל בְּ֭לִבּוֹ אֵ֣ין אֱלֹהִ֑ים הִֽ֝שְׁחִ֗יתוּ וְהִֽתְעִ֥יבוּ עָ֝֗וֶל אֵ֣ין עֹֽשֵׂה־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Psalm 53:2
Psalm 53:3Every one of them has gone back. They have become filthy together. There is no one who does good, no, not one.
Psalm 53:33  אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים מִשָּׁמַיִם֮ הִשְׁקִ֢יף עַֽל־בְּנֵ֫י אָדָ֥ם לִ֭רְאוֹת הֲיֵ֣שׁ מַשְׂכִּ֑יל דֹּ֝רֵ֗שׁ אֶת־אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 53:3
Psalm 53:4Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat up my people as they eat bread, and don't call on God?
Psalm 53:43  כֻּלּ֥וֹ סָג֮ יַחְדָּ֢ו נֶ֫אֱלָ֥חוּ אֵ֤ין עֹֽשֵׂה־ט֑וֹב אֵ֝֗ין גַּם־אֶחָֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 53:4
Psalm 53:5There they were in great fear, where no fear was, for God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you. You have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.
Psalm 53:53  הֲלֹ֥א יָדְעוּ֮ פֹּ֤עֲלֵ֫י אָ֥וֶן אֹכְלֵ֣י עַ֭מִּי אָ֣כְלוּ לֶ֑חֶם אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לֹ֣א קָרָֽאוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 53:5
Psalm 53:6Oh that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When God brings back his people from captivity, then Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad. For the Chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A contemplation by David, when the Ziphites came and said to Saul, |Isn't David hiding himself among us?|
Psalm 53:63  שָׁ֤ם ׀ פָּֽחֲדוּ־פַחַד֮ לֹא־הָ֢יָה֫ פָ֥חַד כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֗ים פִּ֭זַּר עַצְמ֣וֹת חֹנָ֑ךְ הֱ֝בִשֹׁ֗תָה כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים מְאָסָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 53:6
Psalm 53:7(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 53:73  מִ֥י יִתֵּ֣ן מִצִּיּוֹן֮ יְשֻׁע֢וֹת יִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל בְּשׁ֣וּב אֱ֭לֹהִים שְׁב֣וּת עַמּ֑וֹ יָגֵ֥ל יַ֝עֲקֹ֗ב יִשְׂמַ֥ח יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 53:7
Psalm 54:1Save me, God, by your name. Vindicate me in your might.
Psalm 54:14  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֗ת מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 54:1
Psalm 54:2Hear my prayer, God. Listen to the words of my mouth.
Psalm 54:24  בְּב֣וֹא הַ֭זִּיפִים וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לְשָׁא֑וּל הֲלֹ֥א דָ֝וִ֗ד מִסְתַּתֵּ֥ר עִמָּֽנוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 54:2
Psalm 54:3For strangers have risen up against me. Violent men have sought after my soul. They haven't set God before them. Selah.
Psalm 54:34  אֱ֭לֹהִים בְּשִׁמְךָ֣ הוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי וּבִגְבוּרָתְךָ֥ תְדִינֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 54:3
Psalm 54:4Behold, God is my helper. The Lord is the one who sustains my soul.
Psalm 54:44  אֱ֭לֹהִים שְׁמַ֣ע תְּפִלָּתִ֑י הַ֝אֲזִ֗ינָה לְאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 54:4
Psalm 54:5He will repay the evil to my enemies. Destroy them in your truth.
Psalm 54:54  כִּ֤י זָרִ֨ים ׀ קָ֤מוּ עָלַ֗י וְֽ֭עָרִיצִים בִּקְשׁ֣וּ נַפְשִׁ֑י לֹ֤א שָׂ֨מוּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְנֶגְדָּ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 54:5
Psalm 54:6With a free will offering, I will sacrifice to you. I will give thanks to your name, Yahweh, for it is good.
Psalm 54:64  הִנֵּ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים עֹזֵ֣ר לִ֑י אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י בְּֽסֹמְכֵ֥י נַפְשִֽׁי׃ ‬
Psalm 54:6
Psalm 54:7For he has delivered me out of all trouble. My eye has seen triumph over my enemies. For the Chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A contemplation by David.
Psalm 54:74  *ישוב **יָשִׁ֣יב הָ֭רַע לְשֹׁרְרָ֑י בַּ֝אֲמִתְּךָ֗ הַצְמִיתֵֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 54:7
Psalm 54:8(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 54:84  בִּנְדָבָ֥ה אֶזְבְּחָה־לָּ֑ךְ א֤וֹדֶה שִּׁמְךָ֖ יְהוָ֣ה כִּי־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Psalm 54:8
Psalm 54:9(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 54:94  כִּ֣י מִכָּל־צָ֭רָה הִצִּילָ֑נִי וּ֝בְאֹיְבַ֗י רָאֲתָ֥ה עֵינִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 54:9
Psalm 55:1Listen to my prayer, God. Don't hide yourself from my supplication.
Psalm 55:15  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֗ת מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 55:1
Psalm 55:2Attend to me, and answer me. I am restless in my complaint, and moan,
Psalm 55:25  הַאֲזִ֣ינָה אֱ֭לֹהִים תְּפִלָּתִ֑י וְאַל־תִּ֝תְעַלַּ֗ם מִתְּחִנָּתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 55:2
Psalm 55:3Because of the voice of the enemy, Because of the oppression of the wicked. For they bring suffering on me. In anger they hold a grudge against me.
Psalm 55:35  הַקְשִׁ֣יבָה לִּ֣י וַעֲנֵ֑נִי אָרִ֖יד בְּשִׂיחִ֣י וְאָהִֽימָה׃ ‬
Psalm 55:3
Psalm 55:4My heart is severely pained within me. The terrors of death have fallen on me.
Psalm 55:45  מִקּ֤וֹל אוֹיֵ֗ב מִפְּנֵ֣י עָקַ֣ת רָשָׁ֑ע כִּי־יָמִ֥יטוּ עָלַ֥י אָ֝֗וֶן וּבְאַ֥ף יִשְׂטְמֽוּנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 55:4
Psalm 55:5Fearfulness and trembling have come on me. Horror has overwhelmed me.
Psalm 55:55  לִ֭בִּי יָחִ֣יל בְּקִרְבִּ֑י וְאֵימ֥וֹת מָ֝֗וֶת נָפְל֥וּ עָלָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 55:5
Psalm 55:6I said, |Oh that I had wings like a dove! Then I would fly away, and be at rest.
Psalm 55:65  יִרְאָ֣ה וָ֭רַעַד יָ֣בֹא בִ֑י וַ֝תְּכַסֵּ֗נִי פַּלָּצֽוּת׃ ‬
Psalm 55:6
Psalm 55:7Behold, then I would wander far off. I would lodge in the wilderness.| Selah.
Psalm 55:75  וָאֹמַ֗ר מִֽי־יִתֶּן־לִּ֣י אֵ֭בֶר כַּיּוֹנָ֗ה אָע֥וּפָה וְאֶשְׁכֹּֽנָה׃ ‬
Psalm 55:7
Psalm 55:8|I would hurry to a shelter from the stormy wind and storm.|
Psalm 55:85  הִ֭נֵּה אַרְחִ֣יק נְדֹ֑ד אָלִ֖ין בַּמִּדְבָּ֣ר סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 55:8
Psalm 55:9Confuse them, Lord, and confound their language, for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
Psalm 55:95  אָחִ֣ישָׁה מִפְלָ֣ט לִ֑י מֵר֖וּחַ סֹעָ֣ה מִסָּֽעַר׃ ‬
Psalm 55:9
Psalm 55:10Day and night they prowl around on its walls. Malice and abuse are also within her.
Psalm 55:105  בַּלַּ֣ע אֲ֭דֹנָי פַּלַּ֣ג לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם כִּֽי־רָאִ֨יתִי חָמָ֖ס וְרִ֣יב בָּעִֽיר׃ ‬
Psalm 55:10
Psalm 55:11Destructive forces are within her. Threats and lies don't depart from her streets.
Psalm 55:115  יוֹמָ֤ם וָלַ֗יְלָה יְסוֹבְבֻ֥הָ עַל־חוֹמֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאָ֖וֶן וְעָמָ֣ל בְּקִרְבָּֽהּ׃ ‬
Psalm 55:11
Psalm 55:12For it was not an enemy who insulted me, then I could have endured it. Neither was it he who hated me who raised himself up against me, then I would have hidden myself from him.
Psalm 55:125  הַוּ֥וֹת בְּקִרְבָּ֑הּ וְֽלֹא־יָמִ֥ישׁ מֵ֝רְחֹבָ֗הּ תֹּ֣ךְ וּמִרְמָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 55:12
Psalm 55:13But it was you, a man like me, my companion, and my familiar friend.
Psalm 55:135  כִּ֤י לֹֽא־אוֹיֵ֥ב יְחָֽרְפֵ֗נִי וְאֶ֫שָּׂ֥א לֹֽא־מְ֭שַׂנְאִי עָלַ֣י הִגְדִּ֑יל וְאֶסָּתֵ֥ר מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 55:13
Psalm 55:14We took sweet fellowship together. We walked in God's house with company.
Psalm 55:145  וְאַתָּ֣ה אֱנ֣וֹשׁ כְּעֶרְכִּ֑י אַ֝לּוּפִ֗י וּמְיֻדָּֽעִי׃ ‬
Psalm 55:14
Psalm 55:15Let death come suddenly on them. Let them go down alive into Sheol. For wickedness is in their dwelling, in the midst of them.
Psalm 55:155  אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַ֭חְדָּו נַמְתִּ֣יק ס֑וֹד בְּבֵ֥ית אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים נְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בְּרָֽגֶשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 55:15
Psalm 55:16As for me, I will call on God. Yahweh will save me.
Psalm 55:165  *ישימות **יַשִּׁ֤י **מָ֨וֶת ׀ עָלֵ֗ימוֹ יֵרְד֣וּ שְׁא֣וֹל חַיִּ֑ים כִּֽי־רָע֖וֹת בִּמְגוּרָ֣ם בְּקִרְבָּֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 55:16
Psalm 55:17Evening, morning, and at noon, I will cry out in distress. He will hear my voice.
Psalm 55:175  אֲ֭נִי אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֶקְרָ֑א וַ֝יהוָ֗ה יוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 55:17
Psalm 55:18He has redeemed my soul in peace from the battle that was against me, although there are many who oppose me.
Psalm 55:185  עֶ֤רֶב וָבֹ֣קֶר וְ֭צָהֳרַיִם אָשִׂ֣יחָה וְאֶהֱמֶ֑ה וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע קוֹלִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 55:18
Psalm 55:19God, who is enthroned forever, will hear, and answer them. Selah. They never change, who don't fear God.
Psalm 55:195  פָּ֘דָ֤ה בְשָׁל֣וֹם נַ֭פְשִׁי מִקֲּרָב־לִ֑י כִּֽי־בְ֝רַבִּ֗ים הָי֥וּ עִמָּדִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 55:19
Psalm 55:20He raises his hands against his friends. He has violated his covenant.
Psalm 55:205  יִשְׁמַ֤ע ׀ אֵ֨ל ׀ וְֽיַעֲנֵם֮ וְיֹ֤שֵׁ֥ב קֶ֗דֶם סֶ֥לָה אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵ֣ין חֲלִיפ֣וֹת לָ֑מוֹ וְלֹ֖א יָרְא֣וּ אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 55:20
Psalm 55:21His mouth was smooth as butter, but his heart was war. His words were softer than oil, yet they were drawn swords.
Psalm 55:215  שָׁלַ֣ח יָ֭דָיו בִּשְׁלֹמָ֗יו חִלֵּ֥ל בְּרִיתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 55:21
Psalm 55:22Cast your burden on Yahweh, and he will sustain you. He will never allow the righteous to be moved.
Psalm 55:225  חָלְק֤וּ ׀ מַחְמָאֹ֣ת פִּיו֮ וּֽקֲרָב־לִ֫בּ֥וֹ רַכּ֖וּ דְבָרָ֥יו מִשֶּׁ֗מֶן וְהֵ֣מָּה פְתִחֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 55:22
Psalm 55:23But you, God, will bring them down into the pit of destruction. Bloodthirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days, but I will trust in you. For the Chief Musician. To the tune of |Silent Dove in Distant Lands.| A poem by David, when the Philistines seized him in Gath.
Psalm 55:235  הַשְׁלֵ֤ךְ עַל־יְהוָ֨ה ׀ יְהָבְךָ֮ וְה֢וּא יְכַ֫לְכְּלֶ֥ךָ לֹא־יִתֵּ֖ן לְעוֹלָ֥ם מ֗וֹט לַצַּדִּֽיק׃ ‬
Psalm 55:23
Psalm 55:24(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 55:245  וְאַתָּ֤ה אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ תּוֹרִדֵ֬ם ׀ לִבְאֵ֬ר שַׁ֗חַת אַנְשֵׁ֤י דָמִ֣ים וּ֭מִרְמָה לֹא־יֶחֱצ֣וּ יְמֵיהֶ֑ם וַ֝אֲנִ֗י אֶבְטַח־בָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 55:24
Psalm 56:1Be merciful to me, God, for man wants to swallow me up. All day long, he attacks and oppresses me.
Psalm 56:16  לַמְנַצֵּ֤חַ ׀ עַל־י֬וֹנַת אֵ֣לֶם רְ֭חֹקִים לְדָוִ֣ד מִכְתָּ֑ם בֶּֽאֱחֹ֨ז אֹת֖וֹ פְלִשְׁתִּ֣ים בְּגַֽת׃ ‬
Psalm 56:1
Psalm 56:2My enemies want to swallow me up all day long, for they are many who fight proudly against me.
Psalm 56:26  חָנֵּ֣נִי אֱ֭לֹהִים כִּֽי־שְׁאָפַ֣נִי אֱנ֑וֹשׁ כָּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם לֹחֵ֥ם יִלְחָצֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 56:2
Psalm 56:3When I am afraid, I will put my trust in you.
Psalm 56:36  שָׁאֲפ֣וּ שׁ֭וֹרְרַי כָּל־הַיּ֑וֹם כִּֽי־רַבִּ֨ים לֹחֲמִ֖ים לִ֣י מָרֽוֹם׃ ‬
Psalm 56:3
Psalm 56:4In God, I praise his word. In God, I put my trust. I will not be afraid. What can flesh do to me?
Psalm 56:46  י֥וֹם אִירָ֑א אֲ֝נִ֗י אֵלֶ֥יךָ אֶבְטָֽח׃ ‬
Psalm 56:4
Psalm 56:5All day long they twist my words. All their thoughts are against me for evil.
Psalm 56:56  בֵּאלֹהִים֮ אֲהַלֵּ֢ל דְּבָ֫ר֥וֹ בֵּאלֹהִ֣ים בָּ֭טַחְתִּי לֹ֣א אִירָ֑א מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בָשָׂ֣ר לִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 56:5
Psalm 56:6They conspire and lurk, watching my steps, they are eager to take my life.
Psalm 56:66  כָּל־הַ֭יּוֹם דְּבָרַ֣י יְעַצֵּ֑בוּ עָלַ֖י כָּל־מַחְשְׁבֹתָ֣ם לָרָֽע׃ ‬
Psalm 56:6
Psalm 56:7Shall they escape by iniquity? In anger cast down the peoples, God.
Psalm 56:76  יָג֤וּרוּ ׀ *יצפינו **יִצְפּ֗וֹנוּ הֵ֭מָּה עֲקֵבַ֣י יִשְׁמֹ֑רוּ כַּ֝אֲשֶׁ֗ר קִוּ֥וּ נַפְשִֽׁי׃ ‬
Psalm 56:7
Psalm 56:8You number my wanderings. You put my tears into your bottle. Aren't they in your book?
Psalm 56:86  עַל־אָ֥וֶן פַּלֶּט־לָ֑מוֹ בְּ֝אַ֗ף עַמִּ֤ים ׀ הוֹרֵ֬ד אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 56:8
Psalm 56:9Then my enemies shall turn back in the day that I call. I know this, that God is for me.
Psalm 56:96  נֹדִי֮ סָפַ֢רְתָּ֫ה אָ֥תָּה שִׂ֣ימָה דִמְעָתִ֣י בְנֹאדֶ֑ךָ הֲ֝לֹ֗א בְּסִפְרָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 56:9
Psalm 56:10In God, I will praise his word. In Yahweh, I will praise his word.
Psalm 56:106  אָ֥֨ז יָ֘שׁ֤וּבוּ אוֹיְבַ֣י אָ֭חוֹר בְּי֣וֹם אֶקְרָ֑א זֶה־יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים לִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 56:10
Psalm 56:11I have put my trust in God. I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
Psalm 56:116  בֵּֽ֭אלֹהִים אֲהַלֵּ֣ל דָּבָ֑ר בַּ֝יהוָ֗ה אֲהַלֵּ֥ל דָּבָֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 56:11
Psalm 56:12Your vows are on me, God. I will give thank offerings to you.
Psalm 56:126  בֵּֽאלֹהִ֣ים בָּ֭טַחְתִּי לֹ֣א אִירָ֑א מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה אָדָ֣ם לִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 56:12
Psalm 56:13For you have delivered my soul from death, and prevented my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living. For the Chief Musician. To the tune of |Do Not Destroy.| A poem by David, when he fled from Saul, in the cave.
Psalm 56:136  עָלַ֣י אֱלֹהִ֣ים נְדָרֶ֑יךָ אֲשַׁלֵּ֖ם תּוֹדֹ֣ת לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 56:13
Psalm 56:14(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 56:146  כִּ֤י הִצַּ֪לְתָּ נַפְשִׁ֡י מִמָּוֶת֮ הֲלֹ֥א רַגְלַ֗י מִ֫דֶּ֥חִי לְ֭הִֽתְהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּ֝א֗וֹר הֽ͏ַחַיִּֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 56:14
Psalm 57:1Be merciful to me, God, be merciful to me, for my soul takes refuge in you. Yes, in the shadow of your wings, I will take refuge, until disaster has passed.
Psalm 57:17  לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ אַל־תַּ֭שְׁחֵת לְדָוִ֣ד מִכְתָּ֑ם בְּבָרְח֥וֹ מִפְּנֵי־שָׁ֝א֗וּל בַּמְּעָרֽ͏ָה׃ ‬
Psalm 57:1
Psalm 57:2I cry out to God Most High, to God who accomplishes my requests for me.
Psalm 57:27  חָנֵּ֤נִי אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ חָנֵּ֗נִי כִּ֥י בְךָ֮ חָסָ֢יָה נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י וּבְצֵֽל־כְּנָפֶ֥יךָ אֶחְסֶ֑ה עַ֝֗ד יַעֲבֹ֥ר הַוּֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 57:2
Psalm 57:3He will send from heaven, and save me, he rebukes the one who is pursuing me. Selah. God will send out his loving kindness and his truth.
Psalm 57:37  אֶ֭קְרָא לֵֽאלֹהִ֣ים עֶלְי֑וֹן לָ֝אֵ֗ל גֹּמֵ֥ר עָלָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 57:3
Psalm 57:4My soul is among lions. I lie among those who are set on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.
Psalm 57:47  יִשְׁלַ֤ח מִשָּׁמַ֨יִם ׀ וְֽיוֹשִׁיעֵ֗נִי חֵרֵ֣ף שֹׁאֲפִ֣י סֶ֑לָה יִשְׁלַ֥ח אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים חַסְדּ֥וֹ וַאֲמִתּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 57:4
Psalm 57:5Be exalted, God, above the heavens! Let your glory be above all the earth!
Psalm 57:57  נַפְשִׁ֤י ׀ בְּת֥וֹךְ לְבָאִם֮ אֶשְׁכְּבָ֢ה לֹ֫הֲטִ֥ים בְּֽנֵי־אָדָ֗ם שִׁ֭נֵּיהֶם חֲנִ֣ית וְחִצִּ֑ים וּ֝לְשׁוֹנָ֗ם חֶ֣רֶב חַדָּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 57:5
Psalm 57:6They have prepared a net for my steps. My soul is bowed down. They dig a pit before me. They fall into its midst themselves. Selah.
Psalm 57:67  ר֣וּמָה עַל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם אֱלֹהִ֑ים עַ֖ל כָּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 57:6
Psalm 57:7My heart is steadfast, God, my heart is steadfast. I will sing, yes, I will sing praises.
Psalm 57:77  רֶ֤שֶׁת ׀ הֵכִ֣ינוּ לִפְעָמַי֮ כָּפַ֢ף נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י כָּר֣וּ לְפָנַ֣י שִׁיחָ֑ה נָפְל֖וּ בְתוֹכָ֣הּ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 57:7
Psalm 57:8Wake up, my glory! Wake up, psaltery and harp! I will wake up the dawn.
Psalm 57:87  נָ֘כ֤וֹן לִבִּ֣י אֱ֭לֹהִים נָכ֣וֹן לִבִּ֑י אָ֝שִׁ֗ירָה וַאֲזַמֵּֽרָה׃ ‬
Psalm 57:8
Psalm 57:9I will give thanks to you, Lord, among the peoples. I will sing praises to you among the nations.
Psalm 57:97  ע֤וּרָה כְבוֹדִ֗י ע֭וּרָֽה הַנֵּ֥בֶל וְכִנּ֗וֹר אָעִ֥ירָה שָּֽׁחַר׃ ‬
Psalm 57:9
Psalm 57:10For your great loving kindness reaches to the heavens, and your truth to the skies.
Psalm 57:107  אוֹדְךָ֖ בָעַמִּ֥ים ׀ אֲדֹנָ֑י אֲ֝זַמֶּרְךָ֗ בַּל־אֻמִּֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 57:10
Psalm 57:11Be exalted, God, above the heavens. Let your glory be over all the earth. For the Chief Musician. To the tune of |Do Not Destroy.| A poem by David.
Psalm 57:117  כִּֽי־גָדֹ֣ל עַד־שָׁמַ֣יִם חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וְֽעַד־שְׁחָקִ֥ים אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 57:11
Psalm 57:12(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 57:127  ר֣וּמָה עַל־שָׁמַ֣יִם אֱלֹהִ֑ים עַ֖ל כָּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 57:12
Psalm 58:1Do you indeed speak righteousness, silent ones? Do you judge blamelessly, you sons of men?
Psalm 58:18  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אַל־תַּשְׁחֵ֗ת לְדָוִ֥ד מִכְתָּֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 58:1
Psalm 58:2No, in your heart you plot injustice. You measure out the violence of your hands in the earth.
Psalm 58:28  הַֽאֻמְנָ֗ם אֵ֣לֶם צֶ֭דֶק תְּדַבֵּר֑וּן מֵישָׁרִ֥ים תִּ֝שְׁפְּט֗וּ בְּנֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 58:2
Psalm 58:3The wicked go astray from the womb. They are wayward as soon as they are born, speaking lies.
Psalm 58:38  אַף־בְּלֵב֮ עוֹלֹ֢ת תִּפְעָ֫ל֥וּן בָּאָ֡רֶץ חֲמַ֥ס יְ֝דֵיכֶ֗ם תְּפַלֵּֽסֽוּן׃ ‬
Psalm 58:3
Psalm 58:4Their poison is like the poison of a snake; like a deaf cobra that stops its ear,
Psalm 58:48  זֹ֣רוּ רְשָׁעִ֣ים מֵרָ֑חֶם תָּע֥וּ מִ֝בֶּ֗טֶן דֹּבְרֵ֥י כָזָֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 58:4
Psalm 58:5which doesn't listen to the voice of charmers, no matter how skillful the charmer may be.
Psalm 58:58  חֲמַת־לָ֗מוֹ כִּדְמ֥וּת חֲמַת־נָחָ֑שׁ כְּמוֹ־פֶ֥תֶן חֵ֝רֵ֗שׁ יַאְטֵ֥ם אָזְנֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 58:5
Psalm 58:6Break their teeth, God, in their mouth. Break out the great teeth of the young lions, Yahweh.
Psalm 58:68  אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יִ֭שְׁמַע לְק֣וֹל מְלַחֲשִׁ֑ים חוֹבֵ֖ר חֲבָרִ֣ים מְחֻכָּֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 58:6
Psalm 58:7Let them vanish as water that flows away. When they draw the bow, let their arrows be made blunt.
Psalm 58:78  אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים הֲרָס־שִׁנֵּ֥ימוֹ בְּפִ֑ימוֹ מַלְתְּע֥וֹת כְּ֝פִירִ֗ים נְתֹ֣ץ ׀ יְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 58:7
Psalm 58:8Let them be like a snail which melts and passes away, like the stillborn child, who has not seen the sun.
Psalm 58:88  יִמָּאֲס֣וּ כְמוֹ־מַ֭יִם יִתְהַלְּכוּ־לָ֑מוֹ יִדְרֹ֥ךְ *חצו **חִ֝צָּ֗יו כְּמ֣וֹ יִתְמֹלָֽלוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 58:8
Psalm 58:9Before your pots can feel the heat of the thorns, he will sweep away the green and the burning alike.
Psalm 58:98  כְּמ֣וֹ שַׁ֭בְּלוּל תֶּ֣מֶס יַהֲלֹ֑ךְ נֵ֥פֶל אֵ֝֗שֶׁת בַּל־חָ֥זוּ שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 58:9
Psalm 58:10The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance. He shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked;
Psalm 58:108  בְּטֶ֤רֶם יָבִ֣ינוּ סִּֽירֹתֵיכֶ֣ם אָטָ֑ד כְּמוֹ־חַ֥י כְּמוֹ־חָ֝ר֗וֹן יִשְׂעָרֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 58:10
Psalm 58:11so that men shall say, |Most certainly there is a reward for the righteous. Most certainly there is a God who judges the earth.| For the Chief Musician. To the tune of |Do Not Destroy.| A poem by David, when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him.
Psalm 58:118  יִשְׂמַ֣ח צַ֭דִּיק כִּי־חָזָ֣ה נָקָ֑ם פְּעָמָ֥יו יִ֝רְחַ֗ץ בְּדַ֣ם הָרָשָֽׁע׃ ‬
Psalm 58:11
Psalm 58:12(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 58:128  וְיֹאמַ֣ר אָ֭דָם אַךְ־פְּרִ֣י לַצַּדִּ֑יק אַ֥ךְ יֵשׁ־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים שֹׁפְטִ֥ים בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 58:12
Psalm 59:1Deliver me from my enemies, my God. Set me on high from those who rise up against me.
Psalm 59:19  לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ אַל־תַּשְׁחֵת֮ לְדָוִ֢ד מִ֫כְתָּ֥ם בִּשְׁלֹ֥חַ שָׁא֑וּל וַֽיִּשְׁמְר֥וּ אֶת־הַ֝בַּ֗יִת לַהֲמִיתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 59:1
Psalm 59:2Deliver me from the workers of iniquity. Save me from the bloodthirsty men.
Psalm 59:29  הַצִּילֵ֖נִי מֵאֹיְבַ֥י ׀ אֱלֹהָ֑י מִּמִתְקוֹמְמַ֥י תְּשַׂגְּבֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 59:2
Psalm 59:3For, behold, they lie in wait for my soul. The mighty gather themselves together against me, not for my disobedience, nor for my sin, Yahweh.
Psalm 59:39  הַ֭צִּילֵנִי מִפֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן וּֽמֵאַנְשֵׁ֥י דָ֝מִ֗ים הוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 59:3
Psalm 59:4I have done no wrong, yet they are ready to attack me. Rise up, behold, and help me!
Psalm 59:49  כִּ֤י הִנֵּ֪ה אָֽרְב֡וּ לְנַפְשִׁ֗י יָג֣וּרוּ עָלַ֣י עַזִ֑ים לֹא־פִשְׁעִ֖י וְלֹא־חַטָּאתִ֣י יְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 59:4
Psalm 59:5You, Yahweh God of Armies, the God of Israel, rouse yourself to punish the nations. Show no mercy to the wicked traitors. Selah.
Psalm 59:59  בְּֽלִי־עָ֭וֺן יְרוּצ֣וּן וְיִכּוֹנָ֑נוּ ע֖וּרָה לִקְרָאתִ֣י וּרְאֵה׃ ‬
Psalm 59:5
Psalm 59:6They return at evening, howling like dogs, and prowl around the city.
Psalm 59:69  וְאַתָּ֤ה יְהוָֽה־אֱלֹהִ֥ים ׀ צְבָא֡וֹת אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הָקִ֗יצָה לִפְקֹ֥ד כָּֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם אַל־תָּחֹ֨ן כָּל־בֹּ֖גְדֵי אָ֣וֶן סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 59:6
Psalm 59:7Behold, they spew with their mouth. Swords are in their lips, |For,| they say, |who hears us?|
Psalm 59:79  יָשׁ֣וּבוּ לָ֭עֶרֶב יֶהֱמ֥וּ כַכָּ֗לֶב וִיס֥וֹבְבוּ עִֽיר׃ ‬
Psalm 59:7
Psalm 59:8But you, Yahweh, laugh at them. You scoff at all the nations.
Psalm 59:89  הִנֵּ֤ה ׀ יַבִּ֘יע֤וּן בְּפִיהֶ֗ם חֲ֭רָבוֹת בְּשִׂפְתוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם כִּי־מִ֥י שֹׁמֵֽעַ׃ ‬
Psalm 59:8
Psalm 59:9Oh, my Strength, I watch for you, for God is my high tower.
Psalm 59:99  וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֭הוָה תִּשְׂחַק־לָ֑מוֹ תִּ֝לְעַ֗ג לְכָל־גּוֹיִֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 59:9
Psalm 59:10My God will go before me with his loving kindness. God will let me look at my enemies in triumph.
Psalm 59:109  עֻ֭זּוֹ אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֶשְׁמֹ֑רָה כִּֽי־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים מִשְׂגַּבִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 59:10
Psalm 59:11Don't kill them, or my people may forget. Scatter them by your power, and bring them down, Lord our shield.
Psalm 59:119  אֱלֹהֵ֣י *חסדו **חַסְדִּ֣י יְקַדְּמֵ֑נִי אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים יַרְאֵ֥נִי בְשֹׁרְרָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 59:11
Psalm 59:12For the sin of their mouth, and the words of their lips, let them be caught in their pride, for the curses and lies which they utter.
Psalm 59:129  אַל־תַּהַרְגֵ֤ם ׀ פֶּֽן־יִשְׁכְּח֬וּ עַמִּ֗י הֲנִיעֵ֣מוֹ בְ֭חֵילְךָ וְהוֹרִידֵ֑מוֹ מָֽגִנֵּ֣נוּ אֲדֹנָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 59:12
Psalm 59:13Consume them in wrath. Consume them, and they will be no more. Let them know that God rules in Jacob, to the ends of the earth. Selah.
Psalm 59:139  חַטַּאת־פִּ֗ימוֹ דְּֽבַר־שְׂפָ֫תֵ֥ימוֹ וְיִלָּכְד֥וּ בִגְאוֹנָ֑ם וּמֵאָלָ֖ה וּמִכַּ֣חַשׁ יְסַפֵּֽרוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 59:13
Psalm 59:14At evening let them return. Let them howl like a dog, and go around the city.
Psalm 59:149  כַּלֵּ֥ה בְחֵמָה֮ כַּלֵּ֢ה וְֽאֵ֫ינֵ֥מוֹ וְֽיֵדְע֗וּ כִּֽי־אֱ֭לֹהִים מֹשֵׁ֣ל בְּיַעֲקֹ֑ב לְאַפְסֵ֖י הָאָ֣רֶץ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 59:14
Psalm 59:15They shall wander up and down for food, and wait all night if they aren't satisfied.
Psalm 59:159  וְיָשׁ֣וּבוּ לָ֭עֶרֶב יֶהֱמ֥וּ כַכָּ֗לֶב וִיס֥וֹבְבוּ עִֽיר׃ ‬
Psalm 59:15
Psalm 59:16But I will sing of your strength. Yes, I will sing aloud of your loving kindness in the morning. For you have been my high tower, a refuge in the day of my distress.
Psalm 59:169  הֵ֭מָּה *ינועון **יְנִיע֣וּן לֶאֱכֹ֑ל אִם־לֹ֥א יִ֝שְׂבְּע֗וּ וַיָּלִֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 59:16
Psalm 59:17To you, my strength, I will sing praises. For God is my high tower, the God of my mercy. For the Chief Musician. To the tune of |The Lily of the Covenant.| A teaching poem by David, when he fought with Aram Naharaim and with Aram Zobah, and Joab returned, and killed twelve thousand of Edom in the Valley of Salt.
Psalm 59:179  וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ אָשִׁ֣יר עֻזֶּךָ֮ וַאֲרַנֵּ֥ן לַבֹּ֗קֶר חַ֫סְדֶּ֥ךָ כִּֽי־הָיִ֣יתָ מִשְׂגָּ֣ב לִ֑י וּ֝מָנ֗וֹס בְּי֣וֹם צַר־לִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 59:17
Psalm 59:18(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 59:189  עֻ֭זִּי אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֲזַמֵּ֑רָה כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים מִ֝שְׂגַּבִּ֗י אֱלֹהֵ֥י חַסְדִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 59:18
Psalm 60:1God, you have rejected us. You have broken us down. You have been angry. Restore us, again.
Psalm 60:10  לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ עַל־שׁוּשַׁ֣ן עֵד֑וּת מִכְתָּ֖ם לְדָוִ֣ד לְלַמֵּֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 60:1
Psalm 60:2You have made the land tremble. You have torn it. Mend its fractures, for it quakes.
Psalm 60:20  בְּהַצּוֹת֨וֹ ׀ אֶ֥ת אֲרַ֣ם נַהֲרַיִם֮ וְאֶת־אֲרַ֢ם צ֫וֹבָ֥ה וַיָּ֤שָׁב יוֹאָ֗ב וַיַּ֣ךְ אֶת־אֱד֣וֹם בְּגֵיא־מֶ֑לַח שְׁנֵ֖ים עָשָׂ֣ר אָֽלֶף׃ ‬
Psalm 60:2
Psalm 60:3You have shown your people hard things. You have made us drink the wine that makes us stagger.
Psalm 60:30  אֱ֭לֹהִים זְנַחְתָּ֣נוּ פְרַצְתָּ֑נוּ אָ֝נַ֗פְתָּ תְּשׁ֣וֹבֵ֥ב לָֽנוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 60:3
Psalm 60:4You have given a banner to those who fear you, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
Psalm 60:40  הִרְעַ֣שְׁתָּה אֶ֣רֶץ פְּצַמְתָּ֑הּ רְפָ֖ה שְׁבָרֶ֣יהָ כִי־מָֽטָה׃ ‬
Psalm 60:4
Psalm 60:5So that your beloved may be delivered, save with your right hand, and answer us.
Psalm 60:50  הִרְאִ֣יתָה עַמְּךָ֣ קָשָׁ֑ה הִ֝שְׁקִיתָ֗נוּ יַ֣יִן תַּרְעֵלָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 60:5
Psalm 60:6God has spoken from his sanctuary: |I will triumph. I will divide Shechem, and measure out the valley of Succoth.
Psalm 60:60  נָ֘תַ֤תָּה לִּירֵאֶ֣יךָ נֵּ֭ס לְהִתְנוֹסֵ֑ס מִ֝פְּנֵ֗י קֹ֣שֶׁט סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 60:6
Psalm 60:7Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine. Ephraim also is the defense of my head. Judah is my scepter.
Psalm 60:70  לְ֭מַעַן יֵחָלְצ֣וּן יְדִידֶ֑יךָ הוֹשִׁ֖יעָה יְמִֽינְךָ֣ *ועננו **וַעֲנֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 60:7
Psalm 60:8Moab is my wash basin. I will throw my shoe on Edom. I shout in triumph over Philistia.|
Psalm 60:80  אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ דִּבֶּ֥ר בְּקָדְשׁ֗וֹ אֶ֫עְלֹ֥זָה אֲחַלְּקָ֥ה שְׁכֶ֑ם וְעֵ֖מֶק סֻכּ֣וֹת אֲמַדֵּֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 60:8
Psalm 60:9Who will bring me into the strong city? Who has led me to Edom?
Psalm 60:90  לִ֤י גִלְעָ֨ד ׀ וְלִ֬י מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה וְ֭אֶפְרַיִם מָע֣וֹז רֹאשִׁ֑י יְ֝הוּדָ֗ה מְחֹֽקְקִי׃ ‬
Psalm 60:9
Psalm 60:10Haven't you, God, rejected us? You don't go out with our armies, God.
Psalm 60:100  מוֹאָ֤ב ׀ סִ֬יר רַחְצִ֗י עַל־אֱ֭דוֹם אַשְׁלִ֣יךְ נַעֲלִ֑י עָ֝לַ֗י פְּלֶ֣שֶׁת הִתְרֹעָֽעִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 60:10
Psalm 60:11Give us help against the adversary, for the help of man is vain.
Psalm 60:110  מִ֣י יֹ֭בִלֵנִי עִ֣יר מָצ֑וֹר מִ֖י נָחַ֣נִי עַד־אֱדֽוֹם׃ ‬
Psalm 60:11
Psalm 60:12Through God we shall do valiantly, for it is he who will tread down our adversaries. For the Chief Musician. For a stringed instrument. By David.
Psalm 60:120  הֲלֹֽא־אַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים זְנַחְתָּ֑נוּ וְֽלֹא־תֵצֵ֥א אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בְּצִבְאוֹתֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 60:12
Psalm 60:13(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 60:130  הָֽבָה־לָּ֣נוּ עֶזְרָ֣ת מִצָּ֑ר וְ֝שָׁ֗וְא תְּשׁוּעַ֥ת אָדָם׃ ‬
Psalm 60:13
Psalm 60:14(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 60:140  בֵּֽאלֹהִ֥ים נַעֲשֶׂה־חָ֑יִל וְ֝ה֗וּא יָב֥וּס צָרֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 60:14
Psalm 61:1Hear my cry, God. Listen to my prayer.
Psalm 61:11  לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ ׀ עַֽל־נְגִינַ֬ת לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 61:1
Psalm 61:2From the end of the earth, I will call to you, when my heart is overwhelmed. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
Psalm 61:21  שִׁמְעָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים רִנָּתִ֑י הַ֝קְשִׁ֗יבָה תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 61:2
Psalm 61:3For you have been a refuge for me, a strong tower from the enemy.
Psalm 61:31  מִקְצֵ֤ה הָאָ֨רֶץ ׀ אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֶ֭קְרָא בַּעֲטֹ֣ף לִבִּ֑י בְּצוּר־יָר֖וּם מִמֶּ֣נִּי תַנְחֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 61:3
Psalm 61:4I will dwell in your tent forever. I will take refuge in the shelter of your wings. Selah.
Psalm 61:41  כִּֽי־הָיִ֣יתָ מַחְסֶ֣ה לִ֑י מִגְדַּל־עֹ֝֗ז מִפְּנֵ֥י אוֹיֵֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 61:4
Psalm 61:5For you, God, have heard my vows. You have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
Psalm 61:51  אָג֣וּרָה בְ֭אָהָלְךָ עוֹלָמִ֑ים אֶֽחֱסֶ֨ה בְסֵ֖תֶר כְּנָפֶ֣יךָ סֶּֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 61:5
Psalm 61:6You will prolong the king's life; his years shall be for generations.
Psalm 61:61  כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים שָׁמַ֣עְתָּ לִנְדָרָ֑י נָתַ֥תָּ יְ֝רֻשַּׁ֗ת יִרְאֵ֥י שְׁמֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 61:6
Psalm 61:7He shall be enthroned in God's presence forever. Appoint your loving kindness and truth, that they may preserve him.
Psalm 61:71  יָמִ֣ים עַל־יְמֵי־מֶ֣לֶךְ תּוֹסִ֑יף שְׁ֝נוֹתָ֗יו כְּמוֹ־דֹ֥ר וָדֹֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 61:7
Psalm 61:8So I will sing praise to your name forever, that I may fulfill my vows daily. For the Chief Musician. To Jeduthan. A Psalm by David.
Psalm 61:81  יֵשֵׁ֣ב ע֭וֹלָם לִפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים חֶ֥סֶד וֶ֝אֱמֶ֗ת מַ֣ן יִנְצְרֻֽהוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 61:8
Psalm 61:9(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 61:91  כֵּ֤ן אֲזַמְּרָ֣ה שִׁמְךָ֣ לָעַ֑ד לְֽשַׁלְּמִ֥י נְדָרַ֗י י֣וֹם ׀ יֽוֹם׃ ‬
Psalm 61:9
Psalm 62:1My soul rests in God alone. My salvation is from him.
Psalm 62:12  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־יְדוּת֗וּן מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 62:1
Psalm 62:2He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress— I will never be greatly shaken.
Psalm 62:22  אַ֣ךְ אֶל־אֱ֭לֹהִים דּֽוּמִיָּ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ יְשׁוּעָתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 62:2
Psalm 62:3How long will you assault a man, would all of you throw him down, Like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence?
Psalm 62:32  אַךְ־ה֣וּא צ֭וּרִי וִֽישׁוּעָתִ֑י מִ֝שְׂגַּבִּ֗י לֹא־אֶמּ֥וֹט רַבָּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 62:3
Psalm 62:4They fully intend to throw him down from his lofty place. They delight in lies. They bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.
Psalm 62:42  עַד־אָ֤נָה ׀ תְּהֽוֹתְת֣וּ עַל‪[c]‬ אִישׁ֮ תְּרָצְּח֢וּ כֻ֫לְּכֶ֥ם כְּקִ֥יר נָט֑וּי גָּ֝דֵ֗ר הַדְּחוּיֽ͏ָה׃ ‬
Psalm 62:4
Psalm 62:5My soul, wait in silence for God alone, for my expectation is from him.
Psalm 62:52  אַ֤ךְ מִשְּׂאֵת֨וֹ ׀ יָעֲצ֣וּ לְהַדִּיחַ֮ יִרְצ֢וּ כָ֫זָ֥ב בְּפִ֥יו יְבָרֵ֑כוּ וּ֝בְקִרְבָּ֗ם יְקַלְלוּ־סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 62:5
Psalm 62:6He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress. I will not be shaken.
Psalm 62:62  אַ֣ךְ לֵ֭אלֹהִים דּ֣וֹמִּי נַפְשִׁ֑י כִּי־מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ תִּקְוָתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 62:6
Psalm 62:7With God is my salvation and my honor. The rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.
