Psalm 62:72  אַךְ־ה֣וּא צ֭וּרִי וִֽישׁוּעָתִ֑י מִ֝שְׂגַּבִּ֗י לֹ֣א אֶמּֽוֹט׃ ‬
Psalm 62:7
Psalm 62:8Trust in him at all times, you people. Pour out your heart before him. God is a refuge for us. Selah.
Psalm 62:82  עַל־אֱ֭לֹהִים יִשְׁעִ֣י וּכְבוֹדִ֑י צוּר־עֻזִּ֥י מַ֝חְסִ֗י בֵּֽאלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 62:8
Psalm 62:9Surely men of low degree are just a breath, and men of high degree are a lie. In the balances they will go up. They are together lighter than a breath.
Psalm 62:92  בִּטְח֘וּ ב֤וֹ בְכָל־עֵ֨ת ׀ עָ֗ם שִׁפְכֽוּ־לְפָנָ֥יו לְבַבְכֶ֑ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים מַחֲסֶה־לָּ֣נוּ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 62:9
Psalm 62:10Don't trust in oppression. Don't become vain in robbery. If riches increase, don't set your heart on them.
Psalm 62:102  אַ֤ךְ ׀ הֶ֥בֶל בְּנֵֽי־אָדָם֮ כָּזָ֢ב בְּנֵ֫י אִ֥ישׁ בְּמֹאזְנַ֥יִם לַעֲל֑וֹת הֵ֝֗מָּה מֵהֶ֥בֶל יָֽחַד׃ ‬
Psalm 62:10
Psalm 62:11God has spoken once; twice I have heard this, that power belongs to God.
Psalm 62:112  אַל־תִּבְטְח֣וּ בְעֹשֶׁק֮ וּבְגָזֵ֢ל אַל־תֶּ֫הְבָּ֥לוּ חַ֤יִל ׀ כִּֽי־יָנ֑וּב אַל־תָּשִׁ֥יתוּ לֵֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 62:11
Psalm 62:12Also to you, Lord, belongs loving kindness, for you reward every man according to his work. A Psalm by David, when he was in the desert of Judah.
Psalm 62:122  אַחַ֤ת ׀ דִּבֶּ֬ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים שְׁתַּֽיִם־ז֥וּ שָׁמָ֑עְתִּי כִּ֥י עֹ֝֗ז לֵאלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 62:12
Psalm 62:13(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 62:132  וּלְךָֽ־אֲדֹנָ֥י חָ֑סֶד כִּֽי־אַתָּ֨ה תְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לְאִ֣ישׁ כְּֽמַעֲשֵֽׂהוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 62:13
Psalm 63:1God, you are my God. I will earnestly seek you. My soul thirsts for you. My flesh longs for you, in a dry and weary land, where there is no water.
Psalm 63:13  מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִ֑ד בִּ֝הְיוֹת֗וֹ בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר יְהוּדָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 63:1
Psalm 63:2So I have seen you in the sanctuary, watching your power and your glory.
Psalm 63:23  אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ אֵלִ֥י אַתָּ֗ה אֲ‍ֽשַׁחֲ֫רֶ֥ךָּ צָמְאָ֬ה לְךָ֨ ׀ נַפְשִׁ֗י כָּמַ֣הּ לְךָ֣ בְשָׂרִ֑י בְּאֶֽרֶץ־צִיָּ֖ה וְעָיֵ֣ף בְּלִי־מָֽיִם׃ ‬
Psalm 63:2
Psalm 63:3Because your loving kindness is better than life, my lips shall praise you.
Psalm 63:33  כֵּ֭ן בַּקֹּ֣דֶשׁ חֲזִיתִ֑יךָ לִרְא֥וֹת עֻ֝זְּךָ֗ וּכְבוֹדֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 63:3
Psalm 63:4So I will bless you while I live. I will lift up my hands in your name.
Psalm 63:43  כִּי־ט֣וֹב חַ֭סְדְּךָ מֵֽחַיִּ֗ים שְׂפָתַ֥י יְשַׁבְּחֽוּנְךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 63:4
Psalm 63:5My soul shall be satisfied as with the richest food. My mouth shall praise you with joyful lips,
Psalm 63:53  כֵּ֣ן אֲבָרֶכְךָ֣ בְחַיָּ֑י בְּ֝שִׁמְךָ אֶשָּׂ֥א כַפָּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 63:5
Psalm 63:6when I remember you on my bed, and think about you in the night watches.
Psalm 63:63  כְּמ֤וֹ חֵ֣לֶב וָ֭דֶשֶׁן תִּשְׂבַּ֣ע נַפְשִׁ֑י וְשִׂפְתֵ֥י רְ֝נָנ֗וֹת יְהַלֶּל־פִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 63:6
Psalm 63:7For you have been my help. I will rejoice in the shadow of your wings.
Psalm 63:73  אִם־זְכַרְתִּ֥יךָ עַל־יְצוּעָ֑י בְּ֝אַשְׁמֻר֗וֹת אֶהְגֶּה־בָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 63:7
Psalm 63:8My soul stays close to you. Your right hand holds me up.
Psalm 63:83  כִּֽי־הָיִ֣יתָ עֶזְרָ֣תָה לִּ֑י וּבְצֵ֖ל כְּנָפֶ֣יךָ אֲרַנֵּֽן׃ ‬
Psalm 63:8
Psalm 63:9But those who seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
Psalm 63:93  דָּבְקָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֣י אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ בִּ֝֗י תָּמְכָ֥ה יְמִינֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 63:9
Psalm 63:10They shall be given over to the power of the sword. They shall be jackal food.
Psalm 63:103  וְהֵ֗מָּה לְ֭שׁוֹאָה יְבַקְשׁ֣וּ נַפְשִׁ֑י יָ֝בֹ֗אוּ בְּֽתַחְתִּיּ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 63:10
Psalm 63:11But the king shall rejoice in God. Everyone who swears by him will praise him, for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be silenced. For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David.
Psalm 63:113  יַגִּירֻ֥הוּ עַל־יְדֵי־חָ֑רֶב מְנָ֖ת שֻׁעָלִ֣ים יִהְיֽוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 63:11
Psalm 63:12(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 63:123  וְהַמֶּלֶךְ֮ יִשְׂמַ֢ח בֵּאלֹ֫הִ֥ים יִ֭תְהַלֵּל כָּל־הַנִּשְׁבָּ֣ע בּ֑וֹ כִּ֥י יִ֝סָּכֵ֗ר פִּ֣י דֽוֹבְרֵי־שָֽׁקֶר׃ ‬
Psalm 63:12
Psalm 64:1Hear my voice, God, in my complaint. Preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
Psalm 64:14  לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 64:1
Psalm 64:2Hide me from the conspiracy of the wicked, from the noisy crowd of the ones doing evil;
Psalm 64:24  שְׁמַע־אֱלֹהִ֣ים קוֹלִ֣י בְשִׂיחִ֑י מִפַּ֥חַד א֝וֹיֵ֗ב תִּצֹּ֥ר חַיָּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 64:2
Psalm 64:3who sharpen their tongue like a sword, and aim their arrows, deadly words,
Psalm 64:34  תַּ֭סְתִּירֵנִי מִסּ֣וֹד מְרֵעִ֑ים מֵ֝רִגְשַׁ֗ת פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃ ‬
Psalm 64:3
Psalm 64:4to shoot innocent men from ambushes. They shoot at him suddenly and fearlessly.
Psalm 64:44  אֲשֶׁ֤ר שָׁנְנ֣וּ כַחֶ֣רֶב לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם דָּרְכ֥וּ חִ֝צָּ֗ם דָּבָ֥ר מָֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 64:4
Psalm 64:5They encourage themselves in evil plans. They talk about laying snares secretly. They say, |Who will see them?|
Psalm 64:54  לִיר֣וֹת בַּמִּסְתָּרִ֣ים תָּ֑ם פִּתְאֹ֥ם יֹ֝רֻ֗הוּ וְלֹ֣א יִירָֽאוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 64:5
Psalm 64:6They plot injustice, saying, |We have made a perfect plan!| Surely man's mind and heart are cunning.
Psalm 64:64  יְחַזְּקוּ־לָ֨מוֹ ׀ דָּ֘בָ֤ר רָ֗ע יְֽ֭סַפְּרוּ לִטְמ֣וֹן מוֹקְשִׁ֑ים אָ֝מְר֗וּ מִ֣י יִרְאֶה־לָּֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 64:6
Psalm 64:7But God will shoot at them. They will be suddenly struck down with an arrow.
Psalm 64:74  יַֽחְפְּֽשׂוּ־עוֹלֹ֗ת תַּ֭מְנוּ חֵ֣פֶשׂ מְחֻפָּ֑שׂ וְקֶ֥רֶב אִ֝֗ישׁ וְלֵ֣ב עָמֹֽק׃ ‬
Psalm 64:7
Psalm 64:8Their own tongues shall ruin them. All who see them will shake their heads.
Psalm 64:84  וַיֹּרֵ֗ם אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים חֵ֥ץ פִּתְא֑וֹם הָ֝י֗וּ מַכּוֹתָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 64:8
Psalm 64:9All mankind shall be afraid. They shall declare the work of God, and shall wisely ponder what he has done.
Psalm 64:94  וַיַּכְשִׁיל֣וּהוּ עָלֵ֣ימוֹ לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם יִ֝תְנֹדֲד֗וּ כָּל־רֹ֥אֵה בָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 64:9
Psalm 64:10The righteous shall be glad in Yahweh, and shall take refuge in him. All the upright in heart shall praise him! For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. A song.
Psalm 64:104  וַיִּֽירְא֗וּ כָּל־אָ֫דָ֥ם וַ֭יַּגִּידוּ פֹּ֥עַל אֱלֹהִ֗ים וּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֥הוּ הִשְׂכִּֽילוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 64:10
Psalm 64:11(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 64:114  יִשְׂמַ֬ח צַדִּ֣יק בַּ֭יהוָה וְחָ֣סָה ב֑וֹ וְ֝יִתְהַֽלְל֗וּ כָּל־יִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 64:11
Psalm 65:1Praise waits for you, God, in Zion. To you shall vows be performed.
Psalm 65:15  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָוִ֥ד שִֽׁיר׃ ‬
Psalm 65:1
Psalm 65:2You who hear prayer, to you all men will come.
Psalm 65:25  לְךָ֤ דֻֽמִיָּ֬ה תְהִלָּ֓ה אֱלֹ֘הִ֥ים בְּצִיּ֑וֹן וּ֝לְךָ֗ יְשֻׁלַּם־נֶֽדֶר׃ ‬
Psalm 65:2
Psalm 65:3Sins overwhelmed me, but you atoned for our transgressions.
Psalm 65:35  שֹׁמֵ֥עַ תְּפִלָּ֑ה עָ֝דֶ֗יךָ כָּל־בָּשָׂ֥ר יָבֹֽאוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 65:3
Psalm 65:4Blessed is one whom you choose, and cause to come near, that he may live in your courts. We will be filled with the goodness of your house, your holy temple.
Psalm 65:45  דִּבְרֵ֣י עֲ֭וֺנֹת גָּ֣בְרוּ מֶ֑נִּי פְּ֝שָׁעֵ֗ינוּ אַתָּ֥ה תְכַפְּרֵֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 65:4
Psalm 65:5By awesome deeds of righteousness, you answer us, God of our salvation. You who are the hope of all the ends of the earth, of those who are far away on the sea;
Psalm 65:55  אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ תִּֽבְחַ֣ר וּתְקָרֵב֮ יִשְׁכֹּ֢ן חֲצֵ֫רֶ֥יךָ נִ֭שְׂבְּעָה בְּט֣וּב בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ קְ֝דֹ֗שׁ הֵיכָלֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 65:5
Psalm 65:6Who by his power forms the mountains, having armed yourself with strength;
Psalm 65:65  נ֤וֹרָא֨וֹת ׀ בְּצֶ֣דֶק תַּ֭עֲנֵנוּ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעֵ֑נוּ מִבְטָ֥ח כָּל־קַצְוֵי־אֶ֝֗רֶץ וְיָ֣ם רְחֹקִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 65:6
Psalm 65:7who stills the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the turmoil of the nations.
Psalm 65:75  מֵכִ֣ין הָרִ֣ים בְּכֹח֑וֹ נֶ֝אְזָ֗ר בִּגְבוּרָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 65:7
Psalm 65:8They also who dwell in faraway places are afraid at your wonders. You call the morning's dawn and the evening with songs of joy.
Psalm 65:85  מַשְׁבִּ֤יחַ ׀ שְׁא֣וֹן יַ֭מִּים שְׁא֥וֹן גַּלֵּיהֶ֗ם וַהֲמ֥וֹן לְאֻמִּֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 65:8
Psalm 65:9You visit the earth, and water it. You greatly enrich it. The river of God is full of water. You provide them grain, for so you have ordained it.
Psalm 65:95  וַיִּ֤ירְא֨וּ ׀ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י קְ֭צָוֺת מֵאוֹתֹתֶ֑יךָ מ֤וֹצָֽאֵי־בֹ֖קֶר וָעֶ֣רֶב תַּרְנִֽין׃ ‬
Psalm 65:9
Psalm 65:10You drench its furrows. You level its ridges. You soften it with showers. You bless it with a crop.
Psalm 65:105  פָּקַ֥דְתָּ הָאָ֨רֶץ ׀ וַתְּשֹׁ֪קְקֶ֡הָ רַבַּ֬ת תַּעְשְׁרֶ֗נָּה פֶּ֣לֶג אֱ֭לֹהִים מָ֣לֵא מָ֑יִם תָּכִ֥ין דְּ֝גָנָ֗ם כִּי־כֵ֥ן תְּכִינֶֽהָ׃ ‬
Psalm 65:10
Psalm 65:11You crown the year with your bounty. Your carts overflow with abundance.
Psalm 65:115  תְּלָמֶ֣יהָ רַ֭וֵּה נַחֵ֣ת גְּדוּדֶ֑יהָ בִּרְבִיבִ֥ים תְּ֝מֹגְגֶ֗נָּה צִמְחָ֥הּ תְּבָרֵֽךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 65:11
Psalm 65:12The wilderness grasslands overflow. The hills are clothed with gladness.
Psalm 65:125  עִ֭טַּרְתָּ שְׁנַ֣ת טוֹבָתֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מַעְגָּלֶ֗יךָ יִרְעֲפ֥וּן דָּֽשֶׁן׃ ‬
Psalm 65:12
Psalm 65:13The pastures are covered with flocks. The valleys also are clothed with grain. They shout for joy! They also sing. For the Chief Musician. A song. A Psalm.
Psalm 65:135  יִ֭רְעֲפוּ נְא֣וֹת מִדְבָּ֑ר וְ֝גִ֗יל גְּבָע֥וֹת תַּחְגֹּֽרְנָה׃ ‬
Psalm 65:13
Psalm 65:14(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 65:145  לָבְשׁ֬וּ כָרִ֨ים ׀ הַצֹּ֗אן וַעֲמָקִ֥ים יַֽעַטְפוּ־בָ֑ר יִ֝תְרוֹעֲע֗וּ אַף־יָשִֽׁירוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 65:14
Psalm 66:1Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth!
Psalm 66:16  לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ שִׁ֣יר מִזְמ֑וֹר הָרִ֥יעוּ לֵ֝אלֹהִים כָּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 66:1
Psalm 66:2Sing to the glory of his name! Offer glory and praise!
Psalm 66:26  זַמְּר֥וּ כְבֽוֹד־שְׁמ֑וֹ שִׂ֥ימוּ כָ֝ב֗וֹד תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 66:2
Psalm 66:3Tell God, |How awesome are your deeds! Through the greatness of your power, your enemies submit themselves to you.
Psalm 66:36  אִמְר֣וּ לֵ֭אלֹהִים מַה־נּוֹרָ֣א מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ בְּרֹ֥ב עֻ֝זְּךָ֗ יְֽכַחֲשׁ֖וּ לְךָ֣ אֹיְבֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 66:3
Psalm 66:4All the earth will worship you, and will sing to you; they will sing to your name.| Selah.
Psalm 66:46  כָּל־הָאָ֤רֶץ ׀ יִשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ לְ֭ךָ וִֽיזַמְּרוּ־לָ֑ךְ יְזַמְּר֖וּ שִׁמְךָ֣ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 66:4
Psalm 66:5Come, and see God's deeds— awesome work on behalf of the children of men.
Psalm 66:56  לְכ֣וּ וּ֭רְאוּ מִפְעֲל֣וֹת אֱלֹהִ֑ים נוֹרָ֥א עֲ֝לִילָ֗ה עַל־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 66:5
Psalm 66:6He turned the sea into dry land. They went through the river on foot. There, we rejoiced in him.
Psalm 66:66  הָ֤פַךְ יָ֨ם ׀ לְֽיַבָּשָׁ֗ה בַּ֭נָּהָר יַֽעַבְר֣וּ בְרָ֑גֶל שָׁ֝֗ם נִשְׂמְחָה־בּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 66:6
Psalm 66:7He rules by his might forever. His eyes watch the nations. Don't let the rebellious rise up against him. Selah.
Psalm 66:76  מֹ֘שֵׁ֤ל בִּגְבוּרָת֨וֹ ׀ עוֹלָ֗ם עֵ֭ינָיו בַּגּוֹיִ֣ם תִּצְפֶּ֑ינָה הַסּוֹרְרִ֓ים ׀ אַל־*ירימו **יָר֖וּמוּ לָ֣מוֹ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 66:7
Psalm 66:8Praise our God, you peoples! Make the sound of his praise heard,
Psalm 66:86  בָּרְכ֖וּ עַמִּ֥ים ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְ֝הַשְׁמִ֗יעוּ ק֣וֹל תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 66:8
Psalm 66:9who preserves our life among the living, and doesn't allow our feet to be moved.
Psalm 66:96  הַשָּׂ֣ם נַ֭פְשֵׁנוּ בַּֽחַיִּ֑ים וְלֹֽא־נָתַ֖ן לַמּ֣וֹט רַגְלֵֽנוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 66:9
Psalm 66:10For you, God, have tested us. You have refined us, as silver is refined.
Psalm 66:106  כִּֽי־בְחַנְתָּ֥נוּ אֱלֹהִ֑ים צְ֝רַפְתָּ֗נוּ כִּצְרָף־כָּֽסֶף׃ ‬
Psalm 66:10
Psalm 66:11You brought us into prison. You laid a burden on our backs.
Psalm 66:116  הֲבֵאתָ֥נוּ בַמְּצוּדָ֑ה שַׂ֖מְתָּ מוּעָקָ֣ה בְמָתְנֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 66:11
Psalm 66:12You allowed men to ride over our heads. We went through fire and through water, but you brought us to the place of abundance.
Psalm 66:126  הִרְכַּ֥בְתָּ אֱנ֗וֹשׁ לְרֹ֫אשֵׁ֥נוּ בָּֽאנוּ־בָאֵ֥שׁ וּבַמַּ֑יִם וַ֝תּוֹצִיאֵ֗נוּ לָֽרְוָיָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 66:12
Psalm 66:13I will come into your temple with burnt offerings. I will pay my vows to you,
Psalm 66:136  אָב֣וֹא בֵיתְךָ֣ בְעוֹל֑וֹת אֲשַׁלֵּ֖ם לְךָ֣ נְדָרָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 66:13
Psalm 66:14which my lips promised, and my mouth spoke, when I was in distress.
Psalm 66:146  אֲשֶׁר־פָּצ֥וּ שְׂפָתָ֑י וְדִבֶּר־פִּ֝֗י בַּצַּר־לִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 66:14
Psalm 66:15I will offer to you burnt offerings of fat animals, with the offering of rams, I will offer bulls with goats. Selah.
Psalm 66:156  עֹ֘ל֤וֹת מֵחִ֣ים אַעֲלֶה־לָּ֭ךְ עִם־קְטֹ֣רֶת אֵילִ֑ים אֶ֥עֱשֶֽׂה בָקָ֖ר עִם־עַתּוּדִ֣ים סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 66:15
Psalm 66:16Come, and hear, all you who fear God. I will declare what he has done for my soul.
Psalm 66:166  לְכֽוּ־שִׁמְע֣וּ וַ֭אֲסַפְּרָה כָּל־יִרְאֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עָשָׂ֣ה לְנַפְשִֽׁי׃ ‬
Psalm 66:16
Psalm 66:17I cried to him with my mouth. He was extolled with my tongue.
Psalm 66:176  אֵלָ֥יו פִּֽי־קָרָ֑אתִי וְ֝רוֹמַ֗ם תַּ֣חַת לְשׁוֹנִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 66:17
Psalm 66:18If I cherished sin in my heart, the Lord wouldn't have listened.
Psalm 66:186  אָ֭וֶן אִם־רָאִ֣יתִי בְלִבִּ֑י לֹ֖א יִשְׁמַ֣ע ׀ אֲדֹנָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 66:18
Psalm 66:19But most certainly, God has listened. He has heard the voice of my prayer.
Psalm 66:196  אָ֭כֵן שָׁמַ֣ע אֱלֹהִ֑ים הִ֝קְשִׁ֗יב בְּק֣וֹל תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 66:19
Psalm 66:20Blessed be God, who has not turned away my prayer, nor his loving kindness from me. For the Chief Musician. With stringed instruments. A Psalm. A song.
Psalm 66:206  בָּר֥וּךְ אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־הֵסִ֘יר תְּפִלָּתִ֥י וְ֝חַסְדּ֗וֹ מֵאִתִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 66:20
Psalm 67:1May God be merciful to us, bless us, and cause his face to shine on us. Selah.
Psalm 67:17  לַמְנַצֵּ֥ח בִּנְגִינֹ֗ת מִזְמ֥וֹר שִֽׁיר׃ ‬
Psalm 67:1
Psalm 67:2That your way may be known on earth, and your salvation among all nations,
Psalm 67:27  אֱלֹהִ֗ים יְחָנֵּ֥נוּ וִֽיבָרְכֵ֑נוּ יָ֤אֵ֥ר פָּנָ֖יו אִתָּ֣נוּ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 67:2
Psalm 67:3let the peoples praise you, God. Let all the peoples praise you.
Psalm 67:37  לָדַ֣עַת בָּאָ֣רֶץ דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ בְּכָל־גּ֝וֹיִ֗ם יְשׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 67:3
Psalm 67:4Oh let the nations be glad and sing for joy, for you will judge the peoples with equity, and govern the nations on earth. Selah.
Psalm 67:47  יוֹד֖וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים ׀ אֱלֹהִ֑ים י֝וֹד֗וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים כֻּלָּֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 67:4
Psalm 67:5Let the peoples praise you, God. Let all the peoples praise you.
Psalm 67:57  יִֽשְׂמְח֥וּ וִֽירַנְּנ֗וּ לְאֻ֫מִּ֥ים כִּֽי־תִשְׁפֹּ֣ט עַמִּ֣ים מִישׁ֑וֹר וּלְאֻמִּ֓ים ׀ בָּאָ֖רֶץ תַּנְחֵ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 67:5
Psalm 67:6The earth has yielded its increase. God, even our own God, will bless us.
Psalm 67:67  יוֹד֖וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים ׀ אֱלֹהִ֑ים י֝וֹד֗וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים כֻּלָּֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 67:6
Psalm 67:7God will bless us. All the ends of the earth shall fear him. For the Chief Musician. A Psalm by David. A song.
Psalm 67:77  אֶ֭רֶץ נָתְנָ֣ה יְבוּלָ֑הּ יְ֝בָרְכֵ֗נוּ אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 67:7
Psalm 67:8(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 67:87  יְבָרְכֵ֥נוּ אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְיִֽירְא֥וּ אֹ֝ת֗וֹ כָּל־אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 67:8
Psalm 68:1Let God arise! Let his enemies be scattered! Let them who hate him also flee before him.
Psalm 68:18  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ לְדָוִ֗ד מִזְמ֥וֹר שִֽׁיר׃ ‬
Psalm 68:1
Psalm 68:2As smoke is driven away, so drive them away. As wax melts before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
Psalm 68:28  יָק֣וּם אֱ֭לֹהִים יָפ֣וּצוּ אוֹיְבָ֑יו וְיָנ֥וּסוּ מְ֝שַׂנְאָ֗יו מִפָּנָֽיו׃ ‬
Psalm 68:2
Psalm 68:3But let the righteous be glad. Let them rejoice before God. Yes, let them rejoice with gladness.
Psalm 68:38  כְּהִנְדֹּ֥ף עָשָׁ֗ן תִּ֫נְדֹּ֥ף כְּהִמֵּ֣ס דּ֭וֹנַג מִפְּנֵי־אֵ֑שׁ יֹאבְד֥וּ רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים מִפְּנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 68:3
Psalm 68:4Sing to God! Sing praises to his name! Extol him who rides on the clouds: to Yah, his name! Rejoice before him!
Psalm 68:48  וְֽצַדִּיקִ֗ים יִשְׂמְח֣וּ יַֽ֭עַלְצוּ לִפְנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִ֗ים וְיָשִׂ֥ישׂוּ בְשִׂמְחָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 68:4
Psalm 68:5A father of the fatherless, and a defender of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
Psalm 68:58  שִׁ֤ירוּ ׀ לֵֽאלֹהִים֮ זַמְּר֢וּ שְׁ֫מ֥וֹ סֹ֡לּוּ לָרֹכֵ֣ב בָּ֭עֲרָבוֹת בְּיָ֥הּ שְׁמ֗וֹ וְעִלְז֥וּ לְפָנָֽיו׃ ‬
Psalm 68:5
Psalm 68:6God sets the lonely in families. He brings out the prisoners with singing, but the rebellious dwell in a sun-scorched land.
Psalm 68:68  אֲבִ֣י יְ֭תוֹמִים וְדַיַּ֣ן אַלְמָנ֑וֹת אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בִּמְע֥וֹן קָדְשֽׁוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 68:6
Psalm 68:7God, when you went forth before your people, when you marched through the wilderness... Selah.
Psalm 68:78  אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ מ֘וֹשִׁ֤יב יְחִידִ֨ים ׀ בַּ֗יְתָה מוֹצִ֣יא אֲ֭סִירִים בַּכּוֹשָׁר֑וֹת אַ֥ךְ ס֝וֹרֲרִ֗ים שָׁכְנ֥וּ צְחִיחָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 68:7
Psalm 68:8The earth trembled. The sky also poured down rain at the presence of the God of Sinai— at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
Psalm 68:88  אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים בְּ֭צֵאתְךָ לִפְנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֑ךָ בְּצַעְדְּךָ֖ בִֽישִׁימ֣וֹן סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 68:8
Psalm 68:9You, God, sent a plentiful rain. You confirmed your inheritance, when it was weary.
Psalm 68:98  אֶ֤רֶץ רָעָ֨שָׁה ׀ אַף־שָׁמַ֣יִם נָטְפוּ֮ מִפְּנֵ֢י אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים זֶ֥ה סִינַ֑י מִפְּנֵ֥י אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 68:9
Psalm 68:10Your congregation lived therein. You, God, prepared your goodness for the poor.
Psalm 68:108  גֶּ֣שֶׁם נְ֭דָבוֹת תָּנִ֣יף אֱלֹהִ֑ים נַחֲלָתְךָ֥ וְ֝נִלְאָ֗ה אַתָּ֥ה כֽוֹנַנְתּֽ͏ָהּ׃ ‬
Psalm 68:10
Psalm 68:11The Lord announced the word. The ones who proclaim it are a great company.
Psalm 68:118  חַיָּתְךָ֥ יָֽשְׁבוּ־בָ֑הּ תָּ֤כִ֥ין בְּטוֹבָתְךָ֖ לֶעָנִ֣י אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 68:11
Psalm 68:12|Kings of armies flee! They flee!| She who waits at home divides the spoil,
Psalm 68:128  אֲדֹנָ֥י יִתֶּן־אֹ֑מֶר הַֽ֝מְבַשְּׂר֗וֹת צָבָ֥א רָֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 68:12
Psalm 68:13while you sleep among the campfires, the wings of a dove sheathed with silver, her feathers with shining gold.
Psalm 68:138  מַלְכֵ֣י צְ֭בָאוֹת יִדֹּד֣וּן יִדֹּד֑וּן וּנְוַת־בַּ֝֗יִת תְּחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁלָֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 68:13
Psalm 68:14When the Almighty scattered kings in her, it snowed on Zalmon.
Psalm 68:148  אִֽם־תִּשְׁכְּבוּן֮ בֵּ֢ין שְׁפַ֫תָּ֥יִם כַּנְפֵ֣י י֭וֹנָה נֶחְפָּ֣ה בַכֶּ֑סֶף וְ֝אֶבְרוֹתֶ֗יהָ בִּֽירַקְרַ֥ק חָרֽוּץ׃ ‬
Psalm 68:14
Psalm 68:15The mountains of Bashan are majestic mountains. The mountains of Bashan are rugged.
Psalm 68:158  בְּפָ֘רֵ֤שׂ שַׁדַּ֓י מְלָ֘כִ֤ים בָּ֗הּ תַּשְׁלֵ֥ג בְּצַלְמֽוֹן׃ ‬
Psalm 68:15
Psalm 68:16Why do you look in envy, you rugged mountains, at the mountain where God chooses to reign? Yes, Yahweh will dwell there forever.
Psalm 68:168  הַר־אֱ֭לֹהִים הַר־בָּשָׁ֑ן הַ֥ר גַּ֝בְנֻנִּ֗ים הַר־בָּשָֽׁן׃ ‬
Psalm 68:16
Psalm 68:17The chariots of God are tens of thousands and thousands of thousands. The Lord is among them, from Sinai, into the sanctuary.
Psalm 68:178  לָ֤מָּה ׀ תְּֽרַצְּדוּן֮ הָרִ֢ים גַּבְנֻ֫נִּ֥ים הָהָ֗ר חָמַ֣ד אֱלֹהִ֣ים לְשִׁבְתּ֑וֹ אַף־יְ֝הוָ֗ה יִשְׁכֹּ֥ן לָנֶֽצַח׃ ‬
Psalm 68:17
Psalm 68:18You have ascended on high. You have led away captives. You have received gifts among men, yes, among the rebellious also, that Yah God might dwell there.
Psalm 68:188  רֶ֤כֶב אֱלֹהִ֗ים רִבֹּתַ֣יִם אַלְפֵ֣י שִׁנְאָ֑ן אֲדֹנָ֥י בָ֝֗ם סִינַ֥י בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 68:18
Psalm 68:19Blessed be the Lord, who daily bears our burdens, even the God who is our salvation. Selah.
Psalm 68:198  עָ֘לִ֤יתָ לַמָּר֨וֹם ׀ שָׁ֘בִ֤יתָ שֶּׁ֗בִי לָקַ֣חְתָּ מַ֭תָּנוֹת בָּאָדָ֑ם וְאַ֥ף ס֝וֹרְרִ֗ים לִשְׁכֹּ֤ן ׀ יָ֬הּ אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 68:19
Psalm 68:20God is to us a God of deliverance. To Yahweh, the Lord, belongs escape from death.
Psalm 68:208  בָּ֤ר֣וּךְ אֲדֹנָי֮ י֤וֹם ׀ י֥וֹם יַֽעֲמָס־לָ֗נוּ הָ֘אֵ֤ל יְֽשׁוּעָתֵ֬נוּ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 68:20
Psalm 68:21But God will strike through the head of his enemies, the hairy scalp of such a one as still continues in his guiltiness.
Psalm 68:218  הָ֤אֵ֣ל ׀ לָנוּ֮ אֵ֤ל לְֽמוֹשָׁ֫ע֥וֹת וְלֵיהוִ֥ה אֲדֹנָ֑י לַ֝מָּ֗וֶת תּוֹצָאֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 68:21
Psalm 68:22The Lord said, |I will bring you again from Bashan, I will bring you again from the depths of the sea;
Psalm 68:228  אַךְ־אֱלֹהִ֗ים יִמְחַץ֮ רֹ֤אשׁ אֹ֫יְבָ֥יו קָדְקֹ֥ד שֵׂעָ֑ר מִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בַּאֲשָׁמָֽיו׃ ‬
Psalm 68:22
Psalm 68:23That you may crush them, dipping your foot in blood, that the tongues of your dogs may have their portion from your enemies.|
Psalm 68:238  אָמַ֣ר אֲ֭דֹנָי מִבָּשָׁ֣ן אָשִׁ֑יב אָ֝שִׁ֗יב מִֽמְּצֻל֥וֹת יָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 68:23
Psalm 68:24They have seen your processions, God, even the processions of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.
Psalm 68:248  לְמַ֤עַן ׀ תִּֽמְחַ֥ץ רַגְלְךָ֗ בְּ֫דָ֥ם לְשׁ֥וֹן כְּלָבֶ֑יךָ מֵאֹיְבִ֥ים מִנֵּֽהוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 68:24
Psalm 68:25The singers went before, the minstrels followed after, in the midst of the ladies playing with tambourines,
Psalm 68:258  רָא֣וּ הֲלִיכוֹתֶ֣יךָ אֱלֹהִ֑ים הֲלִ֘יכ֤וֹת אֵלִ֖י מַלְכִּ֣י בַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 68:25
Psalm 68:26|Bless God in the congregations, even the Lord in the assembly of Israel!|
Psalm 68:268  קִדְּמ֣וּ שָׁ֭רִים אַחַ֣ר נֹגְנִ֑ים בְּת֥וֹךְ עֲ֝לָמ֗וֹת תּוֹפֵפֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 68:26
Psalm 68:27There is little Benjamin, their ruler, the princes of Judah, their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
Psalm 68:278  בְּֽ֭מַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכ֣וּ אֱלֹהִ֑ים יְ֝הוָ֗ה מִמְּק֥וֹר יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 68:27
Psalm 68:28Your God has commanded your strength. Strengthen, God, that which you have done for us.
Psalm 68:288  שָׁ֤ם בִּנְיָמִ֨ן ׀ צָעִ֡יר רֹדֵ֗ם שָׂרֵ֣י יְ֭הוּדָה רִגְמָתָ֑ם שָׂרֵ֥י זְ֝בֻל֗וּן שָׂרֵ֥י נַפְתָּלִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 68:28
Psalm 68:29Because of your temple at Jerusalem, kings shall bring presents to you.
Psalm 68:298  צִוָּ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ עֻ֫זֶּ֥ךָ עוּזָּ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים ז֝֗וּ פָּעַ֥לְתָּ לָּֽנוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 68:29
Psalm 68:30Rebuke the wild animal of the reeds, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the peoples. Being humbled, may it bring bars of silver. Scatter the nations that delight in war.
Psalm 68:308  מֵֽ֭הֵיכָלֶךָ עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לְךָ֤ יוֹבִ֖ילוּ מְלָכִ֣ים שָֽׁי׃ ‬
Psalm 68:30
Psalm 68:31Princes shall come out of Egypt. Ethiopia shall hurry to stretch out her hands to God.
Psalm 68:318  גְּעַ֨ר חַיַּ֪ת קָנֶ֡ה עֲדַ֤ת אַבִּירִ֨ים ׀ בְּעֶגְלֵ֬י עַמִּ֗ים מִתְרַפֵּ֥ס בְּרַצֵּי־כָ֑סֶף בִּזַּ֥ר עַ֝מִּ֗ים קְרָב֥וֹת יֶחְפָּֽצוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 68:31
Psalm 68:32Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth! Sing praises to the Lord! Selah.
Psalm 68:328  יֶאֱתָ֣יוּ חַ֭שְׁמַנִּים מִנִּ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם כּ֥וּשׁ תָּרִ֥יץ יָ֝דָ֗יו לֵאלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 68:32
Psalm 68:33To him who rides on the heaven of heavens, which are of old; behold, he utters his voice, a mighty voice.
Psalm 68:338  מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָ֭אָרֶץ שִׁ֣ירוּ לֵאלֹהִ֑ים זַמְּר֖וּ אֲדֹנָ֣י סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 68:33
Psalm 68:34Ascribe strength to God! His excellency is over Israel, his strength is in the skies.
Psalm 68:348  לָ֭רֹכֵב בִּשְׁמֵ֣י שְׁמֵי־קֶ֑דֶם הֵ֥ן יִתֵּ֥ן בְּ֝קוֹלוֹ ק֣וֹל עֹֽז׃ ‬
Psalm 68:34
Psalm 68:35You are awesome, God, in your sanctuaries. The God of Israel gives strength and power to his people. Praise be to God! For the Chief Musician. To the tune of |Lilies.| By David.
Psalm 68:358  תְּנ֥וּ עֹ֗ז לֵֽאלֹ֫הִ֥ים עַֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל גַּאֲוָת֑וֹ וְ֝עֻזּ֗וֹ בַּשְּׁחָקִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 68:35
Psalm 68:36(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 68:368  נ֤וֹרָ֥א אֱלֹהִ֗ים מִֽמִּקְדָּ֫שֶׁ֥יךָ אֵ֤ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל ה֤וּא נֹתֵ֨ן ׀ עֹ֖ז וְתַעֲצֻמ֥וֹת לָעָ֗ם בָּר֥וּךְ אֱלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 68:36
Psalm 69:1Save me, God, for the waters have come up to my neck!
Psalm 69:19  לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ עַֽל־שׁוֹשַׁנִּ֬ים לְדָוִֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 69:1
Psalm 69:2I sink in deep mire, where there is no foothold. I have come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
Psalm 69:29  הוֹשִׁיעֵ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֤י בָ֖אוּ מַ֣יִם עַד־נָֽפֶשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:2
Psalm 69:3I am weary with my crying. My throat is dry. My eyes fail, looking for my God.
Psalm 69:39  טָבַ֤עְתִּי ׀ בִּיוֵ֣ן מְ֭צוּלָה וְאֵ֣ין מָעֳמָ֑ד בָּ֥אתִי בְמַעֲמַקֵּי־מַ֝֗יִם וְשִׁבֹּ֥לֶת שְׁטָפָֽתְנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:3
Psalm 69:4Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head. Those who want to cut me off, being my enemies wrongfully, are mighty. I have to restore what I didn't take away.
Psalm 69:49  יָגַ֣עְתִּי בְקָרְאִי֮ נִחַ֢ר גְּר֫וֹנִ֥י כָּל֥וּ עֵינַ֑י מְ֝יַחֵ֗ל לֵאלֹהָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:4
Psalm 69:5God, you know my foolishness. My sins aren't hidden from you.
Psalm 69:59  רַבּ֤וּ ׀ מִשַּׂעֲר֣וֹת רֹאשִׁי֮ שֹׂנְאַ֢י חִ֫נָּ֥ם עָצְמ֣וּ מַ֭צְמִיתַי אֹיְבַ֣י שֶׁ֑קֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־גָ֝זַ֗לְתִּי אָ֣ז אָשִֽׁיב׃ ‬
Psalm 69:5
Psalm 69:6Don't let those who wait for you be shamed through me, Lord Yahweh of Armies. Don't let those who seek you be brought to dishonor through me, God of Israel.
Psalm 69:69  אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים אַתָּ֣ה יָ֭דַעְתָּ לְאִוַּלְתִּ֑י וְ֝אַשְׁמוֹתַ֗י מִמְּךָ֥ לֹא־נִכְחָֽדוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:6
Psalm 69:7Because for your sake, I have borne reproach. Shame has covered my face.
Psalm 69:79  אַל־יֵ֘בֹ֤שׁוּ בִ֨י ׀ קֹוֶיךָ֮ אֲדֹנָ֥י יְהוִ֗ה צְבָ֫א֥וֹת אַל־יִכָּ֣לְמוּ בִ֣י מְבַקְשֶׁ֑יךָ אֱ֝לֹהֵ֗י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 69:7
Psalm 69:8I have become a stranger to my brothers, an alien to my mother's children.
Psalm 69:89  כִּֽי־עָ֭לֶיךָ נָשָׂ֣אתִי חֶרְפָּ֑ה כִּסְּתָ֖ה כְלִמָּ֣ה פָנָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:8
Psalm 69:9For the zeal of your house consumes me. The reproaches of those who reproach you have fallen on me.
Psalm 69:99  מ֭וּזָר הָיִ֣יתִי לְאֶחָ֑י וְ֝נָכְרִ֗י לִבְנֵ֥י אִמִּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:9
Psalm 69:10When I wept and I fasted, that was to my reproach.
Psalm 69:109  כִּֽי־קִנְאַ֣ת בֵּיתְךָ֣ אֲכָלָ֑תְנִי וְחֶרְפּ֥וֹת ח֝וֹרְפֶ֗יךָ נָפְל֥וּ עָלָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:10
Psalm 69:11When I made sackcloth my clothing, I became a byword to them.
Psalm 69:119  וָאֶבְכֶּ֣ה בַצּ֣וֹם נַפְשִׁ֑י וַתְּהִ֖י לַחֲרָפ֣וֹת לִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:11
Psalm 69:12Those who sit in the gate talk about me. I am the song of the drunkards.
Psalm 69:129  וָאֶתְּנָ֣ה לְבוּשִׁ֣י שָׂ֑ק וָאֱהִ֖י לָהֶ֣ם לְמָשָֽׁל׃ ‬
Psalm 69:12
Psalm 69:13But as for me, my prayer is to you, Yahweh, in an acceptable time. God, in the abundance of your loving kindness, answer me in the truth of your salvation.
Psalm 69:139  יָשִׂ֣יחוּ בִ֭י יֹ֣שְׁבֵי שָׁ֑עַר וּ֝נְגִינ֗וֹת שׁוֹתֵ֥י שֵׁכָֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 69:13
Psalm 69:14Deliver me out of the mire, and don't let me sink. Let me be delivered from those who hate me, and out of the deep waters.
Psalm 69:149  וַאֲנִ֤י תְפִלָּתִֽי־לְךָ֨ ׀ יְהוָ֡ה עֵ֤ת רָצ֗וֹן אֱלֹהִ֥ים בְּרָב־חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ עֲ֝נֵ֗נִי בֶּאֱמֶ֥ת יִשְׁעֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:14
Psalm 69:15Don't let the flood waters overwhelm me, neither let the deep swallow me up. Don't let the pit shut its mouth on me.
Psalm 69:159  הַצִּילֵ֣נִי מִ֭טִּיט וְאַל־אֶטְבָּ֑עָה אִנָּצְלָ֥ה מִ֝שֹּֽׂנְאַ֗י וּמִמַּֽעֲמַקֵּי־מָֽיִם׃ ‬
Psalm 69:15
Psalm 69:16Answer me, Yahweh, for your loving kindness is good. According to the multitude of your tender mercies, turn to me.
Psalm 69:169  אַל־תִּשְׁטְפֵ֤נִי ׀ שִׁבֹּ֣לֶת מַ֭יִם וְאַל־תִּבְלָעֵ֣נִי מְצוּלָ֑ה וְאַל־תֶּאְטַר־עָלַ֖י בְּאֵ֣ר פִּֽיהָ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:16
Psalm 69:17Don't hide your face from your servant, for I am in distress. Answer me speedily!
Psalm 69:179  עֲנֵ֣נִי יְ֭הוָה כִּי־ט֣וֹב חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ כְּרֹ֥ב רַ֝חֲמֶ֗יךָ פְּנֵ֣ה אֵלָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:17
Psalm 69:18Draw near to my soul, and redeem it. Ransom me because of my enemies.
Psalm 69:189  וְאַל־תַּסְתֵּ֣ר פָּ֭נֶיךָ מֵֽעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּֽי־צַר־לִ֝֗י מַהֵ֥ר עֲנֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:18
Psalm 69:19You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor. My adversaries are all before you.
Psalm 69:199  קָרְבָ֣ה אֶל־נַפְשִׁ֣י גְאָלָ֑הּ לְמַ֖עַן אֹיְבַ֣י פְּדֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:19
Psalm 69:20Reproach has broken my heart, and I am full of heaviness. I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; for comforters, but I found none.
Psalm 69:209  אַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֗עְתָּ חֶרְפָּתִ֣י וּ֭בָשְׁתִּי וּכְלִמָּתִ֑י נֶ֝גְדְּךָ֗ כָּל־צוֹרְרָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:20
Psalm 69:21They also gave me gall for my food. In my thirst, they gave me vinegar to drink.
Psalm 69:219  חֶרְפָּ֤ה ׀ שָֽׁבְרָ֥ה לִבִּ֗י וָֽאָ֫נ֥וּשָׁה וָאֲקַוֶּ֣ה לָנ֣וּד וָאַ֑יִן וְ֝לַמְנַחֲמִ֗ים וְלֹ֣א מָצָֽאתִי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:21
Psalm 69:22Let their table before them become a snare. May it become a retribution and a trap.
Psalm 69:229  וַיִּתְּנ֣וּ בְּבָרוּתִ֣י רֹ֑אשׁ וְ֝לִצְמָאִ֗י יַשְׁק֥וּנִי חֹֽמֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:22
Psalm 69:23Let their eyes be darkened, so that they can't see. Let their backs be continually bent.
Psalm 69:239  יְהִֽי־שֻׁלְחָנָ֣ם לִפְנֵיהֶ֣ם לְפָ֑ח וְלִשְׁלוֹמִ֥ים לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:23
Psalm 69:24Pour out your indignation on them. Let the fierceness of your anger overtake them.
Psalm 69:249  תֶּחְשַׁ֣כְנָה עֵ֭ינֵיהֶם מֵרְא֑וֹת וּ֝מָתְנֵ֗יהֶם תָּמִ֥יד הַמְעַֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 69:24
Psalm 69:25Let their habitation be desolate. Let no one dwell in their tents.
Psalm 69:259  שְׁפָךְ־עֲלֵיהֶ֥ם זַעְמֶ֑ךָ וַחֲר֥וֹן אַ֝פְּךָ֗ יַשִּׂיגֵֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 69:25
Psalm 69:26For they persecute him whom you have wounded. They tell of the sorrow of those whom you have hurt.
Psalm 69:269  תְּהִי־טִֽירָתָ֥ם נְשַׁמָּ֑ה בְּ֝אָהֳלֵיהֶ֗ם אַל־יְהִ֥י יֹשֵֽׁב׃ ‬
Psalm 69:26
Psalm 69:27Charge them with crime upon crime. Don't let them come into your righteousness.
Psalm 69:279  כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־הִכִּ֣יתָ רָדָ֑פוּ וְאֶל־מַכְא֖וֹב חֲלָלֶ֣יךָ יְסַפֵּֽרוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:27
Psalm 69:28Let them be blotted out of the book of life, and not be written with the righteous.
Psalm 69:289  תְּֽנָה־עָ֭וֺן עַל־עֲוֺנָ֑ם וְאַל־יָ֝בֹ֗אוּ בְּצִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:28
Psalm 69:29But I am in pain and distress. Let your salvation, God, protect me.
Psalm 69:299  יִ֭מָּחֽוּ מִסֵּ֣פֶר חַיִּ֑ים וְעִ֥ם צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים אַל־יִכָּתֵֽבוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:29
Psalm 69:30I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.
Psalm 69:309  וַ֭אֲנִי עָנִ֣י וְכוֹאֵ֑ב יְשׁוּעָתְךָ֖ אֱלֹהִ֣ים תְּשַׂגְּבֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 69:30
Psalm 69:31It will please Yahweh better than an ox, or a bull that has horns and hoofs.
Psalm 69:319  אֲהַֽלְלָ֣ה שֵׁם־אֱלֹהִ֣ים בְּשִׁ֑יר וַאֲגַדְּלֶ֥נּוּ בְתוֹדָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 69:31
Psalm 69:32The humble have seen it, and are glad. You who seek after God, let your heart live.
Psalm 69:329  וְתִיטַ֣ב לַֽ֭יהוָה מִשּׁ֥וֹר פָּ֗ר מַקְרִ֥ן מַפְרִֽיס׃ ‬
Psalm 69:32
Psalm 69:33For Yahweh hears the needy, and doesn't despise his captive people.
Psalm 69:339  רָא֣וּ עֲנָוִ֣ים יִשְׂמָ֑חוּ דֹּרְשֵׁ֥י אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים וִיחִ֥י לְבַבְכֶֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 69:33
Psalm 69:34Let heaven and earth praise him; the seas, and everything that moves therein!
Psalm 69:349  כִּֽי־שֹׁמֵ֣עַ אֶל־אֶבְיוֹנִ֣ים יְהוָ֑ה וְאֶת־אֲ֝סִירָ֗יו לֹ֣א בָזָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 69:34
Psalm 69:35For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah. They shall settle there, and own it.
Psalm 69:359  יְֽ֭הַלְלוּהוּ שָׁמַ֣יִם וָאָ֑רֶץ יַ֝מִּ֗ים וְֽכָל־רֹמֵ֥שׂ בָּֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 69:35
Psalm 69:36The children also of his servants shall inherit it. Those who love his name shall dwell therein. For the Chief Musician. By David. A reminder.
Psalm 69:369  כִּ֤י אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ י֘וֹשִׁ֤יעַ צִיּ֗וֹן וְ֭יִבְנֶה עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וְיָ֥שְׁבוּ שָׁ֝֗ם וִירֵשֽׁוּהָ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:36
Psalm 69:37(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 69:379  וְזֶ֣רַע עֲ֭בָדָיו יִנְחָל֑וּהָ וְאֹהֲבֵ֥י שְׁ֝מ֗וֹ יִשְׁכְּנוּ־בָֽהּ׃ ‬
Psalm 69:37
Psalm 70:1Hurry, God, to deliver me. Come quickly to help me, Yahweh.
Psalm 70:10  לַ֝מְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָוִ֥ד לְהַזְכִּֽיר׃ ‬
Psalm 70:1
Psalm 70:2Let them be disappointed and confounded who seek my soul. Let those who desire my ruin be turned back in disgrace.
Psalm 70:20  אֱלֹהִ֥ים לְהַצִּילֵ֑נִי יְ֝הוָ֗ה לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי חֽוּשָֽׁה׃ ‬
Psalm 70:2
Psalm 70:3Let them be turned because of their shame Who say, |Aha! Aha!|
Psalm 70:30  יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ וְיַחְפְּרוּ֮ מְבַקְשֵׁ֢י נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י יִסֹּ֣גוּ אָ֭חוֹר וְיִכָּלְמ֑וּ חֲ֝פֵצֵ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 70:3
Psalm 70:4Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you. Let those who love your salvation continually say, |Let God be exalted!|
Psalm 70:40  יָ֭שׁוּבוּ עַל־עֵ֣קֶב בָּשְׁתָּ֑ם הָ֝אֹמְרִ֗ים הֶ֘אָ֥ח ׀ הֶאָֽח׃ ‬
Psalm 70:4
Psalm 70:5But I am poor and needy. Come to me quickly, God. You are my help and my deliverer. Yahweh, don't delay.
Psalm 70:50  יָ֘שִׂ֤ישׂוּ וְיִשְׂמְח֨וּ ׀ בְּךָ֗ כָּֽל־מְבַ֫קְשֶׁ֥יךָ וְיֹאמְר֣וּ תָ֭מִיד יִגְדַּ֣ל אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֹ֝הֲבֵ֗י יְשׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 70:5
Psalm 70:6(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 70:60  וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְיוֹן֮ אֱלֹהִ֢ים חֽוּשָׁ֫ה־לִּ֥י עֶזְרִ֣י וּמְפַלְטִ֣י אַ֑תָּה יְ֝הוָ֗ה אַל־תְּאַחַֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 70:6
Psalm 71:1In you, Yahweh, I take refuge. Never let me be disappointed.
Psalm 71:11  בְּךָֽ־יְהוָ֥ה חָסִ֑יתִי אַל־אֵב֥וֹשָׁה לְעוֹלָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 71:1
Psalm 71:2Deliver me in your righteousness, and rescue me. Turn your ear to me, and save me.
Psalm 71:21  בְּצִדְקָתְךָ֗ תַּצִּילֵ֥נִי וּֽתְפַלְּטֵ֑נִי הַטֵּֽה־אֵלַ֥י אָ֝זְנְךָ֗ וְהוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 71:2
Psalm 71:3Be to me a rock of refuge to which I may always go. Give the command to save me, for you are my rock and my fortress.
Psalm 71:31  הֱיֵ֤ה לִ֨י ׀ לְצ֥וּר מָע֡וֹן לָב֗וֹא תָּמִ֗יד צִוִּ֥יתָ לְהוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי כִּֽי־סַלְעִ֖י וּמְצוּדָתִ֣י אָֽתָּה׃ ‬
Psalm 71:3
Psalm 71:4Rescue me, my God, from the hand of the wicked, from the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
Psalm 71:41  אֱ‍ֽלֹהַ֗י פַּ֭לְּטֵנִי מִיַּ֣ד רָשָׁ֑ע מִכַּ֖ף מְעַוֵּ֣ל וְחוֹמֵץ׃ ‬
Psalm 71:4
Psalm 71:5For you are my hope, Lord Yahweh; my confidence from my youth.
Psalm 71:51  כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה תִקְוָתִ֑י אֲדֹנָ֥י יְ֝הוִ֗ה מִבְטַחִ֥י מִנְּעוּרָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 71:5
Psalm 71:6I have relied on you from the womb. You are he who took me out of my mother's womb. I will always praise you.
Psalm 71:61  עָלֶ֤יךָ ׀ נִסְמַ֬כְתִּי מִבֶּ֗טֶן מִמְּעֵ֣י אִ֭מִּי אַתָּ֣ה גוֹזִ֑י בְּךָ֖ תְהִלָּתִ֣י תָמִֽיד׃ ‬
Psalm 71:6
Psalm 71:7I am a marvel to many, but you are my strong refuge.
Psalm 71:71  כְּ֭מוֹפֵת הָיִ֣יתִי לְרַבִּ֑ים וְ֝אַתָּ֗ה מַֽחֲסִי־עֹֽז׃ ‬
Psalm 71:7
Psalm 71:8My mouth shall be filled with your praise, with your honor all the day.
Psalm 71:81  יִמָּ֣לֵא פִ֭י תְּהִלָּתֶ֑ךָ כָּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם תִּפְאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 71:8
Psalm 71:9Don't reject me in my old age. Don't forsake me when my strength fails.
Psalm 71:91  אַֽל־תַּ֭שְׁלִיכֵנִי לְעֵ֣ת זִקְנָ֑ה כִּכְל֥וֹת כֹּ֝חִ֗י אֽ͏ַל־תַּעַזְבֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 71:9
Psalm 71:10For my enemies talk about me. Those who watch for my soul conspire together,
Psalm 71:101  כִּֽי־אָמְר֣וּ אוֹיְבַ֣י לִ֑י וְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י נוֹעֲצ֥וּ יַחְדָּֽו׃ ‬
Psalm 71:10
Psalm 71:11saying, |God has forsaken him. Pursue and take him, for no one will rescue him.|
Psalm 71:111  לֵ֭אמֹר אֱלֹהִ֣ים עֲזָב֑וֹ רִֽדְפ֥וּ וְ֝תִפְשׂ֗וּהוּ כִּי־אֵ֥ין מַצִּֽיל׃ ‬
Psalm 71:11
Psalm 71:12God, don't be far from me. My God, hurry to help me.
Psalm 71:121  אֱ֭לֹהִים אַל־תִּרְחַ֣ק מִמֶּ֑נִּי אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי *חישה **חֽוּשָׁה׃ ‬
Psalm 71:12
Psalm 71:13Let my accusers be disappointed and consumed. Let them be covered with disgrace and scorn who want to harm me.
Psalm 71:131  יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ יִכְלוּ֮ שֹׂטְנֵ֢י נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י יַֽעֲט֣וּ חֶ֭רְפָּה וּכְלִמָּ֑ה מְ֝בַקְשֵׁ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 71:13
Psalm 71:14But I will always hope, and will add to all of your praise.
Psalm 71:141  וַ֭אֲנִי תָּמִ֣יד אֲיַחֵ֑ל וְ֝הוֹסַפְתִּ֗י עַל־כָּל־תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 71:14
Psalm 71:15My mouth will tell about your righteousness, and of your salvation all day, though I don't know its full measure.
Psalm 71:151  פִּ֤י ׀ יְסַפֵּ֬ר צִדְקָתֶ֗ךָ כָּל־הַיּ֥וֹם תְּשׁוּעָתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֤י לֹ֖א יָדַ֣עְתִּי סְפֹרֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 71:15
Psalm 71:16I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord Yahweh. I will make mention of your righteousness, even of yours alone.
Psalm 71:161  אָב֗וֹא בִּ֭גְבֻרוֹת אֲדֹנָ֣י יְהוִ֑ה אַזְכִּ֖יר צִדְקָתְךָ֣ לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 71:16
Psalm 71:17God, you have taught me from my youth. Until now, I have declared your wondrous works.
Psalm 71:171  אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים לִמַּדְתַּ֥נִי מִנְּעוּרָ֑י וְעַד־הֵ֝֗נָּה אַגִּ֥יד נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 71:17
Psalm 71:18Yes, even when I am old and gray-haired, God, don't forsake me, until I have declared your strength to the next generation, your might to everyone who is to come.
Psalm 71:181  וְגַ֤ם עַד־זִקְנָ֨ה ׀ וְשֵׂיבָה֮ אֱלֹהִ֢ים אַֽל־תַּעַ֫זְבֵ֥נִי עַד־אַגִּ֣יד זְרוֹעֲךָ֣ לְד֑וֹר לְכָל־יָ֝ב֗וֹא גְּבוּרָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 71:18
Psalm 71:19Your righteousness also, God, reaches to the heavens; you have done great things. God, who is like you?
Psalm 71:191  וְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ אֱלֹהִ֗ים עַד־מָ֫ר֥וֹם אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֥יתָ גְדֹל֑וֹת אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים מִ֣י כָמֽוֹךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 71:19
Psalm 71:20You, who have shown us many and bitter troubles, you will let me live. You will bring us up again from the depths of the earth.
Psalm 71:201  אֲשֶׁ֤ר *הראיתנו **הִרְאִיתַ֨נִי ׀ צָר֥וֹת רַבּ֗וֹת וְרָ֫ע֥וֹת תָּשׁ֥וּב *תחיינו **תְּחַיֵּ֑ינִי וּֽמִתְּהֹמ֥וֹת הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ תָּשׁ֥וּב תַּעֲלֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 71:20
Psalm 71:21Increase my honor, and comfort me again.
Psalm 71:211  תֶּ֤רֶב ׀ גְּֽדֻלָּתִ֗י וְתִסֹּ֥ב תְּֽנַחֲמֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 71:21
Psalm 71:22I will also praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, my God. I sing praises to you with the lyre, Holy One of Israel.
Psalm 71:221  גַּם־אֲנִ֤י ׀ אוֹדְךָ֣ בִכְלִי־נֶבֶל֮ אֲמִתְּךָ֢ אֱלֹ֫הָ֥י אֲזַמְּרָ֣ה לְךָ֣ בְכִנּ֑וֹר קְ֝ד֗וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 71:22
Psalm 71:23My lips shall shout for joy! My soul, which you have redeemed, sings praises to you!
Psalm 71:231  תְּרַנֵּ֣נָּ֣ה שְׂ֭פָתַי כִּ֣י אֲזַמְּרָה־לָּ֑ךְ וְ֝נַפְשִׁ֗י אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּדִֽיתָ׃ ‬
Psalm 71:23
Psalm 71:24My tongue will also talk about your righteousness all day long, for they are disappointed, and they are confounded, who want to harm me. By Solomon.
Psalm 71:241  גַּם־לְשׁוֹנִ֗י כָּל־הַ֭יּוֹם תֶּהְגֶּ֣ה צִדְקָתֶ֑ךָ כִּי־בֹ֥שׁוּ כִֽי־חָ֝פְר֗וּ מְבַקְשֵׁ֥י רָעָתִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 71:24
Psalm 72:1God, give the king your justice; your righteousness to the royal son.
Psalm 72:12  לִשְׁלֹמֹ֨ה ׀ אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים מִ֭שְׁפָּטֶיךָ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ תֵּ֑ן וְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ לְבֶן־מֶֽלֶךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:1
Psalm 72:2He will judge your people with righteousness, and your poor with justice.
Psalm 72:22  יָדִ֣ין עַמְּךָ֣ בְצֶ֑דֶק וַעֲנִיֶּ֥יךָ בְמִשְׁפָּֽט׃ ‬
Psalm 72:2
Psalm 72:3The mountains shall bring prosperity to the people. The hills bring the fruit of righteousness.
Psalm 72:32  יִשְׂא֤וּ הָרִ֓ים שָׁ֘ל֥וֹם לָעָ֑ם וּ֝גְבָע֗וֹת בִּצְדָקָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 72:3
Psalm 72:4He will judge the poor of the people. He will save the children of the needy, and will break the oppressor in pieces.
Psalm 72:42  יִשְׁפֹּ֤ט ׀ עֲ‍ֽנִיֵּי־עָ֗ם י֭וֹשִׁיעַ לִבְנֵ֣י אֶבְי֑וֹן וִֽידַכֵּ֣א עוֹשֵֽׁק׃ ‬
Psalm 72:4
Psalm 72:5They shall fear you while the sun endures; and as long as the moon, throughout all generations.
Psalm 72:52  יִֽירָא֥וּךָ עִם־שָׁ֑מֶשׁ וְלִפְנֵ֥י יָ֝רֵ֗חַ דּ֣וֹר דּוֹרִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 72:5
Psalm 72:6He will come down like rain on the mown grass, as showers that water the earth.
Psalm 72:62  יֵ֭רֵד כְּמָטָ֣ר עַל־גֵּ֑ז כִּ֝רְבִיבִ֗ים זַרְזִ֥יף אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:6
Psalm 72:7In his days, the righteous shall flourish, and abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.
Psalm 72:72  יִֽפְרַח־בְּיָמָ֥יו צַדִּ֑יק וְרֹ֥ב שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם עַד־בְּלִ֥י יָרֵֽחַ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:7
Psalm 72:8He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, from the River to the ends of the earth.
Psalm 72:82  וְ֭יֵרְדְּ מִיָּ֣ם עַד־יָ֑ם וּ֝מִנָּהָ֗ר עַד־אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:8
Psalm 72:9Those who dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him. His enemies shall lick the dust.
Psalm 72:92  לְ֭פָנָיו יִכְרְע֣וּ צִיִּ֑ים וְ֝אֹיְבָ֗יו עָפָ֥ר יְלַחֵֽכוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:9
Psalm 72:10The kings of Tarshish and of the islands will bring tribute. The kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
Psalm 72:102  מַלְכֵ֬י תַרְשִׁ֣ישׁ וְ֭אִיִּים מִנְחָ֣ה יָשִׁ֑יבוּ מַלְכֵ֥י שְׁבָ֥א וּ֝סְבָ֗א אֶשְׁכָּ֥ר יַקְרִֽיבוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:10
Psalm 72:11Yes, all kings shall fall down before him. All nations shall serve him.
Psalm 72:112  וְיִשְׁתַּחֲווּ־ל֥וֹ כָל־מְלָכִ֑ים כָּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם יַֽעַבְדֽוּהוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:11
Psalm 72:12For he will deliver the needy when he cries; the poor, who has no helper.
Psalm 72:122  כִּֽי־יַ֭צִּיל אֶבְי֣וֹן מְשַׁוֵּ֑עַ וְ֝עָנִ֗י וְֽאֵין־עֹזֵ֥ר לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:12
Psalm 72:13He will have pity on the poor and needy. He will save the souls of the needy.
Psalm 72:132  יָ֭חֹס עַל־דַּ֣ל וְאֶבְי֑וֹן וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹת אֶבְיוֹנִ֣ים יוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:13
Psalm 72:14He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence. Their blood will be precious in his sight.
Psalm 72:142  מִתּ֣וֹךְ וּ֭מֵחָמָס יִגְאַ֣ל נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְיֵיקַ֖ר דָּמָ֣ם בְּעֵינָֽיו׃ ‬
Psalm 72:14
Psalm 72:15They shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba. Men shall pray for him continually. They shall bless him all day long.
Psalm 72:152  וִיחִ֗י וְיִתֶּן־לוֹ֮ מִזְּהַ֢ב שְׁ֫בָ֥א וְיִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל בַּעֲד֣וֹ תָמִ֑יד כָּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם יְבָרֲכֶֽנְהֽוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:15
Psalm 72:16Abundance of grain shall be throughout the land. Its fruit sways like Lebanon. Let it flourish, thriving like the grass of the field.
Psalm 72:162  יְהִ֤י פִסַּת־בַּ֨ר ׀ בָּאָרֶץ֮ בְּרֹ֢אשׁ הָ֫רִ֥ים יִרְעַ֣שׁ כַּלְּבָנ֣וֹן פִּרְי֑וֹ וְיָצִ֥יצוּ מֵ֝עִ֗יר כְּעֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:16
Psalm 72:17His name endures forever. His name continues as long as the sun. Men shall be blessed by him. All nations will call him blessed.
Psalm 72:172  יְהִ֤י שְׁמ֨וֹ לְֽעוֹלָ֗ם לִפְנֵי־שֶׁמֶשׁ֮ *ינין **יִנּ֢וֹן שְׁ֫מ֥וֹ וְיִתְבָּ֥רְכוּ ב֑וֹ כָּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם יְאַשְּׁרֽוּהוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:17
Psalm 72:18Praise be to Yahweh God, the God of Israel, who alone does marvelous deeds.
Psalm 72:182  בָּר֤וּךְ ׀ יְהוָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עֹשֵׂ֖ה נִפְלָא֣וֹת לְבַדּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 72:18
Psalm 72:19Blessed be his glorious name forever! Let the whole earth be filled with his glory! Amen and amen.
Psalm 72:192  וּבָר֤וּךְ ׀ שֵׁ֥ם כְּבוֹד֗וֹ לְע֫וֹלָ֥ם וְיִמָּלֵ֣א כְ֭בוֹדוֹ אֶת־כֹּ֥ל הָאָ֗רֶץ אָ֘מֵ֥ן ׀ וְאָמֵֽן׃ ‬
Psalm 72:19
Psalm 72:20This ends the prayers by David, the son of Jesse. BOOK III A Psalm by Asaph.
Psalm 72:202  כָּלּ֥וּ תְפִלּ֑וֹת דָּ֝וִ֗ד בֶּן־יִשָֽׁי׃ ‬
Psalm 72:20
Psalm 73:1Surely God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart.
Psalm 73:13  מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אַ֤ךְ ט֭וֹב לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אֱלֹהִ֗ים לְבָרֵ֥י לֵבָֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 73:1
Psalm 73:2But as for me, my feet were almost gone. My steps had nearly slipped.
Psalm 73:23  וַאֲנִ֗י כִּ֭מְעַט *נטוי **נָטָ֣יוּ רַגְלָ֑י כְּ֝אַ֗יִן *שפכה **שֻׁפְּכ֥וּ אֲשֻׁרָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 73:2
Psalm 73:3For I was envious of the arrogant, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
Psalm 73:33  כִּֽי־קִ֭נֵּאתִי בַּֽהוֹלְלִ֑ים שְׁל֖וֹם רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֶרְאֶֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 73:3
Psalm 73:4For there are no struggles in their death, but their strength is firm.
Psalm 73:43  כִּ֤י אֵ֖ין חַרְצֻבּ֥וֹת לְמוֹתָ֗ם וּבָרִ֥יא אוּלָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 73:4
Psalm 73:5They are free from burdens of men, neither are they plagued like other men.
Psalm 73:53  בַּעֲמַ֣ל אֱנ֣וֹשׁ אֵינֵ֑מוֹ וְעִם־אָ֝דָ֗ם לֹ֣א יְנֻגָּֽעוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 73:5
Psalm 73:6Therefore pride is like a chain around their neck. Violence covers them like a garment.
Psalm 73:63  לָ֭כֵן עֲנָקַ֣תְמוֹ גַאֲוָ֑ה יַעֲטָף־שִׁ֝֗ית חָמָ֥ס לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 73:6
Psalm 73:7Their eyes bulge with fat. Their minds pass the limits of conceit.
Psalm 73:73  יָ֭צָא מֵחֵ֣לֶב עֵינֵ֑מוֹ עָ֝בְר֗וּ מַשְׂכִּיּ֥וֹת לֵבָֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 73:7
Psalm 73:8They scoff and speak with malice. In arrogance, they threaten oppression.
Psalm 73:83  יָמִ֤יקוּ ׀ וִידַבְּר֣וּ בְרָ֣ע עֹ֑שֶׁק מִמָּר֥וֹם יְדַבֵּֽרוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 73:8
Psalm 73:9They have set their mouth in the heavens. Their tongue walks through the earth.
Psalm 73:93  שַׁתּ֣וּ בַשָּׁמַ֣יִם פִּיהֶ֑ם וּ֝לְשׁוֹנָ֗ם תִּֽהֲלַ֥ךְ בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 73:9
Psalm 73:10Therefore their people return to them, and they drink up waters of abundance.
Psalm 73:103  לָכֵ֤ן ׀ *ישיב **יָשׁ֣וּב עַמּ֣וֹ הֲלֹ֑ם וּמֵ֥י מָ֝לֵ֗א יִמָּ֥צוּ לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 73:10
Psalm 73:11They say, |How does God know? Is there knowledge in the Most High?|
Psalm 73:113  וְֽאָמְר֗וּ אֵיכָ֥ה יָדַֽע־אֵ֑ל וְיֵ֖שׁ דֵּעָ֣ה בְעֶלְיֽוֹן׃ ‬
Psalm 73:11
Psalm 73:12Behold, these are the wicked. Being always at ease, they increase in riches.
Psalm 73:123  הִנֵּה־אֵ֥לֶּה רְשָׁעִ֑ים וְשַׁלְוֵ֥י ע֝וֹלָ֗ם הִשְׂגּוּ־חָֽיִל׃ ‬
Psalm 73:12
Psalm 73:13Surely in vain I have cleansed my heart, and washed my hands in innocence,
Psalm 73:133  אַךְ־רִ֭יק זִכִּ֣יתִי לְבָבִ֑י וָאֶרְחַ֖ץ בְּנִקָּי֣וֹן כַּפָּֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 73:13
Psalm 73:14For all day long have I been plagued, and punished every morning.
Psalm 73:143  וָאֱהִ֣י נָ֭גוּעַ כָּל־הַיּ֑וֹם וְ֝תוֹכַחְתִּ֗י לַבְּקָרִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 73:14
Psalm 73:15If I had said, |I will speak thus;| behold, I would have betrayed the generation of your children.
Psalm 73:153  אִם־אָ֭מַרְתִּי אֲסַפְּרָ֥ה כְמ֑וֹ הִנֵּ֤ה ד֭וֹר בָּנֶ֣יךָ בָגָֽדְתִּי׃ ‬
Psalm 73:15
Psalm 73:16When I tried to understand this, it was too painful for me;
Psalm 73:163  וָֽ֭אֲחַשְּׁבָה לָדַ֣עַת זֹ֑את עָמָ֖ל *היא **ה֣וּא בְעֵינָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 73:16
Psalm 73:17Until I entered God's sanctuary, and considered their latter end.
Psalm 73:173  עַד־אָ֭בוֹא אֶל־מִקְדְּשֵׁי־אֵ֑ל אָ֝בִ֗ינָה לְאַחֲרִיתָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 73:17
Psalm 73:18Surely you set them in slippery places. You throw them down to destruction.
Psalm 73:183  אַ֣ךְ בַּ֭חֲלָקוֹת תָּשִׁ֣ית לָ֑מוֹ הִ֝פַּלְתָּ֗ם לְמַשּׁוּאֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 73:18
Psalm 73:19How they are suddenly destroyed! They are completely swept away with terrors.
Psalm 73:193  אֵ֤יךְ הָי֣וּ לְשַׁמָּ֣ה כְרָ֑גַע סָ֥פוּ תַ֝֗מּוּ מִן־בַּלָּהֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 73:19
Psalm 73:20As a dream when one wakes up, so, Lord, when you awake, you will despise their fantasies.
Psalm 73:203  כַּחֲל֥וֹם מֵהָקִ֑יץ אֲ֝דֹנָי בָּעִ֤יר ׀ צַלְמָ֬ם תִּבְזֶֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 73:20
Psalm 73:21For my soul was grieved. I was embittered in my heart.
Psalm 73:213  כִּ֭י יִתְחַמֵּ֣ץ לְבָבִ֑י וְ֝כִלְיוֹתַ֗י אֶשְׁתּוֹנָֽן׃ ‬
Psalm 73:21
Psalm 73:22I was so senseless and ignorant. I was a brute beast before you.
Psalm 73:223  וַאֲנִי־בַ֭עַר וְלֹ֣א אֵדָ֑ע בְּ֝הֵמ֗וֹת הָיִ֥יתִי עִמָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 73:22
Psalm 73:23Nevertheless, I am continually with you. You have held my right hand.
Psalm 73:233  וַאֲנִ֣י תָמִ֣יד עִמָּ֑ךְ אָ֝חַ֗זְתָּ בְּיַד־יְמִינִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 73:23
Psalm 73:24You will guide me with your counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
Psalm 73:243  בַּעֲצָתְךָ֥ תַנְחֵ֑נִי וְ֝אַחַ֗ר כָּב֥וֹד תִּקָּחֵֽנִי׃ ‬
Psalm 73:24
Psalm 73:25Who do I have in heaven? There is no one on earth who I desire besides you.
Psalm 73:253  מִי־לִ֥י בַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְ֝עִמְּךָ֗ לֹא־חָפַ֥צְתִּי בָאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 73:25
Psalm 73:26My flesh and my heart fails, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
Psalm 73:263  כָּלָ֥ה שְׁאֵרִ֗י וּלְבָ֫בִ֥י צוּר־לְבָבִ֥י וְחֶלְקִ֗י אֱלֹהִ֥ים לְעוֹלָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 73:26
Psalm 73:27For, behold, those who are far from you shall perish. You have destroyed all those who are unfaithful to you.
Psalm 73:273  כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה רְחֵקֶ֣יךָ יֹאבֵ֑דוּ הִ֝צְמַ֗תָּה כָּל־זוֹנֶ֥ה מִמֶּֽךָּ׃ ‬
Psalm 73:27
Psalm 73:28But it is good for me to come close to God. I have made the Lord Yahweh my refuge, that I may tell of all your works. A contemplation by Asaph.
Psalm 73:283  וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ קִֽרֲבַ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֗ים לִ֫י־ט֥וֹב שַׁתִּ֤י ׀ בַּאדֹנָ֣י יְהֹוִ֣ה מַחְסִ֑י לְ֝סַפֵּ֗ר כָּל־מַלְאֲכוֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 73:28
Psalm 74:1God, why have you rejected us forever? Why does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?
Psalm 74:14  מַשְׂכִּ֗יל לְאָ֫סָ֥ף לָמָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים זָנַ֣חְתָּ לָנֶ֑צַח יֶעְשַׁ֥ן אַ֝פְּךָ֗ בְּצֹ֣אן מַרְעִיתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 74:1
Psalm 74:2Remember your congregation, which you purchased of old, which you have redeemed to be the tribe of your inheritance; Mount Zion, in which you have lived.
Psalm 74:24  זְכֹ֤ר עֲדָתְךָ֨ ׀ קָ֘נִ֤יתָ קֶּ֗דֶם גָּ֭אַלְתָּ שֵׁ֣בֶט נַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ הַר־צִ֝יּ֗וֹן זֶ֤ה ׀ שָׁכַ֬נְתָּ בּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 74:2
Psalm 74:3Lift up your feet to the perpetual ruins, all the evil that the enemy has done in the sanctuary.
Psalm 74:34  הָרִ֣ימָה פְ֭עָמֶיךָ לְמַשֻּׁא֣וֹת נֶ֑צַח כָּל־הֵרַ֖ע אוֹיֵ֣ב בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 74:3
Psalm 74:4Your adversaries have roared in the midst of your assembly. They have set up their standards as signs.
Psalm 74:44  שָׁאֲג֣וּ צֹ֭רְרֶיךָ בְּקֶ֣רֶב מוֹעֲדֶ֑ךָ שָׂ֖מוּ אוֹתֹתָ֣ם אֹתֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 74:4
Psalm 74:5They behaved like men wielding axes, cutting through a thicket of trees.
Psalm 74:54  יִ֭וָּדַע כְּמֵבִ֣יא לְמָ֑עְלָה בִּֽסֲבָךְ־עֵ֝֗ץ קַרְדֻּמּֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 74:5
Psalm 74:6Now they break all its carved work down with hatchet and hammers.
Psalm 74:64  *ועת **וְ֭עַתָּה פִּתּוּחֶ֣יהָ יָּ֑חַד בְּכַשִּׁ֥יל וְ֝כֵֽילַפֹּ֗ת יַהֲלֹמֽוּן׃ ‬
Psalm 74:6
Psalm 74:7They have burned your sanctuary to the ground. They have profaned the dwelling place of your Name.
Psalm 74:74  שִׁלְח֣וּ בָ֭אֵשׁ מִקְדָּשֶׁ֑ךָ לָ֝אָ֗רֶץ חִלְּל֥וּ מִֽשְׁכַּן־שְׁמֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 74:7
Psalm 74:8They said in their heart, |We will crush them completely.| They have burned up all the places in the land where God was worshiped.
Psalm 74:84  אָמְר֣וּ בְ֭לִבָּם נִינָ֣ם יָ֑חַד שָׂרְפ֖וּ כָל־מוֹעֲדֵי־אֵ֣ל בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 74:8
Psalm 74:9We see no miraculous signs. There is no longer any prophet, neither is there among us anyone who knows how long.
Psalm 74:94  אֽוֹתֹתֵ֗ינוּ לֹ֥א רָ֫אִ֥ינוּ אֵֽין־ע֥וֹד נָבִ֑יא וְלֹֽא־אִ֝תָּ֗נוּ יֹדֵ֥עַ עַד־מָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 74:9
Psalm 74:10How long, God, shall the adversary reproach? Shall the enemy blaspheme your name forever?
Psalm 74:104  עַד־מָתַ֣י אֱ֭לֹהִים יְחָ֣רֶף צָ֑ר יְנָ֘אֵ֤ץ אוֹיֵ֖ב שִׁמְךָ֣ לָנֶֽצַח׃ ‬
Psalm 74:10
Psalm 74:11Why do you draw back your hand, even your right hand? Take it out of your pocket and consume them!
Psalm 74:114  לָ֤מָּה תָשִׁ֣יב יָ֭דְךָ וִֽימִינֶ֑ךָ מִקֶּ֖רֶב *חוקך **חֽ͏ֵיקְךָ֣ כַלֵּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 74:11
Psalm 74:12Yet God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
Psalm 74:124  וֵ֭אלֹהִים מַלְכִּ֣י מִקֶּ֑דֶם פֹּעֵ֥ל יְ֝שׁוּע֗וֹת בְּקֶ֣רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 74:12
Psalm 74:13You divided the sea by your strength. You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.
Psalm 74:134  אַתָּ֤ה פוֹרַ֣רְתָּ בְעָזְּךָ֣ יָ֑ם שִׁבַּ֖רְתָּ רָאשֵׁ֥י תַ֝נִּינִ֗ים עַל־הַמָּֽיִם׃ ‬
Psalm 74:13
Psalm 74:14You broke the heads of Leviathan in pieces. You gave him as food to people and desert creatures.
Psalm 74:144  אַתָּ֣ה רִ֭צַּצְתָּ רָאשֵׁ֣י לִוְיָתָ֑ן תִּתְּנֶ֥נּוּ מַ֝אֲכָ֗ל לְעָ֣ם לְצִיִּֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 74:14
Psalm 74:15You opened up spring and stream. You dried up mighty rivers.
Psalm 74:154  אַתָּ֣ה בָ֭קַעְתָּ מַעְיָ֣ן וָנָ֑חַל אַתָּ֥ה ה֝וֹבַ֗שְׁתָּ נַהֲר֥וֹת אֵיתָֽן׃ ‬
Psalm 74:15
Psalm 74:16The day is yours, the night is also yours. You have prepared the light and the sun.
Psalm 74:164  לְךָ֣ י֭וֹם אַף־לְךָ֥ לָ֑יְלָה אַתָּ֥ה הֲ֝כִינ֗וֹתָ מָא֥וֹר וָשָֽׁמֶשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 74:16
Psalm 74:17You have set all the boundaries of the earth. You have made summer and winter.
Psalm 74:174  אַתָּ֣ה הִ֭צַּבְתָּ כָּל־גְּבוּל֣וֹת אָ֑רֶץ קַ֥יִץ וָ֝חֹ֗רֶף אַתָּ֥ה יְצַרְתָּם׃ ‬
Psalm 74:17
Psalm 74:18Remember this, that the enemy has mocked you, Yahweh. Foolish people have blasphemed your name.
Psalm 74:184  זְכָר־זֹ֗את א֭וֹיֵב חֵרֵ֣ף ׀ יְהוָ֑ה וְעַ֥ם נָ֝בָ֗ל נִֽאֲצ֥וּ שְׁמֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 74:18
Psalm 74:19Don't deliver the soul of your dove to wild beasts. Don't forget the life of your poor forever.
Psalm 74:194  אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן לְ֭חַיַּת נֶ֣פֶשׁ תּוֹרֶ֑ךָ חַיַּ֥ת עֲ֝נִיֶּ֗יךָ אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח לָנֶֽצַח׃ ‬
Psalm 74:19
Psalm 74:20Honor your covenant, for haunts of violence fill the dark places of the earth.
Psalm 74:204  הַבֵּ֥ט לַבְּרִ֑ית כִּ֥י מָלְא֥וּ מַחֲשַׁכֵּי־אֶ֝֗רֶץ נְא֣וֹת חָמָֽס׃ ‬
Psalm 74:20
Psalm 74:21Don't let the oppressed return ashamed. Let the poor and needy praise your name.
Psalm 74:214  אַל־יָשֹׁ֣ב דַּ֣ךְ נִכְלָ֑ם עָנִ֥י וְ֝אֶבְי֗וֹן יְֽהַלְל֥וּ שְׁמֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 74:21
Psalm 74:22Arise, God! Plead your own cause. Remember how the foolish man mocks you all day.
Psalm 74:224  קוּמָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים רִיבָ֣ה רִיבֶ֑ךָ זְכֹ֥ר חֶרְפָּתְךָ֥ מִנִּי־נָ֝בָ֗ל כָּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃ ‬
Psalm 74:22
Psalm 74:23Don't forget the voice of your adversaries. The tumult of those who rise up against you ascends continually. For the Chief Musician. To the tune of |Do Not Destroy.| A Psalm by Asaph. A song.
Psalm 74:234  אַל־תִּ֭שְׁכַּח ק֣וֹל צֹרְרֶ֑יךָ שְׁא֥וֹן קָ֝מֶ֗יךָ עֹלֶ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃ ‬
Psalm 74:23
Psalm 75:1We give thanks to you, God. We give thanks, for your Name is near. Men tell about your wondrous works.
Psalm 75:15  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אַל־תַּשְׁחֵ֑ת מִזְמ֖וֹר לְאָסָ֣ף שִֽׁיר׃ ‬
Psalm 75:1
Psalm 75:2When I choose the appointed time, I will judge blamelessly.
Psalm 75:25  ה֘וֹדִ֤ינוּ לְּךָ֨ ׀ אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים ה֭וֹדִינוּ וְקָר֣וֹב שְׁמֶ֑ךָ סִ֝פְּר֗וּ נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 75:2
Psalm 75:3The earth and all its inhabitants quake. I firmly hold its pillars. Selah.
Psalm 75:35  כִּ֭י אֶקַּ֣ח מוֹעֵ֑ד אֲ֝נִ֗י מֵישָׁרִ֥ים אֶשְׁפֹּֽט׃ ‬
Psalm 75:3
Psalm 75:4I said to the arrogant, |Don't boast!| I said to the wicked, |Don't lift up the horn.
Psalm 75:45  נְֽמֹגִ֗ים אֶ֥רֶץ וְכָל־יֹשְׁבֶ֑יהָ אָנֹכִ֨י תִכַּ֖נְתִּי עַמּוּדֶ֣יהָ סֶּֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 75:4
Psalm 75:5Don't lift up your horn on high. Don't speak with a stiff neck.|
Psalm 75:55  אָמַ֣רְתִּי לַֽ֭הוֹלְלִים אַל־תָּהֹ֑לּוּ וְ֝לָרְשָׁעִ֗ים אַל־תָּרִ֥ימוּ קָֽרֶן׃ ‬
Psalm 75:5
Psalm 75:6For neither from the east, nor from the west, nor yet from the south, comes exaltation.
Psalm 75:65  אַל־תָּרִ֣ימוּ לַמָּר֣וֹם קַרְנְכֶ֑ם תְּדַבְּר֖וּ בְצַוָּ֣אר עָתָֽק׃ ‬
Psalm 75:6
Psalm 75:7But God is the judge. He puts down one, and lifts up another.
Psalm 75:75  כִּ֤י לֹ֣א מִ֭מּוֹצָא וּמִֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב וְ֝לֹ֗א מִמִּדְבַּ֥ר הָרִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 75:7
Psalm 75:8For in the hand of Yahweh there is a cup, full of foaming wine mixed with spices. He pours it out. Indeed the wicked of the earth drink and drink it to its very dregs.
Psalm 75:85  כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים שֹׁפֵ֑ט זֶ֥ה יַ֝שְׁפִּ֗יל וְזֶ֣ה יָרִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 75:8
Psalm 75:9But I will declare this forever: I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
Psalm 75:95  כִּ֤י כ֪וֹס בְּֽיַד־יְהוָ֡ה וְיַ֤יִן חָמַ֨ר ׀ מָ֥לֵא מֶסֶךְ֮ וַיַּגֵּ֢ר מִ֫זֶּ֥ה אַךְ־שְׁ֭מָרֶיהָ יִמְצ֣וּ יִשְׁתּ֑וּ כֹּ֝֗ל רִשְׁעֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 75:9
Psalm 75:10I will cut off all the horns of the wicked, but the horns of the righteous shall be lifted up. For the Chief Musician. On stringed instruments. A Psalm by Asaph. A song.
Psalm 75:105  וַ֭אֲנִי אַגִּ֣יד לְעֹלָ֑ם אֲ֝זַמְּרָ֗ה לֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 75:10
Psalm 75:11(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 75:115  וְכָל־קַרְנֵ֣י רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֲגַדֵּ֑עַ תְּ֝רוֹמַ֗מְנָה קַֽרְנ֥וֹת צַדִּֽיק׃ ‬
Psalm 75:11
Psalm 76:1In Judah, God is known. His name is great in Israel.
Psalm 76:16  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֑ת מִזְמ֖וֹר לְאָסָ֣ף שִֽׁיר׃ ‬
Psalm 76:1
Psalm 76:2His tabernacle is also in Salem; His dwelling place in Zion.
Psalm 76:26  נוֹדָ֣ע בִּֽיהוּדָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּ֝יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל גָּד֥וֹל שְׁמֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 76:2
Psalm 76:3There he broke the flaming arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah.
Psalm 76:36  וַיְהִ֣י בְשָׁלֵ֣ם סֻכּ֑וֹ וּמְע֖וֹנָת֣וֹ בְצִיּֽוֹן׃ ‬
Psalm 76:3
Psalm 76:4Glorious are you, and excellent, more than mountains of game.
Psalm 76:46  שָׁ֭מָּה שִׁבַּ֣ר רִשְׁפֵי־קָ֑שֶׁת מָגֵ֬ן וְחֶ֖רֶב וּמִלְחָמָ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 76:4
Psalm 76:5Valiant men lie plundered, they have slept their last sleep. None of the men of war can lift their hands.
Psalm 76:56  נָ֭אוֹר אַתָּ֥ה אַדִּ֗יר מֵֽהַרְרֵי־טָֽרֶף׃ ‬
Psalm 76:5
Psalm 76:6At your rebuke, God of Jacob, both chariot and horse are cast into a deep sleep.
Psalm 76:66  אֶשְׁתּוֹלְל֨וּ ׀ אַבִּ֣ירֵי לֵ֭ב נָמ֣וּ שְׁנָתָ֑ם וְלֹא־מָצְא֖וּ כָל־אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֣יִל יְדֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 76:6
Psalm 76:7You, even you, are to be feared. Who can stand in your sight when you are angry?
Psalm 76:76  מִ֭גַּעֲרָ֣תְךָ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֑ב נִ֝רְדָּ֗ם וְרֶ֣כֶב וָסֽוּס׃ ‬
Psalm 76:7
Psalm 76:8You pronounced judgment from heaven. The earth feared, and was silent,
Psalm 76:86  אַתָּ֤ה ׀ נ֥וֹרָא אַ֗תָּה וּמִֽי־יַעֲמֹ֥ד לְפָנֶ֗יךָ מֵאָ֥ז אַפֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 76:8
Psalm 76:9when God arose to judgment, to save all the afflicted ones of the earth. Selah.
Psalm 76:96  מִ֭שָּׁמַיִם הִשְׁמַ֣עְתָּ דִּ֑ין אֶ֖רֶץ יָֽרְאָ֣ה וְשָׁקָֽטָה׃ ‬
Psalm 76:9
Psalm 76:10Surely the wrath of man praises you. The survivors of your wrath are restrained.
Psalm 76:106  בְּקוּם־לַמִּשְׁפָּ֥ט אֱלֹהִ֑ים לְהוֹשִׁ֖יעַ כָּל־עַנְוֵי־אֶ֣רֶץ סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 76:10
Psalm 76:11Make vows to Yahweh your God, and fulfill them! Let all of his neighbors bring presents to him who is to be feared.
Psalm 76:116  כִּֽי־חֲמַ֣ת אָדָ֣ם תּוֹדֶ֑ךָּ שְׁאֵרִ֖ית חֵמֹ֣ת תַּחְגֹּֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 76:11
Psalm 76:12He will cut off the spirit of princes. He is feared by the kings of the earth. For the Chief Musician. To Jeduthun. A Psalm by Asaph.
Psalm 76:126  נִֽדֲר֣וּ וְשַׁלְּמוּ֮ לַיהוָ֢ה אֱ‍ֽלֹהֵ֫יכֶ֥ם כָּל־סְבִיבָ֑יו יוֹבִ֥ילוּ שַׁ֝֗י לַמּוֹרָֽא׃ ‬
Psalm 76:12
Psalm 76:13(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 76:136  יִ֭בְצֹר ר֣וּחַ נְגִידִ֑ים נ֝וֹרָ֗א לְמַלְכֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 76:13
Psalm 77:1My cry goes to God! Indeed, I cry to God for help, and for him to listen to me.
Psalm 77:17  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־*ידיתון **יְדוּת֗וּן לְאָסָ֥ף מִזְמֽוֹר׃ ‬
Psalm 77:1
Psalm 77:2In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord. My hand was stretched out in the night, and didn't get tired. My soul refused to be comforted.
Psalm 77:27  קוֹלִ֣י אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֣ים וְאֶצְעָ֑קָה קוֹלִ֥י אֶל־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים וְהַאֲזִ֥ין אֵלָֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 77:2
Psalm 77:3I remember God, and I groan. I complain, and my spirit is overwhelmed. Selah.
Psalm 77:37  בְּי֥וֹם צָרָתִי֮ אֲדֹנָ֢י דָּ֫רָ֥שְׁתִּי יָדִ֤י ׀ לַ֣יְלָה נִ֭גְּרָה וְלֹ֣א תָפ֑וּג מֵאֲנָ֖ה הִנָּחֵ֣ם נַפְשִֽׁי׃ ‬
Psalm 77:3
Psalm 77:4You hold my eyelids open. I am so troubled that I can't speak.
Psalm 77:47  אֶזְכְּרָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים וְאֶֽהֱמָיָ֑ה אָשִׂ֓יחָה ׀ וְתִתְעַטֵּ֖ף רוּחִ֣י סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 77:4
Psalm 77:5I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.
Psalm 77:57  אָ֭חַזְתָּ שְׁמֻר֣וֹת עֵינָ֑י נִ֝פְעַ֗מְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אֲדַבֵּֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 77:5
Psalm 77:6I remember my song in the night. I consider in my own heart; my spirit diligently inquires:
Psalm 77:67  חִשַּׁ֣בְתִּי יָמִ֣ים מִקֶּ֑דֶם שְׁ֝נ֗וֹת עוֹלָמִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 77:6
Psalm 77:7|Will the Lord reject us forever? Will he be favorable no more?
Psalm 77:77  אֶֽזְכְּרָ֥ה נְגִינָתִ֗י בַּ֫לָּ֥יְלָה עִם־לְבָבִ֥י אָשִׂ֑יחָה וַיְחַפֵּ֥שׂ רוּחִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 77:7
Psalm 77:8Has his loving kindness vanished forever? Does his promise fail for generations?
Psalm 77:87  הַֽ֭לְעוֹלָמִים יִזְנַ֥ח ׀ אֲדֹנָ֑י וְלֹֽא־יֹסִ֖יף לִרְצ֣וֹת עֽוֹד׃ ‬
Psalm 77:8
Psalm 77:9Has God forgotten to be gracious? Has he, in anger, withheld his compassion?| Selah.
Psalm 77:97  הֶאָפֵ֣ס לָנֶ֣צַח חַסְדּ֑וֹ גָּ֥מַר אֹ֝֗מֶר לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 77:9
Psalm 77:10Then I thought, |I will appeal to this: the years of the right hand of the Most High.|
Psalm 77:107  הֲשָׁכַ֣ח חַנּ֣וֹת אֵ֑ל אִם־קָפַ֥ץ בְּ֝אַ֗ף רַחֲמָ֥יו סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 77:10
Psalm 77:11I will remember Yah's deeds; for I will remember your wonders of old.
Psalm 77:117  וָ֭אֹמַר חַלּ֣וֹתִי הִ֑יא שְׁ֝נ֗וֹת יְמִ֣ין עֶלְיֽוֹן׃ ‬
Psalm 77:11
Psalm 77:12I will also meditate on all your work, and consider your doings.
Psalm 77:127  *אזכיר **אֶזְכּ֥וֹר מַֽעַלְלֵי־יָ֑הּ כִּֽי־אֶזְכְּרָ֖ה מִקֶּ֣דֶם פִּלְאֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 77:12
Psalm 77:13Your way, God, is in the sanctuary. What god is great like God?
Psalm 77:137  וְהָגִ֥יתִי בְכָל־פָּעֳלֶ֑ךָ וּֽבַעֲלִ֖ילוֹתֶ֣יךָ אָשִֽׂיחָה׃ ‬
Psalm 77:13
Psalm 77:14You are the God who does wonders. You have made your strength known among the peoples.
Psalm 77:147  אֱ֭לֹהִים בַּקֹּ֣דֶשׁ דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ מִי־אֵ֥ל גָּ֝ד֗וֹל כֵּֽאלֹהִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 77:14
Psalm 77:15You have redeemed your people with your arm, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
Psalm 77:157  אַתָּ֣ה הָ֭אֵל עֹ֣שֵׂה פֶ֑לֶא הוֹדַ֖עְתָּ בָעַמִּ֣ים עֻזֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 77:15
Psalm 77:16The waters saw you, God. The waters saw you, and they writhed. The depths also convulsed.
Psalm 77:167  גָּאַ֣לְתָּ בִּזְר֣וֹעַ עַמֶּ֑ךָ בְּנֵי־יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְיוֹסֵ֣ף סֶֽלָה׃ ‬
Psalm 77:16
Psalm 77:17The clouds poured out water. The skies resounded with thunder. Your arrows also flashed around.
Psalm 77:177  רָ֘א֤וּךָ מַּ֨יִם ׀ אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֗ים רָא֣וּךָ מַּ֣יִם יָחִ֑ילוּ אַ֝֗ף יִרְגְּז֥וּ תְהֹמֽוֹת׃ ‬
Psalm 77:17
Psalm 77:18The voice of your thunder was in the whirlwind. The lightnings lit up the world. The earth trembled and shook.
Psalm 77:187  זֹ֤רְמוּ מַ֨יִם ׀ עָב֗וֹת ק֭וֹל נָתְנ֣וּ שְׁחָקִ֑ים אַף־חֲ֝צָצֶ֗יךָ יִתְהַלָּֽכוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 77:18
Psalm 77:19Your way was through the sea; your paths through the great waters. Your footsteps were not known.
Psalm 77:197  ק֤וֹל רַעַמְךָ֨ ׀ בַּגַּלְגַּ֗ל הֵאִ֣ירוּ בְרָקִ֣ים תֵּבֵ֑ל רָגְזָ֖ה וַתִּרְעַ֣שׁ הָאָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 77:19
Psalm 77:20You led your people like a flock, by the hand of Moses and Aaron. A contemplation by Asaph.
Psalm 77:207  בַּיָּ֤ם דַּרְכֶּ֗ךָ *ושביליך **וּֽ֭שְׁבִֽילְךָ בְּמַ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים וְ֝עִקְּבוֹתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א נֹדָֽעוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 77:20
Psalm 77:21(Verse absent in World English Bible)
Psalm 77:217  נָחִ֣יתָ כַצֹּ֣אן עַמֶּ֑ךָ בְּֽיַד־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃ ‬
Psalm 77:21
Psalm 78:1Hear my teaching, my people. Turn your ears to the words of my mouth.
Psalm 78:18  מַשְׂכִּ֗יל לְאָ֫סָ֥ף הַאֲזִ֣ינָה עַ֭מִּי תּוֹרָתִ֑י הַטּ֥וּ אָ֝זְנְכֶ֗ם לְאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃ ‬
Psalm 78:1
Psalm 78:2I will open my mouth in a parable. I will utter dark sayings of old,
Psalm 78:28  אֶפְתְּחָ֣ה בְמָשָׁ֣ל פִּ֑י אַבִּ֥יעָה חִ֝יד֗וֹת מִנִּי־קֶֽדֶם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:2
Psalm 78:3Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
Psalm 78:38  אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁ֭מַעְנוּ וַנֵּדָעֵ֑ם וַ֝אֲבוֹתֵ֗ינוּ סִפְּרוּ־לָֽנוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:3
Psalm 78:4We will not hide them from their children, telling to the generation to come the praises of Yahweh, his strength, and his wondrous works that he has done.
Psalm 78:48  לֹ֤א נְכַחֵ֨ד ׀ מִבְּנֵיהֶ֗ם לְד֥וֹר אַחֲר֗וֹן מְֽ֭סַפְּרִים תְּהִלּ֣וֹת יְהוָ֑ה וֶעֱזוּז֥וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָֽׂה׃ ‬
Psalm 78:4
Psalm 78:5For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a teaching in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children;
Psalm 78:58  וַיָּ֤קֶם עֵד֨וּת ׀ בְּֽיַעֲקֹ֗ב וְתוֹרָה֮ שָׂ֤ם בְּיִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִ֭וָּה אֶת־אֲבוֹתֵ֑ינוּ לְ֝הוֹדִיעָ֗ם לִבְנֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:5
Psalm 78:6that the generation to come might know, even the children who should be born; who should arise and tell their children,
Psalm 78:68  לְמַ֤עַן יֵדְע֨וּ ׀ דּ֣וֹר אַ֭חֲרוֹן בָּנִ֣ים יִוָּלֵ֑דוּ יָ֝קֻ֗מוּ וִֽיסַפְּר֥וּ לִבְנֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:6
Psalm 78:7that they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments,
Psalm 78:78  וְיָשִׂ֥ימוּ בֵֽאלֹהִ֗ים כִּ֫סְלָ֥ם וְלֹ֣א יִ֭שְׁכְּחוּ מַֽעַלְלֵי־אֵ֑ל וּמִצְוֺתָ֥יו יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:7
Psalm 78:8and might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation that didn't make their hearts loyal, whose spirit was not steadfast with God.
Psalm 78:88  וְלֹ֤א יִהְי֨וּ ׀ כַּאֲבוֹתָ֗ם דּוֹר֮ סוֹרֵ֢ר וּמֹ֫רֶ֥ה דּ֭וֹר לֹא־הֵכִ֣ין לִבּ֑וֹ וְלֹא־נֶאֶמְנָ֖ה אֶת־אֵ֣ל רוּחֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:8
Psalm 78:9The children of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.
Psalm 78:98  בְּֽנֵי־אֶפְרַ֗יִם נוֹשְׁקֵ֥י רוֹמֵי־קָ֑שֶׁת הָ֝פְכ֗וּ בְּי֣וֹם קְרָֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 78:9
Psalm 78:10They didn't keep God's covenant, and refused to walk in his law.
Psalm 78:108  לֹ֣א שָׁ֭מְרוּ בְּרִ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים וּ֝בְתוֹרָת֗וֹ מֵאֲנ֥וּ לָלֶֽכֶת׃ ‬
Psalm 78:10
Psalm 78:11They forgot his doings, his wondrous works that he had shown them.
Psalm 78:118  וַיִּשְׁכְּח֥וּ עֲלִילוֹתָ֑יו וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶרְאָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:11
Psalm 78:12He did marvelous things in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
Psalm 78:128  נֶ֣גֶד אֲ֭בוֹתָם עָ֣שָׂה פֶ֑לֶא בְּאֶ֖רֶץ מִצְרַ֣יִם שְׂדֵה־צֹֽעַן׃ ‬
Psalm 78:12
Psalm 78:13He split the sea, and caused them to pass through. He made the waters stand as a heap.
Psalm 78:138  בָּ֣קַע יָ֭ם וַיַּֽעֲבִירֵ֑ם וַֽיַּצֶּב־מַ֥יִם כְּמוֹ־נֵֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 78:13
Psalm 78:14In the daytime he also led them with a cloud, and all night with a light of fire.
Psalm 78:148  וַיַּנְחֵ֣ם בֶּעָנָ֣ן יוֹמָ֑ם וְכָל־הַ֝לַּ֗יְלָה בְּא֣וֹר אֵֽשׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:14
Psalm 78:15He split rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink abundantly as out of the depths.
Psalm 78:158  יְבַקַּ֣ע צֻ֭רִים בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַ֝יַּ֗שְׁקְ כִּתְהֹמ֥וֹת רַבָּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 78:15
Psalm 78:16He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.
Psalm 78:168  וַיּוֹצִ֣א נוֹזְלִ֣ים מִסָּ֑לַע וַיּ֖וֹרֶד כַּנְּהָר֣וֹת מָֽיִם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:16
Psalm 78:17Yet they still went on to sin against him, to rebel against the Most High in the desert.
Psalm 78:178  וַיּוֹסִ֣יפוּ ע֭וֹד לַחֲטֹא־ל֑וֹ לַֽמְר֥וֹת עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן בַּצִּיָּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 78:17
Psalm 78:18They tempted God in their heart by asking food according to their desire.
Psalm 78:188  וַיְנַסּוּ־אֵ֥ל בִּלְבָבָ֑ם לִֽשְׁאָל־אֹ֥כֶל לְנַפְשָֽׁם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:18
Psalm 78:19Yes, they spoke against God. They said, |Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
Psalm 78:198  וַֽיְדַבְּר֗וּ בֵּֽאלֹ֫הִ֥ים אָ֭מְרוּ הֲי֣וּכַל אֵ֑ל לַעֲרֹ֥ךְ שֻׁ֝לְחָ֗ן בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 78:19
Psalm 78:20Behold, he struck the rock, so that waters gushed out, and streams overflowed. Can he give bread also? Will he provide flesh for his people?|
Psalm 78:208  הֵ֤ן הִכָּה־צ֨וּר ׀ וַיָּז֣וּבוּ מַיִם֮ וּנְחָלִ֢ים יִ֫שְׁטֹ֥פוּ הֲגַם־לֶ֭חֶם י֣וּכַל תֵּ֑ת אִם־יָכִ֖ין שְׁאֵ֣ר לְעַמּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:20
Psalm 78:21Therefore Yahweh heard, and was angry. A fire was kindled against Jacob, anger also went up against Israel,
Psalm 78:218  לָכֵ֤ן ׀ שָׁמַ֥ע יְהוָ֗ה וַֽיִּתְעַבָּ֥ר וְ֭אֵשׁ נִשְּׂקָ֣ה בְיַעֲקֹ֑ב וְגַם־אַ֝֗ף עָלָ֥ה בְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 78:21
Psalm 78:22because they didn't believe in God, and didn't trust in his salvation.
Psalm 78:228  כִּ֤י לֹ֣א הֶ֭אֱמִינוּ בֵּאלֹהִ֑ים וְלֹ֥א בָ֝טְח֗וּ בִּֽישׁוּעָתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:22
Psalm 78:23Yet he commanded the skies above, and opened the doors of heaven.
Psalm 78:238  וַיְצַ֣ו שְׁחָקִ֣ים מִמָּ֑עַל וְדַלְתֵ֖י שָׁמַ֣יִם פָּתָֽח׃ ‬
Psalm 78:23
Psalm 78:24He rained down manna on them to eat, and gave them food from the sky.
Psalm 78:248  וַיַּמְטֵ֬ר עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם מָ֣ן לֶאֱכֹ֑ל וּדְגַן־שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם נָ֣תַן לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:24
Psalm 78:25Man ate the bread of angels. He sent them food to the full.
Psalm 78:258  לֶ֣חֶם אַ֭בִּירִים אָ֣כַל אִ֑ישׁ צֵידָ֬ה שָׁלַ֖ח לָהֶ֣ם לָשֹֽׂבַע׃ ‬
Psalm 78:25
Psalm 78:26He caused the east wind to blow in the sky. By his power he guided the south wind.
Psalm 78:268  יַסַּ֣ע קָ֭דִים בַּשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיְנַהֵ֖ג בְּעֻזּ֣וֹ תֵימָֽן׃ ‬
Psalm 78:26
Psalm 78:27He rained also flesh on them as the dust; winged birds as the sand of the seas.
Psalm 78:278  וַיַּמְטֵ֬ר עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּעָפָ֣ר שְׁאֵ֑ר וּֽכְח֥וֹל יַ֝מִּ֗ים ע֣וֹף כָּנָֽף׃ ‬
Psalm 78:27
Psalm 78:28He let them fall in the midst of their camp, around their habitations.
Psalm 78:288  וַ֭יַּפֵּל בְּקֶ֣רֶב מַחֲנֵ֑הוּ סָ֝בִ֗יב לְמִשְׁכְּנֹתָֽיו׃ ‬
Psalm 78:28
Psalm 78:29So they ate, and were well filled. He gave them their own desire.
Psalm 78:298  וַיֹּאכְל֣וּ וַיִּשְׂבְּע֣וּ מְאֹ֑ד וְ֝תַֽאֲוָתָ֗ם יָבִ֥א לָהֶֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:29
Psalm 78:30They didn't turn from their cravings. Their food was yet in their mouths,
Psalm 78:308  לֹא־זָר֥וּ מִתַּאֲוָתָ֑ם ע֝֗וֹד אָכְלָ֥ם בְּפִיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:30
Psalm 78:31when the anger of God went up against them, killed some of the fattest of them, and struck down the young men of Israel.
Psalm 78:318  וְאַ֤ף אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ עָ֘לָ֤ה בָהֶ֗ם וַֽ֭יַּהֲרֹג בְּמִשְׁמַנֵּיהֶ֑ם וּבַחוּרֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל הִכְרִֽיעַ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:31
Psalm 78:32For all this they still sinned, and didn't believe in his wondrous works.
Psalm 78:328  בְּכָל־זֹ֭את חָֽטְאוּ־ע֑וֹד וְלֹֽא־הֶ֝אֱמִ֗ינוּ בְּנִפְלְאוֹתָֽיו׃ ‬
Psalm 78:32
Psalm 78:33Therefore he consumed their days in vanity, and their years in terror.
Psalm 78:338  וַיְכַל־בַּהֶ֥בֶל יְמֵיהֶ֑ם וּ֝שְׁנוֹתָ֗ם בַּבֶּהָלָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 78:33
Psalm 78:34When he killed them, then they inquired after him. They returned and sought God earnestly.
Psalm 78:348  אִם־הֲרָגָ֥ם וּדְרָשׁ֑וּהוּ וְ֝שָׁ֗בוּ וְשִֽׁחֲרוּ־אֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 78:34
Psalm 78:35They remembered that God was their rock, the Most High God, their redeemer.
Psalm 78:358  וַֽ֭יִּזְכְּרוּ כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֣ים צוּרָ֑ם וְאֵ֥ל עֶ֝לְיוֹן גֹּאֲלָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:35
Psalm 78:36But they flattered him with their mouth, and lied to him with their tongue.
Psalm 78:368  וַיְפַתּ֥וּהוּ בְּפִיהֶ֑ם וּ֝בִלְשׁוֹנָ֗ם יְכַזְּבוּ־לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:36
Psalm 78:37For their heart was not right with him, neither were they faithful in his covenant.
Psalm 78:378  וְ֭לִבָּם לֹא־נָכ֣וֹן עִמּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א נֶ֝אֶמְנ֗וּ בִּבְרִיתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:37
Psalm 78:38But he, being merciful, forgave iniquity, and didn't destroy them. Yes, many times he turned his anger away, and didn't stir up all his wrath.
Psalm 78:388  וְה֤וּא רַח֨וּם ׀ יְכַפֵּ֥ר עָוֺן֮ וְֽלֹא־יַ֫שְׁחִ֥ית וְ֭הִרְבָּה לְהָשִׁ֣יב אַפּ֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־יָ֝עִיר כָּל־חֲמָתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:38
Psalm 78:39He remembered that they were but flesh, a wind that passes away, and doesn't come again.
Psalm 78:398  וַ֭יִּזְכֹּר כִּי־בָשָׂ֣ר הֵ֑מָּה ר֥וּחַ ה֝וֹלֵ֗ךְ וְלֹ֣א יָשֽׁוּב׃ ‬
Psalm 78:39
Psalm 78:40How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness, and grieved him in the desert!
Psalm 78:408  כַּ֭מָּה יַמְר֣וּהוּ בַמִּדְבָּ֑ר יַ֝עֲצִיב֗וּהוּ בִּֽישִׁימֽוֹן׃ ‬
Psalm 78:40
Psalm 78:41They turned again and tempted God, and provoked the Holy One of Israel.
Psalm 78:418  וַיָּשׁ֣וּבוּ וַיְנַסּ֣וּ אֵ֑ל וּקְד֖וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל הִתְווּ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:41
Psalm 78:42They didn't remember his hand, nor the day when he redeemed them from the adversary;
Psalm 78:428  לֹא־זָכְר֥וּ אֶת־יָד֑וֹ י֝֗וֹם אֲ‍ֽשֶׁר־פָּדָ֥ם מִנִּי־צָֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 78:42
Psalm 78:43how he set his signs in Egypt, his wonders in the field of Zoan,
Psalm 78:438  אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם בְּ֭מִצְרַיִם אֹֽתוֹתָ֑יו וּ֝מוֹפְתָ֗יו בִּשְׂדֵה־צֹֽעַן׃ ‬
Psalm 78:43
Psalm 78:44he turned their rivers into blood, and their streams, so that they could not drink.
Psalm 78:448  וַיַּהֲפֹ֣ךְ לְ֭דָם יְאֹרֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝נֹזְלֵיהֶ֗ם בַּל־יִשְׁתָּיֽוּן׃ ‬
Psalm 78:44
Psalm 78:45He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.
Psalm 78:458  יְשַׁלַּ֬ח בָּהֶ֣ם עָ֭רֹב וַיֹּאכְלֵ֑ם וּ֝צְפַרְדֵּ֗עַ וַתַּשְׁחִיתֵֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:45
Psalm 78:46He gave also their increase to the caterpillar, and their labor to the locust.
Psalm 78:468  וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לֶחָסִ֣יל יְבוּלָ֑ם וִֽ֝יגִיעָ֗ם לָאַרְבֶּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 78:46
Psalm 78:47He destroyed their vines with hail, their sycamore fig trees with frost.
Psalm 78:478  יַהֲרֹ֣ג בַּבָּרָ֣ד גַּפְנָ֑ם וְ֝שִׁקְמוֹתָ֗ם בַּֽחֲנָמַֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 78:47
Psalm 78:48He gave over their livestock also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
Psalm 78:488  וַיַּסְגֵּ֣ר לַבָּרָ֣ד בְּעִירָ֑ם וּ֝מִקְנֵיהֶ֗ם לָרְשָׁפִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 78:48
Psalm 78:49He threw on them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, indignation, and trouble, and a band of angels of evil.
Psalm 78:498  יְשַׁלַּח־בָּ֨ם ׀ חֲר֬וֹן אַפּ֗וֹ עֶבְרָ֣ה וָזַ֣עַם וְצָרָ֑ה מִ֝שְׁלַ֗חַת מַלְאֲכֵ֥י רָעִֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 78:49
Psalm 78:50He made a path for his anger. He didn't spare their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence,
Psalm 78:508  יְפַלֵּ֥ס נָתִ֗יב לְאַ֫פּ֥וֹ לֹא־חָשַׂ֣ךְ מִמָּ֣וֶת נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְ֝חַיָּתָ֗ם לַדֶּ֥בֶר הִסְגִּֽיר׃ ‬
Psalm 78:50
Psalm 78:51and struck all the firstborn in Egypt, the chief of their strength in the tents of Ham.
Psalm 78:518  וַיַּ֣ךְ כָּל־בְּכ֣וֹר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם רֵאשִׁ֥ית א֝וֹנִ֗ים בְּאָהֳלֵי־חָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:51
Psalm 78:52But he led forth his own people like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
Psalm 78:528  וַיַּסַּ֣ע כַּצֹּ֣אן עַמּ֑וֹ וַֽיְנַהֲגֵ֥ם כַּ֝עֵ֗דֶר בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 78:52
Psalm 78:53He led them safely, so that they weren't afraid, but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
Psalm 78:538  וַיַּנְחֵ֣ם לָ֭בֶטַח וְלֹ֣א פָחָ֑דוּ וְאֶת־א֝וֹיְבֵיהֶ֗ם כִּסָּ֥ה הַיָּֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:53
Psalm 78:54He brought them to the border of his sanctuary, to this mountain, which his right hand had taken.
Psalm 78:548  וַ֭יְבִיאֵם אֶל־גְּב֣וּל קָדְשׁ֑וֹ הַר־זֶ֝֗ה קָנְתָ֥ה יְמִינֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:54
Psalm 78:55He also drove out the nations before them, allotted them for an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
Psalm 78:558  וַיְגָ֤רֶשׁ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֨ם ׀ גּוֹיִ֗ם וַֽ֭יַּפִּילֵם בְּחֶ֣בֶל נַחֲלָ֑ה וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֥ן בְּ֝אָהֳלֵיהֶ֗ם שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 78:55
Psalm 78:56Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God, and didn't keep his testimonies;
Psalm 78:568  וַיְנַסּ֣וּ וַ֭יַּמְרוּ אֶת־אֱלֹהִ֣ים עֶלְי֑וֹן וְ֝עֵדוֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א שָׁמָֽרוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:56
Psalm 78:57but turned back, and dealt treacherously like their fathers. They were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
Psalm 78:578  וַיִּסֹּ֣גוּ וַֽ֭יִּבְגְּדוּ כַּאֲבוֹתָ֑ם נֶ֝הְפְּכ֗וּ כְּקֶ֣שֶׁת רְמִיָּֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 78:57
Psalm 78:58For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their engraved images.
Psalm 78:588  וַיַּכְעִיס֥וּהוּ בְּבָמוֹתָ֑ם וּ֝בִפְסִילֵיהֶ֗ם יַקְנִיאֽוּהוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:58
Psalm 78:59When God heard this, he was angry, and greatly abhorred Israel;
Psalm 78:598  שָׁמַ֣ע אֱ֭לֹהִים וַֽיִּתְעַבָּ֑ר וַיִּמְאַ֥ס מְ֝אֹ֗ד בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 78:59
Psalm 78:60So that he forsook the tent of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;
Psalm 78:608  וַ֭יִּטֹּשׁ מִשְׁכַּ֣ן שִׁל֑וֹ אֹ֝֗הֶל שִׁכֵּ֥ן בָּאָדָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:60
Psalm 78:61and delivered his strength into captivity, his glory into the adversary's hand.
Psalm 78:618  וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לַשְּׁבִ֣י עֻזּ֑וֹ וְֽתִפְאַרְתּ֥וֹ בְיַד־צָֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 78:61
Psalm 78:62He also gave his people over to the sword, and was angry with his inheritance.
Psalm 78:628  וַיַּסְגֵּ֣ר לַחֶ֣רֶב עַמּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְנַחֲלָת֗וֹ הִתְעַבָּֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 78:62
Psalm 78:63Fire devoured their young men. Their virgins had no wedding song.
Psalm 78:638  בַּחוּרָ֥יו אָֽכְלָה־אֵ֑שׁ וּ֝בְתוּלֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א הוּלָּֽלוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:63
Psalm 78:64Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows couldn't weep.
Psalm 78:648  כֹּ֭הֲנָיו בַּחֶ֣רֶב נָפָ֑לוּ וְ֝אַלְמְנֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִבְכֶּֽינָה׃ ‬
Psalm 78:64
Psalm 78:65Then the Lord awakened as one out of sleep, like a mighty man who shouts by reason of wine.
Psalm 78:658  וַיִּקַ֖ץ כְּיָשֵׁ֥ן ׀ אֲדֹנָ֑י כְּ֝גִבּ֗וֹר מִתְרוֹנֵ֥ן מִיָּֽיִן׃ ‬
Psalm 78:65
Psalm 78:66He struck his adversaries backward. He put them to a perpetual reproach.
Psalm 78:668  וַיַּךְ־צָרָ֥יו אָח֑וֹר חֶרְפַּ֥ת ע֝וֹלָ֗ם נָ֣תַן לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:66
Psalm 78:67Moreover he rejected the tent of Joseph, and didn't choose the tribe of Ephraim,
Psalm 78:678  וַ֭יִּמְאַס בְּאֹ֣הֶל יוֹסֵ֑ף וּֽבְשֵׁ֥בֶט אֶ֝פְרַ֗יִם לֹ֣א בָחָֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 78:67
Psalm 78:68But chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion which he loved.
Psalm 78:688  וַ֭יִּבְחַר אֶת־שֵׁ֣בֶט יְהוּדָ֑ה אֶֽת־הַ֥ר צִ֝יּ֗וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָהֵֽב׃ ‬
Psalm 78:68
Psalm 78:69He built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth which he has established forever.
Psalm 78:698  וַיִּ֣בֶן כְּמוֹ־רָ֭מִים מִקְדָּשׁ֑וֹ כְּ֝אֶ֗רֶץ יְסָדָ֥הּ לְעוֹלָֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:69
Psalm 78:70He also chose David his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds;
Psalm 78:708  וַ֭יִּבְחַר בְּדָוִ֣ד עַבְדּ֑וֹ וַ֝יִּקָּחֵ֗הוּ מִֽמִּכְלְאֹ֥ת צֹֽאן׃ ‬
Psalm 78:70
Psalm 78:71from following the ewes that have their young, he brought him to be the shepherd of Jacob, his people, and Israel, his inheritance.
Psalm 78:718  מֵאַחַ֥ר עָל֗וֹת הֱ֫בִיא֥וֹ לִ֭רְעוֹת בְּיַעֲקֹ֣ב עַמּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 78:71
Psalm 78:72So he was their shepherd according to the integrity of his heart, and guided them by the skillfulness of his hands. A Psalm by Asaph.
Psalm 78:728  וַ֭יִּרְעֵם כְּתֹ֣ם לְבָב֑וֹ וּבִתְבוּנ֖וֹת כַּפָּ֣יו יַנְחֵֽם׃ ‬
Psalm 78:72
Psalm 79:1God, the nations have come into your inheritance. They have defiled your holy temple. They have laid Jerusalem in heaps.
Psalm 79:19  מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אֱ‍ֽלֹהִ֡ים בָּ֤אוּ גוֹיִ֨ם ׀ בְּֽנַחֲלָתֶ֗ךָ טִ֭מְּאוּ אֶת־הֵיכַ֣ל קָדְשֶׁ֑ךָ שָׂ֖מוּ אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם לְעִיִּֽים׃ ‬
Psalm 79:1
Psalm 79:2They have given the dead bodies of your servants to be food for the birds of the sky, the flesh of your saints to the animals of the earth.
Psalm 79:29  נָֽתְנ֡וּ אֶת־נִבְלַ֬ת עֲבָדֶ֗יךָ מַ֭אֲכָל לְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם בְּשַׂ֥ר חֲ֝סִידֶ֗יךָ לְחַיְתוֹ־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 79:2
Psalm 79:3Their blood they have shed like water around Jerusalem. There was no one to bury them.
Psalm 79:39  שָׁפְכ֬וּ דָמָ֨ם ׀ כַּמַּ֗יִם סְֽבִ֘יב֤וֹת יְֽרוּשָׁלִָ֗ם וְאֵ֣ין קוֹבֵֽר׃ ‬
Psalm 79:3
Psalm 79:4We have become a reproach to our neighbors, a scoffing and derision to those who are around us.
Psalm 79:49  הָיִ֣ינוּ חֶ֭רְפָּה לִשְׁכֵנֵ֑ינוּ לַ֥עַג וָ֝קֶ֗לֶס לִסְבִיבוֹתֵֽינוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 79:4
Psalm 79:5How long, Yahweh? Will you be angry forever? Will your jealousy burn like fire?
Psalm 79:59  עַד־מָ֣ה יְ֭הוָה תֶּאֱנַ֣ף לָנֶ֑צַח תִּבְעַ֥ר כְּמוֹ־אֵ֝֗שׁ קִנְאָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 79:5
Psalm 79:6Pour out your wrath on the nations that don't know you; on the kingdoms that don't call on your name;
Psalm 79:69  שְׁפֹ֤ךְ חֲמָתְךָ֨ אֶֽל־הַגּוֹיִם֮ אֲשֶׁ֢ר לֹא־יְדָ֫ע֥וּךָ וְעַ֥ל מַמְלָכ֑וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּ֝שִׁמְךָ֗ לֹ֣א קָרָֽאוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 79:6
Psalm 79:7For they have devoured Jacob, and destroyed his homeland.
Psalm 79:79  כִּ֭י אָכַ֣ל אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְֽאֶת־נָוֵ֥הוּ הֵשַֽׁמּוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 79:7
Psalm 79:8Don't hold the iniquities of our forefathers against us. Let your tender mercies speedily meet us, for we are in desperate need.
Psalm 79:89  אַֽל־תִּזְכָּר־לָנוּ֮ עֲוֺנֹ֢ת רִאשֹׁ֫נִ֥ים מַ֭הֵר יְקַדְּמ֣וּנוּ רַחֲמֶ֑יךָ כִּ֖י דַלּ֣וֹנוּ מְאֹֽד׃ ‬
Psalm 79:8
Psalm 79:9Help us, God of our salvation, for the glory of your name. Deliver us, and forgive our sins, for your name's sake.
Psalm 79:99  עָזְרֵ֤נוּ ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י יִשְׁעֵ֗נוּ עַל־דְּבַ֥ר כְּבֽוֹד־שְׁמֶ֑ךָ וְהַצִּילֵ֥נוּ וְכַפֵּ֥ר עַל־חַ֝טֹּאתֵ֗ינוּ לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 79:9
Psalm 79:10Why should the nations say, |Where is their God?| Let it be known among the nations, before our eyes, that vengeance for your servants' blood is being poured out.
Psalm 79:109  לָ֤מָּה ׀ יֹאמְר֣וּ הַגּוֹיִם֮ אַיֵּ֢ה אֱ‍ֽלֹהֵ֫יהֶ֥ם יִוָּדַ֣ע *בגיים **בַּגּוֹיִ֣ם לְעֵינֵ֑ינוּ נִ֝קְמַ֗ת דַּֽם־עֲבָדֶ֥יךָ הַשָּׁפֽוּךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 79:10
Psalm 79:11Let the sighing of the prisoner come before you. According to the greatness of your power, preserve those who are sentenced to death.
Psalm 79:119  תָּ֤ב֣וֹא לְפָנֶיךָ֮ אֶנְקַ֢ת אָ֫סִ֥יר כְּגֹ֥דֶל זְרוֹעֲךָ֑ ה֝וֹתֵ֗ר בְּנֵ֣י תְמוּתָֽה׃ ‬
Psalm 79:11
Psalm 79:12Pay back to our neighbors seven times into their bosom their reproach with which they have reproached you, Lord.
Psalm 79:129  וְהָ֘שֵׁ֤ב לִשְׁכֵנֵ֣ינוּ שִׁ֭בְעָתַיִם אֶל־חֵיקָ֑ם חֶרְפָּ֘תָ֤ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר חֵרְפ֣וּךָ אֲדֹנֽ͏ָי׃ ‬
Psalm 79:12
Psalm 79:13So we, your people and sheep of your pasture, will give you thanks forever. We will praise you forever, to all generations. For the Chief Musician. To the tune of |The Lilies of the Covenant.| A Psalm by Asaph.
Psalm 79:139  וַאֲנַ֤חְנוּ עַמְּךָ֨ ׀ וְצֹ֥אן מַרְעִיתֶךָ֮ נ֤וֹדֶ֥ה לְּךָ֗ לְע֫וֹלָ֥ם לְדֹ֥ר וָדֹ֑ר נְ֝סַפֵּ֗ר תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 79:13
Psalm 80:1Hear us, Shepherd of Israel, you who lead Joseph like a flock, you who sit above the cherubim, shine forth.
Psalm 80:10  לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אֶל־שֹׁשַׁנִּ֑ים עֵד֖וּת לְאָסָ֣ף מִזְמֽוֹר׃ ‬
Psalm 80:1
Psalm 80:2Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up your might! Come to save us!
Psalm 80:20  רֹ֘עֵ֤ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל ׀ הַאֲזִ֗ינָה נֹהֵ֣ג כַּצֹּ֣אן יוֹסֵ֑ף יֹשֵׁ֖ב הַכְּרוּבִ֣ים הוֹפִֽיעָה׃ ‬
Psalm 80:2
Psalm 80:3Turn us again, God. Cause your face to shine, and we will be saved.
Psalm 80:30  לִפְנֵ֤י אֶפְרַ֨יִם ׀ וּבִנְיָ֘מִ֤ן וּמְנַשֶּׁ֗ה עוֹרְרָ֥ה אֶת־גְּבֽוּרָתֶ֑ךָ וּלְכָ֖ה לִישֻׁעָ֣תָה לָּֽנוּ׃ ‬
Psalm 80:3
Psalm 80:4Yahweh God of Armies, How long will you be angry against the prayer of your people?
Psalm 80:40  אֱלֹהִ֥ים הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נוּ וְהָאֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וְנִוָּשֵֽׁעָה׃ ‬
Psalm 80:4
Psalm 80:5You have fed them with the bread of tears, and given them tears to drink in large measure.
Psalm 80:50  יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָא֑וֹת עַד־מָתַ֥י עָ֝שַׁ֗נְתָּ בִּתְפִלַּ֥ת עַמֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Psalm 80:5
Psalm 80:6You make us a source of contention to our neighbors. Our enemies laugh among themselves.
Psalm 80:60  הֶ֭אֱכַלְתָּם לֶ֣חֶם דִּמְעָ֑ה וַ֝תַּשְׁקֵ֗מוֹ בִּדְמָע֥וֹת שָׁלִֽישׁ׃ ‬
Psalm 80:6
Psalm 80:7Turn us again, God of Armies. Cause your face to shine, and we will be saved.
Psalm 80:70  תְּשִׂימֵ֣נוּ מָ֭דוֹן לִשְׁכֵנֵ֑ינוּ וְ֝אֹיְבֵ֗ינוּ יִלְעֲגוּ־לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Psalm 80:7
Psalm 80:8You brought a vine out of Egypt. You drove out the nations, and planted it.
Psalm 80:80  אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָא֣וֹת הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נוּ וְהָאֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וְנִוָּשֵֽׁעָה׃ ‬
Psalm 80:8
Psalm 80:9You cleared the ground for it. It took deep root, and filled the land.
Psalm 80:90  גֶּ֭פֶן מִמִּצְרַ֣יִם תַּסִּ֑יעַ תְּגָרֵ֥שׁ גּ֝וֹיִ֗ם וַתִּטָּעֶֽהָ׃ ‬
Psalm 80:9
Psalm 80:10The mountains were covered with its shadow. Its boughs were like God's cedars.
Psalm 80:100  פִּנִּ֥יתָ לְפָנֶ֑יהָ וַתַּשְׁרֵ֥שׁ שָׁ֝רָשֶׁ֗יהָ וַתְּמַלֵּא־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Psalm 80:10
Psalm 80:11It sent out its branches to the sea, Its shoots to the River.
Psalm 80:110  כָּסּ֣וּ הָרִ֣ים צִלָּ֑הּ וַ֝עֲנָפֶ֗יהָ אַֽרְזֵי־אֵֽל׃ ‬
Psalm 80:11
Psalm 80:12Why have you broken down its walls, so that all those who pass by the way pluck it?
Psalm 80:120  תְּשַׁלַּ֣ח קְצִירֶ֣הָ עַד־יָ֑ם וְאֶל־נָ֝הָ֗ר יֽוֹנְקוֹתֶֽיהָ׃ ‬
Psalm 80:12
Psalm 80:13The boar out of the wood ravages it. The wild animals of the field feed on it.
Psalm 80:130  לָ֭מָּה פָּרַ֣צְתָּ גְדֵרֶ֑יהָ וְ֝אָר֗וּהָ כָּל־עֹ֥בְרֵי דָֽרֶךְ׃ ‬
Psalm 80:13
Psalm 80:14Turn again, we beg you, God of Armies. Look down from heaven, and see, and visit this vine,
Psalm 80:140  יְכַרְסְמֶ֣נָּֽה חֲזִ֣יר מִיָּ֑עַ‪[7]‬ר וְזִ֖יז שָׂדַ֣י יִרְעֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
