Proverbs 2:7   *וצפן **יִצְפֹּ֣ן לַ֭יְשָׁרִים תּוּשִׁיָּ֑ה מָ֝גֵ֗ן לְהֹ֣לְכֵי תֹֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:7
Proverbs 2:8that he may guard the paths of justice, and preserve the way of his saints.
Proverbs 2:8   לִ֭נְצֹר אָרְח֣וֹת מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וְדֶ֖רֶךְ *חסידו **חֲסִידָ֣יו יִשְׁמֹֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:8
Proverbs 2:9Then you will understand righteousness and justice, equity and every good path.
Proverbs 2:9   אָ֗ז תָּ֭בִין צֶ֣דֶק וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝מֵישָׁרִ֗ים כָּל־מַעְגַּל־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:9
Proverbs 2:10For wisdom will enter into your heart. Knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.
Proverbs 2:10   כִּֽי־תָב֣וֹא חָכְמָ֣ה בְלִבֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝דַ֗עַת לְֽנַפְשְׁךָ֥ יִנְעָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:10
Proverbs 2:11Discretion will watch over you. Understanding will keep you,
Proverbs 2:11   מְ֭זִמָּה תִּשְׁמֹ֥ר עָלֶ֗יךָ תְּבוּנָ֥ה תִנְצְרֶֽכָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:11
Proverbs 2:12to deliver you from the way of evil, from the men who speak perverse things;
Proverbs 2:12   לְ֭הַצִּ֣ילְךָ מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ רָ֑ע מֵ֝אִ֗ישׁ מְדַבֵּ֥ר תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:12
Proverbs 2:13who forsake the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
Proverbs 2:13   הַ֭עֹ֣זְבִים אָרְח֣וֹת יֹ֑שֶׁר לָ֝לֶ֗כֶת בְּדַרְכֵי־חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:13
Proverbs 2:14who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the perverseness of evil;
Proverbs 2:14   הַ֭שְּׂמֵחִים לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת רָ֑ע יָ֝גִ֗ילוּ בְּֽתַהְפֻּכ֥וֹת רָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:14
Proverbs 2:15who are crooked in their ways, and wayward in their paths:
Proverbs 2:15   אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָרְחֹתֵיהֶ֣ם עִקְּשִׁ֑ים וּ֝נְלוֹזִ֗ים בְּמַעְגְּלוֹתָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:15
Proverbs 2:16To deliver you from the strange woman, even from the foreigner who flatters with her words;
Proverbs 2:16   לְ֭הַצִּ֣ילְךָ מֵאִשָּׁ֣ה זָרָ֑ה מִ֝נָּכְרִיָּ֗ה אֲמָרֶ֥יהָ הֶחֱלִֽיקָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:16
Proverbs 2:17who forsakes the friend of her youth, and forgets the covenant of her God:
Proverbs 2:17   הַ֭עֹזֶבֶת אַלּ֣וּף נְעוּרֶ֑יהָ וְאֶת־בְּרִ֖ית אֱלֹהֶ֣יהָ שָׁכֵֽחָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:17
Proverbs 2:18for her house leads down to death, her paths to the dead.
Proverbs 2:18   כִּ֤י שָׁ֣חָה אֶל־מָ֣וֶת בֵּיתָ֑הּ וְאֶל־רְ֝פָאִ֗ים מַעְגְּלֹתֶֽיהָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:18
Proverbs 2:19None who go to her return again, neither do they attain to the paths of life:
Proverbs 2:19   כָּל־בָּ֭אֶיהָ לֹ֣א יְשׁוּב֑וּן וְלֹֽא־יַ֝שִּׂ֗יגוּ אָרְח֥וֹת חַיִּֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:19
Proverbs 2:20that you may walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
Proverbs 2:20   לְמַ֗עַן תֵּ֭לֵךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ טוֹבִ֑ים וְאָרְח֖וֹת צַדִּיקִ֣ים תִּשְׁמֹֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:20
Proverbs 2:21For the upright will dwell in the land. The perfect will remain in it.
Proverbs 2:21   כִּֽי־יְשָׁרִ֥ים יִשְׁכְּנוּ‪[c]‬ אָ֑רֶץ וּ֝תְמִימִ֗ים יִוָּ֥תְרוּ בָֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 2:21
Proverbs 2:22But the wicked will be cut off from the land. The treacherous will be rooted out of it.
Proverbs 2:22   וּ֭רְשָׁעִים מֵאֶ֣רֶץ יִכָּרֵ֑תוּ וּ֝בוֹגְדִ֗ים יִסְּח֥וּ מִמֶּֽנָּה׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 2:22
Proverbs 3:1My son, don't forget my teaching; but let your heart keep my commandments:
Proverbs 3:1   בְּ֭נִי תּוֹרָתִ֣י אַל־תִּשְׁכָּ֑ח וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י יִצֹּ֥ר לִבֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:1
Proverbs 3:2for length of days, and years of life, and peace, will they add to you.
Proverbs 3:2   כִּ֤י אֹ֣רֶךְ יָ֭מִים וּשְׁנ֣וֹת חַיִּ֑ים וְ֝שָׁל֗וֹם יוֹסִ֥יפוּ לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:2
Proverbs 3:3Don't let kindness and truth forsake you. Bind them around your neck. Write them on the tablet of your heart.
Proverbs 3:3   חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶ֗ת אַֽל־יַעַ֫זְבֻ֥ךָ קָשְׁרֵ֥ם עַל־גַּרְגְּרוֹתֶ֑יךָ כָּ֝תְבֵ֗ם עַל־ל֥וּחַ לִבֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:3
Proverbs 3:4So you will find favor, and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
Proverbs 3:4   וּמְצָא־חֵ֖ן וְשֵֽׂכֶל־ט֑וֹב בְּעֵינֵ֖י אֱלֹהִ֣ים וְאָדָֽם׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 3:4
Proverbs 3:5Trust in Yahweh with all your heart, and don't lean on your own understanding.
Proverbs 3:5   בְּטַ֣ח אֶל־יְ֭הוָה בְּכָל־לִבֶּ֑ךָ וְאֶל־בִּֽ֝ינָתְךָ֗ אַל־תִּשָּׁעֵֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:5
Proverbs 3:6In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.
Proverbs 3:6   בְּכָל־דְּרָכֶ֥יךָ דָעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝ה֗וּא יְיַשֵּׁ֥ר אֹֽרְחֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:6
Proverbs 3:7Don't be wise in your own eyes. Fear Yahweh, and depart from evil.
Proverbs 3:7   אַל־תְּהִ֣י חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ יְרָ֥א אֶת־יְ֝הוָ֗ה וְס֣וּר מֵרָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:7
Proverbs 3:8It will be health to your body, and nourishment to your bones.
Proverbs 3:8   רִ֭פְאוּת תְּהִ֣י לְשָׁרֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝שִׁקּ֗וּי לְעַצְמוֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:8
Proverbs 3:9Honor Yahweh with your substance, with the first fruits of all your increase:
Proverbs 3:9   כַּבֵּ֣ד אֶת־יְ֭הוָה מֵהוֹנֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מֵרֵאשִׁ֗ית כָּל־תְּבוּאָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:9
Proverbs 3:10so your barns will be filled with plenty, and your vats will overflow with new wine.
Proverbs 3:10   וְיִמָּלְא֣וּ אֲסָמֶ֣יךָ שָׂבָ֑ע וְ֝תִיר֗וֹשׁ יְקָבֶ֥יךָ יִפְרֹֽצוּ׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 3:10
Proverbs 3:11My son, don't despise Yahweh's discipline, neither be weary of his reproof:
Proverbs 3:11   מוּסַ֣ר יְ֭הוָה בְּנִ֣י אַל־תִּמְאָ֑ס וְאַל־תָּ֝קֹ֗ץ בְּתוֹכַחְתּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:11
Proverbs 3:12for whom Yahweh loves, he reproves; even as a father reproves the son in whom he delights.
Proverbs 3:12   כִּ֤י אֶ֥ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶאֱהַ֣ב יְהוָ֣ה יוֹכִ֑יחַ וּ֝כְאָ֗ב אֶת־בֵּ֥ן יִרְצֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:12
Proverbs 3:13Happy is the man who finds wisdom, the man who gets understanding.
Proverbs 3:13   אַשְׁרֵ֣י אָ֭דָם מָצָ֣א חָכְמָ֑ה וְ֝אָדָ֗ם יָפִ֥יק תְּבוּנָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:13
Proverbs 3:14For her good profit is better than getting silver, and her return is better than fine gold.
Proverbs 3:14   כִּ֤י ט֣וֹב סַ֭חְרָהּ מִסְּחַר־כָּ֑סֶף וּ֝מֵחָר֗וּץ תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:14
Proverbs 3:15She is more precious than rubies. None of the things you can desire are to be compared to her.
Proverbs 3:15   יְקָ֣רָה הִ֭יא *מפניים **מִפְּנִינִ֑ים וְכָל־חֲ֝פָצֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א יִֽשְׁווּ־בָֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:15
Proverbs 3:16Length of days is in her right hand. In her left hand are riches and honor.
Proverbs 3:16   אֹ֣רֶךְ יָ֭מִים בִּֽימִינָ֑הּ בִּ֝שְׂמֹאולָ֗הּ עֹ֣שֶׁר וְכָבֽוֹד׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:16
Proverbs 3:17Her ways are ways of pleasantness. All her paths are peace.
Proverbs 3:17   דְּרָכֶ֥יהָ דַרְכֵי־נֹ֑עַם וְֽכָל־נְתִ֖יבוֹתֶ֣יהָ שָׁלֽוֹם׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:17
Proverbs 3:18She is a tree of life to those who lay hold of her. Happy is everyone who retains her.
Proverbs 3:18   עֵץ־חַיִּ֣ים הִ֭יא לַמַּחֲזִיקִ֣ים בָּ֑הּ וְֽתֹמְכֶ֥יהָ מְאֻשָּֽׁר׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 3:18
Proverbs 3:19By wisdom Yahweh founded the earth. By understanding, he established the heavens.
Proverbs 3:19   יְֽהוָ֗ה בְּחָכְמָ֥ה יָֽסַד־אָ֑רֶץ כּוֹנֵ֥ן שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם בִּתְבוּנָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:19
Proverbs 3:20By his knowledge, the depths were broken up, and the skies drop down the dew.
Proverbs 3:20   בְּ֭דַעְתּוֹ תְּהוֹמ֣וֹת נִבְקָ֑עוּ וּ֝שְׁחָקִ֗ים יִרְעֲפוּ־טָֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:20
Proverbs 3:21My son, let them not depart from your eyes. Keep sound wisdom and discretion:
Proverbs 3:21   בְּ֭נִי אַל־יָלֻ֣זוּ מֵעֵינֶ֑יךָ נְצֹ֥ר תֻּ֝שִׁיָּ֗ה וּמְזִמָּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:21
Proverbs 3:22so they will be life to your soul, and grace for your neck.
Proverbs 3:22   וְיִֽהְי֣וּ חַיִּ֣ים לְנַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְ֝חֵ֗ן לְגַרְגְּרֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:22
Proverbs 3:23Then you shall walk in your way securely. Your foot won't stumble.
Proverbs 3:23   אָ֤ז תֵּלֵ֣ךְ לָבֶ֣טַח דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝רַגְלְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִגּֽוֹף׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:23
Proverbs 3:24When you lie down, you will not be afraid. Yes, you will lie down, and your sleep will be sweet.
Proverbs 3:24   אִם־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ב לֹֽא־תִפְחָ֑ד וְ֝שָׁכַבְתָּ֗ וְֽעָרְבָ֥ה שְׁנָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:24
Proverbs 3:25Don't be afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it comes:
Proverbs 3:25   אַל־תִּ֭ירָא מִפַּ֣חַד פִּתְאֹ֑ם וּמִשֹּׁאַ֥ת רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים כִּ֣י תָבֹֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:25
Proverbs 3:26for Yahweh will be your confidence, and will keep your foot from being taken.
Proverbs 3:26   כִּֽי־יְ֭הוָה יִהְיֶ֣ה בְכִסְלֶ֑ךָ וְשָׁמַ֖ר רַגְלְךָ֣ מִלָּֽכֶד׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:26
Proverbs 3:27Don't withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of your hand to do it.
Proverbs 3:27   אַל־תִּמְנַע־ט֥וֹב מִבְּעָלָ֑יו בִּהְי֨וֹת לְאֵ֖ל *ידיך **יָדְךָ֣ לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:27
Proverbs 3:28Don't say to your neighbor, |Go, and come again; tomorrow I will give it to you,| when you have it by you.
Proverbs 3:28   אַל־תֹּ֘אמַ֤ר *לרעיך **לְרֵֽעֲךָ֨ ׀ לֵ֣ךְ וָ֭שׁוּב וּמָחָ֥ר אֶתֵּ֗ן וְיֵ֣שׁ אִתָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:28
Proverbs 3:29Don't devise evil against your neighbor, since he dwells securely by you.
Proverbs 3:29   אַל־תַּחֲרֹ֣שׁ עַל־רֵעֲךָ֣ רָעָ֑ה וְהֽוּא־יוֹשֵׁ֖ב לָבֶ֣טַח אִתָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:29
Proverbs 3:30Don't strive with a man without cause, if he has done you no harm.
Proverbs 3:30   אַל־*תרוב **תָּרִ֣יב עִם־אָדָ֣ם חִנָּ֑ם אִם־לֹ֖א גְמָלְךָ֣ רָעָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:30
Proverbs 3:31Don't envy the man of violence. Choose none of his ways.
Proverbs 3:31   אַל־תְּ֭קַנֵּא בְּאִ֣ישׁ חָמָ֑ס וְאַל־תִּ֝בְחַ֗ר בְּכָל־דְּרָכָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:31
Proverbs 3:32For the perverse is an abomination to Yahweh, but his friendship is with the upright.
Proverbs 3:32   כִּ֤י תוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהוָ֣ה נָל֑וֹז וְֽאֶת־יְשָׁרִ֥ים סוֹדֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:32
Proverbs 3:33Yahweh's curse is in the house of the wicked, but he blesses the habitation of the righteous.
Proverbs 3:33   מְאֵרַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה בְּבֵ֣ית רָשָׁ֑ע וּנְוֵ֖ה צַדִּיקִ֣ים יְבָרֵֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:33
Proverbs 3:34Surely he mocks the mockers, but he gives grace to the humble.
Proverbs 3:34   אִם־לַלֵּצִ֥ים הֽוּא־יָלִ֑יץ *ולעניים **וְ֝לַעֲנָוִ֗ים יִתֶּן־חֵֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 3:34
Proverbs 3:35The wise will inherit glory, but shame will be the promotion of fools.
Proverbs 3:35   כָּ֭בוֹד חֲכָמִ֣ים יִנְחָ֑לוּ וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים מֵרִ֥ים קָלֽוֹן׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 3:35
Proverbs 4:1Listen, sons, to a father's instruction. Pay attention and know understanding;
Proverbs 4:1   שִׁמְע֣וּ בָ֭נִים מ֣וּסַר אָ֑ב וְ֝הַקְשִׁ֗יבוּ לָדַ֥עַת בִּינָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:1
Proverbs 4:2for I give you sound learning. Don't forsake my law.
Proverbs 4:2   כִּ֤י לֶ֣קַח ט֭וֹב נָתַ֣תִּי לָכֶ֑ם תּֽ֝וֹרָתִ֗י אַֽל־תַּעֲזֹֽבוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:2
Proverbs 4:3For I was a son to my father, tender and an only child in the sight of my mother.
Proverbs 4:3   כִּי־בֵ֭ן הָיִ֣יתִי לְאָבִ֑י רַ֥ךְ וְ֝יָחִ֗יד לִפְנֵ֥י אִמִּֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:3
Proverbs 4:4He taught me, and said to me: |Let your heart retain my words. Keep my commandments, and live.
Proverbs 4:4   וַיֹּרֵ֗נִי וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לִ֗י יִֽתְמָךְ־דְּבָרַ֥י לִבֶּ֑ךָ שְׁמֹ֖ר מִצְוֺתַ֣י וֽ͏ֶחְיֵֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:4
Proverbs 4:5Get wisdom. Get understanding. Don't forget, neither swerve from the words of my mouth.
Proverbs 4:5   קְנֵ֣ה חָ֭כְמָה קְנֵ֣ה בִינָ֑ה אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח וְאַל־תֵּ֝֗ט מֵֽאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:5
Proverbs 4:6Don't forsake her, and she will preserve you. Love her, and she will keep you.
Proverbs 4:6   אַל־תַּעַזְבֶ֥הָ וְתִשְׁמְרֶ֑ךָּ אֱהָבֶ֥הָ וְתִצְּרֶֽךָּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:6
Proverbs 4:7Wisdom is supreme. Get wisdom. Yes, though it costs all your possessions, get understanding.
Proverbs 4:7   רֵאשִׁ֣ית חָ֭כְמָה קְנֵ֣ה חָכְמָ֑ה וּבְכָל־קִ֝נְיָנְךָ֗ קְנֵ֣ה בִינָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:7
Proverbs 4:8Esteem her, and she will exalt you. She will bring you to honor, when you embrace her.
Proverbs 4:8   סַלְסְלֶ֥הָ וּֽתְרוֹמְמֶ֑ךָּ תְּ֝כַבֵּ֗דְךָ כִּ֣י תְחַבְּקֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:8
Proverbs 4:9She will give to your head a garland of grace. She will deliver a crown of splendor to you.|
Proverbs 4:9   תִּתֵּ֣ן לְ֭רֹאשְׁךָ לִוְיַת־חֵ֑ן עֲטֶ֖רֶת תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת תְּמַגְּנֶֽךָּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:9
Proverbs 4:10Listen, my son, and receive my sayings. The years of your life will be many.
Proverbs 4:10   שְׁמַ֣ע בְּ֭נִי וְקַ֣ח אֲמָרָ֑י וְיִרְבּ֥וּ לְ֝ךָ֗ שְׁנ֣וֹת חַיִּֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:10
Proverbs 4:11I have taught you in the way of wisdom. I have led you in straight paths.
Proverbs 4:11   בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ חָ֭כְמָה הֹרֵתִ֑יךָ הִ֝דְרַכְתִּ֗יךָ בְּמַעְגְּלֵי־יֹֽשֶׁר׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:11
Proverbs 4:12When you go, your steps will not be hampered. When you run, you will not stumble.
Proverbs 4:12   בְּֽ֭לֶכְתְּךָ לֹא־יֵצַ֣ר צַעֲדֶ֑ךָ וְאִם־תָּ֝ר֗וּץ לֹ֣א תִכָּשֵֽׁל׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:12
Proverbs 4:13Take firm hold of instruction. Don't let her go. Keep her, for she is your life.
Proverbs 4:13   הַחֲזֵ֣ק בַּמּוּסָ֣ר אַל־תֶּ֑רֶף נִ֝צְּרֶ֗הָ כִּי־הִ֥יא חַיֶּֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:13
Proverbs 4:14Don't enter into the path of the wicked. Don't walk in the way of evil men.
Proverbs 4:14   בְּאֹ֣רַח רְ֭שָׁעִים אַל־תָּבֹ֑א וְאַל־תְּ֝אַשֵּׁ֗ר בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ רָעִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:14
Proverbs 4:15Avoid it, and don't pass by it. Turn from it, and pass on.
Proverbs 4:15   פְּרָעֵ֥הוּ אַל־תַּעֲבָר־בּ֑וֹ שְׂטֵ֖ה מֵעָלָ֣יו וַעֲבֽוֹר׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:15
Proverbs 4:16For they don't sleep, unless they do evil. Their sleep is taken away, unless they make someone fall.
Proverbs 4:16   כִּ֤י לֹ֣א יִֽ֭שְׁנוּ אִם־לֹ֣א יָרֵ֑עוּ וְֽנִגְזְלָ֥ה שְׁ֝נָתָ֗ם אִם־לֹ֥א *יכשולו **יַכְשִֽׁילוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:16
Proverbs 4:17For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
Proverbs 4:17   כִּ֣י לָ֭חֲמוּ לֶ֣חֶם רֶ֑שַׁע וְיֵ֖ין חֲמָסִ֣ים יִשְׁתּֽוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:17
Proverbs 4:18But the path of the righteous is like the dawning light, that shines more and more until the perfect day.
Proverbs 4:18   וְאֹ֣רַח צַ֭דִּיקִים כְּא֣וֹר נֹ֑גַהּ הוֹלֵ֥ךְ וָ֝א֗וֹר עַד־נְכ֥וֹן הַיּֽוֹם׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:18
Proverbs 4:19The way of the wicked is like darkness. They don't know what they stumble over.
Proverbs 4:19   דֶּ֣רֶךְ רְ֭שָׁעִים כָּֽאֲפֵלָ֑ה לֹ֥א יָ֝דְע֗וּ בַּמֶּ֥ה יִכָּשֵֽׁלוּ׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 4:19
Proverbs 4:20My son, attend to my words. Turn your ear to my sayings.
Proverbs 4:20   בְּ֭נִי לִדְבָרַ֣י הַקְשִׁ֑יבָה לַ֝אֲמָרַ֗י הַט־אָזְנֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:20
Proverbs 4:21Let them not depart from your eyes. Keep them in the midst of your heart.
Proverbs 4:21   אַל־יַלִּ֥יזוּ מֵעֵינֶ֑יךָ שָׁ֝מְרֵ֗ם בְּת֣וֹךְ לְבָבֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:21
Proverbs 4:22For they are life to those who find them, and health to their whole body.
Proverbs 4:22   כִּֽי־חַיִּ֣ים הֵ֭ם לְמֹצְאֵיהֶ֑ם וּֽלְכָל־בְּשָׂר֥וֹ מַרְפֵּֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:22
Proverbs 4:23Keep your heart with all diligence, for out of it is the wellspring of life.
Proverbs 4:23   מִֽכָּל־מִ֭שְׁמָר נְצֹ֣ר לִבֶּ֑ךָ כִּֽי־מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ תּוֹצְא֥וֹת חַיִּֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:23
Proverbs 4:24Put away from yourself a perverse mouth. Put corrupt lips far from you.
Proverbs 4:24   הָסֵ֣ר מִ֭מְּךָ עִקְּשׁ֣וּת פֶּ֑ה וּלְז֥וּת שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם הַרְחֵ֥ק מִמֶּֽךָּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:24
Proverbs 4:25Let your eyes look straight ahead. Fix your gaze directly before you.
Proverbs 4:25   עֵ֭ינֶיךָ לְנֹ֣כַח יַבִּ֑יטוּ וְ֝עַפְעַפֶּ֗יךָ יַיְשִׁ֥רוּ נֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:25
Proverbs 4:26Make the path of your feet level. Let all of your ways be established.
Proverbs 4:26   פַּ֭לֵּס מַעְגַּ֣ל רַגְלֶ֑ךָ וְֽכָל־דְּרָכֶ֥יךָ יִכֹּֽנוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:26
Proverbs 4:27Don't turn to the right hand nor to the left. Remove your foot from evil.
Proverbs 4:27   אַֽל־תֵּט־יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול הָסֵ֖ר רַגְלְךָ֣ מֵרָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 4:27
Proverbs 5:1My son, pay attention to my wisdom. Turn your ear to my understanding:
Proverbs 5:1   בְּ֭נִי לְחָכְמָתִ֣י הַקְשִׁ֑יבָה לִ֝תְבוּנָתִ֗י הַט־אָזְנֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:1
Proverbs 5:2that you may maintain discretion, that your lips may preserve knowledge.
Proverbs 5:2   לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מְזִמּ֑וֹת וְ֝דַ֗עַת שְׂפָתֶ֥יךָ יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:2
Proverbs 5:3For the lips of an adulteress drip honey. Her mouth is smoother than oil,
Proverbs 5:3   כִּ֤י נֹ֣פֶת תִּ֭טֹּפְנָה שִׂפְתֵ֣י זָרָ֑ה וְחָלָ֖ק מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן חִכָּֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:3
Proverbs 5:4But in the end she is as bitter as wormwood, and as sharp as a two-edged sword.
Proverbs 5:4   וְֽ֭אַחֲרִיתָהּ מָרָ֣ה כַֽלַּעֲנָ֑ה חַ֝דָּ֗ה כְּחֶ֣רֶב פִּיּֽוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:4
Proverbs 5:5Her feet go down to death. Her steps lead straight to Sheol.
Proverbs 5:5   רַ֭גְלֶיהָ יֹרְד֣וֹת מָ֑וֶת שְׁ֝א֗וֹל צְעָדֶ֥יהָ יִתְמֹֽכוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:5
Proverbs 5:6She gives no thought to the way of life. Her ways are crooked, and she doesn't know it.
Proverbs 5:6   אֹ֣רַח חַ֭יִּים פֶּן־תְּפַלֵּ֑ס נָע֥וּ מַ֝עְגְּלֹתֶ֗יהָ לֹ֣א תֵדֽ͏ָע׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 5:6
Proverbs 5:7Now therefore, my sons, listen to me. Don't depart from the words of my mouth.
Proverbs 5:7   וְעַתָּ֣ה בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י וְאַל־תָּ֝ס֗וּרוּ מֵאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:7
Proverbs 5:8Remove your way far from her. Don't come near the door of her house,
Proverbs 5:8   הַרְחֵ֣ק מֵעָלֶ֣יהָ דַרְכֶּ֑ךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝קְרַ֗ב אֶל־פֶּ֥תַח בֵּיתָֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:8
Proverbs 5:9lest you give your honor to others, and your years to the cruel one;
Proverbs 5:9   פֶּן־תִּתֵּ֣ן לַאֲחֵרִ֣ים הוֹדֶ֑ךָ וּ֝שְׁנֹתֶ֗יךָ לְאַכְזָרִֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:9
Proverbs 5:10lest strangers feast on your wealth, and your labors enrich another man's house.
Proverbs 5:10   פֶּֽן־יִשְׂבְּע֣וּ זָרִ֣ים כֹּחֶ֑ךָ וַ֝עֲצָבֶ֗יךָ בְּבֵ֣ית נָכְרֽ͏ִי׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:10
Proverbs 5:11You will groan at your latter end, when your flesh and your body are consumed,
Proverbs 5:11   וְנָהַמְתָּ֥ בְאַחֲרִיתֶ֑ךָ בִּכְל֥וֹת בְּ֝שָׂרְךָ֗ וּשְׁאֵרֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:11
Proverbs 5:12and say, |How I have hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;
Proverbs 5:12   וְֽאָמַרְתָּ֗ אֵ֭יךְ שָׂנֵ֣אתִי מוּסָ֑ר וְ֝תוֹכַ֗חַת נָאַ֥ץ לִבִּֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:12
Proverbs 5:13neither have I obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor turned my ear to those who instructed me!
Proverbs 5:13   וְֽלֹא־שָׁ֭מַעְתִּי בְּק֣וֹל מוֹרָ֑י וְ֝לִֽמְלַמְּדַ֗י לֹא־הִטִּ֥יתִי אָזְנִֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:13
Proverbs 5:14I have come to the brink of utter ruin, in the midst of the gathered assembly.|
Proverbs 5:14   כִּ֭מְעַט הָיִ֣יתִי בְכָל־רָ֑ע בְּת֖וֹךְ קָהָ֣ל וְעֵדָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:14
Proverbs 5:15Drink water out of your own cistern, running water out of your own well.
Proverbs 5:15   שְׁתֵה־מַ֥יִם מִבּוֹרֶ֑ךָ וְ֝נֹזְלִ֗ים מִתּ֥וֹךְ בְּאֵרֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:15
Proverbs 5:16Should your springs overflow in the streets, streams of water in the public squares?
Proverbs 5:16   יָפ֣וּצוּ מַעְיְנֹתֶ֣יךָ ח֑וּצָה בָּ֝רְחֹב֗וֹת פַּלְגֵי־מָֽיִם׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:16
Proverbs 5:17Let them be for yourself alone, not for strangers with you.
Proverbs 5:17   יִֽהְיוּ־לְךָ֥ לְבַדֶּ֑ךָ וְאֵ֖ין לְזָרִ֣ים אִתָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:17
Proverbs 5:18Let your spring be blessed. Rejoice in the wife of your youth.
Proverbs 5:18   יְהִֽי־מְקוֹרְךָ֥ בָר֑וּךְ וּ֝שְׂמַ֗ח מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת נְעוּרֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:18
Proverbs 5:19A loving doe and a graceful deer— let her breasts satisfy you at all times. Be captivated always with her love.
Proverbs 5:19   אַיֶּ֥לֶת אֲהָבִ֗ים וְֽיַעֲלַ֫ת־חֵ֥ן דַּ֭דֶּיהָ יְרַוֻּ֣ךָ בְכָל־עֵ֑ת בְּ֝אַהֲבָתָ֗הּ תִּשְׁגֶּ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:19
Proverbs 5:20For why should you, my son, be captivated with an adulteress? Why embrace the bosom of another?
Proverbs 5:20   וְלָ֤מָּה תִשְׁגֶּ֣ה בְנִ֣י בְזָרָ֑ה וּ֝תְחַבֵּ֗ק חֵ֣ק נָכְרִיָּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:20
Proverbs 5:21For the ways of man are before the eyes of Yahweh. He examines all his paths.
Proverbs 5:21   כִּ֤י נֹ֨כַח ׀ עֵינֵ֣י יְ֭הוָה דַּרְכֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְֽכָל־מַעְגְּלֹתָ֥יו מְפַלֵּֽס׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:21
Proverbs 5:22The evil deeds of the wicked ensnare him. The cords of his sin hold him firmly.
Proverbs 5:22   עַֽווֹנוֹתָ֗יו יִלְכְּדֻנ֥וֹ אֶת־הָרָשָׁ֑ע וּבְחַבְלֵ֥י חַ֝טָּאת֗וֹ יִתָּמֵֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 5:22
Proverbs 5:23He will die for lack of instruction. In the greatness of his folly, he will go astray.
Proverbs 5:23   ה֗וּא יָ֭מוּת בְּאֵ֣ין מוּסָ֑ר וּבְרֹ֖ב אִוַּלְתּ֣וֹ יִשְׁגֶּֽה׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 5:23
Proverbs 6:1My son, if you have become collateral for your neighbor, if you have struck your hands in pledge for a stranger;
Proverbs 6:1   בְּ֭נִי אִם־עָרַ֣בְתָּ לְרֵעֶ֑ךָ תָּקַ֖עְתָּ לַזָּ֣ר כַּפֶּֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:1
Proverbs 6:2You are trapped by the words of your mouth. You are ensnared with the words of your mouth.
Proverbs 6:2   נוֹקַ֥שְׁתָּ בְאִמְרֵי־פִ֑יךָ נִ֝לְכַּ֗דְתָּ בְּאִמְרֵי־פִֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:2
Proverbs 6:3Do this now, my son, and deliver yourself, since you have come into the hand of your neighbor. Go, humble yourself. Press your plea with your neighbor.
Proverbs 6:3   עֲשֵׂ֨ה זֹ֥את אֵפ֪וֹא ׀ בְּנִ֡י וְֽהִנָּצֵ֗ל כִּ֘י בָ֤אתָ בְכַף־רֵעֶ֑ךָ לֵ֥ךְ הִ֝תְרַפֵּ֗ס וּרְהַ֥ב רֵעֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:3
Proverbs 6:4Give no sleep to your eyes, nor slumber to your eyelids.
Proverbs 6:4   אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן שֵׁנָ֣ה לְעֵינֶ֑יךָ וּ֝תְנוּמָ֗ה לְעַפְעַפֶּֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:4
Proverbs 6:5Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the snare of the fowler.
Proverbs 6:5   הִ֭נָּצֵל כִּצְבִ֣י מִיָּ֑ד וּ֝כְצִפּ֗וֹר מִיַּ֥ד יָקֽוּשׁ׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 6:5
Proverbs 6:6Go to the ant, you sluggard. Consider her ways, and be wise;
Proverbs 6:6   לֵֽךְ־אֶל־נְמָלָ֥ה עָצֵ֑ל רְאֵ֖ה דְרָכֶ֣יהָ וַחֲכָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:6
Proverbs 6:7which having no chief, overseer, or ruler,
Proverbs 6:7   אֲשֶׁ֖ר אֵֽין־לָ֥הּ קָצִ֗ין שֹׁטֵ֥ר וּמֹשֵֽׁל׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:7
Proverbs 6:8provides her bread in the summer, and gathers her food in the harvest.
Proverbs 6:8   תָּכִ֣ין בַּקַּ֣יִץ לַחְמָ֑הּ אָגְרָ֥ה בַ֝קָּצִ֗יר מַאֲכָלָֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:8
Proverbs 6:9How long will you sleep, sluggard? When will you arise out of your sleep?
Proverbs 6:9   עַד־מָתַ֖י עָצֵ֥ל ׀ תִּשְׁכָּ֑ב מָ֝תַ֗י תָּק֥וּם מִשְּׁנָתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:9
Proverbs 6:10A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
Proverbs 6:10   מְעַ֣ט שֵׁ֭נוֹת מְעַ֣ט תְּנוּמ֑וֹת מְעַ֓ט ׀ חִבֻּ֖ק יָדַ֣יִם לִשְׁכָּֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:10
Proverbs 6:11so your poverty will come as a robber, and your scarcity as an armed man.
Proverbs 6:11   וּבָֽא־כִמְהַלֵּ֥ךְ רֵאשֶׁ֑ךָ וּ֝מַחְסֹֽרְךָ֗ כְּאִ֣ישׁ מָגֵֽן׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 6:11
Proverbs 6:12A worthless person, a man of iniquity, is he who walks with a perverse mouth;
Proverbs 6:12   אָדָ֣ם בְּ֭לִיַּעַל אִ֣ישׁ אָ֑וֶן ה֝וֹלֵ֗ךְ עִקְּשׁ֥וּת פֶּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:12
Proverbs 6:13who winks with his eyes, who signals with his feet, who motions with his fingers;
Proverbs 6:13   קֹרֵ֣ץ בְּ֭עֵינָו מֹלֵ֣ל בְּרַגְלָ֑ו מֹ֝רֶ֗ה בְּאֶצְבְּעֹתָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:13
Proverbs 6:14in whose heart is perverseness, who devises evil continually, who always sows discord.
Proverbs 6:14   תַּֽהְפֻּכ֨וֹת ׀ בְּלִבּ֗וֹ חֹרֵ֣שׁ רָ֣ע בְּכָל־עֵ֑ת *מדנים **מִדְיָנִ֥ים יְשַׁלֵּֽחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:14
Proverbs 6:15Therefore his calamity will come suddenly. He will be broken suddenly, and that without remedy.
Proverbs 6:15   עַל־כֵּ֗ן פִּ֭תְאֹם יָב֣וֹא אֵיד֑וֹ פֶּ֥תַע יִ֝שָּׁבֵ֗ר וְאֵ֣ין מַרְפֵּֽא׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 6:15
Proverbs 6:16There are six things which Yahweh hates; yes, seven which are an abomination to him:
Proverbs 6:16   שֶׁשׁ־הֵ֭נָּה שָׂנֵ֣א יְהוָ֑ה וְ֝שֶׁ֗בַע *תועבות **תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:16
Proverbs 6:17haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood;
Proverbs 6:17   עֵינַ֣יִם רָ֭מוֹת לְשׁ֣וֹן שָׁ֑קֶר וְ֝יָדַ֗יִם שֹׁפְכ֥וֹת דָּם־נָקִֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:17
Proverbs 6:18a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that are swift in running to mischief,
Proverbs 6:18   לֵ֗ב חֹ֭רֵשׁ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת אָ֑וֶן רַגְלַ֥יִם מְ֝מַהֲר֗וֹת לָר֥וּץ לָֽרָעָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:18
Proverbs 6:19a false witness who utters lies, and he who sows discord among brothers.
Proverbs 6:19   יָפִ֣יחַ כְּ֭זָבִים עֵ֣ד שָׁ֑קֶר וּמְשַׁלֵּ֥חַ מְ֝דָנִ֗ים בֵּ֣ין אַחִֽים׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 6:19
Proverbs 6:20My son, keep your father's commandment, and don't forsake your mother's teaching.
Proverbs 6:20   נְצֹ֣ר בְּ֭נִי מִצְוַ֣ת אָבִ֑יךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝טֹּ֗שׁ תּוֹרַ֥ת אִמֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:20
Proverbs 6:21Bind them continually on your heart. Tie them around your neck.
Proverbs 6:21   קָשְׁרֵ֣ם עַל־לִבְּךָ֣ תָמִ֑יד עָ֝נְדֵ֗ם עַל־גַּרְגְּרֹתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:21
Proverbs 6:22When you walk, it will lead you. When you sleep, it will watch over you. When you awake, it will talk with you.
Proverbs 6:22   בְּהִתְהַלֶּכְךָ֨ ׀ תַּנְחֶ֬ה אֹתָ֗ךְ בְּֽ֭שָׁכְבְּךָ תִּשְׁמֹ֣ר עָלֶ֑יךָ וַ֝הֲקִיצ֗וֹתָ הִ֣יא תְשִׂיחֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:22
Proverbs 6:23For the commandment is a lamp, and the law is light. Reproofs of instruction are the way of life,
Proverbs 6:23   כִּ֤י נֵ֣ר מִ֭צְוָה וְת֣וֹרָה א֑וֹר וְדֶ֥רֶךְ חַ֝יִּ֗ים תּוֹכְח֥וֹת מוּסָֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:23
Proverbs 6:24to keep you from the immoral woman, from the flattery of the wayward wife's tongue.
Proverbs 6:24   לִ֭שְׁמָרְךָ מֵאֵ֣שֶׁת רָ֑ע מֵֽ֝חֶלְקַ֗ת לָשׁ֥וֹן נָכְרִיָּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:24
Proverbs 6:25Don't lust after her beauty in your heart, neither let her captivate you with her eyelids.
Proverbs 6:25   אַל־תַּחְמֹ֣ד יָ֭פְיָהּ בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ וְאַל־תִּ֝קָּֽחֲךָ֗ בְּעַפְעַפֶּֽיהָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:25
Proverbs 6:26For a prostitute reduces you to a piece of bread. The adulteress hunts for your precious life.
Proverbs 6:26   כִּ֤י בְעַד־אִשָּׁ֥ה זוֹנָ֗ה עַֽד־כִּכַּ֫ר לָ֥חֶם וְאֵ֥שֶׁת אִ֑ישׁ נֶ֖פֶשׁ יְקָרָ֣ה תָצֽוּד׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 6:26
Proverbs 6:27Can a man scoop fire into his lap, and his clothes not be burned?
Proverbs 6:27   הֲיַחְתֶּ֤ה אִ֓ישׁ אֵ֬שׁ בְּחֵיק֑וֹ וּ֝בְגָדָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִשָּׂרַֽפְנָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:27
Proverbs 6:28Or can one walk on hot coals, and his feet not be scorched?
Proverbs 6:28   אִם־יְהַלֵּ֣ךְ אִ֭ישׁ עַל־הַגֶּחָלִ֑ים וְ֝רַגְלָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִכָּוֶֽינָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:28
Proverbs 6:29So is he who goes in to his neighbor's wife. Whoever touches her will not be unpunished.
Proverbs 6:29   כֵּ֗ן הַ֭בָּא אֶל־אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֵ֑הוּ לֹ֥א יִ֝נָּקֶ֗ה כָּֽל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:29
Proverbs 6:30Men don't despise a thief, if he steals to satisfy himself when he is hungry:
Proverbs 6:30   לֹא־יָב֣וּזוּ לַ֭גַּנָּב כִּ֣י יִגְנ֑וֹב לְמַלֵּ֥א נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ כִּ֣י יִרְעָֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:30
Proverbs 6:31but if he is found, he shall restore seven times. He shall give all the wealth of his house.
Proverbs 6:31   וְ֭נִמְצָא יְשַׁלֵּ֣ם שִׁבְעָתָ֑יִם אֶת־כָּל־ה֖וֹן בֵּית֣וֹ יִתֵּֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:31
Proverbs 6:32He who commits adultery with a woman is void of understanding. He who does it destroys his own soul.
Proverbs 6:32   נֹאֵ֣ף אִשָּׁ֣ה חֲסַר־לֵ֑ב מַֽשְׁחִ֥ית נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ ה֣וּא יַעֲשֶֽׂנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:32
Proverbs 6:33He will get wounds and dishonor. His reproach will not be wiped away.
Proverbs 6:33   נֶֽגַע־וְקָל֥וֹן יִמְצָ֑א וְ֝חֶרְפָּת֗וֹ לֹ֣א תִמָּחֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:33
Proverbs 6:34For jealousy arouses the fury of the husband. He won't spare in the day of vengeance.
Proverbs 6:34   כִּֽי־קִנְאָ֥ה חֲמַת־גָּ֑בֶר וְלֹֽא־יַ֝חְמ֗וֹל בְּי֣וֹם נָקָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 6:34
Proverbs 6:35He won't regard any ransom, neither will he rest content, though you give many gifts.
Proverbs 6:35   לֹא־יִ֭שָּׂא פְּנֵ֣י כָל־כֹּ֑פֶר וְלֹֽא־יֹ֝אבֶ֗ה כִּ֣י תַרְבֶּה־שֹֽׁחַד׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 6:35
Proverbs 7:1My son, keep my words. Lay up my commandments within you.
Proverbs 7:1   בְּ֭נִי שְׁמֹ֣ר אֲמָרָ֑י וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י תִּצְפֹּ֥ן אִתָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:1
Proverbs 7:2Keep my commandments and live! Guard my teaching as the apple of your eye.
Proverbs 7:2   שְׁמֹ֣ר מִצְוֺתַ֣י וֶחְיֵ֑ה וְ֝תוֹרָתִ֗י כְּאִישׁ֥וֹן עֵינֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:2
Proverbs 7:3Bind them on your fingers. Write them on the tablet of your heart.
Proverbs 7:3   קָשְׁרֵ֥ם עַל־אֶצְבְּעֹתֶ֑יךָ כָּ֝תְבֵ֗ם עַל־ל֥וּחַ לִבֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:3
Proverbs 7:4Tell wisdom, |You are my sister.| Call understanding your relative,
Proverbs 7:4   אֱמֹ֣ר לַֽ֭חָכְמָה אֲחֹ֣תִי אָ֑תְּ וּ֝מֹדָ֗ע לַבִּינָ֥ה תִקְרָֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:4
Proverbs 7:5that they may keep you from the strange woman, from the foreigner who flatters with her words.
Proverbs 7:5   לִ֭שְׁמָרְךָ מֵאִשָּׁ֣ה זָרָ֑ה מִ֝נָּכְרִיָּ֗ה אֲמָרֶ֥יהָ הֶחֱלִֽיקָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:5
Proverbs 7:6For at the window of my house, I looked out through my lattice.
Proverbs 7:6   כִּ֭י בְּחַלּ֣וֹן בֵּיתִ֑י בְּעַ֖ד אֶשְׁנַבִּ֣י נִשְׁקָֽפְתִּי׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:6
Proverbs 7:7I saw among the simple ones. I discerned among the youths a young man void of understanding,
Proverbs 7:7   וָאֵ֤רֶא בַפְּתָאיִ֗ם אָ֘בִ֤ינָה בַבָּנִ֗ים נַ֣עַר חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:7
Proverbs 7:8passing through the street near her corner, he went the way to her house,
Proverbs 7:8   עֹבֵ֣ר בַּ֭שּׁוּק אֵ֣צֶל פִּנָּ֑הּ וְדֶ֖רֶךְ בֵּיתָ֣הּ יִצְעָֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:8
Proverbs 7:9in the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the middle of the night and in the darkness.
Proverbs 7:9   בְּנֶֽשֶׁף־בְּעֶ֥רֶב י֑וֹם בְּאִישׁ֥וֹן לַ֝֗יְלָה וַאֲפֵלָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:9
Proverbs 7:10Behold, there a woman met him with the attire of a prostitute, and with crafty intent.
Proverbs 7:10   וְהִנֵּ֣ה אִ֭שָּׁה לִקְרָאת֑וֹ שִׁ֥ית ז֝וֹנָ֗ה וּנְצֻ֥רַת לֵֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:10
Proverbs 7:11She is loud and defiant. Her feet don't stay in her house.
Proverbs 7:11   הֹמִיָּ֣ה הִ֣יא וְסֹרָ֑רֶת בְּ֝בֵיתָ֗הּ לֹא־יִשְׁכְּנ֥וּ רַגְלֶֽיהָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:11
Proverbs 7:12Now she is in the streets, now in the squares, and lurking at every corner.
Proverbs 7:12   פַּ֤עַם ׀ בַּח֗וּץ פַּ֥עַם בָּרְחֹב֑וֹת וְאֵ֖צֶל כָּל־פִּנָּ֣ה תֶאֱרֹֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:12
Proverbs 7:13So she caught him, and kissed him. With an impudent face she said to him:
Proverbs 7:13   וְהֶחֱזִ֣יקָה בּ֭וֹ וְנָ֣שְׁקָה־לּ֑וֹ הֵעֵ֥זָה פָ֝נֶ֗יהָ וַתֹּ֣אמַר לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:13
Proverbs 7:14|Sacrifices of peace offerings are with me. This day I have paid my vows.
Proverbs 7:14   זִבְחֵ֣י שְׁלָמִ֣ים עָלָ֑י הַ֝יּ֗וֹם שִׁלַּ֥מְתִּי נְדָרָֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:14
Proverbs 7:15Therefore I came out to meet you, to diligently seek your face, and I have found you.
Proverbs 7:15   עַל־כֵּ֭ן יָצָ֣אתִי לִקְרָאתֶ֑ךָ לְשַׁחֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וָאֶמְצָאֶֽךָּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:15
Proverbs 7:16I have spread my couch with carpets of tapestry, with striped cloths of the yarn of Egypt.
Proverbs 7:16   מַ֭רְבַדִּים רָבַ֣דְתִּי עַרְשִׂ֑י חֲ֝טֻב֗וֹת אֵט֥וּן מִצְרָֽיִם׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:16
Proverbs 7:17I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Proverbs 7:17   נַ֥פְתִּי מִשְׁכָּבִ֑י מֹ֥ר אֲ֝הָלִ֗ים וְקִנָּמֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:17
Proverbs 7:18Come, let's take our fill of loving until the morning. Let's solace ourselves with loving.
Proverbs 7:18   לְכָ֤ה נִרְוֶ֣ה דֹ֭דִים עַד־הַבֹּ֑קֶר נִ֝תְעַלְּסָ֗ה בָּאֳהָבִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:18
Proverbs 7:19For my husband isn't at home. He has gone on a long journey.
Proverbs 7:19   כִּ֤י אֵ֣ין הָאִ֣ישׁ בְּבֵית֑וֹ הָ֝לַ֗ךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ מֵרָחֽוֹק׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:19
Proverbs 7:20He has taken a bag of money with him. He will come home at the full moon.|
Proverbs 7:20   צְֽרוֹר־הַ֭כֶּסֶף לָקַ֣ח בְּיָד֑וֹ לְי֥וֹם הַ֝כֵּ֗סֶא יָבֹ֥א בֵיתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:20
Proverbs 7:21With persuasive words, she led him astray. With the flattering of her lips, she seduced him.
Proverbs 7:21   הִ֭טַּתּוּ בְּרֹ֣ב לִקְחָ֑הּ בְּחֵ֥לֶק שְׂ֝פָתֶ֗יהָ תַּדִּיחֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:21
Proverbs 7:22He followed her immediately, as an ox goes to the slaughter, as a fool stepping into a noose.
Proverbs 7:22   ה֤וֹלֵ֥ךְ אַחֲרֶ֗יהָ פִּ֫תְאֹ֥ם כְּ֭שׁוֹר אֶל־טָ֣בַח יָב֑וֹא וּ֝כְעֶ֗כֶס אֶל־מוּסַ֥ר אֱוֽ͏ִיל׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:22
Proverbs 7:23Until an arrow strikes through his liver, as a bird hurries to the snare, and doesn't know that it will cost his life.
Proverbs 7:23   עַ֤ד יְפַלַּ֪ח חֵ֡ץ כְּֽבֵד֗וֹ כְּמַהֵ֣ר צִפּ֣וֹר אֶל־פָּ֑ח וְלֹֽא־יָ֝דַ֗ע כִּֽי־בְנַפְשׁ֥וֹ הֽוּא׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 7:23
Proverbs 7:24Now therefore, sons, listen to me. Pay attention to the words of my mouth.
Proverbs 7:24   וְעַתָּ֣ה בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י וְ֝הַקְשִׁ֗יבוּ לְאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:24
Proverbs 7:25Don't let your heart turn to her ways. Don't go astray in her paths,
Proverbs 7:25   אַל־יֵ֣שְׂטְ אֶל־דְּרָכֶ֣יהָ לִבֶּ֑ךָ אַל־תֵּ֝תַע בִּנְתִיבוֹתֶֽיהָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:25
Proverbs 7:26for she has thrown down many wounded. Yes, all her slain are a mighty army.
Proverbs 7:26   כִּֽי־רַבִּ֣ים חֲלָלִ֣ים הִפִּ֑ילָה וַ֝עֲצֻמִ֗ים כָּל־הֲרֻגֶֽיהָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 7:26
Proverbs 7:27Her house is the way to Sheol, going down to the rooms of death.
Proverbs 7:27   דַּרְכֵ֣י שְׁא֣וֹל בֵּיתָ֑הּ יֹ֝רְד֗וֹת אֶל־חַדְרֵי־מָֽוֶת׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 7:27
Proverbs 8:1Doesn't wisdom cry out? Doesn't understanding raise her voice?
Proverbs 8:1   הֲלֹֽא־חָכְמָ֥ה תִקְרָ֑א וּ֝תְבוּנָ֗ה תִּתֵּ֥ן קוֹלָֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:1
Proverbs 8:2On the top of high places by the way, where the paths meet, she stands.
Proverbs 8:2   בְּרֹאשׁ־מְרוֹמִ֥ים עֲלֵי־דָ֑רֶךְ בֵּ֖ית נְתִיב֣וֹת נִצָּֽבָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:2
Proverbs 8:3Beside the gates, at the entry of the city, at the entry doors, she cries aloud:
Proverbs 8:3   לְיַד־שְׁעָרִ֥ים לְפִי־קָ֑רֶת מְב֖וֹא פְתָחִ֣ים תָּרֹֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:3
Proverbs 8:4|To you men, I call! I send my voice to the sons of mankind.
Proverbs 8:4   אֲלֵיכֶ֣ם אִישִׁ֣ים אֶקְרָ֑א וְ֝קוֹלִ֗י אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:4
Proverbs 8:5You simple, understand prudence. You fools, be of an understanding heart.
Proverbs 8:5   הָבִ֣ינוּ פְתָאיִ֣ם עָרְמָ֑ה וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים הָבִ֥ינוּ לֵֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:5
Proverbs 8:6Hear, for I will speak excellent things. The opening of my lips is for right things.
Proverbs 8:6   שִׁ֭מְעוּ כִּֽי־נְגִידִ֣ים אֲדַבֵּ֑ר וּמִפְתַּ֥ח שְׂ֝פָתַ֗י מֵישָׁרִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:6
Proverbs 8:7For my mouth speaks truth. Wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
Proverbs 8:7   כִּֽי־אֱ֭מֶת יֶהְגֶּ֣ה חִכִּ֑י וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת שְׂפָתַ֣י רֶֽשַׁע׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:7
Proverbs 8:8All the words of my mouth are in righteousness. There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.
Proverbs 8:8   בְּצֶ֥דֶק כָּל־אִמְרֵי־פִ֑י אֵ֥ין בָּ֝הֶ֗ם נִפְתָּ֥ל וְעִקֵּֽשׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:8
Proverbs 8:9They are all plain to him who understands, right to those who find knowledge.
Proverbs 8:9   כֻּלָּ֣ם נְ֭כֹחִים לַמֵּבִ֑ין וִֽ֝ישָׁרִ֗ים לְמֹ֣צְאֵי דָֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:9
Proverbs 8:10Receive my instruction rather than silver; knowledge rather than choice gold.
Proverbs 8:10   קְחֽוּ־מוּסָרִ֥י וְאַל־כָּ֑סֶף וְ֝דַ֗עַת מֵחָר֥וּץ נִבְחָֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:10
Proverbs 8:11For wisdom is better than rubies. All the things that may be desired can't be compared to it.
Proverbs 8:11   כִּֽי־טוֹבָ֣ה חָ֭כְמָה מִפְּנִינִ֑ים וְכָל־חֲ֝פָצִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִֽשְׁווּ־בָֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:11
Proverbs 8:12|I, wisdom, have made prudence my dwelling. Find out knowledge and discretion.
Proverbs 8:12   אֲ‍ֽנִי־חָ֭כְמָה שָׁכַ֣נְתִּי עָרְמָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת מְזִמּ֣וֹת אֶמְצָֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:12
Proverbs 8:13The fear of Yahweh is to hate evil. I hate pride, arrogance, the evil way, and the perverse mouth.
Proverbs 8:13   יִֽרְאַ֣ת יְהוָה֮ שְֽׂנֹ֫את רָ֥ע גֵּ֘אָ֤ה וְגָא֨וֹן ׀ וְדֶ֣רֶךְ רָ֭ע וּפִ֨י תַהְפֻּכ֬וֹת שָׂנֵֽאתִי׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:13
Proverbs 8:14Counsel and sound knowledge are mine. I have understanding and power.
Proverbs 8:14   לִֽי־עֵ֭צָה וְתוּשִׁיָּ֑ה אֲנִ֥י בִ֝ינָ֗ה לִ֣י גְבוּרָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:14
Proverbs 8:15By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
Proverbs 8:15   בִּ֭י מְלָכִ֣ים יִמְלֹ֑כוּ וְ֝רוֹזְנִ֗ים יְחֹ֣קְקוּ צֶֽדֶק׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:15
Proverbs 8:16By me princes rule; nobles, and all the righteous rulers of the earth.
Proverbs 8:16   בִּ֭י שָׂרִ֣ים יָשֹׂ֑רוּ וּ֝נְדִיבִ֗ים כָּל־שֹׁ֥פְטֵי צֶֽדֶק׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:16
Proverbs 8:17I love those who love me. Those who seek me diligently will find me.
Proverbs 8:17   אֲ֭נִי *אהביה **אֹהֲבַ֣י אֵהָ֑ב וּ֝מְשַׁחֲרַ֗י יִמְצָאֻֽנְנִי׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:17
Proverbs 8:18With me are riches, honor, enduring wealth, and prosperity.
Proverbs 8:18   עֹֽשֶׁר־וְכָב֥וֹד אִתִּ֑י ה֥וֹן עָ֝תֵ֗ק וּצְדָקָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:18
Proverbs 8:19My fruit is better than gold, yes, than fine gold; my yield than choice silver.
Proverbs 8:19   ט֣וֹב פִּ֭רְיִי מֵחָר֣וּץ וּמִפָּ֑ז וּ֝תְבוּאָתִ֗י מִכֶּ֥סֶף נִבְחָֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:19
Proverbs 8:20I walk in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of justice;
Proverbs 8:20   בְּאֹֽרַח־צְדָקָ֥ה אֲהַלֵּ֑ך בְּ֝ת֗וֹךְ נְתִיב֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:20
Proverbs 8:21That I may give wealth to those who love me. I fill their treasuries.
Proverbs 8:21   לְהַנְחִ֖יל אֹהֲבַ֥י ׀ יֵ֑שׁ וְאֹצְרֹ֖תֵיהֶ֣ם אֲמַלֵּֽא׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 8:21
Proverbs 8:22|Yahweh possessed me in the beginning of his work, before his deeds of old.
Proverbs 8:22   יְֽהוָ֗ה קָ֭נָנִי רֵאשִׁ֣ית דַּרְכּ֑וֹ קֶ֖דֶם מִפְעָלָ֣יו מֵאָֽז׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:22
Proverbs 8:23I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, before the earth existed.
Proverbs 8:23   מֵ֭עוֹלָם נִסַּ֥כְתִּי מֵרֹ֗אשׁ מִקַּדְמֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:23
Proverbs 8:24When there were no depths, I was brought forth, when there were no springs abounding with water.
Proverbs 8:24   בְּאֵין־תְּהֹמ֥וֹת חוֹלָ֑לְתִּי בְּאֵ֥ין מַ֝עְיָנ֗וֹת נִכְבַּדֵּי־מָֽיִם׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:24
Proverbs 8:25Before the mountains were settled in place, before the hills, I was brought forth;
Proverbs 8:25   בְּטֶ֣רֶם הָרִ֣ים הָטְבָּ֑עוּ לִפְנֵ֖י גְבָע֣וֹת חוֹלָֽלְתִּי׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:25
Proverbs 8:26while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the beginning of the dust of the world.
Proverbs 8:26   עַד־לֹ֣א עָ֭שָׂה אֶ֣רֶץ וְחוּצ֑וֹת וְ֝רֹ֗אשׁ עָפְר֥וֹת תֵּבֵֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:26
Proverbs 8:27When he established the heavens, I was there; when he set a circle on the surface of the deep,
Proverbs 8:27   בַּהֲכִינ֣וֹ שָׁ֭מַיִם שָׁ֣ם אָ֑נִי בְּח֥וּקוֹ ח֝֗וּג עַל־פְּנֵ֥י תְהֽוֹם׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:27
Proverbs 8:28when he established the clouds above, when the springs of the deep became strong,
Proverbs 8:28   בְּאַמְּצ֣וֹ שְׁחָקִ֣ים מִמָּ֑עַל בַּ֝עֲז֗וֹז עִינ֥וֹת תְּהוֹם׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:28
Proverbs 8:29when he gave to the sea its boundary, that the waters should not violate his commandment, when he marked out the foundations of the earth;
Proverbs 8:29   בְּשׂ֘וּמ֤וֹ לַיָּ֨ם ׀ חֻקּ֗וֹ וּ֭מַיִם לֹ֣א יַֽעַבְרוּ־פִ֑יו בְּ֝חוּק֗וֹ מ֣וֹסְדֵי אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:29
Proverbs 8:30then I was the craftsman by his side. I was a delight day by day, always rejoicing before him,
Proverbs 8:30   וָֽאֶהְיֶ֥ה אֶצְל֗וֹ אָ֫מ֥וֹן וָֽאֶהְיֶ֣ה שַׁ֭עֲשֻׁעִים י֤וֹם ׀ י֑וֹם מְשַׂחֶ֖קֶת לְפָנָ֣יו בְּכָל־עֵֽת׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:30
Proverbs 8:31Rejoicing in his whole world. My delight was with the sons of men.
Proverbs 8:31   מְ֭שַׂחֶקֶת בְּתֵבֵ֣ל אַרְצ֑וֹ וְ֝שַׁעֲשֻׁעַ֗י אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 8:31
Proverbs 8:32|Now therefore, my sons, listen to me, for blessed are those who keep my ways.
Proverbs 8:32   וְעַתָּ֣ה בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י וְ֝אַשְׁרֵ֗י דְּרָכַ֥י יִשְׁמֹֽרוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:32
Proverbs 8:33Hear instruction, and be wise. Don't refuse it.
Proverbs 8:33   שִׁמְע֖וּ מוּסָ֥ר וַחֲכָ֗מוּ וְאַל־תִּפְרָֽעוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:33
Proverbs 8:34Blessed is the man who hears me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at my door posts.
Proverbs 8:34   אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי אָדָם֮ שֹׁמֵ֢עַֽ֫ לִ֥י לִשְׁקֹ֣ד עַל־דַּ֭לְתֹתַי י֤וֹם ׀ י֑וֹם לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר מְזוּזֹ֥ת פְּתָחָֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:34
Proverbs 8:35For whoever finds me, finds life, and will obtain favor from Yahweh.
Proverbs 8:35   כִּ֣י מֹ֭צְאִי *מצאי **מָצָ֣א חַיִּ֑ים וַיָּ֥פֶק רָ֝צ֗וֹן מֵיְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 8:35
Proverbs 8:36But he who sins against me wrongs his own soul. All those who hate me love death.|
Proverbs 8:36   וְֽ֭חֹטְאִי חֹמֵ֣ס נַפְשׁ֑וֹ כָּל־מְ֝שַׂנְאַ֗י אָ֣הֲבוּ מָֽוֶת׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 8:36
Proverbs 9:1Wisdom has built her house. She has carved out her seven pillars.
Proverbs 9:1   חָ֭כְמוֹת בָּנְתָ֣ה בֵיתָ֑הּ חָצְבָ֖ה עַמּוּדֶ֣יהָ שִׁבְעָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:1
Proverbs 9:2She has prepared her meat. She has mixed her wine. She has also set her table.
Proverbs 9:2   טָבְחָ֣ה טִ֭בְחָהּ מָסְכָ֣ה יֵינָ֑הּ אַ֝֗ף עָֽרְכָ֥ה שֻׁלְחָנָֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:2
Proverbs 9:3She has sent out her maidens. She cries from the highest places of the city:
Proverbs 9:3   שָֽׁלְחָ֣ה נַעֲרֹתֶ֣יהָ תִקְרָ֑א עַל־גַּ֝פֵּ֗י מְרֹ֣מֵי קָֽרֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:3
Proverbs 9:4|Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!| As for him who is void of understanding, she says to him,
Proverbs 9:4   מִי־פֶ֭תִי יָסֻ֣ר הֵ֑נָּה חֲסַר־לֵ֝֗ב אָ֣מְרָה לּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:4
Proverbs 9:5|Come, eat some of my bread, Drink some of the wine which I have mixed!
Proverbs 9:5   לְ֭כוּ לַחֲמ֣וּ בְֽלַחֲמִ֑י וּ֝שְׁת֗וּ בְּיַ֣יִן מָסָֽכְתִּי׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:5
Proverbs 9:6Leave your simple ways, and live. Walk in the way of understanding.|
Proverbs 9:6   עִזְב֣וּ פְתָאיִ֣ם וִֽחְי֑וּ וְ֝אִשְׁר֗וּ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ בִּינָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:6
Proverbs 9:7He who corrects a mocker invites insult. He who reproves a wicked man invites abuse.
Proverbs 9:7   יֹ֤סֵ֨ר ׀ לֵ֗ץ לֹקֵ֣חַֽ ל֣וֹ קָל֑וֹן וּמוֹכִ֖יחַ לְרָשָׁ֣ע מוּמֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:7
Proverbs 9:8Don't reprove a scoffer, lest he hate you. Reprove a wise man, and he will love you.
Proverbs 9:8   אַל־תּ֣וֹכַח לֵ֭ץ פֶּן־יִשְׂנָאֶ֑ךָּ הוֹכַ֥ח לְ֝חָכָ֗ם וְיֶאֱהָבֶֽךָּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:8
Proverbs 9:9Instruct a wise man, and he will be still wiser. Teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.
Proverbs 9:9   תֵּ֣ן לְ֭חָכָם וְיֶחְכַּם־ע֑וֹד הוֹדַ֥ע לְ֝צַדִּ֗יק וְי֣וֹסֶף לֶֽקַח׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 9:9
Proverbs 9:10The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom. The knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
Proverbs 9:10   תְּחִלַּ֣ת חָ֭כְמָה יִרְאַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה וְדַ֖עַת קְדֹשִׁ֣ים בִּינָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:10
Proverbs 9:11For by me your days will be multiplied. The years of your life will be increased.
Proverbs 9:11   כִּי־בִ֭י יִרְבּ֣וּ יָמֶ֑יךָ וְיוֹסִ֥יפוּ לְּ֝ךָ֗ שְׁנ֣וֹת חַיִּֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:11
Proverbs 9:12If you are wise, you are wise for yourself. If you mock, you alone will bear it.
Proverbs 9:12   אִם־חָ֭כַמְתָּ חָכַ֣מְתָּ לָּ֑ךְ וְ֝לַ֗צְתָּ לְֽבַדְּךָ֥ תִשָּֽׂא׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:12
Proverbs 9:13The foolish woman is loud, Undisciplined, and knows nothing.
Proverbs 9:13   אֵ֣שֶׁת כְּ֭סִילוּת הֹֽמִיָּ֑ה פְּ֝תַיּ֗וּת וּבַל־יָ֥דְעָה מָּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:13
Proverbs 9:14She sits at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,
Proverbs 9:14   וְֽ֭יָשְׁבָה לְפֶ֣תַח בֵּיתָ֑הּ עַל־כִּ֝סֵּ֗א מְרֹ֣מֵי קָֽרֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:14
Proverbs 9:15To call to those who pass by, who go straight on their ways,
Proverbs 9:15   לִקְרֹ֥א לְעֹֽבְרֵי־דָ֑רֶךְ הַֽ֝מְיַשְּׁרִ֗ים אֹֽרְחוֹתָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:15
Proverbs 9:16|Whoever is simple, let him turn in here.| as for him who is void of understanding, she says to him,
Proverbs 9:16   מִי־פֶ֭תִי יָסֻ֣ר הֵ֑נָּה וַחֲסַר־לֵ֝֗ב וְאָ֣מְרָה לּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:16
Proverbs 9:17|Stolen water is sweet. Food eaten in secret is pleasant.|
Proverbs 9:17   מַֽיִם־גְּנוּבִ֥ים יִמְתָּ֑קוּ וְלֶ֖חֶם סְתָרִ֣ים יִנְעָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 9:17
Proverbs 9:18But he doesn't know that the dead are there, that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
Proverbs 9:18   וְֽלֹא־יָ֭דַע כִּֽי־רְפָאִ֣ים שָׁ֑ם בְּעִמְקֵ֖י שְׁא֣וֹל קְרֻאֶֽיהָ׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 9:18
Proverbs 10:1The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son makes a glad father; but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.
Proverbs 10:10  מִשְׁלֵ֗י שְׁלֹ֫מֹ֥ה פ בֵּ֣ן חָ֭כָם יְשַׂמַּח־אָ֑ב וּבֵ֥ן כְּ֝סִ֗יל תּוּגַ֥ת אִמּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:1
Proverbs 10:2Treasures of wickedness profit nothing, but righteousness delivers from death.
Proverbs 10:20  לֹא־י֭וֹעִילוּ אוֹצְר֣וֹת רֶ֑שַׁע וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה תַּצִּ֥יל מִמָּֽוֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:2
Proverbs 10:3Yahweh will not allow the soul of the righteous to go hungry, but he thrusts away the desire of the wicked.
Proverbs 10:30  לֹֽא־יַרְעִ֣יב יְ֭הוָה נֶ֣פֶשׁ צַדִּ֑יק וְהַוַּ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים יֶהְדֹּֽף׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:3
Proverbs 10:4He becomes poor who works with a lazy hand, but the hand of the diligent brings wealth.
Proverbs 10:40  רָ֗אשׁ עֹשֶׂ֥ה כַף־רְמִיָּ֑ה וְיַ֖ד חָרוּצִ֣ים תַּעֲשִֽׁיר׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:4
Proverbs 10:5He who gathers in summer is a wise son, but he who sleeps during the harvest is a son who causes shame.
Proverbs 10:50  אֹגֵ֣ר בַּ֭קַּיִץ בֵּ֣ן מַשְׂכִּ֑יל נִרְדָּ֥ם בַּ֝קָּצִ֗יר בֵּ֣ן מֵבִֽישׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:5
Proverbs 10:6Blessings are on the head of the righteous, but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
Proverbs 10:60  בְּ֭רָכוֹת לְרֹ֣אשׁ צַדִּ֑יק וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְכַסֶּ֥ה חָמָֽס׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:6
Proverbs 10:7The memory of the righteous is blessed, but the name of the wicked will rot.
Proverbs 10:70  זֵ֣כֶר צַ֭דִּיק לִבְרָכָ֑ה וְשֵׁ֖ם רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִרְקָֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:7
Proverbs 10:8The wise in heart accept commandments, but a chattering fool will fall.
Proverbs 10:80  חֲכַם־לֵ֭ב יִקַּ֣ח מִצְוֺ֑ת וֶאֱוִ֥יל שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם יִלָּבֵֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:8
Proverbs 10:9He who walks blamelessly walks surely, but he who perverts his ways will be found out.
Proverbs 10:90  הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בַּ֭תֹּם יֵ֣לֶךְ בֶּ֑טַח וּמְעַקֵּ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכָ֗יו יִוָּדֵֽעַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:9
Proverbs 10:10One winking with the eye causes sorrow, but a chattering fool will fall.
Proverbs 10:100  קֹ֣רֵֽץ עַ֭יִן יִתֵּ֣ן עַצָּ֑בֶת וֶאֱוִ֥יל שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם יִלָּבֵֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:10
Proverbs 10:11The mouth of the righteous is a spring of life, but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
Proverbs 10:110  מְק֣וֹר חַ֭יִּים פִּ֣י צַדִּ֑יק וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְכַסֶּ֥ה חָמָֽס׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:11
Proverbs 10:12Hatred stirs up strife, but love covers all wrongs.
Proverbs 10:120  שִׂ֭נְאָה תְּעוֹרֵ֣ר מְדָנִ֑ים וְעַ֥ל כָּל־פְּ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תְּכַסֶּ֥ה אַהֲבָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:12
Proverbs 10:13Wisdom is found on the lips of him who has discernment, but a rod is for the back of him who is void of understanding.
Proverbs 10:130  בְּשִׂפְתֵ֣י נָ֭בוֹן תִּמָּצֵ֣א חָכְמָ֑ה וְ֝שֵׁ֗בֶט לְגֵ֣ו חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:13
Proverbs 10:14Wise men lay up knowledge, but the mouth of the foolish is near ruin.
Proverbs 10:140  חֲכָמִ֥ים יִצְפְּנוּ־דָ֑עַת וּפִֽי־אֱ֝וִיל מְחִתָּ֥ה קְרֹבָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:14
Proverbs 10:15The rich man's wealth is his strong city. The destruction of the poor is their poverty.
Proverbs 10:150  ה֣וֹן עָ֭שִׁיר קִרְיַ֣ת עֻזּ֑וֹ מְחִתַּ֖ת דַּלִּ֣ים רֵישָֽׁם׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:15
Proverbs 10:16The labor of the righteous leads to life. The increase of the wicked leads to sin.
Proverbs 10:160  פְּעֻלַּ֣ת צַדִּ֣יק לְחַיִּ֑ים תְּבוּאַ֖ת רָשָׁ֣ע לְחַטָּֽאת׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:16
Proverbs 10:17He is in the way of life who heeds correction, but he who forsakes reproof leads others astray.
Proverbs 10:170  אֹ֣רַח לְ֭חַיִּים שׁוֹמֵ֣ר מוּסָ֑ר וְעוֹזֵ֖ב תּוֹכַ֣חַת מַתְעֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:17
Proverbs 10:18He who hides hatred has lying lips. He who utters a slander is a fool.
Proverbs 10:180  מְכַסֶּ֣ה שִׂ֭נְאָה שִׂפְתֵי־שָׁ֑קֶר וּמוֹצִ֥א דִ֝בָּ֗ה ה֣וּא כְסִֽיל׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:18
Proverbs 10:19In the multitude of words there is no lack of disobedience, but he who restrains his lips does wisely.
Proverbs 10:190  בְּרֹ֣ב דְּ֭בָרִים לֹ֣א יֶחְדַּל־פָּ֑שַׁע וְחֹשֵׂ֖ךְ שְׂפָתָ֣יו מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:19
Proverbs 10:20The tongue of the righteous is like choice silver. The heart of the wicked is of little worth.
Proverbs 10:200  כֶּ֣סֶף נִ֭בְחָר לְשׁ֣וֹן צַדִּ֑יק לֵ֖ב רְשָׁעִ֣ים כִּמְעָֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:20
Proverbs 10:21The lips of the righteous feed many, but the foolish die for lack of understanding.
Proverbs 10:210  שִׂפְתֵ֣י צַ֭דִּיק יִרְע֣וּ רַבִּ֑ים וֶֽ֝אֱוִילִ֗ים בַּחֲסַר־לֵ֥ב יָמֽוּתוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:21
Proverbs 10:22Yahweh's blessing brings wealth, and he adds no trouble to it.
Proverbs 10:220  בִּרְכַּ֣ת יְ֭הוָה הִ֣יא תַעֲשִׁ֑יר וְלֹֽא־יוֹסִ֖ף עֶ֣צֶב עִמָּֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:22
Proverbs 10:23It is a fool's pleasure to do wickedness, but wisdom is a man of understanding's pleasure.
Proverbs 10:230  כִּשְׂח֣וֹק לִ֭כְסִיל עֲשׂ֣וֹת זִמָּ֑ה וְ֝חָכְמָ֗ה לְאִ֣ישׁ תְּבוּנָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:23
Proverbs 10:24What the wicked fear, will overtake them, but the desire of the righteous will be granted.
Proverbs 10:240  מְגוֹרַ֣ת רָ֭שָׁע הִ֣יא תְבוֹאֶ֑נּוּ וְתַאֲוַ֖ת צַדִּיקִ֣ים יִתֵּֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:24
Proverbs 10:25When the whirlwind passes, the wicked is no more; but the righteous stand firm forever.
Proverbs 10:250  כַּעֲב֣וֹר ס֭וּפָה וְאֵ֣ין רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝צַדִּ֗יק יְס֣וֹד עוֹלָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:25
Proverbs 10:26As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to those who send him.
Proverbs 10:260  כַּחֹ֤מֶץ ׀ לַשִּׁנַּ֗יִם וְכֶעָשָׁ֥ן לָעֵינָ֑יִם כֵּ֥ן הֶ֝עָצֵ֗ל לְשֹׁלְחָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:26
Proverbs 10:27The fear of Yahweh prolongs days, but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
Proverbs 10:270  יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה תּוֹסִ֣יף יָמִ֑ים וּשְׁנ֖וֹת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תִּקְצֹֽרְנָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:27
Proverbs 10:28The prospect of the righteous is joy, but the hope of the wicked will perish.
Proverbs 10:280  תּוֹחֶ֣לֶת צַדִּיקִ֣ים שִׂמְחָ֑ה וְתִקְוַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֹּאבֵֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:28
Proverbs 10:29The way of Yahweh is a stronghold to the upright, but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.
Proverbs 10:290  מָע֣וֹז לַ֭תֹּם דֶּ֣רֶךְ יְהוָ֑ה וּ֝מְחִתָּ֗ה לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:29
Proverbs 10:30The righteous will never be removed, but the wicked will not dwell in the land.
Proverbs 10:300  צַדִּ֣יק לְעוֹלָ֣ם בַּל־יִמּ֑וֹט וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִשְׁכְּנוּ־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:30
Proverbs 10:31The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be cut off.
Proverbs 10:310  פִּֽי־צַ֭דִּיק יָנ֣וּב חָכְמָ֑ה וּלְשׁ֥וֹן תַּ֝הְפֻּכ֗וֹת תִּכָּרֵֽת׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:31
Proverbs 10:32The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, but the mouth of the wicked is perverse.
Proverbs 10:320  שִׂפְתֵ֣י צַ֭דִּיק יֵדְע֣וּן רָצ֑וֹן וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 10:32
Proverbs 11:1A false balance is an abomination to Yahweh, but accurate weights are his delight.
Proverbs 11:11  מֹאזְנֵ֣י מִ֭רְמָה תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה וְאֶ֖בֶן שְׁלֵמָ֣ה רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:1
Proverbs 11:2When pride comes, then comes shame, but with humility comes wisdom.
Proverbs 11:21  בָּֽא־זָ֭דוֹן וַיָּבֹ֣א קָל֑וֹן וְֽאֶת־צְנוּעִ֥ים חָכְמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:2
Proverbs 11:3The integrity of the upright shall guide them, but the perverseness of the treacherous shall destroy them.
Proverbs 11:31  תֻּמַּ֣ת יְשָׁרִ֣ים תַּנְחֵ֑ם וְסֶ֖לֶף בּוֹגְדִ֣ים *ושדם **יְשָׁדֵּֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:3
Proverbs 11:4Riches don't profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness delivers from death.
Proverbs 11:41  לֹא־יוֹעִ֣יל ה֭וֹן בְּי֣וֹם עֶבְרָ֑ה וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה תַּצִּ֥יל מִמָּֽוֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:4
Proverbs 11:5The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way, but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
Proverbs 11:51  צִדְקַ֣ת תָּ֭מִים תְּיַשֵּׁ֣ר דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְרִשְׁעָת֗וֹ יִפֹּ֥ל רָשָֽׁע׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:5
Proverbs 11:6The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them, but the unfaithful will be trapped by evil desires.
Proverbs 11:61  צִדְקַ֣ת יְ֭שָׁרִים תַּצִּילֵ֑ם וּ֝בְהַוַּ֗ת בֹּגְדִ֥ים יִלָּכֵֽדוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:6
Proverbs 11:7When a wicked man dies, hope perishes, and expectation of power comes to nothing.
Proverbs 11:71  בְּמ֤וֹת אָדָ֣ם רָ֭שָׁע תֹּאבַ֣ד תִּקְוָ֑ה וְתוֹחֶ֖לֶת אוֹנִ֣ים אָבָֽדָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:7
Proverbs 11:8A righteous person is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked takes his place.
Proverbs 11:81  צַ֭דִּיק מִצָּרָ֣ה נֶחֱלָ֑ץ וַיָּבֹ֖א רָשָׁ֣ע תַּחְתָּֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:8
Proverbs 11:9With his mouth the godless man destroys his neighbor, but the righteous will be delivered through knowledge.
Proverbs 11:91  בְּפֶ֗ה חָ֭נֵף יַשְׁחִ֣ת רֵעֵ֑הוּ וּ֝בְדַ֗עַת צַדִּיקִ֥ים יֵחָלֵֽצוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:9
Proverbs 11:10When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices. When the wicked perish, there is shouting.
Proverbs 11:101  בְּט֣וּב צַ֭דִּיקִים תַּעֲלֹ֣ץ קִרְיָ֑ה וּבַאֲבֹ֖ד רְשָׁעִ֣ים רִנָּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:10
Proverbs 11:11By the blessing of the upright, the city is exalted, but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
Proverbs 11:111  בְּבִרְכַּ֣ת יְ֭שָׁרִים תָּר֣וּם קָ֑רֶת וּבְפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תֵּהָרֵֽס׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:11
Proverbs 11:12One who despises his neighbor is void of wisdom, but a man of understanding holds his peace.
Proverbs 11:121  בָּז־לְרֵעֵ֥הוּ חֲסַר־לֵ֑ב וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּבוּנ֣וֹת יַחֲרִֽישׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:12
Proverbs 11:13One who brings gossip betrays a confidence, but one who is of a trustworthy spirit is one who keeps a secret.
Proverbs 11:131  הוֹלֵ֣ךְ רָ֭כִיל מְגַלֶּה־סּ֑וֹד וְנֶאֱמַן־ר֝֗וּחַ מְכַסֶּ֥ה דָבָֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:13
Proverbs 11:14Where there is no wise guidance, the nation falls, but in the multitude of counselors there is victory.
Proverbs 11:141  בְּאֵ֣ין תַּ֭חְבֻּלוֹת יִפָּל־עָ֑ם וּ֝תְשׁוּעָ֗ה בְּרֹ֣ב יוֹעֵֽץ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:14
Proverbs 11:15He who is collateral for a stranger will suffer for it, but he who refuses pledges of collateral is secure.
Proverbs 11:151  רַע־יֵ֭רוֹעַ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וְשֹׂנֵ֖א תֹקְעִ֣ים בּוֹטֵֽחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:15
Proverbs 11:16A gracious woman obtains honor, but violent men obtain riches.
Proverbs 11:161  אֵֽשֶׁת־חֵ֭ן תִּתְמֹ֣ךְ כָּב֑וֹד וְ֝עָרִיצִ֗ים יִתְמְכוּ־עֹֽשֶׁר׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:16
Proverbs 11:17The merciful man does good to his own soul, but he who is cruel troubles his own flesh.
Proverbs 11:171  גֹּמֵ֣ל נַ֭פְשׁוֹ אִ֣ישׁ חָ֑סֶד וְעֹכֵ֥ר שְׁ֝אֵר֗וֹ אַכְזָרִֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:17
Proverbs 11:18Wicked people earn deceitful wages, but one who sows righteousness reaps a sure reward.
Proverbs 11:181  רָשָׁ֗ע עֹשֶׂ֥ה פְעֻלַּת־שָׁ֑קֶר וְזֹרֵ֥עַ צְ֝דָקָ֗ה שֶׂ֣כֶר אֱמֶֽת׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:18
Proverbs 11:19He who is truly righteous gets life. He who pursues evil gets death.
Proverbs 11:191  כֵּן־צְדָקָ֥ה לְחַיִּ֑ים וּמְרַדֵּ֖ף רָעָ֣ה לְמוֹתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:19
Proverbs 11:20Those who are perverse in heart are an abomination to Yahweh, but those whose ways are blameless are his delight.
Proverbs 11:201  תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה עִקְּשֵׁי־לֵ֑ב וּ֝רְצוֹנ֗וֹ תְּמִ֣ימֵי דָֽרֶךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:20
Proverbs 11:21Most certainly, the evil man will not be unpunished, but the seed of the righteous will be delivered.
Proverbs 11:211  יָ֣ד לְ֭יָד לֹא־יִנָּ֣קֶה רָּ֑ע וְזֶ֖רַע צַדִּיקִ֣ים נִמְלָֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:21
Proverbs 11:22Like a gold ring in a pig's snout, is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.
Proverbs 11:221  נֶ֣זֶם זָ֭הָב בְּאַ֣ף חֲזִ֑יר אִשָּׁ֥ה יָ֝פָ֗ה וְסָ֣רַת טָֽעַם׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:22
Proverbs 11:23The desire of the righteous is only good. The expectation of the wicked is wrath.
Proverbs 11:231  תַּאֲוַ֣ת צַדִּיקִ֣ים אַךְ־ט֑וֹב תִּקְוַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים עֶבְרָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:23
Proverbs 11:24There is one who scatters, and increases yet more. There is one who withholds more than is appropriate, but gains poverty.
Proverbs 11:241  יֵ֣שׁ מְ֭פַזֵּר וְנוֹסָ֥ף ע֑וֹד וְחוֹשֵׂ֥ךְ מִ֝יֹּ֗שֶׁר אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:24
Proverbs 11:25The liberal soul shall be made fat. He who waters shall be watered also himself.
Proverbs 11:251  נֶֽפֶשׁ־בְּרָכָ֥ה תְדֻשָּׁ֑ן וּ֝מַרְוֶ֗ה גַּם־ה֥וּא יוֹרֶֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:25
Proverbs 11:26People curse someone who withholds grain, but blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.
Proverbs 11:261  מֹ֣נֵֽעַ בָּ֭ר יִקְּבֻ֣הוּ לְא֑וֹם וּ֝בְרָכָ֗ה לְרֹ֣אשׁ מַשְׁבִּֽיר׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:26
Proverbs 11:27He who diligently seeks good seeks favor, but he who searches after evil, it shall come to him.
Proverbs 11:271  שֹׁ֣חֵֽר ט֭וֹב יְבַקֵּ֣שׁ רָצ֑וֹן וְדֹרֵ֖שׁ רָעָ֣ה תְבוֹאֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:27
Proverbs 11:28He who trusts in his riches will fall, but the righteous shall flourish as the green leaf.
Proverbs 11:281  בּוֹטֵ֣חַ בְּ֭עָשְׁרוֹ ה֣וּא יִפֹּ֑ל וְ֝כֶעָלֶ֗ה צַדִּיקִ֥ים יִפְרָֽחוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:28
Proverbs 11:29He who troubles his own house shall inherit the wind. The foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.
Proverbs 11:291  עוֹכֵ֣ר בֵּ֭יתוֹ יִנְחַל־ר֑וּחַ וְעֶ֥בֶד אֱ֝וִ֗יל לַחֲכַם־לֵֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:29
Proverbs 11:30The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life. He who is wise wins souls.
Proverbs 11:301  פְּֽרִי־צַ֭דִּיק עֵ֣ץ חַיִּ֑ים וְלֹקֵ֖חַ נְפָשׂ֣וֹת חָכָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:30
Proverbs 11:31Behold, the righteous shall be repaid in the earth; how much more the wicked and the sinner!
Proverbs 11:311  הֵ֣ן צַ֭דִּיק בָּאָ֣רֶץ יְשֻׁלָּ֑ם אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־רָשָׁ֥ע וְחוֹטֵֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 11:31
Proverbs 12:1Whoever loves correction loves knowledge, but he who hates reproof is stupid.
Proverbs 12:12  אֹהֵ֣ב מ֭וּסָר אֹ֣הֵֽב דָּ֑עַת וְשֹׂנֵ֖א תוֹכַ֣חַת בָּֽעַר׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:1
Proverbs 12:2A good man shall obtain favor from Yahweh, but he will condemn a man of wicked devices.
Proverbs 12:22  ט֗וֹב יָפִ֣יק רָ֭צוֹן מֵיְהוָ֑ה וְאִ֖ישׁ מְזִמּ֣וֹת יַרְשִֽׁיעַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:2
Proverbs 12:3A man shall not be established by wickedness, but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
Proverbs 12:32  לֹא־יִכּ֣וֹן אָדָ֣ם בְּרֶ֑שַׁע וְשֹׁ֥רֶשׁ צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים בַּל־יִמּֽוֹט׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:3
Proverbs 12:4A worthy woman is the crown of her husband, but a disgraceful wife is as rottenness in his bones.
Proverbs 12:42  אֵֽשֶׁת־חַ֭יִל עֲטֶ֣רֶת בַּעְלָ֑הּ וּכְרָקָ֖ב בְּעַצְמוֹתָ֣יו מְבִישָֽׁה׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:4
Proverbs 12:5The thoughts of the righteous are just, but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.
Proverbs 12:52  מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת צַדִּיקִ֣ים מִשְׁפָּ֑ט תַּחְבֻּל֖וֹת רְשָׁעִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:5
Proverbs 12:6The words of the wicked are about lying in wait for blood, but the speech of the upright rescues them.
Proverbs 12:62  דִּבְרֵ֣י רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֱרָב־דָּ֑ם וּפִ֥י יְ֝שָׁרִ֗ים יַצִּילֵֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:6
Proverbs 12:7The wicked are overthrown, and are no more, but the house of the righteous shall stand.
Proverbs 12:72  הָפ֣וֹךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים וְאֵינָ֑ם וּבֵ֖ית צַדִּיקִ֣ים יַעֲמֹֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:7
Proverbs 12:8A man shall be commended according to his wisdom, but he who has a warped mind shall be despised.
Proverbs 12:82  לְֽפִי־שִׂ֭כְלוֹ יְהֻלַּל־אִ֑ישׁ וְנַעֲוֵה־לֵ֝֗ב יִהְיֶ֥ה לָבֽוּז׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:8
Proverbs 12:9Better is he who is lightly esteemed, and has a servant, than he who honors himself, and lacks bread.
Proverbs 12:92  ט֣וֹב נִ֭קְלֶה וְעֶ֣בֶד ל֑וֹ מִ֝מְּתַכַּבֵּ֗ד וַחֲסַר־לָֽחֶם׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:9
Proverbs 12:10A righteous man respects the life of his animal, but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
Proverbs 12:102  יוֹדֵ֣עַ צַ֭דִּיק נֶ֣פֶשׁ בְּהֶמְתּ֑וֹ וְֽרַחֲמֵ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים אַכְזָרִֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:10
Proverbs 12:11He who tills his land shall have plenty of bread, but he who chases fantasies is void of understanding.
Proverbs 12:112  עֹבֵ֣ד אַ֭דְמָתוֹ יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָ֑חֶם וּמְרַדֵּ֖ף רֵיקִ֣ים חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:11
Proverbs 12:12The wicked desires the plunder of evil men, but the root of the righteous flourishes.
Proverbs 12:122  חָמַ֣ד רָ֭שָׁע מְצ֣וֹד רָעִ֑ים וְשֹׁ֖רֶשׁ צַדִּיקִ֣ים יִתֵּֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:12
Proverbs 12:13An evil man is trapped by sinfulness of lips, but the righteous shall come out of trouble.
Proverbs 12:132  בְּפֶ֣שַׁע שְׂ֭פָתַיִם מוֹקֵ֣שׁ רָ֑ע וַיֵּצֵ֖א מִצָּרָ֣ה צַדִּֽיק׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:13
Proverbs 12:14A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth. The work of a man's hands shall be rewarded to him.
Proverbs 12:142  מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ יִשְׂבַּע־ט֑וֹב וּגְמ֥וּל יְדֵי־אָ֝דָ֗ם *ישוב **יָשִׁ֥יב לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:14
Proverbs 12:15The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but he who is wise listens to counsel.
Proverbs 12:152  דֶּ֣רֶךְ אֱ֭וִיל יָשָׁ֣ר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְשֹׁמֵ֖עַ לְעֵצָ֣ה חָכָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:15
Proverbs 12:16A fool shows his annoyance the same day, but one who overlooks an insult is prudent.
Proverbs 12:162  אֱוִ֗יל בַּ֭יּוֹם יִוָּדַ֣ע כַּעְס֑וֹ וְכֹסֶ֖ה קָל֣וֹן עָרֽוּם׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:16
Proverbs 12:17He who is truthful testifies honestly, but a false witness lies.
Proverbs 12:172  יָפִ֣יחַ אֱ֭מוּנָה יַגִּ֣יד צֶ֑דֶק וְעֵ֖ד שְׁקָרִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:17
Proverbs 12:18There is one who speaks rashly like the piercing of a sword, but the tongue of the wise heals.
Proverbs 12:182  יֵ֣שׁ בּ֭וֹטֶה כְּמַדְקְר֣וֹת חָ֑רֶב וּלְשׁ֖וֹן חֲכָמִ֣ים מַרְפֵּֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:18
Proverbs 12:19Truth's lips will be established forever, but a lying tongue is only momentary.
Proverbs 12:192  שְֽׂפַת־אֱ֭מֶת תִּכּ֣וֹן לָעַ֑ד וְעַד־אַ֝רְגִּ֗יעָה לְשׁ֣וֹן שָֽׁקֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:19
Proverbs 12:20Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil, but joy comes to the promoters of peace.
Proverbs 12:202  מִ֭רְמָה בְּלֶב־חֹ֣רְשֵׁי רָ֑ע וּֽלְיֹעֲצֵ֖י שָׁל֣וֹם שִׂמְחָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:20
Proverbs 12:21No mischief shall happen to the righteous, but the wicked shall be filled with evil.
Proverbs 12:212  לֹא־יְאֻנֶּ֣ה לַצַּדִּ֣יק כָּל־אָ֑וֶן וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים מָ֣לְאוּ רָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:21
Proverbs 12:22Lying lips are an abomination to Yahweh, but those who do the truth are his delight.
Proverbs 12:222  תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה שִׂפְתֵי־שָׁ֑קֶר וְעֹשֵׂ֖י אֱמוּנָ֣ה רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:22
Proverbs 12:23A prudent man keeps his knowledge, but the hearts of fools proclaim foolishness.
Proverbs 12:232  אָדָ֣ם עָ֭רוּם כֹּ֣סֶה דָּ֑עַת וְלֵ֥ב כְּ֝סִילִ֗ים יִקְרָ֥א אִוֶּֽלֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:23
Proverbs 12:24The hands of the diligent ones shall rule, but laziness ends in slave labor.
Proverbs 12:242  יַד־חָרוּצִ֥ים תִּמְשׁ֑וֹל ו֝רְמִיָּ֗ה תִּהְיֶ֥ה לָמַֽס׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:24
Proverbs 12:25Anxiety in a man's heart weighs it down, but a kind word makes it glad.
Proverbs 12:252  דְּאָגָ֣ה בְלֶב־אִ֣ישׁ יַשְׁחֶ֑נָּה וְדָבָ֖ר ט֣וֹב יְשַׂמְּחֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:25
Proverbs 12:26A righteous person is cautious in friendship, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
Proverbs 12:262  יָתֵ֣ר מֵרֵעֵ֣הוּ צַדִּ֑יק וְדֶ֖רֶךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים תַּתְעֵֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:26
Proverbs 12:27The slothful man doesn't roast his game, but the possessions of diligent men are prized.
Proverbs 12:272  לֹא־יַחֲרֹ֣ךְ רְמִיָּ֣ה צֵיד֑וֹ וְהוֹן־אָדָ֖ם יָקָ֣ר חָרֽוּץ׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:27
Proverbs 12:28In the way of righteousness is life; in its path there is no death.
Proverbs 12:282  בְּאֹֽרַח־צְדָקָ֥ה חַיִּ֑ים וְדֶ֖רֶךְ נְתִיבָ֣ה אַל־מָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 12:28
Proverbs 13:1A wise son listens to his father's instruction, but a scoffer doesn't listen to rebuke.
Proverbs 13:13  בֵּ֣ן חָ֭כָם מ֣וּסַר אָ֑ב וְ֝לֵ֗ץ לֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע גְּעָרָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:1
Proverbs 13:2By the fruit of his lips, a man enjoys good things; but the unfaithful crave violence.
Proverbs 13:23  מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ יֹ֣אכַל ט֑וֹב וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ בֹּגְדִ֣ים חָמָֽס׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:2
Proverbs 13:3He who guards his mouth guards his soul. One who opens wide his lips comes to ruin.
Proverbs 13:33  נֹצֵ֣ר פִּ֭יו שֹׁמֵ֣ר נַפְשׁ֑וֹ פֹּשֵׂ֥ק שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו מְחִתָּה־לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:3
Proverbs 13:4The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing, but the desire of the diligent shall be fully satisfied.
Proverbs 13:43  מִתְאַוָּ֣ה וָ֭אַיִן נַפְשׁ֣וֹ עָצֵ֑ל וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ חָרֻצִ֣ים תְּדֻשָּֽׁן׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:4
Proverbs 13:5A righteous man hates lies, but a wicked man brings shame and disgrace.
Proverbs 13:53  דְּבַר־שֶׁ֭קֶר יִשְׂנָ֣א צַדִּ֑יק וְ֝רָשָׁ֗ע יַבְאִ֥ישׁ וְיַחְפִּֽיר׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:5
Proverbs 13:6Righteousness guards the way of integrity, but wickedness overthrows the sinner.
Proverbs 13:63  צְ֭דָקָה תִּצֹּ֣ר תָּם־דָּ֑רֶךְ וְ֝רִשְׁעָ֗ה תְּסַלֵּ֥ף חַטָּֽאת׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:6
Proverbs 13:7There are some who pretend to be rich, yet have nothing. There are some who pretend to be poor, yet have great wealth.
Proverbs 13:73  יֵ֣שׁ מִ֭תְעַשֵּׁר וְאֵ֣ין כֹּ֑ל מִ֝תְרוֹשֵׁ֗שׁ וְה֣וֹן רָֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:7
Proverbs 13:8The ransom of a man's life is his riches, but the poor hear no threats.
Proverbs 13:83  כֹּ֣פֶר נֶֽפֶשׁ־אִ֣ישׁ עָשְׁר֑וֹ וְ֝רָ֗שׁ לֹא־שָׁמַ֥ע גְּעָרָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:8
Proverbs 13:9The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked is snuffed out.
Proverbs 13:93  אוֹר־צַדִּיקִ֥ים יִשְׂמָ֑ח וְנֵ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִדְעָֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:9
Proverbs 13:10Pride only breeds quarrels, but with ones who take advice is wisdom.
Proverbs 13:103  רַק־בְּ֭זָדוֹן יִתֵּ֣ן מַצָּ֑ה וְאֶת־נ֖וֹעָצִ֣ים חָכְמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:10
Proverbs 13:11Wealth gained dishonestly dwindles away, but he who gathers by hand makes it grow.
Proverbs 13:113  ה֭וֹן מֵהֶ֣בֶל יִמְעָ֑ט וְקֹבֵ֖ץ עַל־יָ֣ד יַרְבֶּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:11
Proverbs 13:12Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but when longing is fulfilled, it is a tree of life.
Proverbs 13:123  תּוֹחֶ֣לֶת מְ֭מֻשָּׁכָה מַחֲלָה־לֵ֑ב וְעֵ֥ץ חַ֝יִּ֗ים תַּאֲוָ֥ה בָאָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:12
Proverbs 13:13Whoever despises instruction will pay for it, but he who respects a command will be rewarded.
Proverbs 13:133  בָּ֣ז לְ֭דָבָר יֵחָ֣בֶל ל֑וֹ וִירֵ֥א מִ֝צְוָ֗ה ה֣וּא יְשֻׁלָּֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:13
Proverbs 13:14The teaching of the wise is a spring of life, to turn from the snares of death.
Proverbs 13:143  תּוֹרַ֣ת חָ֭כָם מְק֣וֹר חַיִּ֑ים לָ֝ס֗וּר מִמֹּ֥קְשֵׁי מָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:14
Proverbs 13:15Good understanding wins favor; but the way of the unfaithful is hard.
Proverbs 13:153  שֵֽׂכֶל־ט֭וֹב יִתֶּן־חֵ֑ן וְדֶ֖רֶךְ בֹּגְדִ֣ים אֵיתָֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:15
Proverbs 13:16Every prudent man acts from knowledge, but a fool exposes folly.
Proverbs 13:163  כָּל־עָ֭רוּם יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה בְדָ֑עַת וּ֝כְסִ֗יל יִפְרֹ֥שׂ אִוֶּֽלֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:16
Proverbs 13:17A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a trustworthy envoy gains healing.
Proverbs 13:173  מַלְאָ֣ךְ רָ֭שָׁע יִפֹּ֣ל בְּרָ֑ע וְצִ֖יר אֱמוּנִ֣ים מַרְפֵּֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:17
Proverbs 13:18Poverty and shame come to him who refuses discipline, but he who heeds correction shall be honored.
Proverbs 13:183  רֵ֣ישׁ וְ֭קָלוֹן פּוֹרֵ֣עַ מוּסָ֑ר וְשׁוֹמֵ֖ר תּוֹכַ֣חַת יְכֻבָּֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:18
Proverbs 13:19Longing fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but fools detest turning from evil.
Proverbs 13:193  תַּאֲוָ֣ה נִ֭הְיָה תֶּעֱרַ֣ב לְנָ֑פֶשׁ וְתוֹעֲבַ֥ת כְּ֝סִילִ֗ים ס֣וּר מֵרָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:19
Proverbs 13:20One who walks with wise men grows wise, but a companion of fools suffers harm.
Proverbs 13:203  *הלוך **הוֹלֵ֣ךְ אֶת־חֲכָמִ֣ים *וחכם **יֶחְכָּ֑ם וְרֹעֶ֖ה כְסִילִ֣ים יֵרֽוֹעַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:20
Proverbs 13:21Misfortune pursues sinners, but prosperity rewards the righteous.
Proverbs 13:213  חַ֭טָּאִים תְּרַדֵּ֣ף רָעָ֑ה וְאֶת־צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים יְשַׁלֶּם־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:21
Proverbs 13:22A good man leaves an inheritance to his children's children, but the wealth of the sinner is stored for the righteous.
Proverbs 13:223  ט֗וֹב יַנְחִ֥יל בְּנֵֽי־בָנִ֑ים וְצָפ֥וּן לַ֝צַּדִּ֗יק חֵ֣יל חוֹטֵֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:22
Proverbs 13:23An abundance of food is in poor people's fields, but injustice sweeps it away.
Proverbs 13:233  רָב־אֹ֭כֶל נִ֣יר רָאשִׁ֑ים וְיֵ֥שׁ נִ֝סְפֶּ֗ה בְּלֹ֣א מִשְׁפָּֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:23
Proverbs 13:24One who spares the rod hates his son, but one who loves him is careful to discipline him.
Proverbs 13:243  חוֹשֵׂ֣ךְ שִׁ֭בְטוֹ שׂוֹנֵ֣א בְנ֑וֹ וְ֝אֹהֲב֗וֹ שִֽׁחֲר֥וֹ מוּסָֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 13:24
Proverbs 13:25The righteous one eats to the satisfying of his soul, but the belly of the wicked goes hungry.
Proverbs 13:253  צַדִּ֗יק אֹ֭כֵל לְשֹׂ֣בַע נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּבֶ֖טֶן רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֶּחְסָֽר׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 13:25
Proverbs 14:1Every wise woman builds her house, but the foolish one tears it down with her own hands.
Proverbs 14:14  חַכְמ֣וֹת נָ֭שִׁים בָּנְתָ֣ה בֵיתָ֑הּ וְ֝אִוֶּ֗לֶת בְּיָדֶ֥יהָ תֶהֶרְסֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:1
Proverbs 14:2He who walks in his uprightness fears Yahweh, but he who is perverse in his ways despises him.
Proverbs 14:24  הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּ֭יָשְׁרוֹ יְרֵ֣א יְהוָ֑ה וּנְל֖וֹז דְּרָכָ֣יו בּוֹזֵֽהוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:2
Proverbs 14:3The fool's talk brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them.
Proverbs 14:34  בְּֽפִי־אֱ֭וִיל חֹ֣טֶר גַּאֲוָ֑ה וְשִׂפְתֵ֥י חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים תִּשְׁמוּרֵֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:3
Proverbs 14:4Where no oxen are, the crib is clean, but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
Proverbs 14:44  בְּאֵ֣ין אֲ֭לָפִים אֵב֣וּס בָּ֑ר וְרָב־תְּ֝בוּא֗וֹת בְּכֹ֣חַ שֽׁוֹר׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:4
Proverbs 14:5A truthful witness will not lie, but a false witness pours out lies.
Proverbs 14:54  עֵ֣ד אֱ֭מוּנִים לֹ֣א יְכַזֵּ֑ב וְיָפִ֥יחַ כְּ֝זָבִ֗ים עֵ֣ד שָֽׁקֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:5
Proverbs 14:6A scoffer seeks wisdom, and doesn't find it, but knowledge comes easily to a discerning person.
Proverbs 14:64  בִּקֶּשׁ־לֵ֣ץ חָכְמָ֣ה וָאָ֑יִן וְדַ֖עַת לְנָב֣וֹן נָקָֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:6
Proverbs 14:7Stay away from a foolish man, for you won't find knowledge on his lips.
Proverbs 14:74  לֵ֣ךְ מִ֭נֶּגֶד לְאִ֣ישׁ כְּסִ֑יל וּבַל־יָ֝דַ֗עְתָּ שִׂפְתֵי־דָֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:7
Proverbs 14:8The wisdom of the prudent is to think about his way, but the folly of fools is deceit.
Proverbs 14:84  חָכְמַ֣ת עָ֭רוּם הָבִ֣ין דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְאִוֶּ֖לֶת כְּסִילִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:8
Proverbs 14:9Fools mock at making atonement for sins, but among the upright there is good will.
Proverbs 14:94  אֱ֭וִלִים יָלִ֣יץ אָשָׁ֑ם וּבֵ֖ין יְשָׁרִ֣ים רָצֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:9
Proverbs 14:10The heart knows its own bitterness and joy; he will not share these with a stranger.
Proverbs 14:104  לֵ֗ב י֭וֹדֵעַ מָרַּ֣ת נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּ֝בְשִׂמְחָת֗וֹ לֹא־יִתְעָ֥רַב זָֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:10
Proverbs 14:11The house of the wicked will be overthrown, but the tent of the upright will flourish.
Proverbs 14:114  בֵּ֣ית רְ֭שָׁעִים יִשָּׁמֵ֑ד וְאֹ֖הֶל יְשָׁרִ֣ים יַפְרִֽיחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:11
Proverbs 14:12There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.
Proverbs 14:124  יֵ֤שׁ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יָ֭שָׁר לִפְנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ דַּרְכֵי־מָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:12
Proverbs 14:13Even in laughter the heart may be sorrowful, and mirth may end in heaviness.
Proverbs 14:134  גַּם־בִּשְׂח֥וֹק יִכְאַב־לֵ֑ב וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖הּ שִׂמְחָ֣ה תוּגָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:13
Proverbs 14:14The unfaithful will be repaid for his own ways; likewise a good man will be rewarded for his ways.
Proverbs 14:144  מִדְּרָכָ֣יו יִ֭שְׂבַּע ס֣וּג לֵ֑ב וּ֝מֵעָלָ֗יו אִ֣ישׁ טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:14
Proverbs 14:15A simple man believes everything, but the prudent man carefully considers his ways.
Proverbs 14:154  פֶּ֭תִי יַאֲמִ֣ין לְכָל־דָּבָ֑ר וְ֝עָר֗וּם יָבִ֥ין לַאֲשֻׁרֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:15
Proverbs 14:16A wise man fears, and shuns evil, but the fool is hotheaded and reckless.
Proverbs 14:164  חָכָ֣ם יָ֭רֵא וְסָ֣ר מֵרָ֑ע וּ֝כְסִ֗יל מִתְעַבֵּ֥ר וּבוֹטֵֽחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:16
Proverbs 14:17He who is quick to become angry will commit folly, and a crafty man is hated.
Proverbs 14:174  קְֽצַר־אַ֭פַּיִם יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה אִוֶּ֑לֶת וְאִ֥ישׁ מְ֝זִמּ֗וֹת יִשָּׂנֵֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:17
Proverbs 14:18The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
Proverbs 14:184  נָחֲל֣וּ פְתָאיִ֣ם אִוֶּ֑לֶת וַֽ֝עֲרוּמִ֗ים יַכְתִּ֥רוּ דָֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:18
Proverbs 14:19The evil bow down before the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
Proverbs 14:194  שַׁח֣וּ רָ֭עִים לִפְנֵ֣י טוֹבִ֑ים וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים עַֽל־שַׁעֲרֵ֥י צַדִּֽיק׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:19
Proverbs 14:20The poor person is shunned even by his own neighbor, but the rich person has many friends.
Proverbs 14:204  גַּם־לְ֭רֵעֵהוּ יִשָּׂ֣נֵא רָ֑שׁ וְאֹהֲבֵ֖י עָשִׁ֣יר רַבִּֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:20
Proverbs 14:21He who despises his neighbor sins, but blessed is he who has pity on the poor.
Proverbs 14:214  בָּז־לְרֵעֵ֥הוּ חוֹטֵ֑א וּמְחוֹנֵ֖ן *עניים **עֲנָוִ֣ים אַשְׁרָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:21
Proverbs 14:22Don't they go astray who plot evil? But love and faithfulness belong to those who plan good.
Proverbs 14:224  הֲ‍ֽלוֹא־יִ֭תְעוּ חֹ֣רְשֵׁי רָ֑ע וְחֶ֥סֶד וֶ֝אֱמֶ֗ת חֹ֣רְשֵׁי טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:22
Proverbs 14:23In all hard work there is profit, but the talk of the lips leads only to poverty.
Proverbs 14:234  בְּכָל־עֶ֭צֶב יִהְיֶ֣ה מוֹתָ֑ר וּדְבַר־שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:23
Proverbs 14:24The crown of the wise is their riches, but the folly of fools crowns them with folly.
Proverbs 14:244  עֲטֶ֣רֶת חֲכָמִ֣ים עָשְׁרָ֑ם אִוֶּ֖לֶת כְּסִילִ֣ים אִוֶּֽלֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:24
Proverbs 14:25A truthful witness saves souls, but a false witness is deceitful.
Proverbs 14:254  מַצִּ֣יל נְ֭פָשׁוֹת עֵ֣ד אֱמֶ֑ת וְיָפִ֖חַ כְּזָבִ֣ים מִרְמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:25
Proverbs 14:26In the fear of Yahweh is a secure fortress, and he will be a refuge for his children.
Proverbs 14:264  בְּיִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה מִבְטַח־עֹ֑ז וּ֝לְבָנָ֗יו יִהְיֶ֥ה מַחְסֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:26
Proverbs 14:27The fear of Yahweh is a fountain of life, turning people from the snares of death.
Proverbs 14:274  יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה מְק֣וֹר חַיִּ֑ים לָ֝ס֗וּר מִמֹּ֥קְשֵׁי מָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:27
Proverbs 14:28In the multitude of people is the king's glory, but in the lack of people is the destruction of the prince.
Proverbs 14:284  בְּרָב־עָ֥ם הַדְרַת־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבְאֶ֥פֶס לְ֝אֹ֗ם מְחִתַּ֥ת רָזֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:28
Proverbs 14:29He who is slow to anger has great understanding, but he who has a quick temper displays folly.
Proverbs 14:294  אֶ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם רַב־תְּבוּנָ֑ה וּקְצַר־ר֝֗וּחַ מֵרִ֥ים אִוֶּֽלֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:29
Proverbs 14:30The life of the body is a heart at peace, but envy rots the bones.
Proverbs 14:304  חַיֵּ֣י בְ֭שָׂרִים לֵ֣ב מַרְפֵּ֑א וּרְקַ֖ב עֲצָמ֣וֹת קִנְאָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:30
Proverbs 14:31He who oppresses the poor shows contempt for his Maker, but he who is kind to the needy honors him.
Proverbs 14:314  עֹ֣שֵֽׁק דָּ֭ל חֵרֵ֣ף עֹשֵׂ֑הוּ וּ֝מְכַבְּד֗וֹ חֹנֵ֥ן אֶבְיֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:31
Proverbs 14:32The wicked is brought down in his calamity, but in death, the righteous has a refuge.
Proverbs 14:324  בְּֽ֭רָעָתוֹ יִדָּחֶ֣ה רָשָׁ֑ע וְחֹסֶ֖ה בְמוֹת֣וֹ צַדּֽ͏ִיק׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:32
Proverbs 14:33Wisdom rests in the heart of one who has understanding, and is even made known in the inward part of fools.
Proverbs 14:334  בְּלֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן תָּנ֣וּחַ חָכְמָ֑ה וּבְקֶ֥רֶב כְּ֝סִילִ֗ים תִּוָּדֵֽעַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:33
Proverbs 14:34Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.
Proverbs 14:344  צְדָקָ֥ה תְרֽוֹמֵֽם־גּ֑וֹי וְחֶ֖סֶד לְאֻמִּ֣ים חַטָּֽאת׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:34
Proverbs 14:35The king's favor is toward a servant who deals wisely, but his wrath is toward one who causes shame.
Proverbs 14:354  רְֽצוֹן־מֶ֭לֶךְ לְעֶ֣בֶד מַשְׂכִּ֑יל וְ֝עֶבְרָת֗וֹ תִּהְיֶ֥ה מֵבִֽישׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 14:35
Proverbs 15:1A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
Proverbs 15:15  מַֽעֲנֶה־רַּ֭ךְ יָשִׁ֣יב חֵמָ֑ה וּדְבַר־עֶ֝֗צֶב יַעֲלֶה־אָֽף׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:1
Proverbs 15:2The tongue of the wise commends knowledge, but the mouth of fools gush out folly.
Proverbs 15:25  לְשׁ֣וֹן חֲ֭כָמִים תֵּיטִ֣יב דָּ֑עַת וּפִ֥י כְ֝סִילִ֗ים יַבִּ֥יעַ אִוֶּֽלֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:2
Proverbs 15:3Yahweh's eyes are everywhere, keeping watch on the evil and the good.
Proverbs 15:35  בְּֽכָל־מָ֭קוֹם עֵינֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה צֹ֝פ֗וֹת רָעִ֥ים וטוֹבִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:3
Proverbs 15:4A gentle tongue is a tree of life, but deceit in it crushes the spirit.
Proverbs 15:45  מַרְפֵּ֣א לָ֭שׁוֹן עֵ֣ץ חַיִּ֑ים וְסֶ֥לֶף בָּ֝֗הּ שֶׁ֣בֶר בְּרֽוּחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:4
Proverbs 15:5A fool despises his father's correction, but he who heeds reproof shows prudence.
Proverbs 15:55  אֱוִ֗יל יִ֭נְאַץ מוּסַ֣ר אָבִ֑יו וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר תּוֹכַ֣חַת יַעְרִֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:5
Proverbs 15:6In the house of the righteous is much treasure, but the income of the wicked brings trouble.
Proverbs 15:65  בֵּ֣ית צַ֭דִּיק חֹ֣סֶן רָ֑ב וּבִתְבוּאַ֖ת רָשָׁ֣ע נֶעְכָּֽרֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:6
Proverbs 15:7The lips of the wise spread knowledge; not so with the heart of fools.
Proverbs 15:75  שִׂפְתֵ֣י חֲ֭כָמִים יְזָ֣רוּ דָ֑עַת וְלֵ֖ב כְּסִילִ֣ים לֹא־כֵֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:7
Proverbs 15:8The sacrifice made by the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh, but the prayer of the upright is his delight.
Proverbs 15:85  זֶ֣בַח רְ֭שָׁעִים תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה וּתְפִלַּ֖ת יְשָׁרִ֣ים רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:8
Proverbs 15:9The way of the wicked is an abomination to Yahweh, but he loves him who follows after righteousness.
Proverbs 15:95  תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה דֶּ֣רֶךְ רָשָׁ֑ע וּמְרַדֵּ֖ף צְדָקָ֣ה יֶאֱהָֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:9
Proverbs 15:10There is stern discipline for one who forsakes the way: whoever hates reproof shall die.
Proverbs 15:105  מוּסָ֣ר רָ֭ע לְעֹזֵ֣ב אֹ֑רַח שׂוֹנֵ֖א תוֹכַ֣חַת יָמֽוּת׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:10
Proverbs 15:11Sheol and Abaddon are before Yahweh— how much more then the hearts of the children of men!
Proverbs 15:115  שְׁא֣וֹל וַ֭אֲבַדּוֹן נֶ֣גֶד יְהוָ֑ה אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לִבּ֥וֹת בְּֽנֵי־אָדָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:11
Proverbs 15:12A scoffer doesn't love to be reproved; he will not go to the wise.
Proverbs 15:125  לֹ֣א יֶאֱהַב־לֵ֭ץ הוֹכֵ֣חַֽ ל֑וֹ אֶל־חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים לֹ֣א יֵלֵֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:12
Proverbs 15:13A glad heart makes a cheerful face; but an aching heart breaks the spirit.
Proverbs 15:135  לֵ֣ב שָׂ֭מֵחַ יֵיטִ֣ב פָּנִ֑ים וּבְעַצְּבַת־לֵ֝ב ר֣וּחַ נְכֵאָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:13
Proverbs 15:14The heart of one who has understanding seeks knowledge, but the mouths of fools feed on folly.
Proverbs 15:145  לֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן יְבַקֶּשׁ־דָּ֑עַת *ופני **וּפִ֥י כְ֝סִילִ֗ים יִרְעֶ֥ה אִוֶּֽלֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:14
Proverbs 15:15All the days of the afflicted are wretched, but one who has a cheerful heart enjoys a continual feast.
Proverbs 15:155  כָּל־יְמֵ֣י עָנִ֣י רָעִ֑ים וְטֽוֹב־לֵ֝֗ב מִשְׁתֶּ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:15
Proverbs 15:16Better is little, with the fear of Yahweh, than great treasure with trouble.
Proverbs 15:165  טוֹב־מְ֭עַט בְּיִרְאַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה מֵאוֹצָ֥ר רָ֝֗ב וּמְה֥וּמָה בֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:16
Proverbs 15:17Better is a dinner of herbs, where love is, than a fattened calf with hatred.
Proverbs 15:175  ט֤וֹב אֲרֻחַ֣ת יָ֭רָק וְאַהֲבָה־שָׁ֑ם מִשּׁ֥וֹר אָ֝ב֗וּס וְשִׂנְאָה־בֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:17
Proverbs 15:18A wrathful man stirs up contention, but one who is slow to anger appeases strife.
Proverbs 15:185  אִ֣ישׁ חֵ֭מָה יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וְאֶ֥רֶך אַ֝פַּ֗יִם יַשְׁקִ֥יט רִֽיב׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:18
Proverbs 15:19The way of the sluggard is like a thorn patch, but the path of the upright is a highway.
Proverbs 15:195  דֶּ֣רֶךְ עָ֭צֵל כִּמְשֻׂ֣כַת חָ֑דֶק וְאֹ֖רַח יְשָׁרִ֣ים סְלֻלָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:19
Proverbs 15:20A wise son makes a father glad, but a foolish man despises his mother.
Proverbs 15:205  בֵּ֣ן חָ֭כָם יְשַׂמַּח־אָ֑ב וּכְסִ֥יל אָ֝דָ֗ם בּוֹזֶ֥ה אִמּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:20
Proverbs 15:21Folly is joy to one who is void of wisdom, but a man of understanding keeps his way straight.
Proverbs 15:215  אִ֭וֶּלֶת שִׂמְחָ֣ה לַחֲסַר־לֵ֑ב וְאִ֥ישׁ תְּ֝בוּנָ֗ה יְיַשֶׁר־לָֽכֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:21
Proverbs 15:22Where there is no counsel, plans fail; but in a multitude of counselors they are established.
Proverbs 15:225  הָפֵ֣ר מַ֭חֲשָׁבוֹת בְּאֵ֣ין ס֑וֹד וּבְרֹ֖ב יוֹעֲצִ֣ים תָּקֽוּם׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:22
Proverbs 15:23Joy comes to a man with the reply of his mouth. How good is a word at the right time!
Proverbs 15:235  שִׂמְחָ֣ה לָ֭אִישׁ בְּמַעֲנֵה־פִ֑יו וְדָבָ֖ר בְּעִתּ֣וֹ מַה־טּֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:23
Proverbs 15:24The path of life leads upward for the wise, to keep him from going downward to Sheol.
Proverbs 15:245  אֹ֣רַח חַ֭יִּים לְמַ֣עְלָה לְמַשְׂכִּ֑יל לְמַ֥עַן ס֝֗וּר מִשְּׁא֥וֹל מָֽטָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:24
Proverbs 15:25Yahweh will uproot the house of the proud, but he will keep the widow's borders intact.
Proverbs 15:255  בֵּ֣ית גֵּ֭אִים יִסַּ֥ח ׀ יְהוָ֑ה וְ֝יַצֵּ֗ב גְּב֣וּל אַלְמָנָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:25
Proverbs 15:26Yahweh detests the thoughts of the wicked, but the thoughts of the pure are pleasing.
Proverbs 15:265  תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת רָ֑ע וּ֝טְהֹרִ֗ים אִמְרֵי־נֹֽעַם׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:26
Proverbs 15:27He who is greedy for gain troubles his own house, but he who hates bribes will live.
Proverbs 15:275  עֹכֵ֣ר בֵּ֭יתוֹ בּוֹצֵ֣עַ בָּ֑צַע וְשׂוֹנֵ֖א מַתָּנֹ֣ת יִחְיֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:27
Proverbs 15:28The heart of the righteous weighs answers, but the mouth of the wicked gushes out evil.
Proverbs 15:285  לֵ֣ב צַ֭דִּיק יֶהְגֶּ֣ה לַעֲנ֑וֹת וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יַבִּ֥יעַ רָעֽוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:28
Proverbs 15:29Yahweh is far from the wicked, but he hears the prayer of the righteous.
Proverbs 15:295  רָח֣וֹק יְ֭הוָה מֵרְשָׁעִ֑ים וּתְפִלַּ֖ת צַדִּיקִ֣ים יִשְׁמָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:29
Proverbs 15:30The light of the eyes rejoices the heart. Good news gives health to the bones.
Proverbs 15:305  מְֽאוֹר־עֵ֭ינַיִם יְשַׂמַּֽח־לֵ֑ב שְׁמוּעָ֥ה ט֝וֹבָ֗ה תְּדַשֶּׁן־עָֽצֶם׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:30
Proverbs 15:31The ear that listens to reproof lives, and will be at home among the wise.
Proverbs 15:315  אֹ֗זֶן שֹׁ֭מַעַת תּוֹכַ֣חַת חַיִּ֑ים בְּקֶ֖רֶב חֲכָמִ֣ים תָּלִֽין׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:31
Proverbs 15:32He who refuses correction despises his own soul, but he who listens to reproof gets understanding.
Proverbs 15:325  פּוֹרֵ֣עַ מ֭וּסָר מוֹאֵ֣ס נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וְשׁוֹמֵ֥עַ תּ֝וֹכַ֗חַת ק֣וֹנֶה לֵּֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:32
Proverbs 15:33The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom. Before honor is humility.
Proverbs 15:335  יִרְאַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה מוּסַ֣ר חָכְמָ֑ה וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָב֣וֹד עֲנָוָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 15:33
Proverbs 16:1The plans of the heart belong to man, but the answer of the tongue is from Yahweh.
Proverbs 16:16  לְאָדָ֥ם מַֽעַרְכֵי־לֵ֑ב וּ֝מֵיְהוָ֗ה מַעֲנֵ֥ה לָשֽׁוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:1
Proverbs 16:2All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but Yahweh weighs the motives.
Proverbs 16:26  כָּֽל־דַּרְכֵי־אִ֭ישׁ זַ֣ךְ בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְתֹכֵ֖ן רוּח֣וֹת יְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:2
Proverbs 16:3Commit your deeds to Yahweh, and your plans shall succeed.
Proverbs 16:36  גֹּ֣ל אֶל־יְהוָ֣ה מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ וְ֝יִכֹּ֗נוּ מַחְשְׁבֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:3
Proverbs 16:4Yahweh has made everything for its own end— yes, even the wicked for the day of evil.
Proverbs 16:46  כֹּ֤ל פָּעַ֣ל יְ֭הוָה לַֽמַּעֲנֵ֑הוּ וְגַם־רָ֝שָׁ֗ע לְי֣וֹם רָעָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:4
Proverbs 16:5Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to Yahweh: they shall certainly not be unpunished.
Proverbs 16:56  תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה כָּל־גְּבַהּ־לֵ֑ב יָ֥ד לְ֝יָ֗ד לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:5
Proverbs 16:6By mercy and truth iniquity is atoned for. By the fear of Yahweh men depart from evil.
Proverbs 16:66  בְּחֶ֣סֶד וֶ֭אֱמֶת יְכֻפַּ֣ר עָוֺ֑ן וּבְיִרְאַ֥ת יְ֝הוָ֗ה ס֣וּר מֵרָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:6
Proverbs 16:7When a man's ways please Yahweh, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
Proverbs 16:76  בִּרְצ֣וֹת יְ֭הוָה דַּרְכֵי־אִ֑ישׁ גַּם־א֝וֹיְבָ֗יו יַשְׁלִ֥ם אִתּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:7
Proverbs 16:8Better is a little with righteousness, than great revenues with injustice.
