Proverbs 16:86  טוֹב־מְ֭עַט בִּצְדָקָ֑ה מֵרֹ֥ב תְּ֝בוּא֗וֹת בְּלֹ֣א מִשְׁפָּֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:8
Proverbs 16:9A man's heart plans his course, but Yahweh directs his steps.
Proverbs 16:96  לֵ֣ב אָ֭דָם יְחַשֵּׁ֣ב דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וַֽ֝יהוָ֗ה יָכִ֥ין צַעֲדֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:9
Proverbs 16:10Inspired judgments are on the lips of the king. He shall not betray his mouth.
Proverbs 16:106  קֶ֤סֶם ׀ עַֽל־שִׂפְתֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ בְּ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט לֹ֣א יִמְעַל־פִּֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:10
Proverbs 16:11Honest balances and scales are Yahweh's; all the weights in the bag are his work.
Proverbs 16:116  פֶּ֤לֶס ׀ וּמֹאזְנֵ֣י מִ֭שְׁפָּט לַֽיהוָ֑ה מַ֝עֲשֵׂ֗הוּ כָּל־אַבְנֵי־כִֽיס׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:11
Proverbs 16:12It is an abomination for kings to do wrong, for the throne is established by righteousness.
Proverbs 16:126  תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת מְ֭לָכִים עֲשׂ֣וֹת רֶ֑שַׁע כִּ֥י בִ֝צְדָקָ֗ה יִכּ֥וֹן כִּסֵּֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:12
Proverbs 16:13Righteous lips are the delight of kings. They value one who speaks the truth.
Proverbs 16:136  רְצ֣וֹן מְ֭לָכִים שִׂפְתֵי־צֶ֑דֶק וְדֹבֵ֖ר יְשָׁרִ֣ים יֶאֱהָֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:13
Proverbs 16:14The king's wrath is a messenger of death, but a wise man will pacify it.
Proverbs 16:146  חֲמַת־מֶ֥לֶךְ מַלְאֲכֵי־מָ֑וֶת וְאִ֖ישׁ חָכָ֣ם יְכַפְּרֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:14
Proverbs 16:15In the light of the king's face is life. His favor is like a cloud of the spring rain.
Proverbs 16:156  בְּאוֹר־פְּנֵי־מֶ֥לֶךְ חַיִּ֑ים וּ֝רְצוֹנ֗וֹ כְּעָ֣ב מַלְקֽוֹשׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:15
Proverbs 16:16How much better it is to get wisdom than gold! Yes, to get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.
Proverbs 16:166  קְֽנֹה־חָכְמָ֗ה מַה־טּ֥וֹב מֵחָר֑וּץ וּקְנ֥וֹת בִּ֝ינָ֗ה נִבְחָ֥ר מִכָּֽסֶף׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:16
Proverbs 16:17The highway of the upright is to depart from evil. He who keeps his way preserves his soul.
Proverbs 16:176  מְסִלַּ֣ת יְ֭שָׁרִים ס֣וּר מֵרָ֑ע שֹׁמֵ֥ר נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ נֹצֵ֥ר דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:17
Proverbs 16:18Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.
Proverbs 16:186  לִפְנֵי־שֶׁ֥בֶר גָּא֑וֹן וְלִפְנֵ֥י כִ֝שָּׁל֗וֹן גֹּ֣בַהּ רֽוּחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:18
Proverbs 16:19It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor, than to divide the plunder with the proud.
Proverbs 16:196  ט֣וֹב שְׁפַל־ר֭וּחַ אֶת־*עניים **עֲנָוִ֑ים מֵֽחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁ֝לָ֗ל אֶת־גֵּאִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:19
Proverbs 16:20He who heeds the Word finds prosperity. Whoever trusts in Yahweh is blessed.
Proverbs 16:206  מַשְׂכִּ֣יל עַל־דָּ֭בָר יִמְצָא־ט֑וֹב וּבוֹטֵ֖חַ בַּיהוָ֣ה אַשְׁרָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:20
Proverbs 16:21The wise in heart shall be called prudent. Pleasantness of the lips promotes instruction.
Proverbs 16:216  לַחֲכַם־לֵ֭ב יִקָּרֵ֣א נָב֑וֹן וּמֶ֥תֶק שְׂ֝פָתַ֗יִם יֹסִ֥יף לֶֽקַח׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:21
Proverbs 16:22Understanding is a fountain of life to one who has it, but the punishment of fools is their folly.
Proverbs 16:226  מְק֣וֹר חַ֭יִּים שֵׂ֣כֶל בְּעָלָ֑יו וּמוּסַ֖ר אֱוִלִ֣ים אִוֶּֽלֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:22
Proverbs 16:23The heart of the wise instructs his mouth, and adds learning to his lips.
Proverbs 16:236  לֵ֣ב חָ֭כָם יַשְׂכִּ֣יל פִּ֑יהוּ וְעַל־שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו יֹסִ֥יף לֶֽקַח׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:23
Proverbs 16:24Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
Proverbs 16:246  צוּף־דְּ֭בַשׁ אִמְרֵי־נֹ֑עַם מָת֥וֹק לַ֝נֶּפֶשׁ וּמַרְפֵּ֥א לָעָֽצֶם׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:24
Proverbs 16:25There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.
Proverbs 16:256  יֵ֤שׁ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יָ֭שָׁר לִפְנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ דַּרְכֵי־מָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:25
Proverbs 16:26The appetite of the laboring man labors for him; for his mouth urges him on.
Proverbs 16:266  נֶ֣פֶשׁ עָ֭מֵל עָ֣מְלָה לּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־אָכַ֖ף עָלָ֣יו פִּֽיהוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:26
Proverbs 16:27A worthless man devises mischief. His speech is like a scorching fire.
Proverbs 16:276  אִ֣ישׁ בְּ֭לִיַּעַל כֹּרֶ֣ה רָעָ֑ה וְעַל־*שפתיו **שְׂ֝פָת֗וֹ כְּאֵ֣שׁ צָרָֽבֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:27
Proverbs 16:28A perverse man stirs up strife. A whisperer separates close friends.
Proverbs 16:286  אִ֣ישׁ תַּ֭הְפֻּכוֹת יְשַׁלַּ֣ח מָד֑וֹן וְ֝נִרְגָּ֗ן‪[6]‬ מַפְרִ֥יד אַלּֽוּף׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:28
Proverbs 16:29A man of violence entices his neighbor, and leads him in a way that is not good.
Proverbs 16:296  אִ֣ישׁ חָ֭מָס יְפַתֶּ֣ה רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝הוֹלִיכ֗וֹ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ לֹא־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:29
Proverbs 16:30One who winks his eyes to plot perversities, one who compresses his lips, is bent on evil.
Proverbs 16:306  עֹצֶ֣ה עֵ֭ינָיו לַחְשֹׁ֣ב תַּהְפֻּכ֑וֹת קֹרֵ֥ץ שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו כִּלָּ֥ה רָעָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:30
Proverbs 16:31Gray hair is a crown of glory. It is attained by a life of righteousness.
Proverbs 16:316  עֲטֶ֣רֶת תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת שֵׂיבָ֑ה בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ צְ֝דָקָ֗ה תִּמָּצֵֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:31
Proverbs 16:32One who is slow to anger is better than the mighty; one who rules his spirit, than he who takes a city.
Proverbs 16:326  ט֤וֹב אֶ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם מִגִּבּ֑וֹר וּמֹשֵׁ֥ל בְּ֝רוּח֗וֹ מִלֹּכֵ֥ד עִֽיר׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:32
Proverbs 16:33The lot is cast into the lap, but its every decision is from Yahweh.
Proverbs 16:336  בַּ֭חֵיק יוּטַ֣ל אֶת־הַגּוֹרָ֑ל וּ֝מֵיְהוָ֗ה כָּל־מִשְׁפָּטֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 16:33
Proverbs 17:1Better is a dry morsel with quietness, than a house full of feasting with strife.
Proverbs 17:17  ט֤וֹב פַּ֣ת חֲ֭רֵבָה וְשַׁלְוָה־בָ֑הּ מִ֝בַּ֗יִת מָלֵ֥א זִבְחֵי־רִֽיב׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:1
Proverbs 17:2A servant who deals wisely will rule over a son who causes shame, and shall have a part in the inheritance among the brothers.
Proverbs 17:27  עֶֽבֶד־מַשְׂכִּ֗יל יִ֭מְשֹׁל בְּבֵ֣ן מֵבִ֑ישׁ וּבְת֥וֹךְ אַ֝חִ֗ים יַחֲלֹ֥ק נַחֲלָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:2
Proverbs 17:3The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold, but Yahweh tests the hearts.
Proverbs 17:37  מַצְרֵ֣ף לַ֭כֶּסֶף וְכ֣וּר לַזָּהָ֑ב וּבֹחֵ֖ן לִבּ֣וֹת יְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:3
Proverbs 17:4An evildoer heeds wicked lips. A liar gives ear to a mischievous tongue.
Proverbs 17:47  מֵ֭רַע מַקְשִׁ֣יב עַל־שְׂפַת־אָ֑וֶן שֶׁ֥קֶר מֵ֝זִין עַל־לְשׁ֥וֹן הַוֺּֽת׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:4
Proverbs 17:5Whoever mocks the poor reproaches his Maker. He who is glad at calamity shall not be unpunished.
Proverbs 17:57  לֹעֵ֣ג לָ֭רָשׁ חֵרֵ֣ף עֹשֵׂ֑הוּ שָׂמֵ֥חַ לְ֝אֵ֗יד לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:5
Proverbs 17:6Children's children are the crown of old men; the glory of children are their parents.
Proverbs 17:67  עֲטֶ֣רֶת זְ֭קֵנִים בְּנֵ֣י בָנִ֑ים וְתִפְאֶ֖רֶת בָּנִ֣ים אֲבוֹתָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:6
Proverbs 17:7Arrogant speech isn't fitting for a fool, much less do lying lips fit a prince.
Proverbs 17:77  לֹא־נָאוָ֣ה לְנָבָ֣ל שְׂפַת־יֶ֑תֶר אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לְנָדִ֥יב שְׂפַת־שָֽׁקֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:7
Proverbs 17:8A bribe is a precious stone in the eyes of him who gives it; wherever he turns, he prospers.
Proverbs 17:87  אֶֽבֶן־חֵ֣ן הַ֭שֹּׁחַד בְּעֵינֵ֣י בְעָלָ֑יו אֶֽל־כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֖ר יִפְנֶ֣ה יַשְׂכִּֽיל׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:8
Proverbs 17:9He who covers an offense promotes love; but he who repeats a matter separates best friends.
Proverbs 17:97  מְֽכַסֶּה־פֶּ֭שַׁע מְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אַהֲבָ֑ה וְשֹׁנֶ֥ה בְ֝דָבָ֗ר מַפְרִ֥יד אַלּֽוּף׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:9
Proverbs 17:10A rebuke enters deeper into one who has understanding than a hundred lashes into a fool.
Proverbs 17:107  תֵּ֣חַת גְּעָרָ֣ה בְמֵבִ֑ין מֵהַכּ֖וֹת כְּסִ֣יל מֵאָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:10
Proverbs 17:11An evil man seeks only rebellion; therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
Proverbs 17:117  אַךְ־מְרִ֥י יְבַקֶּשׁ־רָ֑ע וּמַלְאָ֥ךְ אַ֝כְזָרִ֗י יְשֻׁלַּח־בּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:11
Proverbs 17:12Let a bear robbed of her cubs meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.
Proverbs 17:127  פָּג֬וֹשׁ דֹּ֣ב שַׁכּ֣וּל בְּאִ֑ישׁ וְאַל־כְּ֝סִ֗יל בְּאִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:12
Proverbs 17:13Whoever rewards evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
Proverbs 17:137  מֵשִׁ֣יב רָ֭עָה תַּ֣חַת טוֹבָ֑ה לֹא־*תמיש **תָמ֥וּשׁ רָ֝עָ֗ה מִבֵּיתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:13
Proverbs 17:14The beginning of strife is like breaching a dam, therefore stop contention before quarreling breaks out.
Proverbs 17:147  פּ֣וֹטֵֽר מַ֭יִם רֵאשִׁ֣ית מָד֑וֹן וְלִפְנֵ֥י הִ֝תְגַּלַּ֗ע הָרִ֥יב נְטֽוֹשׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:14
Proverbs 17:15He who justifies the wicked, and he who condemns the righteous, both of them alike are an abomination to Yahweh.
Proverbs 17:157  מַצְדִּ֣יק רָ֭שָׁע וּמַרְשִׁ֣יעַ צַדִּ֑יק תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְ֝הוָ֗ה גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:15
Proverbs 17:16Why is there money in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, since he has no understanding?
Proverbs 17:167  לָמָּה־זֶּ֣ה מְחִ֣יר בְּיַד־כְּסִ֑יל לִקְנ֖וֹת חָכְמָ֣ה וְלֶב־אָֽיִן׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:16
Proverbs 17:17A friend loves at all times; and a brother is born for adversity.
Proverbs 17:177  בְּכָל־עֵ֭ת אֹהֵ֣ב הָרֵ֑עַ וְאָ֥ח לְ֝צָרָ֗ה יִוָּלֵֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:17
Proverbs 17:18A man void of understanding strikes hands, and becomes collateral in the presence of his neighbor.
Proverbs 17:187  אָדָ֣ם חֲסַר־לֵ֭ב תּוֹקֵ֣עַ כָּ֑ף עֹרֵ֥ב עֲ֝רֻבָּ֗ה לִפְנֵ֥י רֵעֵֽהוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:18
Proverbs 17:19He who loves disobedience loves strife. One who builds a high gate seeks destruction.
Proverbs 17:197  אֹ֣הֵֽב פֶּ֭שַׁע אֹהֵ֣ב מַצָּ֑ה מַגְבִּ֥יהַּ פִּ֝תְח֗וֹ מְבַקֶּשׁ־שָֽׁבֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:19
Proverbs 17:20One who has a perverse heart doesn't find prosperity, and one who has a deceitful tongue falls into trouble.
Proverbs 17:207  עִקֶּשׁ־לֵ֭ב לֹ֣א יִמְצָא־ט֑וֹב וְנֶהְפָּ֥ךְ בִּ֝לְשׁוֹנ֗וֹ יִפּ֥וֹל בְּרָעָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:20
Proverbs 17:21He who becomes the father of a fool grieves. The father of a fool has no joy.
Proverbs 17:217  יֹלֵ֣ד כְּ֭סִיל לְת֣וּגָה ל֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־יִ֝שְׂמַ֗ח אֲבִ֣י נָבָֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:21
Proverbs 17:22A cheerful heart makes good medicine, but a crushed spirit dries up the bones.
Proverbs 17:227  לֵ֣ב שָׂ֭מֵחַ יֵיטִ֣ב גֵּהָ֑ה וְר֥וּחַ נְ֝כֵאָ֗ה תְּיַבֶּשׁ־גָּֽרֶם׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:22
Proverbs 17:23A wicked man receives a bribe in secret, to pervert the ways of justice.
Proverbs 17:237  שֹׁ֣חַד מֵ֭חֵיק רָשָׁ֣ע יִקָּ֑ח לְ֝הַטּ֗וֹת אָרְח֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:23
Proverbs 17:24Wisdom is before the face of one who has understanding, but the eyes of a fool wander to the ends of the earth.
Proverbs 17:247  אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י מֵבִ֣ין חָכְמָ֑ה וְעֵינֵ֥י כְ֝סִ֗יל בִּקְצֵה־אָֽרֶץ׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:24
Proverbs 17:25A foolish son brings grief to his father, and bitterness to her who bore him.
Proverbs 17:257  כַּ֣עַס לְ֭אָבִיו בֵּ֣ן כְּסִ֑יל וּ֝מֶ֗מֶר לְיוֹלַדְתּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:25
Proverbs 17:26Also to punish the righteous is not good, nor to flog officials for their integrity.
Proverbs 17:267  גַּ֤ם עֲנ֣וֹשׁ לַצַּדִּ֣יק לֹא־ט֑וֹב לְהַכּ֖וֹת נְדִיבִ֣ים עַל־יֹֽשֶׁר׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:26
Proverbs 17:27He who spares his words has knowledge. He who is even tempered is a man of understanding.
Proverbs 17:277  חוֹשֵׂ֣ךְ אֲ֭מָרָיו יוֹדֵ֣עַ דָּ֑עַת *וקר־**יְקַר־ר֝֗וּחַ אִ֣ישׁ תְּבוּנָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:27
Proverbs 17:28Even a fool, when he keeps silent, is counted wise. When he shuts his lips, he is thought to be discerning.
Proverbs 17:287  גַּ֤ם אֱוִ֣יל מַ֭חֲרִישׁ חָכָ֣ם יֵחָשֵׁ֑ב אֹטֵ֖ם שְׂפָתָ֣יו נָבֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 17:28
Proverbs 18:1An unfriendly man pursues selfishness, and defies all sound judgment.
Proverbs 18:18  לְֽ֭תַאֲוָה יְבַקֵּ֣שׁ נִפְרָ֑ד בְּכָל־תּ֝וּשִׁיָּ֗ה יִתְגַּלָּֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:1
Proverbs 18:2A fool has no delight in understanding, but only in revealing his own opinion.
Proverbs 18:28  לֹֽא־יַחְפֹּ֣ץ כְּ֭סִיל בִּתְבוּנָ֑ה כִּ֝֗י אִֽם־בְּהִתְגַּלּ֥וֹת לִבּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:2
Proverbs 18:3When wickedness comes, contempt also comes, and with shame comes disgrace.
Proverbs 18:38  בְּֽבוֹא־רָ֭שָׁע בָּ֣א גַם־בּ֑וּז וְֽעִם־קָל֥וֹן חֶרְפָּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:3
Proverbs 18:4The words of a man's mouth are like deep waters. The fountain of wisdom is like a flowing brook.
Proverbs 18:48  מַ֣יִם עֲ֭מֻקִּים דִּבְרֵ֣י פִי־אִ֑ישׁ נַ֥חַל נֹ֝בֵ֗עַ מְק֣וֹר חָכְמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:4
Proverbs 18:5To be partial to the faces of the wicked is not good, nor to deprive the innocent of justice.
Proverbs 18:58  שְׂאֵ֣ת פְּנֵי־רָשָׁ֣ע לֹא־ט֑וֹב לְהַטּ֥וֹת צַ֝דִּ֗יק בַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:5
Proverbs 18:6A fool's lips come into strife, and his mouth invites beatings.
Proverbs 18:68  שִׂפְתֵ֣י כְ֭סִיל יָבֹ֣אֽוּ בְרִ֑יב וּ֝פִ֗יו לְֽמַהֲלֻמ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:6
Proverbs 18:7A fool's mouth is his destruction, and his lips are a snare to his soul.
Proverbs 18:78  פִּֽי־כְ֭סִיל מְחִתָּה־ל֑וֹ וּ֝שְׂפָתָ֗יו מוֹקֵ֥שׁ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:7
Proverbs 18:8The words of a gossip are like dainty morsels: they go down into a person's innermost parts.
Proverbs 18:88  דִּבְרֵ֣י נִ֭רְגָּן כְּמִֽתְלַהֲמִ֑ים וְ֝הֵ֗ם יָרְד֥וּ חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:8
Proverbs 18:9One who is slack in his work is brother to him who is a master of destruction.
Proverbs 18:98  גַּ֭ם מִתְרַפֶּ֣ה בִמְלַאכְתּ֑וֹ אָ֥ח ה֝֗וּא לְבַ֣עַל מַשְׁחִֽית׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:9
Proverbs 18:10The name of Yahweh is a strong tower: the righteous run to him, and are safe.
Proverbs 18:108  מִגְדַּל־עֹ֭ז שֵׁ֣ם יְהוָ֑ה בּֽוֹ־יָר֖וּץ צַדִּ֣יק וְנִשְׂגָּֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:10
Proverbs 18:11The rich man's wealth is his strong city, like an unscalable wall in his own imagination.
Proverbs 18:118  ה֣וֹן עָ֭שִׁיר קִרְיַ֣ת עֻזּ֑וֹ וּכְחוֹמָ֥ה נִ֝שְׂגָּבָ֗ה בְּמַשְׂכִּיתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:11
Proverbs 18:12Before destruction the heart of man is proud, but before honor is humility.
Proverbs 18:128  לִפְנֵי־שֶׁ֭בֶר יִגְבַּ֣הּ לֵב־אִ֑ישׁ וְלִפְנֵ֖י כָב֣וֹד עֲנָוֽ͏ָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:12
Proverbs 18:13He who gives answer before he hears, that is folly and shame to him.
Proverbs 18:138  מֵשִׁ֣יב דָּ֭בָר בְּטֶ֣רֶם יִשְׁמָ֑ע אִוֶּ֥לֶת הִיא־ל֝֗וֹ וּכְלִמָּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:13
Proverbs 18:14A man's spirit will sustain him in sickness, but a crushed spirit, who can bear?
Proverbs 18:148  רֽוּחַ־אִ֭ישׁ יְכַלְכֵּ֣ל מַחֲלֵ֑הוּ וְר֥וּחַ נְ֝כֵאָ֗ה מִ֣י יִשָּׂאֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:14
Proverbs 18:15The heart of the discerning gets knowledge. The ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
Proverbs 18:158  לֵ֣ב נָ֭בוֹן יִקְנֶה־דָּ֑עַת וְאֹ֥זֶן חֲ֝כָמִ֗ים תְּבַקֶּשׁ־דָּֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:15
Proverbs 18:16A man's gift makes room for him, and brings him before great men.
Proverbs 18:168  מַתָּ֣ן אָ֭דָם יַרְחִ֣יב ל֑וֹ וְלִפְנֵ֖י גְדֹלִ֣ים יַנְחֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:16
Proverbs 18:17He who pleads his cause first seems right; until another comes and questions him.
Proverbs 18:178  צַדִּ֣יק הָרִאשׁ֣וֹן בְּרִיב֑וֹ *יבא־**וּבָֽא־רֵ֝עֵ֗הוּ וַחֲקָרֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:17
Proverbs 18:18The lot settles disputes, and keeps strong ones apart.
Proverbs 18:188  מִ֭דְיָנִים יַשְׁבִּ֣ית הַגּוֹרָ֑ל וּבֵ֖ין עֲצוּמִ֣ים יַפְרִֽיד׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:18
Proverbs 18:19A brother offended is more difficult than a fortified city; and disputes are like the bars of a castle.
Proverbs 18:198  אָ֗ח נִפְשָׁ֥ע מִקִּרְיַת־עֹ֑ז *ומדונים **וּ֝מִדְיָנִ֗ים כִּבְרִ֥יחַ אַרְמֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:19
Proverbs 18:20A man's stomach is filled with the fruit of his mouth. With the harvest of his lips he is satisfied.
Proverbs 18:208  מִפְּרִ֣י פִי־אִ֭ישׁ תִּשְׂבַּ֣ע בִּטְנ֑וֹ תְּבוּאַ֖ת שְׂפָתָ֣יו יִשְׂבָּֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:20
Proverbs 18:21Death and life are in the power of the tongue; those who love it will eat its fruit.
Proverbs 18:218  מָ֣וֶת וְ֭חַיִּים בְּיַד־לָשׁ֑וֹן וְ֝אֹהֲבֶ֗יהָ יֹאכַ֥ל פִּרְיָֽהּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:21
Proverbs 18:22Whoever finds a wife finds a good thing, and obtains favor of Yahweh.
Proverbs 18:228  מָצָ֣א אִ֭שָּׁה מָ֣צָא ט֑וֹב וַיָּ֥פֶק רָ֝צ֗וֹן מֵיְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:22
Proverbs 18:23The poor plead for mercy, but the rich answer harshly.
Proverbs 18:238  תַּחֲנוּנִ֥ים יְדַבֶּר־רָ֑שׁ וְ֝עָשִׁ֗יר יַעֲנֶ֥ה עַזּֽוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:23
Proverbs 18:24A man of many companions may be ruined, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
Proverbs 18:248  אִ֣ישׁ רֵ֭עִים לְהִתְרֹעֵ֑עַ וְיֵ֥שׁ אֹ֝הֵ֗ב דָּבֵ֥ק מֵאָֽח׃ ‬
Proverbs 18:24
Proverbs 19:1Better is the poor who walks in his integrity than he who is perverse in his lips and is a fool.
Proverbs 19:19  טֽוֹב־רָ֭שׁ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֑וֹ מֵעִקֵּ֥שׁ שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו וְה֣וּא כְסִֽיל׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:1
Proverbs 19:2It isn't good to have zeal without knowledge; nor being hasty with one's feet and missing the way.
Proverbs 19:29  גַּ֤ם בְּלֹא־דַ֣עַת נֶ֣פֶשׁ לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְאָ֖ץ בְּרַגְלַ֣יִם חוֹטֵֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:2
Proverbs 19:3The foolishness of man subverts his way; his heart rages against Yahweh.
Proverbs 19:39  אִוֶּ֣לֶת אָ֭דָם תְּסַלֵּ֣ף דַּרְכּ֑וֹ וְעַל־יְ֝הוָ֗ה יִזְעַ֥ף לִבּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:3
Proverbs 19:4Wealth adds many friends, but the poor is separated from his friend.
Proverbs 19:49  ה֗וֹן יֹ֭סִיף רֵעִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְ֝דָ֗ל מֵרֵ֥עהוּ יִפָּרֵֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:4
Proverbs 19:5A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who pours out lies shall not go free.
Proverbs 19:59  עֵ֣ד שְׁ֭קָרִים לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶ֑ה וְיָפִ֥יחַ כְּ֝זָבִ֗ים לֹ֣א יִמָּלֵֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:5
Proverbs 19:6Many will entreat the favor of a ruler, and everyone is a friend to a man who gives gifts.
Proverbs 19:69  רַ֭בִּים יְחַלּ֣וּ פְנֵֽי־נָדִ֑יב וְכָל־הָ֝רֵ֗עַ לְאִ֣ישׁ מַתָּֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:6
Proverbs 19:7All the relatives of the poor shun him: how much more do his friends avoid him! He pursues them with pleas, but they are gone.
Proverbs 19:79  כָּ֥ל אֲחֵי־רָ֨שׁ ׀ שְֽׂנֵאֻ֗הוּ אַ֤ף כִּ֣י מְ֭רֵעֵהוּ רָחֲק֣וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ מְרַדֵּ֖ף אֲמָרִ֣ים *לא־**לוֹ־הֵֽמָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:7
Proverbs 19:8He who gets wisdom loves his own soul. He who keeps understanding shall find good.
Proverbs 19:89  קֹֽנֶה־לֵּ֭ב אֹהֵ֣ב נַפְשׁ֑וֹ שֹׁמֵ֥ר תְּ֝בוּנָ֗ה לִמְצֹא־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:8
Proverbs 19:9A false witness shall not be unpunished. He who utters lies shall perish.
Proverbs 19:99  עֵ֣ד שְׁ֭קָרִים לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶ֑ה וְיָפִ֖יחַ כְּזָבִ֣ים יֹאבֵֽד׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 19:9
Proverbs 19:10Delicate living is not appropriate for a fool, much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
Proverbs 19:109  לֹֽא־נָאוֶ֣ה לִכְסִ֣יל תַּעֲנ֑וּג אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־לְעֶ֤בֶד ׀ מְשֹׁ֬ל בְּשָׂרִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:10
Proverbs 19:11The discretion of a man makes him slow to anger. It is his glory to overlook an offense.
Proverbs 19:119  שֵׂ֣כֶל אָ֭דָם הֶאֱרִ֣יךְ אַפּ֑וֹ וְ֝תִפאַרְתּ֗וֹ עֲבֹ֣ר עַל־פָּֽשַׁע׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:11
Proverbs 19:12The king's wrath is like the roaring of a lion, but his favor is like dew on the grass.
Proverbs 19:129  נַ֣הַם כַּ֭כְּפִיר זַ֣עַף מֶ֑לֶךְ וּכְטַ֖ל עַל־עֵ֣שֶׂב רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:12
Proverbs 19:13A foolish son is the calamity of his father. A wife's quarrels are a continual dripping.
Proverbs 19:139  הַוֺּ֣ת לְ֭אָבִיו בֵּ֣ן כְּסִ֑יל וְדֶ֥לֶף טֹ֝רֵ֗ד מִדְיְנֵ֥י אִשָּֽׁה׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:13
Proverbs 19:14House and riches are an inheritance from fathers, but a prudent wife is from Yahweh.
Proverbs 19:149  בַּ֣יִת וָ֭הוֹן נַחֲלַ֣ת אָב֑וֹת וּ֝מֵיְהוָ֗ה אִשָּׁ֥ה מַשְׂכָּֽלֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:14
Proverbs 19:15Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep. The idle soul shall suffer hunger.
Proverbs 19:159  עַ֭צְלָה תַּפִּ֣יל תַּרְדֵּמָ֑ה וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ רְמִיָּ֣ה תִרְעָֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:15
Proverbs 19:16He who keeps the commandment keeps his soul, but he who is contemptuous in his ways shall die.
Proverbs 19:169  שֹׁמֵ֣ר מִ֭צְוָה שֹׁמֵ֣ר נַפְשׁ֑וֹ בּוֹזֵ֖ה דְרָכָ֣יו *יומת **יָמֽוּת׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:16
Proverbs 19:17He who has pity on the poor lends to Yahweh; he will reward him.
Proverbs 19:179  מַלְוֵ֣ה יְ֭הוָה ח֣וֹנֵֽן דָּ֑ל וּ֝גְמֻל֗וֹ יְשַׁלֶּם־לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:17
Proverbs 19:18Discipline your son, for there is hope; don't be a willing party to his death.
Proverbs 19:189  יַסֵּ֣ר בִּ֭נְךָ כִּי־יֵ֣שׁ תִּקְוָ֑ה וְאֶל־הֲ֝מִית֗וֹ אַל־תִּשָּׂ֥א נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:18
Proverbs 19:19A hot-tempered man must pay the penalty, for if you rescue him, you must do it again.
Proverbs 19:199  *גרל־**גְּֽדָל־חֵ֭מָה נֹ֣שֵׂא עֹ֑נֶשׁ כִּ֥י אִם־תַּ֝צִּ֗יל וְע֣וֹד תּוֹסִֽף׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:19
Proverbs 19:20Listen to counsel and receive instruction, that you may be wise in your latter end.
Proverbs 19:209  שְׁמַ֣ע עֵ֭צָה וְקַבֵּ֣ל מוּסָ֑ר לְ֝מַ֗עַן תֶּחְכַּ֥ם בְּאַחֲרִיתֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:20
Proverbs 19:21There are many plans in a man's heart, but Yahweh's counsel will prevail.
Proverbs 19:219  רַבּ֣וֹת מַחֲשָׁב֣וֹת בְּלֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וַעֲצַ֥ת יְ֝הוָ֗ה הִ֣יא תָקֽוּם׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:21
Proverbs 19:22That which makes a man to be desired is his kindness. A poor man is better than a liar.
Proverbs 19:229  תַּאֲוַ֣ת אָדָ֣ם חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְטֽוֹב־רָ֝שׁ מֵאִ֥ישׁ כָּזָֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:22
Proverbs 19:23The fear of Yahweh leads to life, then contentment; he rests and will not be touched by trouble.
Proverbs 19:239  יִרְאַ֣ת יְהוָ֣ה לְחַיִּ֑ים וְשָׂבֵ֥עַ יָ֝לִ֗ין בַּל־יִפָּ֥קֶד רָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:23
Proverbs 19:24The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
Proverbs 19:249  טָ֘מַ֤ן עָצֵ֣ל יָ֭דוֹ בַּצַּלָּ֑חַת גַּם־אֶל־פִּ֝֗יהוּ לֹ֣א יְשִׁיבֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:24
Proverbs 19:25Flog a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence; rebuke one who has understanding, and he will gain knowledge.
Proverbs 19:259  לֵ֣ץ תַּ֭כֶּה וּפֶ֣תִי יַעְרִ֑ם וְהוֹכִ֥יחַ לְ֝נָב֗וֹן יָבִ֥ין דָּֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:25
Proverbs 19:26He who robs his father and drives away his mother, is a son who causes shame and brings reproach.
Proverbs 19:269  מְֽשַׁדֶּד־אָ֭ב יַבְרִ֣יחַ אֵ֑ם בֵּ֝֗ן מֵבִ֥ישׁ וּמַחְפִּֽיר׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:26
Proverbs 19:27If you stop listening to instruction, my son, you will stray from the words of knowledge.
Proverbs 19:279  חַֽדַל־בְּ֭נִי לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ מוּסָ֑ר לִ֝שְׁג֗וֹת מֵֽאִמְרֵי־דָֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:27
Proverbs 19:28A corrupt witness mocks justice, and the mouth of the wicked gulps down iniquity.
Proverbs 19:289  עֵ֣ד בְּ֭לִיַּעַל יָלִ֣יץ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּפִ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְבַלַּע־אָֽוֶן׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:28
Proverbs 19:29Penalties are prepared for scoffers, and beatings for the backs of fools.
Proverbs 19:299  נָכ֣וֹנוּ לַלֵּצִ֣ים שְׁפָטִ֑ים וּ֝מַהֲלֻמ֗וֹת לְגֵ֣ו כְּסִילִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 19:29
Proverbs 20:1Wine is a mocker, and beer is a brawler. Whoever is led astray by them is not wise.
Proverbs 20:10  לֵ֣ץ הַ֭יַּין הֹמֶ֣ה שֵׁכָ֑ר וְכָל־שֹׁ֥גֶה בּ֝֗וֹ לֹ֣א יֶחְכָּֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:1
Proverbs 20:2The terror of a king is like the roaring of a lion. He who provokes him to anger forfeits his own life.
Proverbs 20:20  נַ֣הַם כַּ֭כְּפִיר אֵ֣ימַת מֶ֑לֶךְ מִ֝תְעַבְּר֗וֹ חוֹטֵ֥א נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:2
Proverbs 20:3It is an honor for a man to keep aloof from strife; but every fool will be quarreling.
Proverbs 20:30  כָּב֣וֹד לָ֭אִישׁ שֶׁ֣בֶת מֵרִ֑יב וְכָל־אֱ֝וִ֗יל יִתְגַּלָּֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:3
Proverbs 20:4The sluggard will not plow by reason of the winter; therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.
Proverbs 20:40  מֵ֭חֹרֶף עָצֵ֣ל לֹא־יַחֲרֹ֑שׁ *ישאל **וְשָׁאַ֖ל בַּקָּצִ֣יר וָאָֽיִן׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:4
Proverbs 20:5Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
Proverbs 20:50  מַ֣יִם עֲ֭מֻקִּים עֵצָ֣ה בְלֶב־אִ֑ישׁ וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּבוּנָ֣ה יִדְלֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:5
Proverbs 20:6Many men claim to be men of unfailing love, but who can find a faithful man?
Proverbs 20:60  רָב־אָדָ֗ם יִ֭קְרָא אִ֣ישׁ חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֱ֝מוּנִ֗ים מִ֣י יִמְצָֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:6
Proverbs 20:7A righteous man walks in integrity. Blessed are his children after him.
Proverbs 20:70  מִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֣וֹ צַדִּ֑יק אַשְׁרֵ֖י בָנָ֣יו אַחֲרָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:7
Proverbs 20:8A king who sits on the throne of judgment scatters away all evil with his eyes.
Proverbs 20:80  מֶ֗לֶךְ יוֹשֵׁ֥ב עַל־כִּסֵּא־דִ֑ין מְזָרֶ֖ה בְעֵינָ֣יו כָּל־רָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:8
Proverbs 20:9Who can say, |I have made my heart pure. I am clean and without sin?|
Proverbs 20:90  מִֽי־יֹ֭אמַר זִכִּ֣יתִי לִבִּ֑י טָ֝הַ֗רְתִּי מֵחַטָּאתִֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:9
Proverbs 20:10Differing weights and differing measures, both of them alike are an abomination to Yahweh.
Proverbs 20:100  אֶ֣בֶן וָ֭אֶבֶן אֵיפָ֣ה וְאֵיפָ֑ה תּוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְ֝הוָ֗ה גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:10
Proverbs 20:11Even a child makes himself known by his doings, whether his work is pure, and whether it is right.
Proverbs 20:110  גַּ֣ם בְּ֭מַעֲלָלָיו יִתְנַכֶּר־נָ֑עַר אִם־זַ֖ךְ וְאִם־יָשָׁ֣ר פָּעֳלֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:11
Proverbs 20:12The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Yahweh has made even both of them.
Proverbs 20:120  אֹ֣זֶן שֹׁ֭מַעַת וְעַ֣יִן רֹאָ֑ה יְ֝הוָ֗ה עָשָׂ֥ה גַם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:12
Proverbs 20:13Don't love sleep, lest you come to poverty. Open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.
Proverbs 20:130  אַל־תֶּֽאֱהַ֣ב שֵׁ֭נָה פֶּן־תִּוָּרֵ֑שׁ פְּקַ֖ח עֵינֶ֣יךָ שְֽׂבַֽע־לָֽחֶם׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:13
Proverbs 20:14|It's no good, it's no good,| says the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasts.
Proverbs 20:140  רַ֣ע רַ֭ע יֹאמַ֣ר הַקּוֹנֶ֑ה וְאֹזֵ֥ל ל֝֗וֹ אָ֣ז יִתְהַלָּֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:14
Proverbs 20:15There is gold and abundance of rubies; but the lips of knowledge are a rare jewel.
Proverbs 20:150  יֵ֣שׁ זָ֭הָב וְרָב־פְּנִינִ֑ים וּכְלִ֥י יְ֝קָ֗ר שִׂפְתֵי־דָֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:15
Proverbs 20:16Take the garment of one who puts up collateral for a stranger; and hold him in pledge for a wayward woman.
Proverbs 20:160  לְֽקַח־בִּ֭גְדוֹ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וּבְעַ֖ד *נכרים **נָכְרִיָּ֣ה חַבְלֵֽהוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:16
Proverbs 20:17Fraudulent food is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth is filled with gravel.
Proverbs 20:170  עָרֵ֣ב לָ֭אִישׁ לֶ֣חֶם שָׁ֑קֶר וְ֝אַחַ֗ר יִמָּֽלֵא־פִ֥יהוּ חָצָֽץ׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:17
Proverbs 20:18Plans are established by advice; by wise guidance you wage war!
Proverbs 20:180  מַ֭חֲשָׁבוֹת בְּעֵצָ֣ה תִכּ֑וֹן וּ֝בְתַחְבֻּל֗וֹת עֲשֵׂ֣ה מִלְחָמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:18
Proverbs 20:19He who goes about as a tale-bearer reveals secrets; therefore don't keep company with him who opens wide his lips.
Proverbs 20:190  גּֽוֹלֶה־סּ֭וֹד הוֹלֵ֣ךְ רָכִ֑יל וּלְפֹתֶ֥ה שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִתְעָרָֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:19
Proverbs 20:20Whoever curses his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in blackness of darkness.
Proverbs 20:200  מְ֭קַלֵּל אָבִ֣יו וְאִמּ֑וֹ יִֽדְעַ֥ךְ נֵ֝ר֗וֹ *באישון **בֶּאֱשׁ֥וּן חֹֽשֶׁךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:20
Proverbs 20:21An inheritance quickly gained at the beginning, won't be blessed in the end.
Proverbs 20:210  נַ֭חֲלָה *מבחלת **מְבֹהֶ֣לֶת בָּרִאשֹׁנָ֑ה וְ֝אַחֲרִיתָ֗הּ לֹ֣א תְבֹרָֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:21
Proverbs 20:22Don't say, |I will pay back evil.| Wait for Yahweh, and he will save you.
Proverbs 20:220  אַל־תֹּאמַ֥ר אֲשַׁלְּמָה־רָ֑ע קַוֵּ֥ה לַֽ֝יהוָ֗ה וְיֹ֣שַֽׁע לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:22
Proverbs 20:23Yahweh detests differing weights, and dishonest scales are not pleasing.
Proverbs 20:230  תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְ֭הוָה אֶ֣בֶן וָאָ֑בֶן וּמֹאזְנֵ֖י מִרְמָ֣ה לֹא־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:23
Proverbs 20:24A man's steps are from Yahweh; how then can man understand his way?
Proverbs 20:240  מֵיהוָ֥ה מִצְעֲדֵי־גָ֑בֶר וְ֝אָדָ֗ם מַה־יָּבִ֥ין דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:24
Proverbs 20:25It is a snare to a man to make a rash dedication, then later to consider his vows.
Proverbs 20:250  מוֹקֵ֣שׁ אָ֭דָם יָ֣לַע קֹ֑דֶשׁ וְאַחַ֖ר נְדָרִ֣ים לְבַקֵּֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:25
Proverbs 20:26A wise king winnows out the wicked, and drives the threshing wheel over them.
Proverbs 20:260  מְזָרֶ֣ה רְ֭שָׁעִים מֶ֣לֶךְ חָכָ֑ם וַיָּ֖שֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם אוֹפָֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:26
Proverbs 20:27The spirit of man is Yahweh's lamp, searching all his innermost parts.
Proverbs 20:270  נֵ֣ר יְ֭הוָה נִשְׁמַ֣ת אָדָ֑ם חֹ֝פֵ֗שׂ כָּל־חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:27
Proverbs 20:28Love and faithfulness keep the king safe. His throne is sustained by love.
Proverbs 20:280  חֶ֣סֶד וֶ֭אֱמֶת יִצְּרוּ־מֶ֑לֶךְ וְסָעַ֖ד בַּחֶ֣סֶד כִּסְאֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:28
Proverbs 20:29The glory of young men is their strength. The splendor of old men is their gray hair.
Proverbs 20:290  תִּפְאֶ֣רֶת בַּחוּרִ֣ים כֹּחָ֑ם וַהֲדַ֖ר זְקֵנִ֣ים שֵׂיבָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:29
Proverbs 20:30Wounding blows cleanse away evil, and beatings purge the innermost parts.
Proverbs 20:300  חַבֻּר֣וֹת פֶּ֭צַע *תמריק **תַּמְר֣וּק בְּרָ֑ע וּ֝מַכּ֗וֹת חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃ ‬
Proverbs 20:30
Proverbs 21:1The king's heart is in Yahweh's hand like the watercourses. He turns it wherever he desires.
Proverbs 21:11  פַּלְגֵי־מַ֣יִם לֶב־מֶ֭לֶךְ בְּיַד־יְהוָ֑ה עַֽל־כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֖ר יַחְפֹּ֣ץ יַטֶּֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:1
Proverbs 21:2Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, but Yahweh weighs the hearts.
Proverbs 21:21  כָּֽל־דֶּרֶךְ־אִ֭ישׁ יָשָׁ֣ר בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְתֹכֵ֖ן לִבּ֣וֹת יְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:2
Proverbs 21:3To do righteousness and justice is more acceptable to Yahweh than sacrifice.
Proverbs 21:31  עֲ֭שֹׂה צְדָקָ֣ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט נִבְחָ֖ר לַיהוָ֣ה מִזָּֽבַח׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:3
Proverbs 21:4A high look, and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, is sin.
Proverbs 21:41  רוּם־עֵ֭ינַיִם וּרְחַב־לֵ֑ב נִ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים חַטָּֽאת׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:4
Proverbs 21:5The plans of the diligent surely lead to profit; and everyone who is hasty surely rushes to poverty.
Proverbs 21:51  מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת חָ֭רוּץ אַךְ־לְמוֹתָ֑ר וְכָל־אָ֝֗ץ אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:5
Proverbs 21:6Getting treasures by a lying tongue is a fleeting vapor for those who seek death.
Proverbs 21:61  פֹּ֣עַל א֭וֹצָרוֹת בִּלְשׁ֣וֹן שָׁ֑קֶר הֶ֥בֶל נִ֝דָּ֗ף מְבַקְשֵׁי־מָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:6
Proverbs 21:7The violence of the wicked will drive them away, because they refuse to do what is right.
Proverbs 21:71  שֹׁד־רְשָׁעִ֥ים יְגוֹרֵ֑ם כִּ֥י מֵ֝אֲנ֗וּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת מִשְׁפָּֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:7
Proverbs 21:8The way of the guilty is devious, but the conduct of the innocent is upright.
Proverbs 21:81  הֲפַכְפַּ֬ךְ דֶּ֣רֶךְ אִ֣ישׁ וָזָ֑ר וְ֝זַ֗ךְ יָשָׁ֥ר פָּעֳלֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:8
Proverbs 21:9It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than to share a house with a contentious woman.
Proverbs 21:91  ט֗וֹב לָשֶׁ֥בֶת עַל־פִּנַּת־גָּ֑ג מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים וּבֵ֥ית חָֽבֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:9
Proverbs 21:10The soul of the wicked desires evil; his neighbor finds no mercy in his eyes.
Proverbs 21:101  נֶ֣פֶשׁ רָ֭שָׁע אִוְּתָה־רָ֑ע לֹא־יֻחַ֖ן בְּעֵינָ֣יו רֵעֵֽהוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:10
Proverbs 21:11When the mocker is punished, the simple gains wisdom. When the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.
Proverbs 21:111  בַּעְנָשׁ־לֵ֭ץ יֶחְכַּם־פֶּ֑תִי וּבְהַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְ֝חָכָ֗ם יִקַּח־דָּֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:11
Proverbs 21:12The Righteous One considers the house of the wicked, and brings the wicked to ruin.
Proverbs 21:121  מַשְׂכִּ֣יל צַ֭דִּיק לְבֵ֣ית רָשָׁ֑ע מְסַלֵּ֖ף רְשָׁעִ֣ים לָרָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:12
Proverbs 21:13Whoever stops his ears at the cry of the poor, he will also cry out, but shall not be heard.
Proverbs 21:131  אֹטֵ֣ם אָ֭זְנוֹ מִזַּעֲקַת־דָּ֑ל גַּֽם־ה֥וּא יִ֝קְרָ֗א וְלֹ֣א יֵעָנֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:13
Proverbs 21:14A gift in secret pacifies anger; and a bribe in the cloak, strong wrath.
Proverbs 21:141  מַתָּ֣ן בַּ֭סֵּתֶר יִכְפֶּה־אָ֑ף וְשֹׁ֥חַד בַּ֝חֵ֗ק חֵמָ֥ה עַזָּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:14
Proverbs 21:15It is joy to the righteous to do justice; but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.
Proverbs 21:151  שִׂמְחָ֣ה לַ֭צַּדִּיק עֲשׂ֣וֹת מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּ֝מְחִתָּ֗ה לְפֹ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:15
Proverbs 21:16The man who wanders out of the way of understanding shall rest in the assembly of the dead.
Proverbs 21:161  אָדָ֗ם תּ֭וֹעֶה מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ הַשְׂכֵּ֑ל בִּקְהַ֖ל רְפָאִ֣ים יָנֽוּחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:16
Proverbs 21:17He who loves pleasure shall be a poor man. He who loves wine and oil shall not be rich.
Proverbs 21:171  אִ֣ישׁ מַ֭חְסוֹר אֹהֵ֣ב שִׂמְחָ֑ה אֹהֵ֥ב יַֽיִן־וָ֝שֶׁ֗מֶן לֹ֣א יַעֲשִֽׁיר׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:17
Proverbs 21:18The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; the treacherous for the upright.
Proverbs 21:181  כֹּ֣פֶר לַצַּדִּ֣יק רָשָׁ֑ע וְתַ֖חַת יְשָׁרִ֣ים בּוֹגֵֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:18
Proverbs 21:19It is better to dwell in a desert land, than with a contentious and fretful woman.
Proverbs 21:191  ט֗וֹב שֶׁ֥בֶת בְּאֶֽרֶץ־מִדְבָּ֑ר מֵאֵ֖שֶׁת *מדונים **מִדְיָנִ֣ים וָכָֽעַס׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:19
Proverbs 21:20There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man swallows it up.
Proverbs 21:201  אוֹצָ֤ר ׀ נֶחְמָ֣ד וָ֭שֶׁמֶן בִּנְוֵ֣ה חָכָ֑ם וּכְסִ֖יל אָדָ֣ם יְבַלְּעֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:20
Proverbs 21:21He who follows after righteousness and kindness finds life, righteousness, and honor.
Proverbs 21:211  רֹ֭דֵף צְדָקָ֣ה וָחָ֑סֶד יִמְצָ֥א חַ֝יִּ֗ים צְדָקָ֥ה וְכָבֽוֹד׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:21
Proverbs 21:22A wise man scales the city of the mighty, and brings down the strength of its confidence.
Proverbs 21:221  עִ֣יר גִּ֭בֹּרִים עָלָ֣ה חָכָ֑ם וַ֝יֹּ֗רֶד עֹ֣ז מִבְטֶחָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:22
Proverbs 21:23Whoever guards his mouth and his tongue keeps his soul from troubles.
Proverbs 21:231  שֹׁמֵ֣ר פִּ֭יו וּלְשׁוֹנ֑וֹ שֹׁמֵ֖ר מִצָּר֣וֹת נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:23
Proverbs 21:24The proud and haughty man, |scoffer| is his name; he works in the arrogance of pride.
Proverbs 21:241  זֵ֣ד יָ֭הִיר לֵ֣ץ שְׁמ֑וֹ ע֝וֹשֶׂ֗ה בְּעֶבְרַ֥ת זָדֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:24
Proverbs 21:25The desire of the sluggard kills him, for his hands refuse to labor.
Proverbs 21:251  תַּאֲוַ֣ת עָצֵ֣ל תְּמִיתֶ֑נּוּ כִּֽי־מֵאֲנ֖וּ יָדָ֣יו לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:25
Proverbs 21:26There are those who covet greedily all day long; but the righteous give and don't withhold.
Proverbs 21:261  כָּל־הַ֭יּוֹם הִתְאַוָּ֣ה תַאֲוָ֑ה וְצַדִּ֥יק יִ֝תֵּ֗ן וְלֹ֣א יַחְשֹֽׂךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:26
Proverbs 21:27The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination: how much more, when he brings it with a wicked mind!
Proverbs 21:271  זֶ֣בַח רְ֭שָׁעִים תּוֹעֵבָ֑ה אַ֝֗ף כִּֽי־בְזִמָּ֥ה יְבִיאֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:27
Proverbs 21:28A false witness will perish, and a man who listens speaks to eternity.
Proverbs 21:281  עֵד־כְּזָבִ֥ים יֹאבֵ֑ד וְאִ֥ישׁ שׁ֝וֹמֵ֗עַ לָנֶ֥צַח יְדַבֵּֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:28
Proverbs 21:29A wicked man hardens his face; but as for the upright, he establishes his ways.
Proverbs 21:291  הֵעֵ֬ז אִ֣ישׁ רָשָׁ֣ע בְּפָנָ֑יו וְ֝יָשָׁ֗ר ה֤וּא ׀ *יכין **יָבִ֬ין *דרכיו **דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:29
Proverbs 21:30There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against Yahweh.
Proverbs 21:301  אֵ֣ין חָ֭כְמָה וְאֵ֣ין תְּבוּנָ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין עֵ֝צָ֗ה לְנֶ֣גֶד יְהוָֽה׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 21:30
Proverbs 21:31The horse is prepared for the day of battle; but victory is with Yahweh.
Proverbs 21:311  ס֗וּס מ֭וּכָן לְי֣וֹם מִלְחָמָ֑ה וְ֝לַֽיהוָ֗ה הַתְּשׁוּעָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 21:31
Proverbs 22:1A good name is more desirable than great riches, and loving favor is better than silver and gold.
Proverbs 22:12  נִבְחָ֣ר שֵׁ֭ם מֵעֹ֣שֶׁר רָ֑ב מִכֶּ֥סֶף וּ֝מִזָּהָ֗ב חֵ֣ן טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:1
Proverbs 22:2The rich and the poor have this in common: Yahweh is the maker of them all.
Proverbs 22:22  עָשִׁ֣יר וָרָ֣שׁ נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ עֹשֵׂ֖ה כֻלָּ֣ם יְהוָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:2
Proverbs 22:3A prudent man sees danger, and hides himself; but the simple pass on, and suffer for it.
Proverbs 22:32  עָר֤וּם ׀ רָאָ֣ה רָעָ֣ה *ויסתר **וְנִסְתָּ֑ר וּ֝פְתָיִ֗ים עָבְר֥וּ וְֽנֶעֱנָֽשׁוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:3
Proverbs 22:4The result of humility and the fear of Yahweh is wealth, honor, and life.
Proverbs 22:42  עֵ֣קֶב עֲ֭נָוָה יִרְאַ֣ת יְהוָ֑ה עֹ֖שֶׁר וְכָב֣וֹד וְחַיִּֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:4
Proverbs 22:5Thorns and snares are in the path of the wicked: whoever guards his soul stays from them.
Proverbs 22:52  צִנִּ֣ים פַּ֭חִים בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ עִקֵּ֑שׁ שׁוֹמֵ֥ר נַ֝פְשׁ֗וֹ יִרְחַ֥ק מֵהֶֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:5
Proverbs 22:6Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.
Proverbs 22:62  חֲנֹ֣ךְ לַ֭נַּעַר עַל־פִּ֣י דַרְכּ֑וֹ גַּ֥ם כִּֽי־יַ֝זְקִ֗ין לֹֽא־יָס֥וּר מִמֶּֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:6
Proverbs 22:7The rich rule over the poor. The borrower is servant to the lender.
Proverbs 22:72  עָ֭שִׁיר בְּרָשִׁ֣ים יִמְשׁ֑וֹל וְעֶ֥בֶד לֹ֝וֶ֗ה לְאִ֣ישׁ מַלְוֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:7
Proverbs 22:8He who sows wickedness reaps trouble, and the rod of his fury will be destroyed.
Proverbs 22:82  זוֹרֵ֣עַ עַ֭וְלָה *יקצור־**יִקְצָר־אָ֑וֶן וְשֵׁ֖בֶט עֶבְרָת֣וֹ יִכְלֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:8
Proverbs 22:9He who has a generous eye will be blessed; for he shares his food with the poor.
Proverbs 22:92  טֽוֹב־עַ֭יִן ה֣וּא יְבֹרָ֑ךְ כִּֽי־נָתַ֖ן מִלַּחְמ֣וֹ לַדָּֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:9
Proverbs 22:10Drive out the mocker, and strife will go out; yes, quarrels and insults will stop.
Proverbs 22:102  גָּ֣רֵֽשׁ לֵ֭ץ וְיֵצֵ֣א מָד֑וֹן וְ֝יִשְׁבֹּ֗ת דִּ֣ין וְקָלֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:10
Proverbs 22:11He who loves purity of heart and speaks gracefully is the king's friend.
Proverbs 22:112  אֹהֵ֥ב *טהור־**טְהָר־לֵ֑ב חֵ֥ן שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו רֵעֵ֥הוּ מֶֽלֶךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:11
Proverbs 22:12The eyes of Yahweh watch over knowledge; but he frustrates the words of the unfaithful.
Proverbs 22:122  עֵינֵ֣י יְ֭הוָה נָ֣צְרוּ דָ֑עַת וַ֝יְסַלֵּ֗ף דִּבְרֵ֥י בֹגֵֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:12
Proverbs 22:13The sluggard says, |There is a lion outside! I will be killed in the streets!|
Proverbs 22:132  אָמַ֣ר עָ֭צֵל אֲרִ֣י בַח֑וּץ בְּת֥וֹךְ רְ֝חֹב֗וֹת אֵֽרָצֵֽחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:13
Proverbs 22:14The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit: he who is under Yahweh's wrath will fall into it.
Proverbs 22:142  שׁוּחָ֣ה עֲ֭מֻקָּה פִּ֣י זָר֑וֹת זְע֥וּם יְ֝הוָ֗ה *יפול־**יִפָּל־שָֽׁם׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:14
Proverbs 22:15Folly is bound up in the heart of a child: the rod of discipline drives it far from him.
Proverbs 22:152  אִ֭וֶּלֶת קְשׁוּרָ֣ה בְלֶב־נָ֑עַר שֵׁ֥בֶט מ֝וּסָ֗ר יַרְחִיקֶ֥נָּה מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:15
Proverbs 22:16Whoever oppresses the poor for his own increase and whoever gives to the rich, both come to poverty.
Proverbs 22:162  עֹ֣שֵֽׁק דָּ֭ל לְהַרְבּ֣וֹת ל֑וֹ נֹתֵ֥ן לְ֝עָשִׁ֗יר אַךְ־לְמַחְסֽוֹר׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:16
Proverbs 22:17Turn your ear, and listen to the words of the wise. Apply your heart to my teaching.
Proverbs 22:172  הַ֥ט אָזְנְךָ֗ וּ֭שְׁמַע דִּבְרֵ֣י חֲכָמִ֑ים וְ֝לִבְּךָ֗ תָּשִׁ֥ית לְדַעְתִּֽי׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:17
Proverbs 22:18For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you, if all of them are ready on your lips.
Proverbs 22:182  כִּֽי־נָ֭עִים כִּֽי־תִשְׁמְרֵ֣ם בְּבִטְנֶ֑ךָ יִכֹּ֥נוּ יַ֝חְדָּ֗ו עַל־שְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:18
Proverbs 22:19That your trust may be in Yahweh, I teach you today, even you.
Proverbs 22:192  לִהְי֣וֹת בַּ֭יהוָה מִבְטַחֶ֑ךָ הוֹדַעְתִּ֖יךָ הַיּ֣וֹם אַף־אָֽתָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:19
Proverbs 22:20Haven't I written to you thirty excellent things of counsel and knowledge,
Proverbs 22:202  הֲלֹ֤א כָתַ֣בְתִּי לְ֭ךָ *שלשום **שָׁלִישִׁ֑ים בְּמ֖וֹעֵצֹ֣ת וָדָֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:20
Proverbs 22:21To teach you truth, reliable words, to give sound answers to the ones who sent you?
Proverbs 22:212  לְהוֹדִֽיעֲךָ֗ קֹ֭שְׁטְ אִמְרֵ֣י אֱמֶ֑ת לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֲמָרִ֥ים אֱ֝מֶ֗ת לְשֹׁלְחֶֽיךָ׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 22:21
Proverbs 22:22Don't exploit the poor, because he is poor; and don't crush the needy in court;
Proverbs 22:222  אַֽל־תִּגְזָל־דָּ֭ל כִּ֣י דַל־ה֑וּא וְאַל־תְּדַכֵּ֖א עָנִ֣י בַשָּֽׁעַר׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:22
Proverbs 22:23for Yahweh will plead their case, and plunder the life of those who plunder them.
Proverbs 22:232  כִּֽי־יְ֭הוָה יָרִ֣יב רִיבָ֑ם וְקָבַ֖ע אֶת־קֹבְעֵיהֶ֣ם נָֽפֶשׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:23
Proverbs 22:24Don't befriend a hot-tempered man, and don't associate with one who harbors anger:
Proverbs 22:242  אַל־תִּ֭תְרַע אֶת־בַּ֣עַל אָ֑ף וְאֶת־אִ֥ישׁ חֵ֝מוֹת לֹ֣א תָבֽוֹא׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:24
Proverbs 22:25lest you learn his ways, and ensnare your soul.
Proverbs 22:252  פֶּן־תֶּאֱלַ֥ף *ארחתו **אֹֽרְחֹתָ֑יו וְלָקַחְתָּ֖ מוֹקֵ֣שׁ לְנַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:25
Proverbs 22:26Don't you be one of those who strike hands, of those who are collateral for debts.
Proverbs 22:262  אַל־תְּהִ֥י בְתֹֽקְעֵי־כָ֑ף בַּ֝עֹרְבִ֗ים מַשָּׁאֽוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:26
Proverbs 22:27If you don't have means to pay, why should he take away your bed from under you?
Proverbs 22:272  אִם־אֵֽין־לְךָ֥ לְשַׁלֵּ֑ם לָ֥מָּה יִקַּ֥ח מִ֝שְׁכָּבְךָ֗ מִתַּחְתֶּֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:27
Proverbs 22:28Don't move the ancient boundary stone, which your fathers have set up.
Proverbs 22:282  אַל־תַּ֭סֵּג גְּב֣וּל עוֹלָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עָשׂ֣וּ אֲבוֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 22:28
Proverbs 22:29Do you see a man skilled in his work? He will serve kings. He won't serve obscure men.
Proverbs 22:292  חָזִ֡יתָ אִ֤ישׁ ׀ מָ֘הִ֤יר בִּמְלַאכְתּ֗וֹ לִֽפְנֵֽי־מְלָכִ֥ים יִתְיַצָּ֑ב בַּל־יִ֝תְיַצֵּב לִפְנֵ֥י חֲשֻׁכִּֽים׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 22:29
Proverbs 23:1When you sit to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before you;
Proverbs 23:13  כִּֽי־תֵ֭שֵׁב לִלְח֣וֹם אֶת־מוֹשֵׁ֑ל בִּ֥ין תָּ֝בִ֗ין אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:1
Proverbs 23:2put a knife to your throat, if you are a man given to appetite.
Proverbs 23:23  וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ שַׂכִּ֣ין בְּלֹעֶ֑ךָ אִם־בַּ֖עַל נֶ֣פֶשׁ אָֽתָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:2
Proverbs 23:3Don't be desirous of his dainties, since they are deceitful food.
Proverbs 23:33  אַל־תִּ֭תְאָו לְמַטְעַמּוֹתָ֑יו וְ֝ה֗וּא לֶ֣חֶם כְּזָבִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:3
Proverbs 23:4Don't weary yourself to be rich. In your wisdom, show restraint.
Proverbs 23:43  אַל־תִּיגַ֥ע לְֽהַעֲשִׁ֑יר מִֽבִּינָתְךָ֥ חֲדָֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:4
Proverbs 23:5Why do you set your eyes on that which is not? For it certainly sprouts wings like an eagle and flies in the sky.
Proverbs 23:53  *התעוף **הֲתָ֤עִיף עֵינֶ֥יךָ בּ֗וֹ וְֽאֵ֫ינֶ֥נּוּ כִּ֤י עָשֹׂ֣ה יַעֲשֶׂה־לּ֣וֹ כְנָפַ֑יִם כְּ֝נֶ֗שֶׁר *ועיף **יָע֥וּף הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 23:5
Proverbs 23:6Don't eat the food of him who has a stingy eye, and don't crave his delicacies:
Proverbs 23:63  אַל־תִּלְחַ֗ם אֶת־לֶ֭חֶם רַ֣ע עָ֑יִן וְאַל־*תתאו **תִּ֝תְאָ֗יו לְמַטְעַמֹּתָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:6
Proverbs 23:7for as he thinks about the cost, so he is. |Eat and drink!| he says to you, but his heart is not with you.
Proverbs 23:73  כִּ֤י ׀ כְּמוֹ־שָׁעַ֥ר בְּנַפְשׁ֗וֹ כֶּ֫ן־ה֥וּא אֱכֹ֣ל וּ֭שְׁתֵה יֹ֣אמַר לָ֑ךְ וְ֝לִבּ֗וֹ בַּל־עִמָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:7
Proverbs 23:8The morsel which you have eaten you shall vomit up, and lose your good words.
Proverbs 23:83  פִּֽתְּךָ־אָכַ֥לְתָּ תְקִיאֶ֑נָּה וְ֝שִׁחַ֗תָּ דְּבָרֶ֥יךָ הַנְּעִימִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:8
Proverbs 23:9Don't speak in the ears of a fool, for he will despise the wisdom of your words.
Proverbs 23:93  בְּאָזְנֵ֣י כְ֭סִיל אַל־תְּדַבֵּ֑ר כִּֽי־יָ֝ב֗וּז לְשֵׂ֣כֶל מִלֶּֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:9
Proverbs 23:10Don't move the ancient boundary stone. Don't encroach on the fields of the fatherless:
Proverbs 23:103  אַל־תַּ֭סֵּג גְּב֣וּל עוֹלָ֑ם וּבִשְׂדֵ֥י יְ֝תוֹמִ֗ים אַל־תָּבֹֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:10
Proverbs 23:11for their Defender is strong. He will plead their case against you.
Proverbs 23:113  כִּֽי־גֹאֲלָ֥ם חָזָ֑ק הֽוּא־יָרִ֖יב אֶת־רִיבָ֣ם אִתָּֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:11
Proverbs 23:12Apply your heart to instruction, and your ears to the words of knowledge.
Proverbs 23:123  הָבִ֣יאָה לַמּוּסָ֣ר לִבֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝אָזְנֶ֗ךָ לְאִמְרֵי־דָֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:12
Proverbs 23:13Don't withhold correction from a child. If you punish him with the rod, he will not die.
Proverbs 23:133  אַל־תִּמְנַ֣ע מִנַּ֣עַר מוּסָ֑ר כִּֽי־תַכֶּ֥נּוּ בַ֝שֵּׁ֗בֶט לֹ֣א יָמֽוּת׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:13
Proverbs 23:14Punish him with the rod, and save his soul from Sheol.
Proverbs 23:143  אַ֭תָּה בַּשֵּׁ֣בֶט תַּכֶּ֑נּוּ וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ מִשְּׁא֥וֹל תַּצִּֽיל׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:14
Proverbs 23:15My son, if your heart is wise, then my heart will be glad, even mine:
Proverbs 23:153  בְּ֭נִי אִם־חָכַ֣ם לִבֶּ֑ךָ יִשְׂמַ֖ח לִבִּ֣י גַם־אָֽנִי׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:15
Proverbs 23:16yes, my heart will rejoice, when your lips speak what is right.
Proverbs 23:163  וְתַעְלֹ֥זְנָה כִלְיוֹתָ֑י בְּדַבֵּ֥ר שְׂ֝פָתֶ֗יךָ מֵישָׁרִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:16
Proverbs 23:17Don't let your heart envy sinners; but rather fear Yahweh all the day long.
Proverbs 23:173  אַל־יְקַנֵּ֣א לִ֭בְּךָ בַּֽחַטָּאִ֑ים כִּ֥י אִם־בְּיִרְאַת־יְ֝הוָ֗ה כָּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:17
Proverbs 23:18Indeed surely there is a future hope, and your hope will not be cut off.
Proverbs 23:183  כִּ֭י אִם־יֵ֣שׁ אַחֲרִ֑ית וְ֝תִקְוָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִכָּרֵֽת׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:18
Proverbs 23:19Listen, my son, and be wise, and keep your heart on the right path!
Proverbs 23:193  שְׁמַע־אַתָּ֣ה בְנִ֣י וַחֲכָ֑ם וְאַשֵּׁ֖ר בַּדֶּ֣רֶךְ לִבֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:19
Proverbs 23:20Don't be among ones drinking too much wine, or those who gorge themselves on meat:
Proverbs 23:203  אַל־תְּהִ֥י בְסֹֽבְאֵי־יָ֑יִן בְּזֹלֲלֵ֖י בָשָׂ֣ר לָֽמוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:20
Proverbs 23:21for the drunkard and the glutton shall become poor; and drowsiness clothes them in rags.
Proverbs 23:213  כִּי־סֹבֵ֣א וְ֭זוֹלֵל יִוָּרֵ֑שׁ וּ֝קְרָעִ֗ים תַּלְבִּ֥ישׁ נוּמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:21
Proverbs 23:22Listen to your father who gave you life, and don't despise your mother when she is old.
Proverbs 23:223  שְׁמַ֣ע לְ֭אָבִיךָ זֶ֣ה יְלָדֶ֑ךָ וְאַל־תָּ֝ב֗וּז כִּֽי־זָקְנָ֥ה אִמֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:22
Proverbs 23:23Buy the truth, and don't sell it. Get wisdom, discipline, and understanding.
Proverbs 23:233  אֱמֶ֣ת קְ֭נֵה וְאַל־תִּמְכֹּ֑ר חָכְמָ֖ה וּמוּסָ֣ר וּבִינָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:23
Proverbs 23:24The father of the righteous has great joy. Whoever fathers a wise child delights in him.
Proverbs 23:243  *גול **גִּ֣יל *יגול **יָ֭גִיל אֲבִ֣י צַדִּ֑יק *יולד **וְיוֹלֵ֥ד חָ֝כָ֗ם *וישמח־**יִשְׂמַח־בּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:24
Proverbs 23:25Let your father and your mother be glad! Let her who bore you rejoice!
Proverbs 23:253  יִֽשְׂמַח־אָבִ֥יךָ וְאִמֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝תָגֵ֗ל יֽוֹלַדְתֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:25
Proverbs 23:26My son, give me your heart; and let your eyes keep in my ways.
Proverbs 23:263  תְּנָֽה־בְנִ֣י לִבְּךָ֣ לִ֑י וְ֝עֵינֶ֗יךָ דְּרָכַ֥י *תרצנה **תִּצֹּֽרְנָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:26
Proverbs 23:27For a prostitute is a deep pit; and a wayward wife is a narrow well.
Proverbs 23:273  כִּֽי־שׁוּחָ֣ה עֲמֻקָּ֣ה זוֹנָ֑ה וּבְאֵ֥ר צָ֝רָ֗ה נָכְרִיָּֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:27
Proverbs 23:28Yes, she lies in wait like a robber, and increases the unfaithful among men.
Proverbs 23:283  אַף־הִ֭יא כְּחֶ֣תֶף תֶּֽאֱרֹ֑ב וּ֝בוֹגְדִ֗ים בְּאָדָ֥ם תּוֹסִֽף׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:28
Proverbs 23:29Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has strife? Who has complaints? Who has needless bruises? Who has bloodshot eyes?
Proverbs 23:293  לְמִ֨י א֥וֹי לְמִ֪י אֲב֡וֹי לְמִ֤י *מדונים **מִדְיָנִ֨ים ׀ לְמִ֥י שִׂ֗יחַ לְ֭מִי פְּצָעִ֣ים חִנָּ֑ם לְ֝מִ֗י חַכְלִל֥וּת עֵינָֽיִם׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:29
Proverbs 23:30Those who stay long at the wine; those who go to seek out mixed wine.
Proverbs 23:303  לַֽמְאַחֲרִ֥ים עַל־הַיָּ֑יִן לַ֝בָּאִ֗ים לַחְקֹ֥ר מִמְסָֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:30
Proverbs 23:31Don't look at the wine when it is red, when it sparkles in the cup, when it goes down smoothly.
Proverbs 23:313  אַל־תֵּ֥רֶא יַיִן֮ כִּ֢י יִתְאַ֫דָּ֥ם כִּֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן *בכיס **בַּכּ֣וֹס עֵינ֑וֹ יִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בְּמֵישָׁרִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:31
Proverbs 23:32In the end, it bites like a snake, and poisons like a viper.
Proverbs 23:323  אַ֭חֲרִיתוֹ כְּנָחָ֣שׁ יִשָּׁ֑ךְ וּֽכְצִפְעֹנִ֥י יַפְרִֽשׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:32
Proverbs 23:33Your eyes will see strange things, and your mind will imagine confusing things.
Proverbs 23:333  עֵ֭ינֶיךָ יִרְא֣וּ זָר֑וֹת וְ֝לִבְּךָ֗ יְדַבֵּ֥ר תַּהְפֻּכֽוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:33
Proverbs 23:34Yes, you will be as he who lies down in the midst of the sea, or as he who lies on top of the rigging:
Proverbs 23:343  וְ֭הָיִיתָ כְּשֹׁכֵ֣ב בְּלֶב־יָ֑ם וּ֝כְשֹׁכֵ֗ב בְּרֹ֣אשׁ חִבֵּֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:34
Proverbs 23:35|They hit me, and I was not hurt! They beat me, and I don't feel it! When will I wake up? I can do it again. I can find another.|
Proverbs 23:353  הִכּ֥וּנִי בַל־חָלִיתִי֮ הֲלָמ֗וּנִי בַּל־יָ֫דָ֥עְתִּי מָתַ֥י אָקִ֑יץ א֝וֹסִ֗יף אֲבַקְשֶׁ֥נּוּ עֽוֹד׃ ‬
Proverbs 23:35
Proverbs 24:1Don't be envious of evil men; neither desire to be with them:
Proverbs 24:14  אַל־תְּ֭קַנֵּא בְּאַנְשֵׁ֣י רָעָ֑ה וְאַל־*תתאו **תִּ֝תְאָ֗יו לִהְי֥וֹת אִתָּֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:1
Proverbs 24:2for their hearts plot violence, and their lips talk about mischief.
Proverbs 24:24  כִּי־שֹׁ֭ד יֶהְגֶּ֣ה לִבָּ֑ם וְ֝עָמָ֗ל שִׂפְתֵיהֶ֥ם תְּדַבֵּֽרְנָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:2
Proverbs 24:3Through wisdom a house is built; by understanding it is established;
Proverbs 24:34  בְּ֭חָכְמָה יִבָּ֣נֶה בָּ֑יִת וּ֝בִתְבוּנָ֗ה יִתְכּוֹנָֽן׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:3
Proverbs 24:4by knowledge the rooms are filled with all rare and beautiful treasure.
Proverbs 24:44  וּ֭בְדַעַת חֲדָרִ֣ים יִמָּלְא֑וּ כָּל־ה֖וֹן יָקָ֣ר וְנָעִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:4
Proverbs 24:5A wise man has great power; and a knowledgeable man increases strength;
Proverbs 24:54  גֶּֽבֶר־חָכָ֥ם בַּע֑וֹז וְאִֽישׁ־דַּ֝֗עַת מְאַמֶּץ־כֹּֽחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:5
Proverbs 24:6for by wise guidance you wage your war; and victory is in many advisors.
Proverbs 24:64  כִּ֣י בְ֭תַחְבֻּלוֹת תַּעֲשֶׂה־לְּךָ֣ מִלְחָמָ֑ה וּ֝תְשׁוּעָ֗ה בְּרֹ֣ב יוֹעֵֽץ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:6
Proverbs 24:7Wisdom is too high for a fool: he doesn't open his mouth in the gate.
Proverbs 24:74  רָאמ֣וֹת לֶֽאֱוִ֣יל חָכְמ֑וֹת בַּ֝שַּׁ֗עַר לֹ֣א יִפְתַּח־פִּֽיהוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:7
Proverbs 24:8One who plots to do evil will be called a schemer.
Proverbs 24:84  מְחַשֵּׁ֥ב לְהָרֵ֑עַ ל֝֗וֹ בַּֽעַל־מְזִמּ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽאוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:8
Proverbs 24:9The schemes of folly are sin. The mocker is detested by men.
Proverbs 24:94  זִמַּ֣ת אִוֶּ֣לֶת חַטָּ֑את וְתוֹעֲבַ֖ת לְאָדָ֣ם לֵֽץ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:9
Proverbs 24:10If you falter in the time of trouble, your strength is small.
Proverbs 24:104  הִ֭תְרַפִּיתָ בְּי֥וֹם צָרָ֗ה צַ֣ר כֹּחֶֽכָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:10
Proverbs 24:11Rescue those who are being led away to death! Indeed, hold back those who are staggering to the slaughter!
Proverbs 24:114  הַ֭צֵּל לְקֻחִ֣ים לַמָּ֑וֶת וּמָטִ֥ים לַ֝הֶ֗רֶג אִם־תַּחְשֽׂוֹךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:11
Proverbs 24:12If you say, |Behold, we didn't know this;| doesn't he who weighs the hearts consider it? He who keeps your soul, doesn't he know it? Shall he not render to every man according to his work?
Proverbs 24:124  כִּֽי־תֹאמַ֗ר הֵן֮ לֹא־יָדַ֢עְנ֫וּ זֶ֥ה הֲ‍ֽלֹא־תֹ֘כֵ֤ן לִבּ֨וֹת ׀ הֽוּא־יָבִ֗ין וְנֹצֵ֣ר נַ֭פְשְׁךָ ה֣וּא יֵדָ֑ע וְהֵשִׁ֖יב לְאָדָ֣ם כְּפָעֳלֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:12
Proverbs 24:13My son, eat honey, for it is good; the droppings of the honeycomb, which are sweet to your taste:
Proverbs 24:134  אֱכָל־בְּנִ֣י דְבַ֣שׁ כִּי־ט֑וֹב וְנֹ֥פֶת מָ֝ת֗וֹק עַל־חִכֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:13
Proverbs 24:14so you shall know wisdom to be to your soul; if you have found it, then there will be a reward, your hope will not be cut off.
Proverbs 24:144  כֵּ֤ן ׀ דְּעֶ֥ה חָכְמָ֗ה לְנַ֫פְשֶׁ֥ךָ אִם־מָ֭צָאתָ וְיֵ֣שׁ אַחֲרִ֑ית וְ֝תִקְוָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תִכָּרֵֽת׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 24:14
Proverbs 24:15Don't lay in wait, wicked man, against the habitation of the righteous. Don't destroy his resting place:
Proverbs 24:154  אַל־תֶּאֱרֹ֣ב רָ֭שָׁע לִנְוֵ֣ה צַדִּ֑יק אַֽל־תְּשַׁדֵּ֥ד רִבְצוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:15
Proverbs 24:16for a righteous man falls seven times, and rises up again; but the wicked are overthrown by calamity.
Proverbs 24:164  כִּ֤י שֶׁ֨בַע ׀ יִפּ֣וֹל צַדִּ֣יק וָקָ֑ם וּ֝רְשָׁעִ֗ים יִכָּשְׁל֥וּ בְרָעָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:16
Proverbs 24:17Don't rejoice when your enemy falls. Don't let your heart be glad when he is overthrown;
Proverbs 24:174  בִּנְפֹ֣ל *אויביך **אֽ֭וֹיִבְךָ אַל־תִּשְׂמָ֑ח וּ֝בִכָּשְׁל֗וֹ אַל־יָגֵ֥ל לִבֶּֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:17
Proverbs 24:18lest Yahweh see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.
Proverbs 24:184  פֶּן־יִרְאֶ֣ה יְ֭הוָה וְרַ֣ע בְּעֵינָ֑יו וְהֵשִׁ֖יב מֵעָלָ֣יו אַפּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:18
Proverbs 24:19Don't fret yourself because of evildoers; neither be envious of the wicked:
Proverbs 24:194  אַל־תִּתְחַ֥ר בַּמְּרֵעִ֑ים אַל־תְּ֝קַנֵּ֗א בָּרְשָׁעִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:19
Proverbs 24:20for there will be no reward to the evil man; and the lamp of the wicked shall be snuffed out.
Proverbs 24:204  כִּ֤י ׀ לֹֽא־תִהְיֶ֣ה אַחֲרִ֣ית לָרָ֑ע נֵ֖ר רְשָׁעִ֣ים יִדְעָֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:20
Proverbs 24:21My son, fear Yahweh and the king. Don't join those who are rebellious:
Proverbs 24:214  יְרָֽא־אֶת־יְהוָ֣ה בְּנִ֣י וָמֶ֑לֶךְ עִם־שׁ֝וֹנִ֗ים אַל־תִּתְעָרָֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:21
Proverbs 24:22for their calamity will rise suddenly; the destruction from them both—who knows?
Proverbs 24:224  כִּֽי־פִ֭תְאֹם יָק֣וּם אֵידָ֑ם וּפִ֥יד שְׁ֝נֵיהֶ֗ם מִ֣י יוֹדֵֽעַ׃ ס ‬
Proverbs 24:22
Proverbs 24:23These also are sayings of the wise. To show partiality in judgment is not good.
Proverbs 24:234  גַּם־אֵ֥לֶּה לַֽחֲכָמִ֑ים הַֽכֵּר־פָּנִ֖ים בְּמִשְׁפָּ֣ט בַּל־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:23
Proverbs 24:24He who says to the wicked, |You are righteous;| peoples shall curse him, and nations shall abhor him—
Proverbs 24:244  אֹ֤מֵ֨ר ׀ לְרָשָׁע֮ צַדִּ֢יק אָ֥תָּה יִקְּבֻ֥הוּ עַמִּ֑ים יִזְעָמ֥וּהוּ לְאֻמִּֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:24
Proverbs 24:25but it will go well with those who convict the guilty, and a rich blessing will come on them.
Proverbs 24:254  וְלַמּוֹכִיחִ֥ים יִנְעָ֑ם וַֽ֝עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם תָּב֥וֹא בִרְכַּת־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:25
Proverbs 24:26An honest answer is like a kiss on the lips.
Proverbs 24:264  שְׂפָתַ֥יִם יִשָּׁ֑ק מֵ֝שִׁ֗יב דְּבָרִ֥ים נְכֹחִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:26
Proverbs 24:27Prepare your work outside, and get your fields ready. Afterwards, build your house.
Proverbs 24:274  הָ֘כֵ֤ן בַּח֨וּץ ׀ מְלַאכְתֶּ֗ךָ וְעַתְּדָ֣הּ בַּשָּׂדֶ֣ה לָ֑ךְ אַ֝חַ֗ר וּבָנִ֥יתָ בֵיתֶֽךָ׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 24:27
Proverbs 24:28Don't be a witness against your neighbor without cause. Don't deceive with your lips.
Proverbs 24:284  אַל־תְּהִ֣י עֵד־חִנָּ֣ם בְּרֵעֶ֑ךָ וַ֝הֲפִתִּ֗יתָ בִּשְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:28
Proverbs 24:29Don't say, |I will do to him as he has done to me; I will render to the man according to his work.|
Proverbs 24:294  אַל־תֹּאמַ֗ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָֽשָׂה־לִ֭י כֵּ֤ן אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לּ֑וֹ אָשִׁ֖יב לָאִ֣ישׁ כְּפָעֳלֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:29
Proverbs 24:30I went by the field of the sluggard, by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
Proverbs 24:304  עַל־שְׂדֵ֣ה אִישׁ־עָצֵ֣ל עָבַ֑רְתִּי וְעַל־כֶּ֝֗רֶם אָדָ֥ם חֲסַר־לֵֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:30
Proverbs 24:31Behold, it was all grown over with thorns. Its surface was covered with nettles, and its stone wall was broken down.
Proverbs 24:314  וְהִנֵּ֨ה עָ֘לָ֤ה כֻלּ֨וֹ ׀ קִמְּשֹׂנִ֗ים כָּסּ֣וּ פָנָ֣יו חֲרֻלִּ֑ים וְגֶ֖דֶר אֲבָנָ֣יו נֶהֱרָֽסָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:31
Proverbs 24:32Then I saw, and considered well. I saw, and received instruction:
Proverbs 24:324  וָֽאֶחֱזֶ֣ה אָ֭נֹכִֽי אָשִׁ֣ית לִבִּ֑י רָ֝אִ֗יתִי לָקַ֥חְתִּי מוּסָֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:32
Proverbs 24:33a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep;
Proverbs 24:334  מְעַ֣ט שֵׁ֭נוֹת מְעַ֣ט תְּנוּמ֑וֹת מְעַ֓ט ׀ חִבֻּ֖ק יָדַ֣יִם לִשְׁכָּֽב׃ ‬
Proverbs 24:33
Proverbs 24:34so your poverty will come as a robber, and your want as an armed man.
Proverbs 24:344  וּבָֽא־מִתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ רֵישֶׁ֑ךָ וּ֝מַחְסֹרֶ֗יךָ כְּאִ֣ישׁ מָגֵֽן׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 24:34
Proverbs 25:1These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
Proverbs 25:15  גַּם־אֵ֭לֶּה מִשְׁלֵ֣י שְׁלֹמֹ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶ֝עְתִּ֗יקוּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י ׀ חִזְקִיָּ֬ה מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:1
Proverbs 25:2It is the glory of God to conceal a thing, but the glory of kings is to search out a matter.
Proverbs 25:25  כְּבֹ֣ד אֱ֭לֹהִים הַסְתֵּ֣ר דָּבָ֑ר וּכְבֹ֥ד מְ֝לָכִ֗ים חֲקֹ֣ר דָּבָֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:2
Proverbs 25:3As the heavens for height, and the earth for depth, so the hearts of kings are unsearchable.
Proverbs 25:35  שָׁמַ֣יִם לָ֭רוּם וָאָ֣רֶץ לָעֹ֑מֶק וְלֵ֥ב מְ֝לָכִ֗ים אֵ֣ין חֵֽקֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:3
Proverbs 25:4Take away the dross from the silver, and material comes out for the refiner;
Proverbs 25:45  הָג֣וֹ סִיגִ֣ים מִכָּ֑סֶף וַיֵּצֵ֖א לַצֹּרֵ֣ף כֶּֽלִי׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:4
Proverbs 25:5Take away the wicked from the king's presence, and his throne will be established in righteousness.
Proverbs 25:55  הָג֣וֹ רָ֭שָׁע לִפְנֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ וְיִכּ֖וֹן בַּצֶּ֣דֶק כִּסְאֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:5
Proverbs 25:6Don't exalt yourself in the presence of the king, or claim a place among great men;
Proverbs 25:65  אַל־תִּתְהַדַּ֥ר לִפְנֵי־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּבִמְק֥וֹם גְּ֝דֹלִ֗ים אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:6
Proverbs 25:7for it is better that it be said to you, |Come up here,| than that you should be put lower in the presence of the prince, whom your eyes have seen.
Proverbs 25:75  כִּ֤י ט֥וֹב אֲמָר־לְךָ֗ עֲ‍ֽלֵ֫ה הֵ֥נָּה מֵֽ֭הַשְׁפִּ֣ילְךָ לִפְנֵ֣י נָדִ֑יב אֲשֶׁ֖ר רָא֣וּ עֵינֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:7
Proverbs 25:8Don't be hasty in bringing charges to court. What will you do in the end when your neighbor shames you?
Proverbs 25:85  אַל־תֵּצֵ֥א לָרִ֗ב מַ֫הֵ֥ר פֶּ֣ן מַה־תַּ֭עֲשֶׂה בְּאַחֲרִיתָ֑הּ בְּהַכְלִ֖ים אֹתְךָ֣ רֵעֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:8
Proverbs 25:9Debate your case with your neighbor, and don't betray the confidence of another;
Proverbs 25:95  רִֽ֭יבְךָ רִ֣יב אֶת־רֵעֶ֑ךָ וְס֖וֹד אַחֵ֣ר אַל־תְּגָֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:9
Proverbs 25:10lest one who hears it put you to shame, and your bad reputation never depart.
Proverbs 25:105  פֶּֽן־יְחַסֶּדְךָ֥ שֹׁמֵ֑עַ וְ֝דִבָּתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א תָשֽׁוּב׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:10
Proverbs 25:11A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver.
Proverbs 25:115  תַּפּוּחֵ֣י זָ֭הָב בְּמַשְׂכִּיּ֥וֹת כָּ֑סֶף דָּ֝בָ֗ר דָּבֻ֥ר עַל־אָפְנָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:11
Proverbs 25:12As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover to an obedient ear.
Proverbs 25:125  נֶ֣זֶם זָ֭הָב וַחֲלִי־כָ֑תֶם מוֹכִ֥יחַ חָ֝כָ֗ם עַל־אֹ֥זֶן שֹׁמָֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:12
Proverbs 25:13As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to those who send him; for he refreshes the soul of his masters.
Proverbs 25:135  כְּצִנַּת־שֶׁ֨לֶג ׀ בְּי֬וֹם קָצִ֗יר צִ֣יר נֶ֭אֱמָן לְשֹׁלְחָ֑יו וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ אֲדֹנָ֣יו יָשִֽׁיב׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 25:13
Proverbs 25:14As clouds and wind without rain, so is he who boasts of gifts deceptively.
Proverbs 25:145  נְשִׂיאִ֣ים וְ֭רוּחַ וְגֶ֣שֶׁם אָ֑יִן אִ֥ישׁ מִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ל בְּמַתַּת־שָֽׁקֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:14
Proverbs 25:15By patience a ruler is persuaded. A soft tongue breaks the bone.
Proverbs 25:155  בְּאֹ֣רֶךְ אַ֭פַּיִם יְפֻתֶּ֣ה קָצִ֑ין וְלָשׁ֥וֹן רַ֝כָּ֗ה תִּשְׁבָּר־גָּֽרֶם׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:15
Proverbs 25:16Have you found honey? Eat as much as is sufficient for you, lest you eat too much, and vomit it.
Proverbs 25:165  דְּבַ֣שׁ מָ֭צָאתָ אֱכֹ֣ל דַּיֶּ֑ךָּ פֶּן־תִּ֝שְׂבָּעֶ֗נּוּ וַהֲקֵֽאתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:16
Proverbs 25:17Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor's house, lest he be weary of you, and hate you.
Proverbs 25:175  הֹקַ֣ר רַ֭גְלְךָ מִבֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֑ךָ פֶּן־יִ֝שְׂבָּעֲךָ֗ וּשְׂנֵאֶֽךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:17
Proverbs 25:18A man who gives false testimony against his neighbor is like a club, a sword, or a sharp arrow.
Proverbs 25:185  מֵפִ֣יץ וְ֭חֶרֶב וְחֵ֣ץ שָׁנ֑וּן אִ֥ישׁ עֹנֶ֥ה בְ֝רֵעֵ֗הוּ עֵ֣ד שָֽׁקֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:18
Proverbs 25:19Confidence in someone unfaithful in time of trouble is like a bad tooth, or a lame foot.
Proverbs 25:195  שֵׁ֣ן רֹ֭עָה וְרֶ֣גֶל מוּעָ֑דֶת מִבְטָ֥ח בּ֝וֹגֵ֗ד בְּי֣וֹם צָרֽ͏ָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:19
Proverbs 25:20As one who takes away a garment in cold weather, or vinegar on soda, so is one who sings songs to a heavy heart.
Proverbs 25:205  מַ֥עֲדֶה בֶּ֨גֶד ׀ בְּי֣וֹם קָ֭רָה חֹ֣מֶץ עַל־נָ֑תֶר וְשָׁ֥ר בַּ֝שִּׁרִ֗ים עַ֣ל לֶב־רָֽע׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 25:20
Proverbs 25:21If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat. If he is thirsty, give him water to drink:
Proverbs 25:215  אִם־רָעֵ֣ב שֹׂ֭נַאֲךָ הַאֲכִלֵ֣הוּ לָ֑חֶם וְאִם־צָ֝מֵ֗א הַשְׁקֵ֥הוּ מָֽיִם׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:21
Proverbs 25:22for you will heap coals of fire on his head, and Yahweh will reward you.
Proverbs 25:225  כִּ֤י גֶֽחָלִ֗ים אַ֭תָּה חֹתֶ֣ה עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וֽ͏ַ֝יהוָ֗ה יְשַׁלֶּם־לָֽךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:22
Proverbs 25:23The north wind brings forth rain: so a backbiting tongue brings an angry face.
Proverbs 25:235  ר֣וּחַ צָ֭פוֹן תְּח֣וֹלֵֽל גָּ֑שֶׁם וּפָנִ֥ים נִ֝זְעָמִ֗ים לְשׁ֣וֹן סָֽתֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:23
Proverbs 25:24It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than to share a house with a contentious woman.
Proverbs 25:245  ט֗וֹב שֶׁ֥בֶת עַל־פִּנַּת־גָּ֑ג מֵאֵ֥שֶׁת *מדונים **מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים וּבֵ֥ית חָֽבֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:24
Proverbs 25:25Like cold water to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
Proverbs 25:255  מַ֣יִם קָ֭רִים עַל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ עֲיֵפָ֑ה וּשְׁמוּעָ֥ה ט֝וֹבָ֗ה מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מֶרְחָֽק׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:25
Proverbs 25:26Like a muddied spring, and a polluted well, so is a righteous man who gives way before the wicked.
Proverbs 25:265  מַעְיָ֣ן נִ֭רְפָּשׂ וּמָק֣וֹר מָשְׁחָ֑ת צַ֝דִּ֗יק מָ֣ט לִפְנֵֽי־רָשָֽׁע׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:26
Proverbs 25:27It is not good to eat much honey; nor is it honorable to seek one's own honor.
Proverbs 25:275  אָ֘כֹ֤ל דְּבַ֣שׁ הַרְבּ֣וֹת לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְחֵ֖קֶר כְּבֹדָ֣ם כָּבֽוֹד׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:27
Proverbs 25:28Like a city that is broken down and without walls is a man whose spirit is without restraint.
Proverbs 25:285  עִ֣יר פְּ֭רוּצָה אֵ֣ין חוֹמָ֑ה אִ֝֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵ֖ין מַעְצָ֣ר לְרוּחֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 25:28
Proverbs 26:1Like snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honor is not fitting for a fool.
Proverbs 26:16  כַּשֶּׁ֤לֶג ׀ בַּקַּ֗יִץ וְכַמָּטָ֥ר בַּקָּצִ֑יר כֵּ֤ן לֹא־נָאוֶ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל כָּבֽוֹד׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:1
Proverbs 26:2Like a fluttering sparrow, like a darting swallow, so the undeserved curse doesn't come to rest.
Proverbs 26:26  כַּצִּפּ֣וֹר לָ֭נוּד כַּדְּר֣וֹר לָע֑וּף כֵּ֥ן קִֽלְלַ֥ת חִ֝נָּ֗ם *לא **ל֣וֹ תָבֹֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:2
Proverbs 26:3A whip is for the horse, a bridle for the donkey, and a rod for the back of fools!
Proverbs 26:36  שׁ֣וֹט לַ֭סּוּס מֶ֣תֶג לַחֲמ֑וֹר וְ֝שֵׁ֗בֶט לְגֵ֣ו כְּסִילִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:3
Proverbs 26:4Don't answer a fool according to his folly, lest you also be like him.
Proverbs 26:46  אַל־תַּ֣עַן כְּ֭סִיל כְּאִוַּלְתּ֑וֹ פֶּֽן־תִּשְׁוֶה־לּ֥וֹ גַם־אָֽתָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:4
Proverbs 26:5Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own eyes.
Proverbs 26:56  עֲנֵ֣ה כְ֭סִיל כְּאִוַּלְתּ֑וֹ פֶּן־יִהְיֶ֖ה חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:5
Proverbs 26:6One who sends a message by the hand of a fool is cutting off feet and drinking violence.
Proverbs 26:66  מְקַצֶּ֣ה רַ֭גְלַיִם חָמָ֣ס שֹׁתֶ֑ה שֹׁלֵ֖חַ דְּבָרִ֣ים בְּיַד־כְּסִֽיל׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:6
Proverbs 26:7Like the legs of the lame that hang loose: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
Proverbs 26:76  דַּלְי֣וּ שֹׁ֭קַיִם מִפִּסֵּ֑חַ וּ֝מָשָׁ֗ל בְּפִ֣י כְסִילִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:7
Proverbs 26:8As one who binds a stone in a sling, so is he who gives honor to a fool.
Proverbs 26:86  כִּצְר֣וֹר אֶ֭בֶן בְּמַרְגֵּמָ֑ה כֵּן־נוֹתֵ֖ן לִכְסִ֣יל כָּבֽוֹד׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:8
Proverbs 26:9Like a thornbush that goes into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
Proverbs 26:96  ח֭וֹחַ עָלָ֣ה בְיַד־שִׁכּ֑וֹר וּ֝מָשָׁ֗ל בְּפִ֣י כְסִילִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:9
Proverbs 26:10As an archer who wounds all, so is he who hires a fool or he who hires those who pass by.
Proverbs 26:106  רַ֥ב מְחֽוֹלֵֽל־כֹּ֑ל וְשֹׂכֵ֥ר כְּ֝סִ֗יל וְשֹׂכֵ֥ר עֹבְרִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:10
Proverbs 26:11As a dog that returns to his vomit, so is a fool who repeats his folly.
Proverbs 26:116  כְּ֭כֶלֶב שָׁ֣ב עַל־קֵא֑וֹ כְּ֝סִ֗יל שׁוֹנֶ֥ה בְאִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:11
Proverbs 26:12Do you see a man wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
Proverbs 26:126  רָאִ֗יתָ אִ֭ישׁ חָכָ֣ם בְּעֵינָ֑יו תִּקְוָ֖ה לִכְסִ֣יל מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:12
Proverbs 26:13The sluggard says, |There is a lion in the road! A fierce lion roams the streets!|
Proverbs 26:136  אָמַ֣ר עָ֭צֵל שַׁ֣חַל בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ אֲ֝רִ֗י בֵּ֣ין הָרְחֹבֽוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:13
Proverbs 26:14As the door turns on its hinges, so does the sluggard on his bed.
Proverbs 26:146  הַ֭דֶּלֶת תִּסּ֣וֹב עַל־צִירָ֑הּ וְ֝עָצֵ֗ל עַל־מִטָּתֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:14
Proverbs 26:15The sluggard buries his hand in the dish. He is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.
Proverbs 26:156  טָ֘מַ֤ן עָצֵ֣ל יָ֭דוֹ בַּצַּלָּ֑חַת נִ֝לְאָ֗ה לַֽהֲשִׁיבָ֥הּ אֶל־פִּֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:15
Proverbs 26:16The sluggard is wiser in his own eyes than seven men who answer with discretion.
Proverbs 26:166  חָכָ֣ם עָצֵ֣ל בְּעֵינָ֑יו מִ֝שִּׁבְעָ֗ה מְשִׁ֣יבֵי טָֽעַם׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:16
Proverbs 26:17Like one who grabs a dog's ears is one who passes by and meddles in a quarrel not his own.
Proverbs 26:176  מַחֲזִ֥יק בְּאָזְנֵי־כָ֑לֶב עֹבֵ֥ר מִ֝תְעַבֵּ֗ר עַל־רִ֥יב לֹּֽא־לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:17
Proverbs 26:18Like a madman who shoots torches, arrows, and death,
Proverbs 26:186  כְּֽ֭מִתְלַהְלֵהַּ הַיֹּרֶ֥ה זִקִּ֗ים חִצִּ֥ים וָמָֽוֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:18
Proverbs 26:19is the man who deceives his neighbor and says, |Am I not joking?|
Proverbs 26:196  כֵּֽן־אִ֭ישׁ רִמָּ֣ה אֶת־רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝אָמַ֗ר הֲ‍ֽלֹא־מְשַׂחֵ֥ק אָֽנִי׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:19
Proverbs 26:20For lack of wood a fire goes out. Without gossip, a quarrel dies down.
Proverbs 26:206  בְּאֶ֣פֶס עֵ֭צִים תִּכְבֶּה־אֵ֑שׁ וּבְאֵ֥ין נִ֝רְגָּ֗ן יִשְׁתֹּ֥ק מָדֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:20
Proverbs 26:21As coals are to hot embers, and wood to fire, so is a contentious man to kindling strife.
Proverbs 26:216  פֶּחָ֣ם לְ֭גֶחָלִים וְעֵצִ֣ים לְאֵ֑שׁ וְאִ֥ישׁ *מדונים **מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים לְחַרְחַר־רִֽיב׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 26:21
Proverbs 26:22The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, they go down into the innermost parts.
Proverbs 26:226  דִּבְרֵ֣י נִ֭רְגָּן כְּמִֽתְלַהֲמִ֑ים וְ֝הֵ֗ם יָרְד֥וּ חַדְרֵי־בָֽטֶן׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:22
Proverbs 26:23Like silver dross on an earthen vessel are the lips of a fervent one with an evil heart.
Proverbs 26:236  כֶּ֣סֶף סִ֭יגִים מְצֻפֶּ֣ה עַל־חָ֑רֶשׂ שְׂפָתַ֖יִם דֹּלְקִ֣ים וְלֶב־רָֽע׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:23
Proverbs 26:24A malicious man disguises himself with his lips, but he harbors evil in his heart.
Proverbs 26:246  *בשפתו **בִּ֭שְׂפָתָיו יִנָּכֵ֣ר שׂוֹנֵ֑א וּ֝בְקִרְבּ֗וֹ יָשִׁ֥ית מִרְמָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:24
Proverbs 26:25When his speech is charming, don't believe him; for there are seven abominations in his heart.
Proverbs 26:256  כִּֽי־יְחַנֵּ֣ן ק֭וֹלוֹ אַל־תַּֽאֲמֶן־בּ֑וֹ כִּ֤י שֶׁ֖בַע תּוֹעֵב֣וֹת בְּלִבּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:25
Proverbs 26:26His malice may be concealed by deception, but his wickedness will be exposed in the assembly.
Proverbs 26:266  תִּכַּסֶּ֣ה שִׂ֭נְאָה בְּמַשָּׁא֑וֹן תִּגָּלֶ֖ה רָעָת֣וֹ בְקָהָֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:26
Proverbs 26:27Whoever digs a pit shall fall into it. Whoever rolls a stone, it will come back on him.
Proverbs 26:276  כֹּֽרֶה־שַּׁ֭חַת בָּ֣הּ יִפֹּ֑ל וְגֹ֥לֵ֥ל אֶ֝בֶן אֵלָ֥יו תָּשֽׁוּב׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:27
Proverbs 26:28A lying tongue hates those it hurts; and a flattering mouth works ruin.
Proverbs 26:286  לְֽשׁוֹן־שֶׁ֭קֶר יִשְׂנָ֣א דַכָּ֑יו וּפֶ֥ה חָ֝לָ֗ק יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה מִדְחֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 26:28
Proverbs 27:1Don't boast about tomorrow; for you don't know what a day may bring forth.
Proverbs 27:17  אַֽל־תִּ֭תְהַלֵּל בְּי֣וֹם מָחָ֑ר כִּ֤י לֹא־תֵ֝דַ֗ע מַה־יֵּ֥לֶד יֽוֹם׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:1
Proverbs 27:2Let another man praise you, and not your own mouth; a stranger, and not your own lips.
Proverbs 27:27  יְהַלֶּלְךָ֣ זָ֣ר וְלֹא־פִ֑יךָ נָ֝כְרִ֗י וְאַל־שְׂפָתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:2
Proverbs 27:3A stone is heavy, and sand is a burden; but a fool's provocation is heavier than both.
Proverbs 27:37  כֹּֽבֶד־אֶ֭בֶן וְנֵ֣טֶל הַח֑וֹל וְכַ֥עַס אֱ֝וִ֗יל כָּבֵ֥ד מִשְּׁנֵיהֶֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:3
Proverbs 27:4Wrath is cruel, and anger is overwhelming; but who is able to stand before jealousy?
Proverbs 27:47  אַכְזְרִיּ֣וּת חֵ֭מָה וְשֶׁ֣טֶף אָ֑ף וּמִ֥י יַ֝עֲמֹד לִפְנֵ֥י קִנְאָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:4
Proverbs 27:5Better is open rebuke than hidden love.
Proverbs 27:57  ט֭וֹבָה תּוֹכַ֣חַת מְגֻלָּ֑ה מֵֽאַהֲבָ֥ה מְסֻתָּֽרֶת׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:5
Proverbs 27:6Faithful are the wounds of a friend; although the kisses of an enemy are profuse.
Proverbs 27:67  נֶ֭אֱמָנִים פִּצְעֵ֣י אוֹהֵ֑ב וְ֝נַעְתָּר֗וֹת נְשִׁיק֥וֹת שׂוֹנֵֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:6
Proverbs 27:7A full soul loathes a honeycomb; but to a hungry soul, every bitter thing is sweet.
Proverbs 27:77  נֶ֣פֶשׁ שְׂ֭בֵעָה תָּב֣וּס נֹ֑פֶת וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ רְ֝עֵבָ֗ה כָּל־מַ֥ר מָתֽוֹק׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:7
Proverbs 27:8As a bird that wanders from her nest, so is a man who wanders from his home.
Proverbs 27:87  כְּ֭צִפּוֹר נוֹדֶ֣דֶת מִן־קִנָּ֑הּ כֵּֽן־אִ֝֗ישׁ נוֹדֵ֥ד מִמְּקוֹמֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:8
Proverbs 27:9Perfume and incense bring joy to the heart; so does earnest counsel from a man's friend.
Proverbs 27:97  שֶׁ֣מֶן וּ֭קְטֹרֶת יְשַׂמַּֽח־לֵ֑ב וּמֶ֥תֶק רֵ֝עֵ֗הוּ מֵֽעֲצַת־נָֽפֶשׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:9
Proverbs 27:10Don't forsake your friend and your father's friend. Don't go to your brother's house in the day of your disaster: better is a neighbor who is near than a distant brother.
Proverbs 27:107  רֵֽעֲךָ֨ *ורעה **וְרֵ֪עַ אָבִ֡יךָ אַֽל־תַּעֲזֹ֗ב וּבֵ֥ית אָחִ֗יךָ אַל־תָּ֭בוֹא בְּי֣וֹם אֵידֶ֑ךָ ט֥וֹב שָׁכֵ֥ן קָ֝ר֗וֹב מֵאָ֥ח רָחֽוֹק׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:10
Proverbs 27:11Be wise, my son, and bring joy to my heart, then I can answer my tormentor.
Proverbs 27:117  חֲכַ֣ם בְּ֭נִי וְשַׂמַּ֣ח לִבִּ֑י וְאָשִׁ֖יבָה חֹרְפִ֣י דָבָֽר׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:11
Proverbs 27:12A prudent man sees danger and takes refuge; but the simple pass on, and suffer for it.
Proverbs 27:127  עָר֤וּם רָאָ֣ה רָעָ֣ה נִסְתָּ֑ר פְּ֝תָאיִ֗ם עָבְר֥וּ נֶעֱנָֽשׁוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:12
Proverbs 27:13Take his garment when he puts up collateral for a stranger. Hold it for a wayward woman!
Proverbs 27:137  קַח־בִּ֭גְדוֹ כִּי־עָ֣רַב זָ֑ר וּבְעַ֖ד נָכְרִיָּ֣ה חַבְלֵֽהוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:13
Proverbs 27:14He who blesses his neighbor with a loud voice early in the morning, it will be taken as a curse by him.
Proverbs 27:147  מְבָ֘רֵ֤ךְ רֵעֵ֨הוּ ׀ בְּק֣וֹל גָּ֭דוֹל בַּבֹּ֣קֶר הַשְׁכֵּ֑ים קְ֝לָלָ֗ה תֵּחָ֥שֶׁב לֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:14
Proverbs 27:15A continual dropping on a rainy day and a contentious wife are alike:
Proverbs 27:157  דֶּ֣לֶף ט֭וֹרֵד בְּי֣וֹם סַגְרִ֑יר וְאֵ֥שֶׁת *מדונים **מִ֝דְיָנִ֗ים נִשְׁתָּוָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:15
Proverbs 27:16restraining her is like restraining the wind, or like grasping oil in his right hand.
Proverbs 27:167  צֹפְנֶ֥יהָ צָֽפַן־ר֑וּחַ וְשֶׁ֖מֶן יְמִינ֣וֹ יִקְרָֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:16
Proverbs 27:17Iron sharpens iron; so a man sharpens his friend's countenance.
Proverbs 27:177  בַּרְזֶ֣ל בְּבַרְזֶ֣ל יָ֑חַד וְ֝אִ֗ישׁ יַ֣חַד פְּנֵֽי־רֵעֵֽהוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:17
Proverbs 27:18Whoever tends the fig tree shall eat its fruit. He who looks after his master shall be honored.
Proverbs 27:187  נֹצֵ֣ר תְּ֭אֵנָה יֹאכַ֣ל פִּרְיָ֑הּ וְשֹׁמֵ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֣יו יְכֻבָּֽד׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:18
Proverbs 27:19As water reflects a face, so a man's heart reflects the man.
Proverbs 27:197  כַּ֭מַּיִם הַפָּנִ֣ים לַפָּנִ֑ים כֵּ֤ן לֵֽב־הָ֝אָדָ֗ם לָאָדָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:19
Proverbs 27:20Sheol and Abaddon are never satisfied; and a man's eyes are never satisfied.
Proverbs 27:207  שְׁא֣וֹל *ואבדה **וַ֭אֲבַדּוֹ לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּ֑עְנָה וְעֵינֵ֥י הָ֝אָדָ֗ם לֹ֣א תִשְׂבַּֽעְנָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:20
Proverbs 27:21The crucible is for silver, and the furnace for gold; but man is refined by his praise.
Proverbs 27:217  מַצְרֵ֣ף לַ֭כֶּסֶף וְכ֣וּר לַזָּהָ֑ב וְ֝אִ֗ישׁ לְפִ֣י מַהֲלָלֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:21
Proverbs 27:22Though you grind a fool in a mortar with a pestle along with grain, yet his foolishness will not be removed from him.
Proverbs 27:227  אִ֥ם תִּכְתּֽוֹשׁ־אֶת־הָאֱוִ֨יל ׀ בַּֽמַּכְתֵּ֡שׁ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָ֭רִיפוֹת בַּֽעֱלִ֑י לֹא־תָס֥וּר מֵ֝עָלָ֗יו אִוַּלְתּֽוֹ׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 27:22
Proverbs 27:23Know well the state of your flocks, and pay attention to your herds:
Proverbs 27:237  יָדֹ֣עַ תֵּ֭דַע פְּנֵ֣י צֹאנֶ֑ךָ שִׁ֥ית לִ֝בְּךָ֗ לַעֲדָרִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:23
Proverbs 27:24for riches are not forever, nor does even the crown endure to all generations.
Proverbs 27:247  כִּ֤י לֹ֣א לְעוֹלָ֣ם חֹ֑סֶן וְאִם־נֵ֝֗זֶר לְד֣וֹר *דור **וָדֽוֹר׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:24
Proverbs 27:25The hay is removed, and the new growth appears, the grasses of the hills are gathered in.
Proverbs 27:257  גָּלָ֣ה חָ֭צִיר וְנִרְאָה־דֶ֑שֶׁא וְ֝נֶאֶסְפ֗וּ עִשְּׂב֥וֹת הָרִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:25
Proverbs 27:26The lambs are for your clothing, and the goats are the price of a field.
Proverbs 27:267  כְּבָשִׂ֥ים לִלְבוּשֶׁ֑ךָ וּמְחִ֥יר שָׂ֝דֶ֗ה עַתּוּדִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:26
Proverbs 27:27There will be plenty of goats' milk for your food, for your family's food, and for the nourishment of your servant girls.
Proverbs 27:277  וְדֵ֤י ׀ חֲלֵ֬ב עִזִּ֗ים לְֽ֭לַחְמְךָ לְלֶ֣חֶם בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וְ֝חַיִּ֗ים לְנַעֲרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃ ‬
Proverbs 27:27
Proverbs 28:1The wicked flee when no one pursues; but the righteous are as bold as a lion.
Proverbs 28:18  נָ֣סוּ וְאֵין־רֹדֵ֣ף רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝צַדִּיקִ֗ים כִּכְפִ֥יר יִבְטָֽח׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:1
Proverbs 28:2In rebellion, a land has many rulers, but order is maintained by a man of understanding and knowledge.
Proverbs 28:28  בְּפֶ֣שַֽׁע אֶ֭רֶץ רַבִּ֣ים שָׂרֶ֑יהָ וּבְאָדָ֥ם מֵבִ֥ין יֹ֝דֵ֗עַ כֵּ֣ן יַאֲרִֽיךְ׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:2
Proverbs 28:3A needy man who oppresses the poor is like a driving rain which leaves no crops.
Proverbs 28:38  גֶּ֣בֶר רָ֭שׁ וְעֹשֵׁ֣ק דַּלִּ֑ים מָטָ֥ר סֹ֝חֵ֗ף וְאֵ֣ין לָֽחֶם׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:3
Proverbs 28:4Those who forsake the law praise the wicked; but those who keep the law contend with them.
Proverbs 28:48  עֹזְבֵ֣י ת֭וֹרָה יְהַֽלְל֣וּ רָשָׁ֑ע וְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י ת֝וֹרָ֗ה יִתְגָּ֥רוּ בָֽם׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 28:4
Proverbs 28:5Evil men don't understand justice; but those who seek Yahweh understand it fully.
Proverbs 28:58  אַנְשֵׁי־רָ֭ע לֹא־יָבִ֣ינוּ מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּמְבַקְשֵׁ֥י יְ֝הוָ֗ה יָבִ֥ינוּ כֹֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:5
Proverbs 28:6Better is the poor who walks in his integrity, than he who is perverse in his ways, and he is rich.
Proverbs 28:68  טֽוֹב־רָ֭שׁ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ בְּתֻמּ֑וֹ מֵעִקֵּ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכַ֗יִם וְה֣וּא עָשִֽׁיר׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:6
Proverbs 28:7Whoever keeps the law is a wise son; but he who is a companion of gluttons shames his father.
Proverbs 28:78  נוֹצֵ֣ר תּ֭וֹרָה בֵּ֣ן מֵבִ֑ין וְרֹעֶ֥‪[t]‬ה זֽ֝וֹלְלִ֗ים יַכְלִ֥ים אָבִֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:7
Proverbs 28:8He who increases his wealth by excessive interest gathers it for one who has pity on the poor.
Proverbs 28:88  מַרְבֶּ֣ה ה֭וֹנוֹ בְּנֶ֣שֶׁךְ *ובתרבית **וְתַרְבִּ֑ית לְחוֹנֵ֖ן דַּלִּ֣ים יִקְבְּצֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:8
Proverbs 28:9He who turns away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer is an abomination.
Proverbs 28:98  מֵסִ֣יר אָ֭זְנוֹ מִשְּׁמֹ֣עַ תּוֹרָ֑ה גַּֽם־תְּ֝פִלָּת֗וֹ תּוֹעֵבָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:9
Proverbs 28:10Whoever causes the upright to go astray in an evil way, he will fall into his own trap; but the blameless will inherit good.
Proverbs 28:108  מַשְׁגֶּ֤ה יְשָׁרִ֨ים ׀ בְּדֶ֥רֶךְ רָ֗ע בִּשְׁחוּת֥וֹ הֽוּא־יִפּ֑וֹל וּ֝תְמִימִ֗ים יִנְחֲלוּ־טֽוֹב׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:10
Proverbs 28:11The rich man is wise in his own eyes; but the poor who has understanding sees through him.
Proverbs 28:118  חָכָ֣ם בְּ֭עֵינָיו אִ֣ישׁ עָשִׁ֑יר וְדַ֖ל מֵבִ֣ין יַחְקְרֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:11
Proverbs 28:12When the righteous triumph, there is great glory; but when the wicked rise, men hide themselves.
Proverbs 28:128  בַּעֲלֹ֣ץ צַ֭דִּיקִים רַבָּ֣ה תִפְאָ֑רֶת וּבְק֥וּם רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יְחֻפַּ֥שׂ אָדָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:12
Proverbs 28:13He who conceals his sins doesn't prosper, but whoever confesses and renounces them finds mercy.
Proverbs 28:138  מְכַסֶּ֣ה פְ֭שָׁעָיו לֹ֣א יַצְלִ֑יחַ וּמוֹדֶ֖ה וְעֹזֵ֣ב יְרֻחָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:13
Proverbs 28:14Blessed is the man who always fears; but one who hardens his heart falls into trouble.
Proverbs 28:148  אַשְׁרֵ֣י אָ֭דָם מְפַחֵ֣ד תָּמִ֑יד וּמַקְשֶׁ֥ה לִ֝בּ֗וֹ יִפּ֥וֹל בְּרָעָֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:14
Proverbs 28:15As a roaring lion or a charging bear, so is a wicked ruler over helpless people.
Proverbs 28:158  אֲרִי־נֹ֭הֵם וְדֹ֣ב שׁוֹקֵ֑ק מֹשֵׁ֥ל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע עַ֣ל עַם־דָּֽל׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:15
Proverbs 28:16A tyrannical ruler lacks judgment. One who hates ill-gotten gain will have long days.
Proverbs 28:168  נָגִ֗יד חֲסַ֣ר תְּ֭בוּנוֹת וְרַ֥ב מַעֲשַׁקּ֑וֹת *שנאי **שֹׂ֥נֵא בֶ֝֗צַע יַאֲרִ֥יךְ יָמִֽים׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 28:16
Proverbs 28:17A man who is tormented by life blood will be a fugitive until death; no one will support him.
Proverbs 28:178  אָ֭דָם עָשֻׁ֣ק בְּדַם־נָפֶשׁ‪[c]‬ עַד־בּ֥וֹר יָ֝נ֗וּס אַל־יִתְמְכוּ־בֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:17
Proverbs 28:18Whoever walks blamelessly is kept safe; but one with perverse ways will fall suddenly.
Proverbs 28:188  הוֹלֵ֣ךְ תָּ֭מִים יִוָּשֵׁ֑עַ וְנֶעְקַ֥שׁ דְּ֝רָכַ֗יִם יִפּ֥וֹל בְּאֶחָֽת׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:18
Proverbs 28:19One who works his land will have an abundance of food; but one who chases fantasies will have his fill of poverty.
Proverbs 28:198  עֹבֵ֣ד אַ֭דְמָתוֹ יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־לָ֑חֶם וּמְרַדֵּ֥ף רֵ֝קִ֗ים יִֽשְׂבַּֽע־רִֽישׁ׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:19
Proverbs 28:20A faithful man is rich with blessings; but one who is eager to be rich will not go unpunished.
Proverbs 28:208  אִ֣ישׁ אֱ֭מוּנוֹת רַב־בְּרָכ֑וֹת וְאָ֥ץ לְ֝הַעֲשִׁ֗יר לֹ֣א יִנָּקֶֽה׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:20
Proverbs 28:21To show partiality is not good; yet a man will do wrong for a piece of bread.
Proverbs 28:218  הַֽכֵּר־פָּנִ֥ים לֹא־ט֑וֹב וְעַל־פַּת־לֶ֝֗חֶם יִפְשַׁע־גָּֽבֶר׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:21
Proverbs 28:22A stingy man hurries after riches, and doesn't know that poverty waits for him.
Proverbs 28:228  נִֽבֳהָ֥ל לַה֗וֹן אִ֭ישׁ רַ֣ע עָ֑יִן וְלֹֽא־יֵ֝דַע כִּי־חֶ֥סֶר יְבֹאֶֽנּוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:22
Proverbs 28:23One who rebukes a man will afterward find more favor than one who flatters with the tongue.
Proverbs 28:238  מ֘וֹכִ֤יחַ אָדָ֣ם אַ֭חֲרַי חֵ֣ן יִמְצָ֑א מִֽמַּחֲלִ֥יק לָשֽׁוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:23
Proverbs 28:24Whoever robs his father or his mother, and says, |It's not wrong.| He is a partner with a destroyer.
Proverbs 28:248  גּוֹזֵ֤ל ׀ אָ֘בִ֤יו וְאִמּ֗וֹ וְאֹמֵ֥ר אֵֽין־פָּ֑שַׁע חָבֵ֥ר ה֝֗וּא לְאִ֣ישׁ מַשְׁחִֽית׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:24
Proverbs 28:25One who is greedy stirs up strife; but one who trusts in Yahweh will prosper.
Proverbs 28:258  רְחַב־נֶ֭פֶשׁ יְגָרֶ֣ה מָד֑וֹן וּבוֹטֵ֖חַ עַל־יְהוָ֣ה יְדֻשָּֽׁן׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:25
Proverbs 28:26One who trusts in himself is a fool; but one who walks in wisdom is kept safe.
Proverbs 28:268  בּוֹטֵ֣חַ בְּ֭לִבּוֹ ה֣וּא כְסִ֑יל וְהוֹלֵ֥ךְ בְּ֝חָכְמָ֗ה ה֣וּא יִמָּלֵֽט׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:26
Proverbs 28:27One who gives to the poor has no lack; but one who closes his eyes will have many curses.
Proverbs 28:278  נוֹתֵ֣ן לָ֭רָשׁ אֵ֣ין מַחְס֑וֹר וּמַעְלִ֥ים עֵ֝ינָ֗יו רַב־מְאֵרֽוֹת׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:27
Proverbs 28:28When the wicked rise, men hide themselves; but when they perish, the righteous thrive.
Proverbs 28:288  בְּק֣וּם רְ֭שָׁעִים יִסָּתֵ֣ר אָדָ֑ם וּ֝בְאָבְדָ֗ם יִרְבּ֥וּ צַדִּיקִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 28:28
Proverbs 29:1He who is often rebuked and stiffens his neck will be destroyed suddenly, with no remedy.
Proverbs 29:19  אִ֣ישׁ תּ֭וֹכָחוֹת מַקְשֶׁה־עֹ֑רֶף פֶּ֥תַע יִ֝שָּׁבֵ֗ר וְאֵ֣ין מַרְפֵּֽא׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:1
Proverbs 29:2When the righteous thrive, the people rejoice; but when the wicked rule, the people groan.
Proverbs 29:29  בִּרְב֣וֹת צַ֭דִּיקִים יִשְׂמַ֣ח הָעָ֑ם וּבִמְשֹׁ֥ל רָ֝שָׁ֗ע יֵאָ֥נַֽח עָֽם׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:2
Proverbs 29:3Whoever loves wisdom brings joy to his father; but a companion of prostitutes squanders his wealth.
Proverbs 29:39  אִֽישׁ־אֹהֵ֣ב חָ֭כְמָה יְשַׂמַּ֣ח אָבִ֑יו וְרֹעֶ֥ה ז֝וֹנ֗וֹת יְאַבֶּד־הֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:3
Proverbs 29:4The king by justice makes the land stable, but he who takes bribes tears it down.
Proverbs 29:49  מֶ֗לֶךְ בְּ֭מִשְׁפָּט יַעֲמִ֣יד אָ֑רֶץ וְאִ֖ישׁ תְּרוּמ֣וֹת יֶֽהֶרְסֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:4
Proverbs 29:5A man who flatters his neighbor spreads a net for his feet.
Proverbs 29:59  גֶּ֭בֶר מַחֲלִ֣יק עַל־רֵעֵ֑הוּ רֶ֝֗שֶׁת פּוֹרֵ֥שׂ עַל־פְּעָמָֽיו׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:5
Proverbs 29:6An evil man is snared by his sin, but the righteous can sing and be glad.
Proverbs 29:69  בְּפֶ֤שַֽׁע אִ֣ישׁ רָ֣ע מוֹקֵ֑שׁ וְ֝צַדִּ֗יק יָר֥וּן וְשָׂמֵֽחַ׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:6
Proverbs 29:7The righteous care about justice for the poor. The wicked aren't concerned about knowledge.
Proverbs 29:79  יֹדֵ֣עַ צַ֭דִּיק דִּ֣ין דַּלִּ֑ים רָ֝שָׁ֗ע לֹא־יָבִ֥ין דָּֽעַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:7
Proverbs 29:8Mockers stir up a city, but wise men turn away anger.
Proverbs 29:89  אַנְשֵׁ֣י לָ֭צוֹן יָפִ֣יחוּ קִרְיָ֑ה וַ֝חֲכָמִ֗ים יָשִׁ֥יבוּ אָֽף׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:8
Proverbs 29:9If a wise man goes to court with a foolish man, the fool rages or scoffs, and there is no peace.
Proverbs 29:99  אִֽישׁ־חָכָ֗ם נִ֭שְׁפָּט אֶת־אִ֣ישׁ אֱוִ֑יל וְרָגַ֥ז וְ֝שָׂחַ֗ק וְאֵ֣ין נָֽחַת׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:9
Proverbs 29:10The bloodthirsty hate a man of integrity; and they seek the life of the upright.
Proverbs 29:109  אַנְשֵׁ֣י דָ֭מִים יִשְׂנְאוּ־תָ֑ם וִֽ֝ישָׁרִ֗ים יְבַקְשׁ֥וּ נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:10
Proverbs 29:11A fool vents all of his anger, but a wise man brings himself under control.
Proverbs 29:119  כָּל־ר֭וּחוֹ יוֹצִ֣יא כְסִ֑יל וְ֝חָכָ֗ם בְּאָח֥וֹר יְשַׁבְּחֶֽנָּה׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:11
Proverbs 29:12If a ruler listens to lies, all of his officials are wicked.
Proverbs 29:129  מֹ֭שֵׁל מַקְשִׁ֣יב עַל־דְּבַר־שָׁ֑קֶר כָּֽל־מְשָׁרְתָ֥יו רְשָׁעִֽים׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:12
Proverbs 29:13The poor man and the oppressor have this in common: Yahweh gives sight to the eyes of both.
Proverbs 29:139  רָ֤שׁ וְאִ֣ישׁ תְּכָכִ֣ים נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ מֵ֤אִיר־עֵינֵ֖י שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם יְהוֽ͏ָה׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:13
Proverbs 29:14The king who fairly judges the poor, his throne shall be established forever.
Proverbs 29:149  מֶ֤לֶךְ שׁוֹפֵ֣ט בֶּֽאֱמֶ֣ת דַּלִּ֑ים כִּ֝סְא֗וֹ לָעַ֥ד יִכּֽוֹן׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:14
Proverbs 29:15The rod of correction gives wisdom, but a child left to himself causes shame to his mother.
Proverbs 29:159  שֵׁ֣בֶט וְ֭תוֹכַחַת יִתֵּ֣ן חָכְמָ֑ה וְנַ֥עַר מְ֝שֻׁלָּ֗ח מֵבִ֥ישׁ אִמּֽוֹ׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:15
Proverbs 29:16When the wicked increase, sin increases; but the righteous will see their downfall.
Proverbs 29:169  בִּרְב֣וֹת רְ֭שָׁעִים יִרְבֶּה־פָּ֑שַׁע וְ֝צַדִּיקִ֗ים בְּֽמַפַּלְתָּ֥ם יִרְאֽוּ׃ ‬
Proverbs 29:16
Proverbs 29:17Correct your son, and he will give you peace; yes, he will bring delight to your soul.
Proverbs 29:179  יַסֵּ֣ר בִּ֭נְךָ וִֽינִיחֶ֑ךָ וְיִתֵּ֖ן מַעֲדַנִּ֣ים לְנַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃ פ ‬
Proverbs 29:17
